11.content:
Sarah jogged back to her apartment, stopping by the staircase and bending down to catch her breath. "Alright...ha...another five miles run today. Good job, Sarah!" She stood back up, taking in more deep breaths before going up the steps. Five miles, every day. That had been Sarah's routine for the last month. Before that, it was seven miles, but she was tapering to she could regrow some muscle. All in preparation for the show of fitness her job was putting on next week - nine days away, to be exact.

Sarah slowly walked up the stairs, wiping sweat from her brow and taking down the headband she had on to keep her long blonde hair in check while she ran. Reaching for the door, Sarah turned the handle. Or, she tried to. It wouldn't move. "Hmm," Sarah mused, trying the handle again and again.

"Sarah?" a voice said behind her. Sarah turned around to see her roommate Britney walking up, a box in her arms.

"Britney, I'm so glad you got here," Sarah sighed with a smile. "There's something wrong with the door. It won't move for some reason."

"Is it...locked?" Britney said, reaching into her pockets for her keys. Sarah paused and thought over her roommate's words.

"Oh."

You see, Sarah was a bit spacey. She wasn't stupid, just spacey, sometimes gullible and absent-minded. Still, Sarah managed to stumble her way through life and even get a good job at the local gym, where she was pretty well-liked by the other regulars and employees. Well, maybe not all of them, but their time will come later in our story.

Britney opened the door and walked inside, putting the box down on the kitchen table as Sarah stretched out her arms and legs just outside.

"What's that?" Sarah asked.

"Actually, it says it's for you," Britney said, pointing to the label. "I just picked up all our mail downstairs and this was there."

"Oh!" Sarah exclaimed excitedly, rushing forward and opening the box. "I remember now, I did order this. It's a new energy health protein drink with anti-oxidants and pomegranates and kale and-"

"Are you sure about this?" Britney said skeptically as Sarah opened the box all the way up. "That sounds like a lot of crap."

"No, it was on the commercial online. All of those things are good for you," Sarah said, shaking her head at Britney's disapproval. "I mean, aren't energy and protein and kale all good for you?"

"Well...yeah, sort of," Britney said, looking at the dozens of packs of canned energy drink Sarah was unloading. "How many of these things are there?"

"Dunno, this was the smallest order they had," Sarah said, staking the cans on the table. "We'll probably have to hold this somewhere else in the apartment..."

"Sarah, this is already nearly a dozen packs of drinks," Britney said. "This must have cost hundreds of dollars. Do you really think that's a good idea?"

"No, that's the best part!" Sarah said gleefully. "The website only charged five bucks for the whole thing! It's from some new company, Yaral Industries."

"Yaral Industries, huh?" Britney said, taking one can. "Well, I've never heard of them, that's for sure. Is this even safe to drink?"

"Absolutely!" Sarah said, rushing into her room and bringing out her laptop. "Here, I'll show you the information on their website." Sarah went to the site for Xpect, clicking on a YouTube video embedded on the page.

"This is a commercial, Sarah," Britney tried to say.

"Shh! It's starting!"

A blue screen appeared with pleasant music. A young, attractive woman appeared, smiling in athletic gear. "Xpect Energy Drink! Product of Yaral Industries! Just one can and you'll feel like a whole new person."

The woman took a can and chugged it in one smooth motion.

"Xpect Energy Drink. Fills you full of life! No consumption under the age of 18."

"Under 18? Geez, is there alcohol in this thing?"

"Oh, hush Britney," Sarah said. "Want to join me in drinking one?"

Britney sighed and looked over the can. It looked like it was packaged legitimately. It had a cool black case with a big white X for the logo. "I don't know about this, Sarah."

"No, c'mon! I need energy and protein for the fitness competition at work next week. It's a gym! A good performance could mean more clients for personal training, maybe even a higher position. Now let's drink!"

Britney shrugged and both pulled back the tabs and took long drinks, just like in the commercial. Upon finishing, both felt a sudden twinge in their stomachs. "Ugh, I feel nauseous after drinking that thing. Sarah, that was terrible."

"No, things that are good for you are supposed to taste bad!" Sarah said, holding her hand over her stomach. "That's why you shouldn't eat apples!"

"What are you talking about?" Britney said, bending over in agony. "Urp...I can't argue with you...I'm going to be sick." Britney ran off to her own room. Sarah could hear her barfing across the way.

"That's you throwing up your toxins!" Sarah said, holding her hand over her mouth. "Ooh, that is bad." Sarah bolted for her own bathroom and eagerly threw up in her toilet.

After a few minutes of vomiting, the two went back into the main room, Britney looking at Sarah with an exhausted expression. "So...believe me now?"

Sarah shrugged. "Maybe. I'll have to try it again tomorrow."

Britney rolled her eyes. "Well, let me know how that goes."

Sarah nodded, wondering how her day would go with this nausea hanging over her.

111.content:
Swallowing the nausea deep inside her, Sarah picked up a few cases of the Xpect drink.
"Where are you taking those things?" Britney asked, still holding her stomach.
"To work. We've got some many of them that I can bring a few cases to work. My boss has been looking for an official drink to tie-in with the gym, and I maybe I can to him this energy drink. It'll be a simple process: I'll get my work-out class and a few of my personal clients on it, have them tell my boss how much they love it, and then with the fitness competition in 9 days, we can make it the official energy drink of the gym, and with it being so cheap from that website, we could order hundreds of cases of it, and sell it for a huge markup.

If I can get my boss to sign on it, it could be huge for me, huge for him, huge for my clients, huge for my class, and huge for the gym" Sarah said, unaware of her soon-to-be ironic in-the-future words she was saying.
"Do you really think you can get your class to take it?" Britney asked, plopping down on the couch, trying to rest after her bout of explosive nausea.
"Sure. My all-girl work-out class would love something like this. I mean, most of the girls in their are in the later 30's to mid-40's, single and/or divorced, you just have to pitch them the wonders it could do to their bodies. I mean, it's not called Femme-Fit class for any old reason" Sarah finally finished.

"Well good luck" Britney said, pulling a sleep mask over her face.
"You're just going to sleep while I'm gone?" Sarah asked.
"I'm exhausted. And starving." Britney replied.

Sarah herself was feeling both exhausted and hungry, but she pushed the thought aside. She needed to work, and she planned out her caloric intake DAYS in advance, which was how she stayed in amazing jaw-droppingly sexy shape.

"Well good luck with that" Sarah said, grabbing a few cases of the energy drink and heading off to her car. After shoving the cases back in the trunk and backseat of her car, she turned over the ignition and headed off to work.

Singing along to some pop-song on the radio, Sarah's mood improved tremendously. She had seemingly forgotten all about the neusea or the gnawing hunger that was slowly creeping up to the point-of "uncontrollable". She pulled into the mall-sized parking lot of "MegaGym", which was less of a gym, and more of a fitness megaplex. A huge 3 story building that featured boxing rings, treadmills, an olympic indoor swimming pool, practically every thing you could ever imagine. A huge banner hung outside the building of the gym, along with dozens of signs that read "MegaGym Mega Fitness Show - Clients and Employee Categories. Sign up now. Huge cash prize!"

She parked in her employee parking space and grabbed the case of drinks from the back before walking into the front doors of MegaGym.
Upon entering she was hit by a cacophony of noises, personal trainers screaming at the top of their lungs to tell people to "Push It! Push It!", the sounds of TV blaring as people exercised in front of them, among other things.

Putting down the drink on the front desk counter, she typed in her employee number and punched herself into the system. Her job as a trainer and class teacher was a pretty sweet one. Hourly wages as well as bonuses for personal clients who met their fitness goals. As a fitness freak, getting paid to stay in shape and help others and get paid for it, really made everything better.

"You were almost late Sarah" Rebecca said from behind the check-in desk with a cackle. Rebecca, Sarah's frienemy and rival, was almost the exact mirror image of Rebecca, except with fiery red-hair. "Oh you know how it is. You go for a five-mile jog and - - - Well maybe you DON'T know how it is" Sarah said, shooting back friendly vitriol. "And what do we have here?" Rebecca asked, grabbing a can of Xpect.

"Just a new product I'm going to have my Femme-Fit class try. Once it's a hit, I'm going to pitch it to the boss and then that promotion and raise is mine" Sarah said with a smile. Rebecca opened the can with POP, and smelled the drink. "If this thing dosen't kill everyone first" Rebecca said, putting the can to her lips.

"Please, it's meant to give you energy and cleanse your body of toxins. I've already had a can this morning, and I feel fantastic" Sarah lied, but it was okay as long as she could get people hooked on this stuff. It's not like it could hurt anyone right?

Rebecca took a big long gulp, before putting it down, a weird expression crossing her face. "Great stuff huh?" Sarah asked. "Uh - yeah" Rebecca said, finishing off the can before throwing it into the recycling.
"Here a take a six-pack. Pass it around to everyone. Make sure they know you got it from me and this gym!" Sarah said, picking up the case and heading of towards the changing rooms, unaware that moments later Rebecca was puking her guts out into a near-by trashcan.

Changing over into her sleek skin-type blue leotard that hugged and showed off her every curve, Sarah grabbed the rest of the drinks and headed into her Femme-Fit class, where her twenty or so "pupils" were waiting for her.

"Afternoon ladies" Sarah said, grabbing her leg behind her and stretching. Her "class" as she called it, was twenty or so women, aged from 18 to 65, whom were actively serious about getting in shape in a safe womanly environment. While some of the women were married, most of the class was made up of late 30's to late 40's singles and divorcees who were trying to get in shape for today's competitive dating market, while one woman, Theresa, was in her mid-60's and just wanted something that would make her feel young again.

"No time for taking, we have a lot to do today. So let's get going!" Sarah said, putting on the CD and leading the class in a variety of exercises from yoga, to cardio, to aerobics and more. After the time with the class came to a close, Sarah brought out the stack of Xpect and presented it in front of the class.

"Ladies, I have a special treat for us. I know some of you don't like or aren't into energy drinks, but I've found this great new product called Xpect, and let me tell you something, it's fantastic. It gives you such much energy and flushes your body of toxins! I have cases of this stuff since this gym will start carrying it exclusively soon. I want each and everyone of you to drink a can now, to get back into you electrolytes and energy you've just spent on this exercise. Some come on, I won't take no for an answer!" Sarah said, handing out a can to each woman in the group.

She watched one by one as each woman in the group opened the can and drank it, some of them chugging it, others like Theresa slowly and cautiously drinking it, afraid it might attack them.

"Everyone take another can with them and give it to someone they know. Tell them where they can get it and how much it's changing your life! And I'll see everyone back here the day after tomorrow!" Sarah said, dismissing the class, unaware of the "gravid" consequences that were quickly unfolding out of sight of Sarah.

Sarah's class met every other day, and one of those days would be 9 days from now on the day of the big "Fitness Show" that she and many of the women in the class would be participating in.

Toweling down the sweat, Sarah looked at the clocked and wondered her next move.

1111.content:
With her class over, Sarah threw her towel over her shoulder and grabbed her exercise bag, still full of cans of Xpect. The nausea had been feeling was muddled with the relative exhaustion of the workout, so she was in a small haze of good emotion. Sarah's personality made it pretty easy for her to snap into a happy mood and the surge of post-exercise serotonin helped that along. At every opportunity to talk about exercise, Sarah was always talking about the "happy chemicals" that the brain releases afterwards. Whether it was actually serotonin, or true at all, was not something she double-checked.

Now that she had her task for the day complete, Sarah thought now would be the best time to plug the drink and see if she could get in good with the boss. Sarah put away her headset and continued toweling off as she walked through the main exercise room. There were treadmills and ellipticals, all kinds of weight machines, and abundant room for exercise mats and wall mirrors. Other gym goers passed a considerable number of glances at her as she walked by. Sara had a great body and her sweaty session made certain special parts of her upper figure glisten.

"The only reason I come here at this time," one middle aged guy with thinning hair on an exercise bike smiled to his buddy on the bike next to him.

"I hear that," his pal responded. "Although today she looks a little green around the gills."

"Yeah, shame."

In the main lobby, Sarah joined her fellow MegaGym employees in the break room. They were chatting casually about their days' workouts and the upcoming competition, taking long sips from their water bottles. Sarah came in with a smile, glad so many people were there.

"Hey everybody!" she beamed. "Listen, I just came across this great new health drink that you've all got to try. It's made with so much protein and quinoa and blueberries and-"

Terry, the crossfit trainer, held up one hand. "Wait a sec, Sarah. No offense, but I'm not into those kinds of fad supplements. They're usually snake oil. I just exercise and eat right." Terry was a pretty tall, typical gym instructor. Short blond hair, muscular, and facial hair a few tones lighter than a 5 'o' clock shadow.

"Well, you won't say so after you've tried this," Sarah said, already rummaging through her bags to get out Xpect cans. "It's done wonders for me."

"Yeah? How long have you been taking it?" Lori, the swimming and water aerobics instructor, asked. Lori was much shorter, a bit above five feet, with long almond hair and tan skin.

"A few hours," Sarah said, handing out cans as the other employees looked up at her perplexed.

"A few...Sarah, you're a great trainer, but some time you can be so gullible about things like this," Jim, the yoga teacher, said. Jim was mid-height with a solid core of muscle. His black hair was naturally a little spiky.

"No, really, it's great," Sarah said. "It cleans your body out almost immediately to start preparing it. I just gave some to Rebecca and my whole Femme-Fit class."

"What's all this?" said Emily, MegaGym's owner. Emily was around the same age as the rest of the instructors but had the look of an 80s aerobics instructor. Her hair was black and curly and hung down to her shoulder blades. She had penetrating blue eyes, so much so that it nearly looked like she had eye shadow. Even in her office, Emily had been wearing a full body exercise leotard. You'd think she missed the casting call for an Olivia Newton John video.

"Emily, great!" Sarah smiled, handing Emily a can as well. "I actually wanted to try and get MegaGym to partner up with Xpect Energy Drink. We don't have much sponsorship and getting ahead of something like this, especially with the big competition coming up, could really benefit the gym."

Emily took the can in her hand and looked it over, as did the rest of the room. "I don't know, I've tried to steer us away from partnering with things like this. Terry put it the right way: these things are usually crap."

"Just try it out and you'll like it," Sarah said, smacking her tongue around in her mouth, feeling the barfy taste coming back.

"It can't hurt to just try," Lori said, popping the tab and taking a sip. Terry, Jim, and Emily all shrugged and did the same. Immediately, Jim dropped his arm back down, cheeks puffed out in disgust as he swallowed, wincing.

"Sarah, oh my god," he choked out, running for the bathroom.

"Namaste!" Sarah called out as Lori and Terry held their hands over their mouth.

"I'm really...really going to...hrrng," Lori said, burping a little as she and Terry left the room. Sarah, still with a blissful smile on her face, turned to Emily.

"So?" Sarah said in a chipper voice.

Emily held her head back, finishing the whole can in one drink. "Hoo...well Sarah, I can see what you meant about the 'cleaning out.' I'll...I'll get back to you about this. Excuse me." Emily closed her office door, the sound of vomiting quietly emanating from behind."

The familiar smell and sound of nausea dug up similar feelings in Sarah, so she headed out the room. No need to get all the toxins out here, she thought. As Sarah tried to find somewhere else to talk to coworkers, she came across one in the main exercise room.

"Hey Nina!" Sarah smiled. Nina was Sarah's best friend of all her coworkers at MegaGym. Nina was about eight months pregnant. Or at least Sarah thought she might be. Her friend insisted in telling her in weeks and Sarah didn't keep track of it all that well. She was big, it was sufficient to say. She also had a red pixie cut and pale skin with lots of birth marks peppering the front of her belly.

"Hi Sarah," Nina said, a little sadly. "A bunch of people just ran out of the employee room. Is everything okay?"

"Yeah, everything's fine," Sarah said. "What's up with you?"

Nina sighed and shrugged. "I'm still not getting anyone to sign up for the pregnant exercise class. I can't teach any regular classes and this is the only way to keep working until the baby comes."

"Even if you have to take a break, it'll be okay," Sarah smiled. "And you'll get more people, I'm sure. Hey, you'll definitely get more people after all the attention the gym's going to get after the fitness contest."

"Good point," Nina said. Like Sarah, she was a bit spacey and could get cheered up very easily. Sarah also had a naturally bright and sunny personality that could bring someone out of the dumps.

"Oh! That reminds me! I'm trying to get a tie-in with MegaGym, the contest, and this great new exercise drink," Sarah said, getting out a can of Xpect. "Here, try it! It's amazing." Nina didn't even hesitate before taking a long drink. "What do you think?"

"Hmm, it tastes pretty bad, but most of these things usually do. It makes me feel almost like I want to throw up, but I get that every now and then, thanks to this little guy," Nina said, running her hand over her belly. "Or this little gal. We want it to be a surprise."

Sarah nodded. "That's part of the healthy effects! Let me know how you like it."

"I will," Nina said, finishing off the can and tossing it inside the recycling. The magic in the can, resonating with some kind of strange power from eons and dimensions past, squirmed with excitement. Even it didn't know what would happen next with what just took place.

Happy with her work spreading the good word about Xpect around MegaGym for the day, Sarah-

11111.content:
Unaware of the "Gravid" chaos she just seeded at her place of employment, Sarah left MegaGym with a smile on her face, for sure that she just convinced all of her co-workers, and more importantly, her boss Emily, to chose Xpect as the drink of choice for the gym.

Looking at the clock, she uttered a small swear under her breath, and walked back to the car. Putting her gym bag, still holding a few cans of Xpect, in the backseat, she got in the front and buckled up.

Her stomach emitted a low rumble, and she felt as if she hadn't eaten in the history of forever. She had.... a craving? Nonsense. She didn't crave. All of her meals were pre-planned for perfect nutritional value. Still... Pizza could be good right now.

Sarah shook her head, trying to get the almost insatiable craving out of her head, as she started the car and drove back home. The ride home itself was uneventful, but that was to change as Sarah climbed up the flights of stairs to her apartment floor.

Her apartment floor was home to four people. Apartment One was home to The Hamiltons, David, age 45, his wife Trisha age 47, and their twin daughters Laci and Maci, age 19. They moved in a little while ago while they were building a home in a suburb in town. Unfortunately, some shady practices by the construction company has left the partially finished house in limbo as The Hamiltons wait for some court decisions before they find another contractor to finish the job. Something about property lines, building materials or something, Sarah didn't quite remember.

Their apartment was quite big, the biggest on the floor actually, so it's wasn't like they were crammed into a tiny tin can. David worked in an office, doing something that Sarah couldn't quite remember, while Trisha was a nurse. The girls were attending the local college. Laci was 6'3, thin, busty, and GOTH. She was so goth she probably shat bats. Her lipstick was black, her eyeliner was black, her hair was black, her earings were black, everything as black. Sarah remembered the goths from High School, and was surprised to learn that old fads die hard.

Maci on the other hand, was a total valley girl, if in fact, the town they lived in was in a valley. Bleached blonde hair, blue contact lenses, low cut tops that showed off ample cleavage, bright red lips, blue eyeshadow, short shorts. She drove the men nuts, and she knew it. She loved using her looks to get whatever she wanted, but that didn't make Maci a spoiled brat. She was smart, hard working, and above all chaste. She was in it for the thrill, and what was a few dinner and movie if she didn't have to pay?

Next door to Sarah and Britney, was Ms. Hilary Perkins. Ms. Hilary Perkins, as everyone called her, was a her early 60's. She lived by herself, and talked to of the neighbors on occasion, but struck Sarah as woman who just wanted to be left alone, and many granted that request for her.

Apartment Three was home to "Superstar" Sabrina. A red-headed bomb-shell in her early 20's, her claim to fame that she was in a commercial that one time that some people vaguely remember seeing at something o'clock in the morning. She claims that she's "an actress" but most people see to remember her as "The Secretary In The Tight Dress", because she the curves to fill them out. She claimed that she was going to be a "big star" one day, but Sarah always wondered when.

Apartment Four was home to the newlyweds Tami and Andrew Smiths. Just married, they moved into an apartment, although Sarah wondered why as they were never in it half of the time. They were always traveling to museums, going on trips, or whatever it was that newlyweds did without kids. The Hamiltons were wondering when the Smiths would start popping out young ones, which as Sarah overheard was a strong and firm "Never".

"Hello Sarah!" Dave Hamilton said, waving from the apartment door. "Hi Dave" Sarah smiled back. "Getting back from work today?" Dave asked, his eyes non-shalently eyeing Sarah's body in her workout gear. He did this every time he saw her in her outfit, and she didn't mind. Men will be men after all.

"Yeah. Just closed a big deal at the gym today. I got us to sponsor this new energy drink for our big fitness expo coming up. Check it out" Sarah said, opening up her bag and pulling out the cans of Xpect. "Xpect?" David asked eyeing the can. "It's amazing. It's made from all natural ingredients and really cleans out your body of toxins" Sarah said, pitching the drink to her neighbor. "Really?" David said looking at the can.

"Yup. And we - - Oh hey, Laci. Maci" Sarah said as the valley girl and the goth pulled open the door to see who it was from their side.
"Hey" they said in unison, Laci never once looking up from her black, heavy metal band logo covered smart phone, while Maci twirled her long blonde locks with her finger.
"Girls, Sarah has a new energy drink. Sounds pretty great. Think we should try it?" David said, handing a can over to Laci.
"Whatever" The girls said in unison, not looking up from their phone or playing with their hair.
"Think I can get a few cans for us?" David asked.

"I didn't think you were much into energy drinks Mr. H" Sarah said, handing out 3 additional cans of the drink.
"Well, I'm not usually, but these girls here slam these things, and I figure, hey let's try to see what makes these things all the rage huh? YOBO; You're Only Born Once, #AMIRITEGIRLS?" David said, trying to be hip and cool, and failing so epicly, eons from now, it will be recognized as a historical event worthy of study.

"Whatever" The two girls said in unison, cracking open their Xpect cans, chugging them together, tossing the cans into recycling and then leaving without ever saying a word other than "Whatever"
David laughed and said "College kids" before drinking his can of Xpect. He took one last can, saying he'll make sure his wife will drink it when she gets home, his face looking unusually pale.

The conversation ended sometime later by a strange bought of nausea, from the three members of the Hamilton family, but Sarah felt fantastic. If she could get everyone else on her floor hooked on this stuff, she could push them in the direction of MegaGym.

And so she went knocking to each door, successfully getting each person on the floor to try Xpect. Each. Single. Person.
It was like a dream Sarah thought. It was almost like the were hypnotized into not saying "no". Finishing up her task with the Smiths, the sounds of puking being softly heard behind their door from both husband and wife, Sarah returned to her apartment (passing along the door to Ms. Hilary Perkins, whom seemed to be also experiencing a toxin cleanse of her own after trying the drink).

"Brit! I'm home!" Sarah said in a delightful sing-song voice. Not only had she (in her own mind) pitched Xpect to her co-workers and boss, she managed to sell the drink to everyone on her floor! Maybe she could sell this stuff door to door! She could make some serious extra money!
"Brit?" Sarah asked, looking around to find Britney asleep on the couch, her hands resting on her midsection, with a huge smile on her face.

"I wonder what you're dreaming about" Sarah thought, opening the fridge and grabbing a large salad she prepared for herself earlier in the day.
She grabbed a few pieces of chicken to put in the salad, but a groan of protest from her stomach, made her drown the once healthy salad in chicken and ranch dressing.

Still healthier for her than the pizza she was craving, she sat down and ate the salad with a ravenous hunger. She practically licked the bowl clean by the time she done. Letting out a small burp after words, Sarah looked over at the clock and felt more tired than usual.

"That's weird. Wonder what's got me so sleepy today?" She asked stifling a yawn as she contemplated staying up or getting to bed early.

went to see her friends
111111.content:
Sarah stretched her arms out, the yawn she tried to suppress getting out. "Mmm, I guess there's nothing wrong with an early bedtime," Sarah said to herself, walking like a zombie to her own room. Once inside, she let out another burp and held her hand over her tight abs. "Ugh, I still feel kinda bad from the Xpect. Hopefully in the morning the nausea will be gone." She changed out of her clothes, still stained and a bit stiff with sweat. Sarah contemplated stepping into the shower but changed her mind at the last second.

One look in the mirror told her that she didn't look too good. Her eyes had grey bags under them and her lips were a little chapped from her repeated vomiting. Sarah looked down at her fit, sexy body, resting one hand on her stomach and pressing gently. That settled her lousy feeling some, so Sarah continued to rub and feel her bare belly. "Nice and flat, and gentle soft skin like pastry," Sarah sang to herself with a little smile. "That's why we go to the gym!"

Sarah tried brushing her teeth, but had to stop every few seconds as her tooth brush set off her gag reflexes. She opted for a swig of mouthwash instead and headed back into bed, unhooking her bra and snuggling under the blankets. "This stuff really took its toll on me," Sarah groaned, seeing a can of Xpect still left on her desk. "I bet I'll feel amazing in the morning now." In no time, Sarah was off to sleep, drifting deeper and deeper into the unfolding dream world.

Nina was at the front of the gym, in her athletic top that just covered her breasts and her little shorts, shuffling back and forth, sweat dripping off of her big belly. "Alright, good, now we're going to pull, just like me. Ready?" Nina said into her headset, pump-up music playing from the speakers above the class. Nina stretched one arm out and pulled it back, switching from arm to arm as she continued to hop around, belly and breasts jiggling.

The class in front of her, all hugely pregnant, some impossibly so, did the same. It was all kinds of familiar faces: Brittany, the Hamiltons, the Smiths, Mrs. Perkins, Sabrina. Although Sabrina and Laci seemed to be having a hard time keeping up with the exercises. It wasn't just because their bellies were nearly five feet in front of their bodies. If anything, that made them below average in this class.

"Alright, now to do some leg work, here's my friend, Sarah!" Nina said, and in came Sarah, with a belly dwarfing Nina's like Jupiter dwarfs Io. Sarah didn't seem to mind, though. "I knew you'd enjoy it, Ms. Perkins," Sarah smiled, walking toward her car now, Sabrina and Hilary following behind.

"I even signed up for your class, Sarah," Hilary beamed, opening the backseat door and sliding in, surprising herself with how mobile she was now. "Now that I'm retired, working out might become the highlight of my week."

Sarah couldn't contain her smile. Okay, she could never contain her smile, but now it was noticeably larger and sunnier. She didn't need a relationship and she certainly wasn't the ugly, tiny woman the break-up made her feel like. Sarah was a fitness herald who helped other women get in shape and improve their lives.

As they drove, Sabrina and Hilary managed to chat, each taking turns talking about things the other couldn't care less about. Plays and "personal journeys" on Sabrina's side, past acquaintances and Jimmy Carter on Hilary's. Slowly, the chatter shifted toward Sarah.

"I feel better now, but I'd still love to have this paunch gone soon," Sabrina said, patting her belly softly. "You say it's bloating from the energy drink?"

Nausea, then intense cravings, plus increased energy and vivid dreams. Weight gain, shinier skin, healthier hair, tight ankles. "Well, a friend of mine, a scientist, is actually looking at it now, so she'll confirm what I've been saying."

"You know, in my day, we had a phrase about 'snake-oil salesmen,'" Hilary said tentatively. "Then again, I drank that nasty beverage too, so I'm just as gullible as everyone else."

"Everything will be fine!" Sarah said, parking quickly in front of the apartment and turning around to face Sabrina and Hilary. Her wide smile and intense, agitated eyes gave her face a distinctly creepy look. "Okay? Everything will be fine! We feel good, we look good, we're great!"

Sabrina and Hilary nodded in fear and eased out of the car, unable to look away from Sarah's eyes. Sarah let out a big sigh and put the car in park, getting out and walking up into her room. She stretched out and opened up her laptop before checking her pockets for her wallet, keys, and phone. Good thing she did: there was a missed call from Diana. Sarah redialed immediately.

"Hey Di," Sarah said, holding the phone with one hand as she checked email and Facebook with the other.

"Sarah, I think I should come over to your apartment. I ran a few tests and I really need to talk to you about Xpect," Diana said, her voice nervous and hurried.

"Okay, sure. I was just thinking about that," Sarah said, her eyes moving from posts to comments on Facebook. "What is it?"

"I think I'd better tell you in person," Diana said. "Is Britney there?"

"..."

"Sarah?"

"Kate is moving back into town," Sarah choked out.

"Okay, I am definitely coming over," Diana said, hanging up. Sarah slumped back into her chair, looking at the comment on a friend's status vacantly. <Kate Becker commented: great, we can talk about it tomorrow. Just moved back in today!>

Kate was "the" ex in Sarah's life. She was everything that matched up in a beauty like Sarah's life. Gorgeous, smart, fun, good job as an ad executive. She and Sarah dated for two years and even flirted with the idea of moving in together and getting married one day and having kids, whether through adoption or the miracle of science. Then, one day, Kate just told Sarah she was bored by her and had been bored for a long time. "A good body isn't enough anymore," Kate had said. "Maybe if it was a great body. But living with you? Kids with you? I can do better for myself." Then Kate moved to an upscale neighborhood in Manhattan to work on a big project which looks like it just wrapped up.

Sarah felt herself shudder, gripping her forearms to stop. She'd loved Kate and Kate broke her heart savagely. A knock at the door drew Sarah's attention, hoping it was Diana so she could have someone to help hug away the bad feelings. Instead, Maci stood there, shifting and looking around. "Hi Sarah. Britney's not back yet?"

"No, sorry," Sarah said, furrowing her brow, noticing that Maci'd put on a bit of a gut too, as well as a larger pair of breasts. She could use a trip to the gym too, Sarah thought. "What do you need?"

"Just someone to talk to," she said quietly. "See, today, Laci and I found out we're-" Maci was cut off by the sound of Trisha and David walking up the stairs, talking in a hushed voice. "Gottagobye."

"I'm as surprised as you are," Trisha whispered as the two got closer, Maci getting back inside and closing the door in just enough time to not be noticed. "I mean, sure it's possible, but three months?"

"And they couldn't tell how many, but it was clear that it was more than one," David whispered. "Twins again. Do you realize how much that will cost?"

"Do not blame me for this, David," Trisha hissed. Sarah slowly closed the door behind her at this point, hearing more than she felt she should. As she walked back to her room, she got a call from Britney.

"Sarah: got those tickets," Britney said, packing things off her desk as she held the phone between her shoulder and ear. "There's also a kind of reception-meal thing afterward that I got you and Diana entry to. Should be nice."

"Sounds nice, thanks," Sarah said. "I think it'll be fun. Hey are you...coming back soon?"

"Yeah, why? Actually, you sound kind of funny. Is something up?"

"Just...come back when you can, okay?" Sarah said, biting her lip. "Bye Britney."

"Bye Sarah," Britney replied.

Minutes later, Diana was at the door. Sarah tried to hold herself together, but her eyes welled up as soon as she saw her old friend. "W-what's the news with Xpect?"

Diana opened her mouth, studying Sarah's face. This was not someone who needed the news that she might be pregnant due to a mystery energy drink.

"Nothing, it's not important right now. Come here, hon," Diana said, opening her arms and letting Sarah dive right in, hugging her close and sobbing. "Let's just talk, okay?"

"Sarah, I'm home," Britney said, putting her purse and laptop bag down in a chair and walking around the apartment. "You wanted to talk?" Turning the corner, she found Diana and Sarah huddled together on the couch, Sarah in her brainy friend's arms. "What's...what's up?"

Sarah was no longer crying, but Britney could see the puffy evidence still on Sarah's face. "Kate's back in town," Sarah said in a monotone. Britney let out a long sigh, sitting on her opposite side and adding her embrace to the mix.

"I'm sorry, Sarah," Britney cooed. The three of them had been friends forever, but Britney and Sarah only became roommates in the aftermath of the infamous "Kate break-up." I forgot to tell you Sarah: somehow I left some cans at Soft Lace and the models all had some, but they don't seem run down like we were yesterday."

After a few seconds, Diana nodded. "O-okay, yeah! That sounds like fun. Should I meet you at-"

Sarah and Britney were both there, hanging out and chatting. Sarah was a few drinks in and was beginning to complain about being single. Britney was one month away from dumping a boyfriend at the time, and when Diana walked into the bar, Britney couldn't help herself from laughing at Sarah's obvious reaction.

"What?" Sarah blushed.

"If you like her, go talk to her," Britney grinned. "You're hot, she's hot, you'll do great together." Sarah slowly went over to Diana and did an astoundingly bad job of flirting. So bad that it took Diana a while to figure out what was going on, by which time they were already starting to like one another's company.

"...oh!" Diana finally exclaimed when Sarah asked if she'd like to get together sometime. "Sorry, I'm...straight."

Sarah turned bright red and apologized about 20 times before Diana got a chance to laugh and join her and Britney at their table, the three becoming close friends ever since.

The pub was pretty crowded when the three made it there today, getting a table across from the bar. "Damn, I'm still crazy hungry," Sarah worried, biting her thumb as she looked over the various greasy burgers the place offered."

"Well, you did your class today. That burns a lot of energy, doesn't it?" Britney said, feeling the same cravings as she read over the menu. Diana too, for that matter.

"Well I took a risk and ate a lot with Diana yesterday and look at me now," Sarah whined, leaning back, raising her shirt to show off her bulging belly.

"No big deal, that's happening to me too and I haven't been eating too much more," Britney said, smoothing out her top to reveal her own gut, emphasizing her breasts in the process. Diana turned bright red, the guilt eating her inside. The guilt and the sudden need for a milkshake.

"Hello and welcome to...Sarah?" the waitress said. Sarah immediately recognized her as Megan from the Femme-Fit class.

"Megan! Oh my God! I didn't know you worked here," Sarah said excitedly. "Megan, these are my two best friends in the whole world: Britney and Diana."

The three said hello before Megan turned back to Sarah. "Actually, I've only been working here for about a week. I've waited tables before, so it's not a big transition, but my husband and I both decided we needed some more money in the house. And good timing too," she said, patting her belly. "Anyway, can I get you all something to drink?"

The three paused before all ordering water. Megan nodded and smiled to turn before Sarah got her attention quickly. "A-actually, is it okay if we put in our food orders now? I'm just feeling weirdly hungry."

"Sure," Megan said, getting the multiple burger, sandwich, and soup orders from the three of them before thanking the trio and heading to the back.

"Hungry too? Or are you just making me feel better?" Sarah laughed. "And you guys can get some beer or something. Don't skimp out just because of me. I'd just rather not start tonight." She bowed her head a little. "I feel like if I start now...I won't stop until it's too late."

"Hey, you're doing great," Britney said, putting her hand on Sarah's back. "And it's fine, I just don't feel like getting a beer tonight."

"If they had kombucha, it would be a different story," Sarah said, seemingly to herself. "It's made from black tea so it's a superfood and it's got alcohol in it."

"Diana, what about you?" Britney said. "You always look so elegant with a glass of red wine in your hand. You could bring plenty of guys over."

Diana laughed nervously. "Oh please. The one who always brings guys over is Sarah. I don't know if that's irony or Murphy's Law or what."

They chuckled some more and Sarah turned to Diana. "But yeah, why aren't you getting anything more?"

"I just...don't feel like it," Diana said, turning red. "I shouldn't."

Sarah and Britney both paused. "Shouldn't?" Britney asked.

"I...that's not what I meant," Diana said quickly, turning redder.

"Hey, are you okay?" Sarah asked quietly.

Diana gripped her fists quickly and let out a little sigh. "I'm pregnant." Britney and Sarah's eyes slowly got bigger as they prepared to get excited as Diana shook her head quickly. "No, no, please. It's not...it's...I have to go." She grabbed her purse and headed out the door, brushing off the multiple guys at the bar who asked for her to wait up.

"Well...this was fun for a little bit," Britney said, biting her lip. "You won't...judge me too hard if I suggest we split Diana's order, would you?"

"You run around with weights all day and you can't handle standing around in a park?" Jim replied with an incredulous smile, biting into one of his slices of pizza. "Besides, this place is fine and it's a lot more fun than any sports bar."

As they found a part of the food truck park with fewer screaming kids and teenagers making-out, Terry and Jim stopped walking around and focused on their own food. "So what do you think about this athletic competition at the gym? It's in less than a week now and I don't know how well we're going to pull it off."

The deadline isn't until the day of the contest so I'll bet there will be a big influx right before. I trust Emily to pull it off." He looked around the park and tapped Terry on the arm. "Speak of the devil."

Emily, with her brown curls and growing belly, saw the two of them and walked over, waving a little. "Hello, funny seeing both of you here."

"Not our usual stomping ground," Terry smiled. He came here to meet women, and even if it's his boss, a hot girl's a hot girl. "So what are you up to?"

"Well, actually," Emily said, turning around and bringing her voice down to a hush. "I'm here with a friend. She just had a pretty bad break-up and I'm trying to cheer her up, get her out of her apartment." Spying her friend, Emily waved her over. "Be nice to her, okay? She's quiet but she'll open up if you treat her well."

"I'll be nice to her, alright," Terry said when he spied Emily's friend, Monica. She had on a white blouse with ruffles down the front, her already impressive chest increased in size thanks to the growing force inside her womb. If Terry and Jim's eyes weren't immediately drawn there, they might have noticed the sloping going on in her midsection. It was tight and concentrated around her front abdomen and while it was maybe unusual for a lingerie model, it was still a modest, gentle pot belly. For now.

"Monica, these are two of my coworkers, Terry and Jim," Emily said with a smile, motioning to her two fitness instructors. Both nodded and smiled, eyes moving to Monica's gorgeous, composed face.

"Hi," Monica replied, waving a bit before moving her hand back to her forearm.

"So, what do you do?" Jim said, quickly trying to wipe the crumbs and cheese from his fingertips.

"I'm a model," Monica said.

"Really?" Terry and Jim said in unison, both of their lips spreading into even wider smiles, their eyes flashing.

"Down, boys," Emily snarked, rolling her eyes as she turned to Monica. "Are you sure you don't want anything?"

She shook her head. "I felt kind of nauseous the past few days and it's still a little residual. Besides, I've got the big show tomorrow." Monica looked back at Emily and her worried face. "I'm fine, really. I'm not hungry."

"You're not missing much," Terry said, eating the last pieces of his kebob. "Personally, I wanted to get some burgers and fries. Models can eat those, can't they?"

A gurgle belched up in Monica's stomach, accompanied by a flare-up of cravings. "Yeah, we can," Monica said with a little laugh. "Not many do, though."

"But you're the exception?" Jim smiled.

Monica smiled. "I guess so."

Emily wasn't thrilled about her coworkers hitting on her troubled friend, but it didn't seem to be bothering her for now and she was at least starting to smile and laugh with strangers. "Well, if you all want to go get junk food, I might as well join you." Emily tried to picture the look on Terry and Jim's face when she revealed that Monica wasn't exactly interested in men and thought that was reason enough to go along.

As the four made their way to the parking lot, another familiar face came their way. "Oh my God, Terry! Jim! Emily!" Rebecca said with a big smile and open arms.

"Rebecca, hi," Terry said, nodding along. Rebecca had been at the top of his "Coworkers I Want To Bang" list for quite some time, but since she started going steady with a new boyfriend, he was sadly forced to move her to the "Unattainable" category, also occupied by Nina for being pregnant and Sarah for being crazy. It was a very complicated system, especially considering he had never even gotten close to having sex with anyone he worked with.

"Rebecca, this is my friend, Monica," Emily said, trying to introduce the two. Introducing Monica to Jim and Terry seemed to work out pretty well. "She's a lingerie model."

"Really?" Rebecca said, sounding much more surprised than Terry or Jim. "I mean, you've got big tits, but doesn't the flabby belly make it harder to get work?"

Monica's freckles hid most of her blushing, but it was pretty strong. "I-I still get work and I think it's a side effect from when I was sick," she said.

"Well, alright," Rebecca shrugged, resting against the tall, strapping guy beside her. "Babe, introduce yourself."

"Hey, I'm Tony, I'm Rebecca's boyfriend," he smiled, wrapping one arm around Rebecca's hip. "Hey, got any ideas for some lingerie I can buy for my girl? She won't take any of my suggestions for sexy clothes."

"Tony!" Rebecca giggled and gasped, pushing against him playfully. "I'll get you back for that."

"Oh yeah?" Tony grinned, the two reaching down to kiss quickly. No one watching was particularly comfortable, but Monica's embarrassment was growing.

"Monica, are you dating anyone we know?" Rebecca asked when she finally broke away from her boyfriend.

"No, I'm single," Monica said, trying to put some confidence back into her voice.

"Aww, you're so cute though," Rebecca said. "Well, maybe it's the belly. I can see some guys being picky about that. Maybe join MegaGym."

"M-maybe," Monica said, her hands tightening around her arms.

Emily could read the situation and got a little closer to Monica. "Well, we were just leaving, but see you at work tomorrow, bright and early," Emily said, the four of them walking past Rebecca and Tony.

"Alright, bye!" Rebecca said, turning back to Tony and groaning. "I hate seeing coworkers outside of the office."

"Yeah," Tony said, nodding along, not really knowing what to say. "I'm going to get a beer. Want one?"

"No boo, I told you, I feel sick when I think about alcohol," Rebecca said in a pouting voice. "Just buy me some ice cream, okay?"

As Terry, Jim, Emily, and Monica made it to their cars, Monica leaned in to her friend. "I don't...feel up to this. Can you just drive me back to my place?"

"You sure?" Emily said. "Are you feeling sick again?"

"I don't know, I just feel like I'm going to bring things down," Monica said, getting into the passenger's seat, taking a deep breath and trying to keep her mind off of her break-up. "Some memories got brought up and...you understand, right Emily?"

"Of course I do," Emily said, getting in the other side and turning on the car. "Just text or call me if anything comes up, okay?"

"Okay," Monica nodded.

"And I know you feel bad now, but I can't say it enough," Emily said, taking Monica's hand in her own. "You're too good for Kate and nothing she said matters."

"Mom, you caught me with my face between my teacher's legs before so this can't come as that much of a shock."

Trisha blushed and lifted her head. "Honey, there can't just...not be a father. Someone had to be involved for you to get pregnant. Did you go to a sperm bank?" In the excitement of it all, she hadn't even gotten to deliver the news to her daughters that she was pregnant with another pair of twins.

Laci shook her head. "Nope. My belly just started getting big all on its own. Personally, I'm hoping I was finally chosen to bear the Anti-Christ or some other demon offspring." She paused, thinking it over. "I'd settle for an alien pregnancy, I suppose. As long as it's the pre-text for a coming invasion."

David stomped his foot, much to the dismay of their downstairs neighbors. "This is not a joke, Laci! Your mother and I are not stupid. You can't just suddenly become pregnant."

"Y-yes you can," Maci managed to get out, looking up from her plate at her parents. "Mom...Dad...I'm pregnant too."

David and Trisha stopped their interrogation of Laci and turned to their other daughter, faces shocked. "Sweetie..." Trisha said.

"And I didn't have sex either," Maci said, hands crossing over her slight belly even more tightly. "I mean, I'm not a lesbian like Laci-"

"We don't want you either," Laci cackled back.

"Shut up, Laci. But I took a pregnancy test and it came up positive. And my belly's been getting bigger, my breasts feel funny, I have these weird cravings. And I haven't had sex with anyone-"

"Not lately," Laci laughed again.

"Shut UP, Laci!" Maci stood up to yell at her sister after her second interjection, her belly now visible to her parents. "You both believe me, don't you?"

David rubbed his forehead, frustrated. "You both took pregnancy tests?" he said. "Where did you get them?"

They clammed up, not wanting to get Britney in trouble. Maci figured she'd need her neighbor's help if she was going to survive this pregnancy under her strict parent's roof and Laci wanted to keep Britney on as a life-line in place of the horrifying sunny Sarah. "Just at the local convenience store," they said in unison.

"Probably some defective, cheap brand," David sighed, sitting down at the table. "You should have let us know so we could have gotten you a proper test."

"We'll still take you both to the doctor's tomorrow," Trisha said, smiling softly. "I'm sure it's nothing. We're all a little stressed, having to stay at this apartment while we try to get the new house and we were all sick a few days ago."

"I hope not," Laci said, moving to the dinner table, sticking her limited belly out proudly, her dark top showing off her midriff while clinging tightly to her growing chest. "I've wanted to be pregnant forever. Feeling something foreign grow inside you, kick and squirm deep in your womb, suck off your nutrients and blood? What could be more metal than that?"

Maci shuddered. "I wish you'd stop talking like that. Being pregnant means getting big and fat. No more parties, no more flirting, no cute little outfits to wear while you sit out in the sun with your friends. I might as well have a job."

"There's a thought," David said, rolling his eyes as he dished out the pasta.

"I hope neither of you are pregnant just yet, but when you want to be pregnant, it can be a wonderful experience," Trisha said. "Laci, it's nice to feel your children inside you, and Maci, I thought I looked very beautiful when I had both of you. And being pregnant isn't just about the changes your body goes through. It's about welcoming some important people into your life." Trisha put her hands on Laci and Maci's shoulders. "And I was lucky enough to get two at once."

"Ugh," the two groaned, rolling their eyes.

Trisha chuckled and bit her lip. "And I'm getting a chance to do that again now." Laci and Maci both turned to their mother in shock. "Your father and I went to the doctor's yesterday and...I'm pregnant. With twins."

"Oh my god," Maci said, putting her hands in her head. "I'm going to be pregnant alongside my mom. This is a nightmare."

Laci laughed out loud. "I must have cast a spell wrong and got the whole apartment pregnant. Dad, maybe you should pee on a strip too."

"That's enough," David grumbled, putting a big helping of linguine on his plate. "You're both still not off the hook. Even if it turns out that these pregnancy tests were defective, you both snuck out and got these tests without coming to your mother and I first. And if...if you are both pregnant than we are all going to have a long conversation."

Trisha hung her head sadly and proceeded to fill her own plate, cravings taking hold of her. Thankfully, they were strong enough that she made enough pasta to feed all four of the pregnant Hamilton family members. She was so excited when she found out she was pregnant for a second time and wanted to share it with her family. It would be the perfect timing too, as the new house was being opened up. But instead, Maci thought it was gross and embarrassing, Laci was wrapped up in her own goth oddities, and David seemed more upset and stressed since he got the news. Who could she share her pregnancy with?

David ate eagerly, unaware of his own twins, when his cellphone buzzed in his pocket. "Shit, hold on," he said, walking out to the apartment complex's open hallway to take the call. More complications with the construction buy-out. He was still getting the house, but future contracts didn't look too promising. When he finished the call, he sighed and rested his head against the wall, sighing. It was pretty late out, the complex's lights giving just enough illumination to see around.

Sometimes when he would get stressed, as he often did, David would loiter outside the apartment, mainly for his neighbors. He started to time his trips to the mailroom and garbage room with Sarah's morning runs so he could see her in her tight exercise clothes. Britney wasn't bad looking either and he constantly tried to convince Trisha to go buy something at Soft Lace so he could see Britney model the lingerie options. Sabrina was a nice, curvy woman too and she seemed happier to chat with him than either Sarah or Britney.

And lately, they'd all looked bustier too. Sabrina definitely had a fatter ass. David's angry scowl curled into a creepy grin, thinking about the women in the building. He'd never cheated on Trisha but he thought about it. A lot. And even tried at a few construction conventions, but with no luck. And if Trisha was going to have a big pregnant stomach again, he wouldn't even have her to release his frustrations into.

Maybe if his company had been bought out better, he'd have more cash to wave around and maybe he'd be able to get one of his neighbors to join him in bed. Until then, where could he casually meet them?

"The gym," David said quietly to himself, stroking his chin. "Of course..."

His stomach began to gurgle and David noticed his hand on his bulging belly, putting it away quickly. Back to dinner for now, he thought, trying to wipe away his lustful grin. And later I'll bring up a subscription to MegaGym.

"It's okay, you don't need to win. I still love you," the woman said, letting Sarah's hand touch hers as she took the water bottle. "And besides, this is just a dream. You'll do much better in the real thing."

"Will you be there for the real thing?" Sarah asked, moving closer to the dream woman.

"Yes. And I can't wait to meet you...," the woman said with a smile, moving her lips to Sarah's, "today."

Sarah woke up in an instant, her eyes darting around her dark apartment room. For someone who just woke up, she felt strangely alert and well-rested. Reaching down, she picked up her phone lying beside her bed and saw the time. One minute before her alarm clock was set to go off. "On the bright side, I can start my run one minute earlier!"

Throwing off her covers and sitting up, Sarah saw that she might need to rethink today's morning run. The potbelly she was carrying around yesterday was now a full-on belly. Round, firm, and big. She could wrap her hands around it and not just rest on top of it and feel bloated and fat. This was different.

"I look...pregnant," Sarah said out loud, looking down at herself. "I...I look pregnant." Standing up slowly, Sarah could feel the change in weight against her back and hips, rubbing her hugeness. But that's impossible, she then thought, bending over slowly to get her phone. The side effects from Xpect were much worse than she thought. Maybe it was a bad purchase after all. If anyone could help explain this to her, it was Diana. She'd been researching this stuff, and besides, Diana was the smartest person Sarah knew. Even if she didn't know anything about Xpect, she could give Sarah some insight into her swelling middle.

Her mind eased for now, Sarah squeezed into her jogging clothes, glad the top and shorts had enough elastic to contain her breasts and ass which had grown along with her belly. Taking a deep breath, Sarah headed out the door, her glowing personality not allowing her to think about the leering looks she would get running around with what looked like a six-month pregnant belly hanging out and heaving breasts in a low-cut athletic top. People on the sidewalk either looked at her in disgust, astonishment, or lust. Some people snapped pictures and uploaded them to all different websites with different captions. "You'll Never Believe How This Girl Decided to Dress." "Fat Pregnant Girl Thinks We All Want To See Her Stomach." "I'm In Love."

Thankfully, being pretty early in the morning, Sarah didn't run into too many people before she got back home. As she came up the steps, she saw the Smiths, walking downstairs, both looking concerned. "Hi Tami, Andrew," Sarah said. Once she got their attention, their faces turned from worry to shock. "How are you both? Still going to MegaGym?"

"Actually, we're going to a doctor's appointment," Tami said, looking away, embarrassed, from Sarah's belly. "I've been feeling a little...odd lately." She tried to cross her arms to hide her own growing belly and wasn't doing the best job.

"Hope everything turns out okay," Sarah said with a sympathetic tone. "If you don't feel good, maybe best to say away from the gym. Let me know, okay?"

They both nodded as Sarah went into her apartment, finding Brittany pacing around, wearing her robe with her belly clearly sticking out. "Sarah...oh my God it's happened to you too."

Sarah sighed and nodded. "Yeah, this bloating is getting out of control, but I'm going to talk with Diana and-"

"Bloating? Sarah, wake up: we're pregnant. Somehow, some way, we're pregnant," she said, unfurling her robe to place both hands over her stomach. "Look at this! This nausea, the exhaustion, the growing all over the place!"

"Brittany, you need to be more reasonable," Sarah said, shaking her head.

"Reasonable?! You say unreasonable stuff all the time! All of this health food crap, all of this exercise! It's all nonsense!" Brittany grabbed a can of Xpect off the table and held it up to Sarah's face. "You waste money on this crazy garbage because you don't know what the fuck you're talking about!" After a few moments of silence, the two friends meeting eyes, Brittany started fanning her face, waddling as quickly as she could back to her room.

Sarah gulped, rubbing her belly with concern as she waddled to her own room to start on her shower. She and Brittany had fought before but...this felt different. First Diana, now Brittany. Were the Three Musketeers breaking apart? Sarah tried not to think about it right now as she washed herself off, finding herself stroking her belly fairly regularly. I kind of like rubbing it, Sarah thought to herself. That's one upside, I suppose.

Once dressed into her usual work attire, Sarah drove herself to the gym, struggling to get the steering wheel to function with her belly in the way. The struggle slowed Sarah down immensely, and once she finally made it to the MegaGym parking lot, it was nearly time for her FemmeFit program to start.

Hurrying inside, having to hold the front of her belly to keep it from slowing her down too much, Sarah checked in quickly and waddled to her area of the gym, when a familiar face stopped her on the way. "Diana?"

"S-Sarah?" Diana said, looking down at Sarah's belly. "I guess I was right," Diana said quietly.

Sarah didn't hear her friend because she was too busy wrapping her up in a big hug. Possibly the biggest hug she'd ever given, minus the first time Kate said she wanted them to move in together. "Diana Larsen, I have wanted to give out one of my special hugs to a best friend when they tell me they are either having a baby or getting married, and now I finally get to do one of those."

Diana laughed a little and hugged Sarah back. "C-careful," Diana managed to get out, both because of their bellies and because Sarah's hugs could sometimes go off the scale of a dynamometer. When Sarah finally broke the hug after nearly a minute, she could see Diana's wardrobe: a pair of black leggings and a bright green spandex top that held in most of her belly. And yes, to Sarah's surprise, Diana now had a sizable belly, which she did not have yesterday. "You can see that I was telling the truth about being pregnant now, huh?"

"Yeah," Sarah said, the two of them resting their hands on their bellies simultaneously. "Did you get my text and that's why you met me here?"

"Sort of," Diana said, adjusting her glasses. "I figured I'd see you here but I also...signed up for pre-natal exercise. I figured I could use it now that I'm...you know."

Sarah smiled. "Well, we need to talk all about it. And about this-" she said, patting her own belly. "I'm starting to look like you, Diana."

"That's actually something I should tell you about quickly," Diana said. "First of all, who else did you give-"

"I'm sorry, I've got my class now and my Pregnant Friend Hug ate up the last bit of time I had left!" Sarah said, waddling past Diana as she yelled to her. "But we'll talk after I'm done?"

"-Xpect to..." Diana tried to get out as Sarah went into the main gym area to teach her class. "Oh boy, she isn't going to like what I have to tell her." Diana turned around to see Terry, leaning against the wall with a casual smile on his face, looking her over.

"Hello there," he said, trying hard to flex his muscles without looking like he's flexing at all. "Are you lost? I teach crossfit training here, so I know everything there is to know about MegaGym. I can help you out."

Diana noticed his own bulging stomach. It just looked like a paunch for now, but she had a bad feeling. "I'm looking for...pre-natal exercise, I guess."

"Oh," Terry said, his muscles immediately shrinking as he relaxed. "Down this hall, second door on the left. Nina runs it, and believe me, you'll be able to recognize her."

"Thanks," Diana said, turning to waddle over before turning back to Terry, "and, um, I'd suggest starting to take iron and calcium supplements soon."

"Why?"

"No reason."

Very important at any stage of pregnancy." As the class began to disperse, Sarah walked over to Nina, getting a smile from her friend. "Sarah, hi!" "Hi Nina," Sarah said slowly, looking her friend over. "You're...what?"

"Some of your FemmeFit ladies look like they're going to join me soon too. Megan's already here. She said she's expecting quadruplets, can you believe it? Ms. Perkins was alone in her apartment, staring at her round middle in the mirror. Her belly, now known to her as her PREGNANT BELLY, was rounding out, taking a ball shape. Her once loose skin had tightened up around her belly, the faint beginnings of stretch marks beginning to make their presence. Her back had a small arch to her as her center of gravity changed as her two twin girls grew inside her.

So, perhaps in this case, Ms. Perkins wasn't alone. She wouldn't ever really be alone ever again… And that terrified the hell out of Ms. Perkins.

She was 54 years old, was pregnant with twins girls that she had no idea how they got there, let alone how she could be fertile well past her prime. Xpect however, which Ms. Perkins had consumed 4 days earlier, decided that the rules of pregnancy no longer need to apply to reality, it was of course magical and slightly infused with the chaotic essence of dark pregnancy obsessed deity, which did give it that slightly "tangy" aftertaste.

"Well, Hillary, what the hell are you going to do now?" She asked her pregnant reflection in the mirror, hoping it would answer her back. It didn't, it only reflected the fact that Ms. Perkins had placed two hands into the small of her back and tried to push out her growing pregnant belly further as a way to try to see how she would look when she was truly and massively pregnant.

It had been one hell of a crazy day for her to put it mildly. After another confusing dream about being massively pregnant, she got up and noticed that she was much bigger than the day before. The words "pregnant" crossed her mind several times, but logic seemed to dictate that was impossible, given a number of reasons, but Ms. Hillary Perkins no longer lived in a world where logic meant anything when a pregnancy inducing energy drink tainted with the essence of a chaotic dark deity was making the rounds.

After eating a larger than usual breakfast, and concerned that she might in fact be what could be the impossible, she managed to catch the bus at a local clinic, where the doctor, shockingly confirmed what should be impossible. Giving her a prescription for pre-natal vitamins, a recommendation for lots of safe exercise, a copy of her sonogram, and the news that she was having TWIN girls, the doctor left her along with her thoughts.

The bus ride home was a blur to her, but she seemed to remember her hand resting against the small potbelly she was forming, hoping to feel something, anything that would make this whole thing seem that much more real. She took her vitamins when she got back to her apartment and spent a long amount of time just staring at herself in the mirror.

A groan of hunger from her stomach, and a sudden craving for pizza gave Ms. Perkins that answer she was looking for, at least temporarily. "Well, I should at least get something to eat." She picked up the phone and dialed out, ordering one, no, make that two pizzas, with anchovies, mushrooms, and peppers, along with extra cheese.

"God, you two are going to make me huge" She said, looking down at her belly. She wasn't sure what to do next. She was 54, 54! While she had a decent amount of money in the bank, it wasn't exactly going to send two kids to college. Forget about college, what about 10 years from now! 64 years and dealing with preteens!

She sat down on the couch, crunching numbers in her head, becoming more and more concerned about the two unexpected guests inside of her. She was alone, and she didn't want to be alone. It's only been a day Ms. Perkins thought to herself, but she needed to talk to her.
She picked up her cellphone and dialed.

Theresa picked up the other end. "Hello?" Theresa said, out of breath from her work-out with Sarah just a few minutes earlier.
"It's me." Ms. Perkins said.
"I thought the rule was you're supposed to wait three days to call after a date" Theresa said back slyly.
"I know but.. Do you think you could head over? I really, really need to talk to you" Ms. Perkins said.

Ms. Perkins and Theresa had only been on one date, but it was magical. Sure they had talked on the chat rooms for months before working up the nerve to meet face to face, but that wasn't exactly going hot-and-heavy. Still, Ms. Perkins felt she had a connection that was more than just purely sexual, and she needed to talk to someone right now.

"Hillary I.." Theresa was going to say something but Ms. Perkins interrupted.
"Please, just come on over. Free food at least. We need to talk"
"Yeah, I guess we do" Theresa said, feeling her own pregnant belly in the locker room of the gym.
"See you soon?" Ms. Perkins asked.
"Whenever I can." Theresa responded back.

It was going to break her heart that she was going to have to break up with Theresa, but realistically what could she expect? Was Theresa going to want to continue dating a 54 year old pregnant lesbian when she ballooned up the size of a house? This was for the best. Let her off easy before things got to crazy. She had.. a family to think of.

Giving her belly a pat, she went into her bedroom and grabbed the SnapPix digital camera that Sarah had given her one year for Christmas. It was a simple point-and-shoot camera, "something any idiot could use" Sarah said to her, not realizing the lack of social tact. Stripping down to only her under wear, she placed one hand across her breasts, shocked at how firm and sensitive they were getting, and walked over to her full length mirror and started taking pictures.

"Well, it's not like this is probably going to ever happen again" She said, taking dozens upon dozens of pictures of her pregnant self "So might as well do the whole experience". She then switched the camera to record video.

"Hello Girls, I guess this is Mommy. I'm not really sure about this whole thing" She said to herself, recording every inch of her pregnant body unto the memory card of the camera. "I'm 54 years old, and I'm four months pregnant with you. I'm recording this so that when you're older you'll understand this whole crazy situation" Ms. Perkins went on like this, recording herself, taking video of the sonogram, documenting her whole unusual pregnancy in video and photos.

After some time had passed, she changed over into a nightgown, that was starting to get alarmingly snug in the middle, and did very little to conceal her pregnant-ness. There was a knock on the door, and she opened to receive her pizzas. She paid for the pizzas, while the delivery boy made a snide comment "You sure look like you have an appetite ma'am". "It's not for me, I'm pregnant" She said, revealing her belly to the man, confusing him greatly.

She paid for her pizzas, (and stiffed the delivery boy his tip after his little "comment) and sat down to devour her meal, when she realized that she wait for Theresa.
She did not have to wait for long as few moments later Theresa came knocking at her door. Gathering up her courage, Ms. Perkins meet her at the door.
"Hello" Theresa said. She was wearing an extra large baggy rain-coat which was unusual giving the somewhat slinky dress she had worn the night before.
"Hey" Ms. Perkins said in silence.

Ms. Perkins waved Theresa inside who took a seat at the table. "Pizza?" Theresa asked. Theresa had a lot on her mind right now given her pregnancy, and while she too had a craving for pizza, she just came from a workout.. Still pregnant women needed to eat…
"Yeah, I had such a craving" Ms. Perkins said, a hand absentmindedly making a way to her middle, luckily for her, Theresa didn't see it.
"I kind of had a craving too" Theresa said, opening the box and inhaling the aroma.

"So, look" Ms. Perkins said, taking a seat at the table. This was it. It wasn't going to be easy.
"There's something I need to tell you" Theresa said, picking at her pizza.
"Me too". Ms Perkins said.
"You first."
"No you".
"Let's just say it at the same time" Ms. Perkins suggested.
A pause.
"I'm Pregnant" "I'm Pregnant" they both said in unison.
"Wait?! You're what?!" They also both said in unison.

Legit shock.

"How can you be pregnant?" Theresa asked, undoing her coat to reveal the belly sticking out from under her clothes.
"I don't know! How can you be pregnant!" Ms. Perkins asked, unveiling her belly behind her bathrobe.
"I don't know!" Theresa responded.
"Well, this is awkward. And to think I was going to break up with you because of these two!" Ms. Perkins said with a smile, placing a hand on her bare-belly.
"Wait! You were going to break up with me? And you're having TWINS?" Theresa asked.
"Yeah. I mean, it just wouldn't work out I thought. You wouldn't want to be with an old pregnant woman"
"I was going to break up with you because I was pregnant with twins as well. I thought YOU wouldn't want to be with an old pregnant woman" Theresa said laughing.
"So boy or girl?" Ms. Perkins asked.
"Twins boys" Theresa said.
"Twin girls" Ms. Perkins said.

Some time passed and Ms. Perkins and Theresa continued to talk to each, pregnant 54 year old to pregnant 54 year old, expressing their fears and concerns. After both pizzas had been devoured, Theresa pat her belly and gave a smile. "Well I should go, it's a long drive back to my apartment with this thing in way"
"Stay the night here. My bed is small, but it should probably hold the two of us" Ms. Perkins said.
"It sounds like you're seducing me Ms. Perkins" Theresa said. "What will the neighbors think? Two old pregnant women sharing the night together in the same bed?"
"This is the 21st century. Smart phones, internet streaming, old pregnant lesbians. Anything is possible. Besides, if it bothers you that much, maybe we should just get married before we share a bed. Do it the old fashioned way!" Ms. Perkins joked.
"Okay" Theresa said without hesitation.
"What?" Ms. Perkins asked.

"Let's get married."
