The nurse made her way to the side of the examination table, moving carefully as she held one hand against her own pregnant belly.

"Are you expecting too?" Trisha asked with a smile, getting a smile out of the nurse as well.

"Triplets," she said. "I never thought I'd be able to have children of my own after I got sick as a teenager but...they're in there alright. And everything looks healthy."

"Triplets," Laci chuckled. "Lucky you. I'm hoping for at least that many."

"Laci," Dave growled, putting a firm hand on his daughter's shoulder. "Please try and behave."

"Alright, who's first?" the nurse said, adjusting a few buttons on the ultrasound machine.

"Me," Laci and Maci said in unison, looking at each other with an annoyed look.

"Why would you want to go first?" Laci sneered. "You're all broken up about being the only bimbo with a belly down at the mall."

"I want an ultrasound to prove that none of this is real," Maci said, hand firmly against her own small but growing belly. In stark contrast to her sister, Maci wore a long top with a thick sweater overtop, complete with a pair of jeans she'd normally find unflatteringly baggy. Her platinum blond hair was also brushed differently to give her bangs, in hopes to further conceal her identity on the off-chance anyone noticed her.

In a funny sort of way, the twin sisters had changed their wardrobes to mirror the others during the course of their pregnancy. Maci, who once let her cleavage hang up and tried to find the shortest skirts possible was bundling up, and Laci, constantly shrouded in fear of getting any sun, was more exposed than even Maci would on a regular day. Maci started doing her hair more and more to hide her face and added more make-up to hide her fear. Her face was a glimmering spectacle of coral lip gloss and tan concealer. Laci, on the other hand, always had her hair in her face like a ghoul, but now styled it to give her a shocking, vampire-queen look and was putting on more black lipstick and white body makeup than ever before.

"Girls, please," Trisha groaned, gripping between her eyebrows. "Maci, you go first."

"You two argue over everything," Dave said, shaking his head. "I never thought I'd have to separate you both arguing over who gets their ultrasound first."

"Roll up your shirt, please," the nurse smiled, applying gel to Maci's bulge. "It's a little cold, but it doesn't hurt." Maci nodded and looked at the ceiling, biting her lip as the deep "gulg, gulg" sound of the machine purred along. "There we go, I've got a good image here. And it looks like twins," the nurse said, turning to the mother. "I guess I don't need to ask if there's a history of twins in the family."

"Twins," Maci said, shaking her head back and forth. "Great. Just great."

"Everything looks healthy," the nurse said, hesitating slightly. "But they look pretty far along. I'd say...21 weeks or so. This is your first appointment?"

"I didn't even know I was pregnant until two days ago," Maci said, her voice desparate, as she looked between her parents and the nurse. The nurse waved Dave and Trisha aside to talk in private.

"We are seeing cases of pregnancies developing rapidly," she said. "I can speak from...personal experience on this as well."

"I know what you mean," Trisha said, hand on her belly. "Maci — everything's going to be fine. Don't worry."

"Yeah, yeah, whatever," Laci said, rolling her eyes. "Don't remind me that Maci got the demon babies in her too. Rapid gestation is part of the lore. Everyone knows it." She hopped onto the table as soon as Maci stepped down, hands tracing her belly with glee. "Alright, let's see how many I've got."

The nurse ran the gel and wand over Laci's belly, smearing her body make-up and revealing some of her own naturally glowing, tan belly skin. "Looks like you're just like your sister: twins."

"That's it?" Laci said. Maci broke out in tears and rested her head against Trisha's shoulders, her mother shushing her and petting her hair.

"And they're also four months along," the nurse smiled at Laci. "And they look pretty healthy and human to me. No demons, no monsters, no aliens."

"What a let down," Laci sighed, rubbing the underside of her belly. "I guess two's better than one at least."

"Don't be so sure," Trisha chuckled, giving Maci a kiss on the head before making her way to the examination table. She rolled her shirt up as well and let the nurse apply the wand as Dave's cellphone buzzed. He checked the text he got and turned pale.

"I'll just be out for a few seconds," he said, darting out before Trisha had a chance to say it was fine.

"Not looking forward to being a dad again?" the nurse said.

"He's just been busy lately," Trisha sighed, looking at her daughters. "And you two don't exactly make things easy for him."

"You're blaming us for this?" Laci cackled, putting both hands around her belly.

"No, no," Trisha smiled, rolling her eyes. "You're both just very...expressive. I can't imagine how your father would react if this time around, I'm having-"

"Twins," the nurse said, cutting her off and turning the screen to Trisha. "Looks like it's a family trait."

"Looks like it," Trisha gulped.

Dave walked around the hallway, looking around as Tami Smith tapped him on the shoulder, her face bright red. Dave opened his mouth but Tami held up her trembling hand. "Save it," she said. "I don't have a lot of time. I have my ultrasound appointment in a few minutes."

"Are you sure it's..." Dave said, voice trailing off.

"Oh, I'm sure. Andrew uses condoms. You didn't," Tami said. "I can't believe I did that."

"Hey, you wanted to get a house so badly. I didn't force you into anything," Dave said.

"You're a pig," Tami said. "You knew I didn't have the money or the credit to get to see a good realtor and you knew you had connections to let us see one. All I had to do was..."

"Does Andrew know?" Dave gulped.

"He'll have to know eventually, because this is your baby and you're paying for it...or them. I'm getting big awfully fast," Tami said, lifting up her shirt to reveal her bulge. "Right now, he's getting an ultrasound of his own. Turns out some men are turning up pregnant in town." Tami looked down at Dave's midsection. "I'd get one too if I were you. You were always chubby, but not that chubby." Tami turned around and hustled back down the hall to her appointment room.

Dave walked into his family's examination room as Trisha was wiping gel off her belly. "Everything alright?"

"Everything's fine," Dave smiled weakly. "But I think I might...need an ultrasound too."

"Xpect?" Emily said, not looking up from her computer. "It's a gross drink that's paying us to put their name on our fitness competition. What else is there to know?"

"Rebecca, calm down!" Emily said. "I don't know how things are going between you and your boyfriend or how things are going for Lori, but I don't need you to pry into my private life and tell me I'm pregnant. I can look after myself and I know I'm not pregnant."

Slowly, Emily reached for her cellphone. "Hello...Dr. Harper's office...hi, my name's Emily Turner and I'd like to set up an appointment for...tomorrow's the best you can do? Alright, that's fine, thank you." She slumped in her seat and stared at the computer in silence for a few minutes. "It's impossible," she muttered, finally getting back to her work.

With that, Sarah got into her own car and headed to Britney's work, ready to bring the same bad news Diana brought her.

11111121221112211211222222111212121212.content:
"Name?"

"Diana Larsen," Diana said, looking around the rest of the doctor's office. She was not the only pregnant patient there and she certainly wasn't the biggest. Some women had colossal bellies resting on their laps, rubbing them cautiously as they looked over pregnancy and baby pamphlets. Some were only slightly paunchy in the middle, but kept their hands over their midsection for dear life. Diana also spotted a few men with bloated midsections too. "Anything's possible," she murmured to herself.

"Excuse me?" the receptionist said, looking past her glasses as Diana. Diana blushed and gave a nervous smile and a sorry. "Fill out this form and have a seat. We're very busy today."

"I think it's going to get worse in the next few days," Diana said, taking the clipboard and moving to a seat beside a woman who could barely fit in her seat because of her pregnant belly. The woman, a middle-aged woman with almond skin, left most of her belly exposed and was rubbing it slowly. She turned to Diana and gave a little smile.

"First appointment?" she asked.

"Yeah, first pregnancy too," Diana smiled back, putting one hand on her belly while she looked over her form. "You?"

"First one, but I've been to the doctor twice before in the last few days," the woman said, rolling her sweater up a few inches to reveal even more of her belly. "I never thought I could have children, but suddenly, I swelled up. The doctor says it's quadruplets." She turned to Diana, laughing a little at the shocked expression on her face. "I felt the same way. And by their estimates, I'm probably full-term right now. Nine months pregnant. It's amazing."

"It certainly is," Diana breathed.

"How far along are you?" the woman asked, looking past her own humungous belly, reaching out nearly as far as her arms, to look at Diana's belly.

"O-oh," Diana said, thinking it over. "I think...four months."

"Well, if you're anything like me, you'll be a lot bigger soon," the woman sighed as her name was called. She slowly heaved herself out of the chair, getting help from Diana and a man sitting next to her. They both took an arm and lifted her up and she rubbed her bare belly quickly when she was back on her feet. "Good luck."

"You too," Diana said, trying to bring her attention back to her form but was too distracted thinking about her pregnancy. If one day was one month, then she was only four months along. But one look at Diana and you'd think she was much, much further along. Diana had the ripe fullness of a woman full term with her first bouncing baby boy. Diana hadn't thought about the possibilities of multiples, but if that woman could have quadruplets, who's to say Diana couldn't have more than one too? Given how big she was already, it was...definitely possible.

"Diana?" a nurse called. Diana raised her hand and waddled over, handing her completed form back to the receptionist. Most of it wasn't filled out, but Diana was a high-ranking scientist at Tritonic. They did plenty of work with the local hospitals and Diana knew they could get whatever information they wanted later.

Just like Sarah said, the examination room was cold and sterile, with a clumsy angular chair for Diana to sit and lean back in. As she sat, staring at the ceiling, a nurse walked in. She was a young Asian woman with a long ponytail and a big smile. "Hello, Diana? I'm Jackie."

"Hello," Diana smiled, feeling the chair recline even more, forcing Diana to look over her breasts to see her nurse at all. Her belly wasn't the only part of her body that had gotten bigger over the past few days.

"I'll be doing the initial ultrasound before the doctor comes in. She's been very busy today," Jackie said, turning on the ultrasound machine. "If you'd roll up your shirt, please."

Diana did as she asked, taking the light material of her athletic top and revealing her entire, round belly. Jackie paused when saw it, her smile shrinking a bit.

"And your chart said you think you're about four months along?" Jackie said, raising an eyebrow as she squirted some gel on Diana's belly.

"Y-yes, I think so," Diana said, giving a little "eep" at the cold gel and ultrasound wand. "I don't...exactly know how this happened."

"Your last sexual experience was over a year ago, you said," Jackie hummed, looking between the chart and the screen. "Sometimes these things can sneak up on women."

"So I'm not the only one you've heard this happen to?" Diana asked. Jackie's lips pursed a bit. It was clear that she wasn't supposed to talk too much about what was going on.

"Here we go; some clear images are developing on the screen," Jackie said. "Yes, looks like...I'd say...17 weeks along, though it's hard to tell with all of this..." Jackie's voice trailed off as she continued to study the display.

"With all the what?" Diana said, not able to see the screen from where she was lying. Although it was cold, Diana found the ultrasound wand oddly soothing. She wished she could feel someone else rub her belly for once. The machine also gave a low, rhythmic sound, which she assumed was the fetal heartbeat.

"It looks like you're expecting more than one baby," Jackie said. "A...lot more."

Diana went a bit pale. "How...many more?"

Then Diana heard the worst response to that question. "I'm still counting." That was not a good sign. If it was "three" or "four" or "five," that would be scary enough. But it doesn't take a lot of time to count five embryos. Especially if part of your job is counting embryos on an ultrasound machine.

The door to the examination room opened and Thomas, Diana's coworker at Trionic, hurried in, grabbing a chair and pulling it beside Diana. "I-I only heard you were coming here recently, sorry. With the contamination and what you were saying about the energy drink, I-"

"Excuse me!" Jackie said, turning around and glaring at Thomas. "This is a hospital and you can't just barge in here."

"It's okay, we work together," Diana said, turning back to Thomas. "Trionic ordered you to check up on me?"

"No, I just figured...you might want someone here," Thomas said, turning pale. He was starting to realize that showing up uninvited to a coworker's first ultrasound might not have been the best idea. "Is that...should I go?"

Diana sighed and gave a little smile. "No, I'm happy to have someone here. I thought I'd want to do this alone, but it feels better to have a friend." Thomas grinned back. She'd never called him a friend before.

"Eight," Jackie finally said. Diana and Thomas both turned to face her. She turned the screen around to show them. "Octuplets."

"E...ight?" Diana gasped, taking off her glasses to squint at the screen. There was no mistaking it. She had eight, four-month-along embryos growing inside her womb.

"I...uh...that's..." Thomas flustered.

"What do you care? You're not the father," Jackie muttered, side-eyeing Thomas. "But Ms. Larsen, at this point, I think I should call in the doctor to talk about...where we go next."

"Mmhmm," Diana nodded, eyes fixed on the screen. With that, Jackie walked out and Thomas scooted closer to Diana.

"If you...I don't know what to say, sorry," Thomas blurted out.

"You don't need to saying anything," Diana sighed, a little smile on her lips. "I'll be okay. I have a feeling that things are going to turn out okay."

"All of this because of an energy drink?" Thomas said, shaking his head. "We need to let people know before anyone else drinks this stuff."

"It might be too late for that," Diana said as the door opened up. In walked a beautiful doctor, with long brown hair and blue eyes, a radiant aura around her. She smiled to Diana and placed a hand on her hip, which only jutted out her own pregnant belly more.

"Hello, Diana," the woman said, her soothing voice spreading over the room. But Diana wasn't calmed by her presence. She could feel her heart racing.

"You're..." she began, before the doctor took the ultrasound wand and began rubbing it against Diana's belly, causing her to coo and moan softly, falling back into the bed.

"Sometimes the first ultrasound can be a bit emotionally exhausting," the doctor smiled. "But let's talk about what you need to do going forward to make sure mom and babies are healthy."

Diana could only nod, but she had one clear thought in her head. You're the woman from the commercial.

I can recommend you some other stores, if you'd like."

Nico, Gisele, and Michelle were all gathered around one mirror, the two taller women bending over Gisele's shoulders to look at her cellphone.

"Where's Monica?" Darren said to them, hands on his hips.

"Taking a break in the bathroom," Michelle said, not averting her eyes. "Britney already checked on her and she said she's fine."

"I just hope she's not sick," Darren said, shaking his head and continuing through to the stage. "You already had that stomach bug a few days ago and I don't want that to rear its head again."

Sarah gulped at the mention of the stomach flu. I guess that wasn't my toxins being purged a few days ago...it was morning sickness, she thought, stroking her belly gently. Which must mean all of these girls too...what have I done?

Britney was walking back and forth on the stage, still dressed only in lingerie, trying to keep her head level. She was repeating the same mantra in her head over and over again: don't think about the belly. No one will be thinking about how fat you look. You're gorgeous and you're dressed amazingly. Britney sighed and turned around, repeating the same three thoughts again. No belly. No fat. You're a babe.

As she walked back, the curtain opened and Darren walked out, Sarah right behind him. "What's up?" Britney asked, her smile growing when she saw her roommate. "Hi Sarah! A little early, aren't you?"

"Y-yeah, you too," Sarah replied, the ends of her lips barely curling up.

"What's up?" Britney said, her eyebrows raising while her smile persisted. "I feel like our personalities have switched."

Sarah bit her lip. Britney was already under so much pressure with this show. Learning she was pregnant, and possibly the rest of her runway team too, could ruin all of her composure. On the other hand, Sarah knew it was important to know and she had an obligation to make sure one of her best friends knew what was going on inside of her womb.

Sarah's face turned burning red as she thought over her options. What to do?

Sabrina fluffed her crimson bangs for the sixth time as she sat in her stiff plastic chair. Looking quickly at her script, Sabrina assumed a pose and practiced her lines again.

"With the new! Stainless pan from Mangiart, dinner's ready for the whole family quickly and easily!" Sabrina crooned, looking quickly back at her script. "Hmm, that's one interpretation."

Next to her were about a dozen other red-headed women, all trying to ignore her or at least stifle their laughter. Sabrina had been running through her lines...well, line like it was a 1940s movie all afternoon and she still hadn't been called in. While Sabrina did her productions for local theater, to make ends meet, she took a lot of work in commercials. Sabrina always over-acted in them and her commercials were somewhat of a local legend for how silly they looked.

"Collins, Sabrina," the casting director's assistant called in a monotone from behind the heavy audition doors. Sabrina beamed and strolled into the room with her usual, graceful gait, a big smile on her lips as she looked at the casting directors. Luckily, today they were all men, so she was sure to flash her curves whenever possible to secure a better chance.

"Go ahead, Ms. Collins," one of the directors smiled. Sabrina cleared her throat and gave a big smile with her ruby red lips.

"With the! New! Stainless pan from Mangiart, why, dinner's ready for the whole family quickly and easily!" Sabrina cooed. "One bite and my husband remembers why he married me. Well, one of the reasons," she added with a wink.

"Miss, please don't add lines," the director's assistant said. The directors were all grinning, stroking their chins and looking between their notes and Sabrina.

"Sorry, just had the actor's flair," Sabrina smiled. "So, what do you think?"

"Ms. Collins...how should we put this," the head director said, lolling his head around. "This product is marketed toward women who already have a family, not one with...a family on the way."

"It would send a confusing message," another director said. "But when you get a little further along, I'm sure you'd be good for a cocoa butter commercial."

"Cocoa...butter?" Sabrina said, her usual hand gestures dropping to her side. "I'm...I'm not pregnant!"

"Oh my," the last director whispered, grimacing. "Is she sick? Or just...very specifically fat?"

Sabrina huffed out of the room without a word, veins on her forehead pulsing. She'd been turned down for parts before, sure, and often very rudely. But that...that was insulting on a whole different level. Sabrina held one hand against her bulging belly as she made her way past the other giggling women ready to audition. Sure, she was bloated, but...but that didn't give them the right to speculate about her being pregnant so easily.

"Whoa, whoa there," a woman said as Sabrina pushed through the doors into a different section of the production building. Sabrina turned around to see another young woman leaning against the wall, smartphone in hand. Sabrina's raging brow settled a little when she saw the woman. She was an absolute beauty, with salon-quality shoulder-length brown hair, gorgeous olive skin, penetrating hazel eyes, an alluring chest, and an intrigued, pink grin.

"Sorry," Sabrina sighed, crossing her arms against her own heaving chest. "I just...I auditioned for an ad and I was turned down very rudely."

"Turned down?" the woman said, slinking her way over to Sabrina. "How could that be? You look amazing and you clearly carry yourself like an actress."

"I try hard to," Sabrina said, puffing out her chest.

"In fact...I've got a few projects I'd love to have you on," the woman nodded, putting one arm around Sabrina's shoulders.

"A few projects? You're a director here?" Sabrina said.

"No, no. I'm an executive," she grinned. "But we've got lots of time to talk. What's your name, superstar?"

"S-Sabrina."

"Very nice to meet you, Sabrina. I'm Kate."

Sarah started taking in deep, long breaths, bending her hips back and forth. "Sarah, what is this?" Britney said. "Is this yoga or something?"
"No, but you should start taking the classes at MegaGym. Very good on the days when you don't go for a run," Sarah said, her voice starting to waver. "B-but I came here to tell you..." Sarah took one last big gulp of air before resting a hand on her swelling belly. "We're pregnant."

A long silence hung between the two friends as Britney moved her eyes between Sarah's roundness and her own. Back and forth and back and forth. Eventually, Britney hovered her own hand above her belly, unsure whether to rest it on the ball she was just told is carrying a growing fetus.
"What?" Britney finally said, followed by "What are you talking about? I know we're kind of bloated, but pregnant?"
"Pregnant," Sarah nodded. "Diana...she said the energy drinks did this to us."
"The energy..." Britney's voice trailed off as she put her hand to her mouth in horror. It was all settling in. She'd started getting bigger since drinking that nasty Xpect stuff. "How is that possible?"
"Even Diana doesn't know but...look at us, Britney," Sarah said, her face getting redder and redder. "We're huge."
"Huge is kind of harsh," Britney mumbled, finally resting her palm against her belly. It was firm, round, warm, and there wasn't any fat anywhere else on her body, if you didn't count her growing breasts and ass. "Are you sure about this?"
"I really don't know," Sarah said, her body shaking as tears welled up in her eyes again. "I-I scheduled a doctor's appointment for myself for tomorrow and I'll know for sure." Sarah bit her lip. "M-maybe you can join me? I don't want to do it alone."
"Of course," Britney sighed, opening her arms. "C'mere." The roommates hugged tightly, both feeling their rounding middles touching. "We'll be okay."
"Y-yeah, we'll be okay," Sarah said. "Imagine playdates with our kids and Diana's. Our apartment will be like a daycare."

"To tell you the truth, I've never been too hot on kids," Britney chuckled. "Are you good with-"
"I love kids!" Sarah squealed, squeezing Britney even tighter before releasing the hug. "I mean, I never expected to get pregnant...like this, but I'm so good with kids. It's like we're on the same level or something."
"I could see that," Britney said, trying not to laugh too hard. "But this will...this will still be a big change. I have a good job here, but I don't know if it's 'support a baby' good."
"And it might not be just one," Sarah said quietly, rubbing the side of her belly. "Diana thought that, at least. We are pretty...big."
"So we're close to the end?" Britney said, much more nervous than she'd been admitting.
"I don't know," Sarah said, putting her other hand on the belly's opposite side. "Doesn't feel like it."
"Feel like it?" Britney said, but she couldn't protest too much. Now that she thought about it, she had a sudden maternal instinct that told her she wouldn't be going into labor for a while. It also told her there was more than one fetus inside her womb, but she ignored that for now.

"Hey Britney?" Gisele said, walking across the stage to approach the two friends, hugging and talking quietly. "Oh, is everything okay?"
"Everything's fine," Britney said, wiping a stray tear as she put on her most confident face. Gisele's own belly wasn't as pronounced as Britney's, but now that Britney knew about Xpect and its "benefits," her bump was obvious, especially while she was wearing the store's lingerie. "What's up?"
"We were just talking about getting dinner before the last rehearsal, since we've got the time," Gisele said as Nico and Michelle walked out from behind the curtains. "We've been getting so hungry lately. Must be nerves."

But the new models Britney had at this show were sexy, new sights for her eyes and they were dressed in wonderfully skimpy underwear. She gave a little sigh, knowing she'd miss a chance to dine with them individually, but there was always the after-party. "I need to get changed out of my sweaty gym clothes and into something a little cuter for the show tonight."

"We might," Nico sighed, patting her belly. "Stress has made us put on a few pounds, it looks like.

"Through that door, then straight until you hit the main floor. You can find the regular doors from there pretty easily," he said. "And nice self-restraint out there," he added with a wink.
"What do you mean?" Sarah said, before furrowing her eyebrow. "Wait, you're not talking about...so you have..."

One was Maci's soft sobs as she texted frantically. She was one of the most popular girls in high school, and even during her college hiatus, Maci remained a "socialite" to whatever extent that's appropriate for preppy teenagers. Her Instagram posts got at least a thousand likes in 24 hours, she was never alone when she prowled around the mall, and she was always making very lewd eye contact with someone in a public place. The other was the muted blare of Warlock's "I Rule the Ruins" coming from Laci's headphones. If Laci wore her headphones on her head — a novel idea — maybe the sound would have been blocked more. But instead, Laci had her headphones around her budding belly, resting her hand on her pale mound of maternal flesh. It was only painted pale, of course. Laci was cursed with the same gorgeous looks as her twin sister Maci, right down to the natural golden tan. As Laci entered her "goth" lifestyle as a young girl, she hated looking too conventional, but as her libido grew and women started coming around to her tall, busty body, Laci decided it wasn't always so bad.

He was going back to his "hip dad" approach he'd been working on to get his daughters to talk to him again, but it was just a mask for his own concerns. What weighed on him the most wasn't that his wife was pregnant again at age 47 or that both of his teenage daughters were pregnant, and not even that he, somehow, was pregnant...although upon immediate review, this was very central in his thoughts as well.

But what was currently bothering David Hamilton the most was the discovery that his neighbor, Tami Smith, was pregnant with his children. She hadn't told him it was multiples yet, but he hedged his bets. It was a one-time exchange of sex for realtor access; something he'd done before and no one ever got pregnant.

"Dad?" Laci said, raising a dyed eyebrow as she leaned forward. "My stop's around here."

"Right, right!" David said, swerving the car to pull into the next set of buildings. "Here? Go have fun, Laci. Get some great shots. We can share them with your grandparents and aunts and uncles and...and everyone will see what a great, growing family we are."

"David..." Trisha said, whispering again. "I thought we weren't going to encourage this...alternative behavior from Laci anymore."

"Hey, I'm cool with it," David grinned, giving his daughter and wife a thumbs-up. "We've all just got different styles, ya dig? Go kick it, Laci."

"Thanks," Laci said, waddling out of the car while rolling her eyes.

"D-dad?" Maci said. "If you're saying Laci can go to her thing now, can I go with my friend to the fashion show?"

"Thanks," Maci sniffed. "It might make me feel better, you know?"

"Hopefully," Trisha sighed. "Just don't stay out too late and no boys."

"I don't think I'll be popular with boys for about five months," Maci scoffed, resting a hand on her belly, much more bundled up than Laci's.

"You're still lovely, Maci," Trisha smiled, looking up at the rear view mirror. "And actually it's...closer to 10 months. 40 weeks, honey."

Maci then let out what may be the world's longest groan. It was hard to measure because it was eventually drowned out with the sound of Maci quickly texting everyone she knew that yes, she would be at the fashion show.

"There she is," Robin smiled, opening her arms wide to embrace her pregnant girlfriend. "Oof, and there they are. I feel your belly pressing against me."

"Get used to it," Laci said, kissing Robin's neck. "Is everything set up?"

"All we need is our model," Robin said, motioning to Laci. "The blue dress is over here if you're ready to change."

"Hey, don't disrespect what Rosemary wore," Robin said, wagging a finger as she walked to her camera and tripod. "She carried the devil's child. You're just carrying my magical lesbian babies." Laci stuck her tongue and stripped in front of her girlfriend, slipping the dress over her.

"It's not a maternity dress," Laci said, pulling it down with some effort.

"I knew it would accentuate the bump," Robin said. "Isn't that what you're going for?" When it was finally on, Laci was still covered in black eyeliner, lipstick, and finger polish as Robin stood behind Laci, tying her hair up to be closer to Mia Farrow's pixie cut in the movie.

Robin wasn't what you'd call a "goth," but she wouldn't fit in with Maci's group of friends either. Robin was 31 and about Laci's height, maybe a little shorter, and had the same ample chest Laci had before she got pregnant. In contrast to Laci's jet black dyed hair, Robin had her hair bleached white, with a light red dusting on the tips. Her hair was short and slicked back so her green eyes could be shown off. Currently, she had a ratty white shirt with the sleeves cut off and a denim vest on, covered in buttons from bands she did road work for when she was Laci's age.

"Alright, just stand in front of the baby carriage with the knife," Robin said, walking back to her camera and looking through the guide. "Good, now look shocked."

"Does it have to be exactly like in Rosemary's Baby?" Laci said. "I mean, if I were in her shoes, I'd look a lot happier."

"We can do a few takes," Robin laughed. "Now come on, let's do it."

"I just...let's think about it a little," Laci said. The knife in her hand was starting to tremble. Robin walked over to Laci and took the knife from her, placing it in the baby carriage.

"What's up?" Robin said, petting her hand against Laci's cheek. "I can tell when something's not going right for you, queenie."

Laci took a deep breath. "I...you know I love pregnancy and the idea of feeling something suck my nutrients and kick and squirm inside my womb, changing my body and forcing me to eat weird things and pee all the time, right?"

"Of course. You said it was the most metal thing you could think of," Robin nodded.

"And I still feel that way, it's just...it's real. It's really happening," Laci whispered. "And now that I've had the ultrasound and all, it's...I'm scared, Robin."

Robin took Laci in a big hug and held her close. "It's going to be okay, yeah? We'll take care of them, together." Robin's voice dropped. "I never thought I would love someone this much until I met you, Laci."

"I-I didn't think I would love anyone period," Laci sighed. "It's so...unlike me."

"I'm glad you tried something new," Robin said, putting her hand against Laci's chin. "How about this: we do these photos, then I take you out for a big dinner. I hear preggos like that kind of thing."

"We might," Laci grinned. "And then after...I've been curious about what Mother Kills Best were singing about with 'Bellies in the Bedroom.'"

"Let's find out together," Robin smiled, placing her hand against Laci's belly. "But for now, you'll kill me if we don't do this photoshoot."

Sarah looked around for anyone she recognized and checked her phone again. Her hair was done up in a tight bun and she had on a black dress she hadn't worn in forever. Of course, with her belly the way it was, much less of her legs were covered than the dressmakers likely intended. It was almost time to start and Diana still hadn't shown up. "C'mon, c'mon," Sarah said to herself. There weren't many seats for this relatively small event and they were filling up quickly. Sarah managed to save a few seats but wasn't sure how much longer they'd last.

"Is this seat taken?" a voice said behind her.

"Yes, it is," Sarah said, immediately putting her hand on her belly. "Please don't take it. It's for my other pregnant friend." She'd gotten accustomed to milking her newly-discovered pregnancy for sympathy quickly.

"S-Sarah?" Maci said, jaw dropping. Sarah turned to see that the voice belonged to one of her twin neighbors and heaved herself quickly. "You're..."

"I am," Sarah sighed, rubbing her belly some more. "And I heard you're also..."

"Yep," Maci said, looking down at her bump. She had a noticeable roundness now, but nowhere near Sarah's considerable pregnant girth. If I'm already this big with twins, how many is she carrying? Maci wondered.

"Well if you ever need someone to talk to, I'm always across the hall," Sarah smiled, opening her arms for a hug.

"Yeah, I'm sorta already talking with Britney," Maci said, running one hand through her hair and looking away bashfully before sitting down.

No...no hug? Sarah tried to process as she reached under her belly, preparing to sit down.

"Don't strain yourself yet," Diana grinned, tapping Sarah on the shoulder. Sarah turned around and saw her friend beaming behind her glasses. Her lovely blond hair was tossed with special care for the evening and she managed to squeeze into an elegant blue dress with a white jacket overtop. Sarah squealed and dove in, giving Diana another colossal hug. "Sorry I took so long."

"No, don't worry!" Sarah smiled, finally opening her eyes to see Thomas standing beside Diana. "Who's he?" she whispered in Diana's ear.

"A friend," Diana smiled back, patting Sarah on the back. "He's been a big help, so I invited him here."

"Nice to meet you," Thomas said with a wave. In no time, Sarah was trying to manuver herself past Diana and to Thomas for a hug, her belly butting the heads of several audience members in the row ahead of her.

"Any friend of Diana is a friend of mine," Sarah said, hugging Thomas tightly, only pulling back when she felt an odd "poke" against her belly. "S-so...how do you know each other?"

"Thomas works with me," Diana said before dropping her voice. "He helped me find out about...the drink."

Sarah blushed before clumsily making her way back to her seat. She and Diana let out long sighs of relief as they sat down, rubbing one another's bellies. "So...how was the ultrasound?"

"Fine," Diana said. "Everything's healthy and having an ultrasound doesn't hurt or anything. It's just cold."

"How..." Sarah took a big gulp. "How many are you carrying?"

Diana turned and looked Sarah in the eyes for a few seconds, building up her resolve. "Eight, all three months along."

Sarah felt her face tingle, her skin not sure whether to blush or turn pale. "Pregnant with eight...you're like the octo-"

"Don't say it," Diana smirked. "But the good news is it looks like you're carrying less than me."

"Only one way to be sure," Sarah sighed, moving her hand to the side of her belly when she felt a strange twinge. "Diana...I think I just felt a-"

"Ladies and gentlemen, we are about to begin," Darren's voice said over the speakers. "Please silence your cellphones and give the runway your full attention. For the first time, Soft Lace is ready to model our original line of lingerie. Are you ready?"

"Very," Sarah said, leaning forward. As she prepared herself to see some gorgeous models walk around in lingerie, she couldn't help think of the last time she saw Kate wearing something sexy. Before the break-up, before Sarah threw herself into exercise, and long before she ever felt the weight of pregnancy in her womb.

-----

"So I've got the part?" Sabrina said. Kate sat in her chair across the room, watching the red-headed aspiring actress with a loaded smile.

"I think so," Kate nodded, looking at her cellphone. "At least for one of our ad campaigns. Tomorrow I'll have to ask you to join me for some more personal auditions, but I feel good about where we're going."

"Excellent," Sabrina said with a relieved laugh. "It's been a while since I was part of a larger commercial." She looked back to see Kate looking up from her phone, her vixen smile not going away. "B-but of course, my goal is to be an actress on the screen or on stage."

"You've got it in you," Kate said, standing up and getting close to Sabrina. "You have a classic Hollywood look about you. Elizabeth Taylor, Judy Garland," Kate said, putting her hand on Sabrina's chin. "Maybe a little Hedy Lamarr too."

"O-oh, thank you," Sabrina blushed. This woman had a much larger presence than she first noticed when bumping into Kate in the hall. "S-so...where should I come tomorrow."

Kate's lips gave away a small laugh before taking her hand away from Sabrina's face. She looked at her phone for a second or so before gazing back at Sabrina. "Meet me here at 10 in the morning," Kate said. "Wear comfortable clothing. There will be changes here for the various scenes."

"Thank you so much," Sabrina said, giving a flourish with her hands. "You'll find hiring me will be one of the best choices of your career."

"I look forward to seeing you prove that true," Kate grinned. "But I have to make an important phone call, so if you don't mind..."

"Of course!" Sabrina nodded, waddling away as quickly as she could, her heart beating with joy. Kate chuckled again before tapping her phone a few times and bringing it to her ear.

"Hey there," a voice cooed on the other end.

"Hello Robin," Kate smiled. "Plans tonight?"

"Just at a photoshoot now, but when it's over, I should have a pretty uneventful night," Robin said, waving to Laci from behind the studio's doors. Laci couldn't hear a thing she was saying. "I take it you have something in mind."

"My things are all moved in and I'd love for you to see my apartment the way I intended," Kate chuckled. "The bed was practically the only thing finished up when you were over."

"Good thing, too," Robin smiled, bringing one finger to her lips.

"I did have one other thing I wanted to do tonight, though," Kate said. "There's a fashion show and a...friend will be there. I want to at least stop by, maybe say a 'hello.'"

"She's that good-looking, huh?" Robin laughed. "Maybe I should come too."

"If you'd like," Kate said. "And yes, she was fine, but...not good for too long. We fooled around when I was shopping around for a new apartment, but got clingy. I set her straight the day before I moved back."

"And I'm sturdier?" Robin smiled.

"I'd say so," Kate grinned. "See you tonight."

"Same to you," Robin said, hanging up and walking back into the studio. "So beautiful, what next?"

"I want to do the same shots, but now do them the way I want," Laci said with an evil smile. "Black bikini, big grin on my face as I hold the knife, that sort of thing."

"Maybe some fake blood on the belly?" Robin smiled. "I can live with that. Just strip when you're ready."

"Always ready," Laci said, taking off her top, letting her bare, swollen breasts hang down. "I just need that bikini."

"Are we all ready?" Britney said, moving from woman to woman. Michelle responded with a brisk, smiling nod, while Nico and Gisele both rolled their eyes.
"Just let us go out already!" Gisele groaned. "I finally got my boobs looking the way I like and if I stay backstage any longer, this stupid tight bra will mess them up again."

"As ready as I'll ever be," she shrugged with a smile. Britney grinned back and patted Monica on the back.
"Good to hear," Britney said, moving to the front of the line as the music began to change. "Well then: here we go."

Britney stepped out and onto the runway, the audience gasping as the clapping began. Britney let herself have a small gulp of nervousness, but otherwise, she continued her walk with a solemn, quietly-sexy expression. One hand on her hip, the other moving back and forth at a light pace. She would have liked to think the audience was gasping at how she looked. Bright white lingerie hugged her hips and ass while a slightly darker bone colored top kept her breasts in place without a strap, and over the course of the past few days, her chest had grown to an F-cup.

But what people initially gasped at was her stomach. Britney was, as she learned today, four months pregnant with an unknown number of fetuses. Definitely more than twins, she suspected. Her bulge was obvious and pronounced, but Britney couldn't stop the show to explain that this only happened a few days ago and it was because of a mysterious energy drink. Britney made it to the end of the runway and looked at Darren, standing in the back behind a barely lit podium. He gave Britney a small nod and she turned, making her way backstage.
As she made the turn, the applause came up again. A good sign, maybe. At least the crowd's polite, Britney thought. Although, even pregnant, I look pretty good.

But the same mixture of applause and surprised chatter started up again when Michelle walked out. Her belly wasn't as big as Britney's so the audience took more time to react. In the audience, Sarah felt her face grow red as Diana leaned over to her.
“I thought you said you only gave this stuff to Britney and me,” Diana whispered.

“Sarah…”

Applause drowned them out again as Gisele walked out. Sarah was glad she focused in time for her. The shorter Latina model was now boasting I-cups thanks to her pregnancy and the lacy top she had on was letting most of her endowment present itself to the audience. Sarah leaned in, putting one hand under her belly for leverage.
“Like her?” Diana chuckled.
“I-I mean…” Sarah bit her lip. “She’d never go for me.” Diana sighed and put her arm around Sarah’s shoulder as Nico walked out.
The two models’ bellies bumped slightly as they passed by and turned to face one another. Darren sighed and rubbed his forehead. “They’re rookies alright,” he sighed. “But at least they’re still on their feet. Not a disaster.”
Nico made it to the end of the runway, poise maintained until a look of confusion flashed across her face. She looked down at her belly and placed one hand on it, rubbing gently.
“Nico!” Darren hissed, getting her attention. He pointed to the back and Nico nodded, trying to regain composure as she finished the catwalk.

“What’s up?” Britney said as Nico came back inside. Britney was already halfway through her outfit change and was beginning to panic. She’d practiced this so many times but didn’t account for the difficulty in changing lingerie with a big belly. A big pregnant belly, on top of it.
“I dunno,” Nico said, rubbing her belly. “I-I felt something weird in my stomach. Like…something was in there.”
Britney turned pale as Gisele, now totally naked, elbowed Nico and laughed. “Just indigestion from that big dinner,” Gisele smiled. “You’re a giant, so it takes longer to work its way through your body.”
“Ha-ha,” Nico said sarcastically, moving to her own changing station to get ready. Britney cracked a worried smile and finished getting her underwear around her growing hips. Then, she peeked out to see how Monica was doing on-stage.

All eyes were fixed on the shy model. The only sounds were the music and the camera flashes. Monica was nailing everything: the walk, the look, the poise. Most people may have not even noticed that she was as pregnant-looking as Britney.
One look in particular was especially glued: Sarah’s. Her jaw was dropped and her heart was racing. As Monica made it to the end of the catwalk, she gave a tiny, superficial smile. A curl of the lips that was barely there. Sarah let out an audible moan when she saw it. Diana turned to her friend in surprise. When Monica was backstage again, Sarah met Diana’s eyes.
“Sarah?” Diana grinned. Sarah turned bright red and buried her face in her hands. “She was cute, huh?”
Sarah just nodded, face still in her hands.
Diana leaned in closer, whispering in Sarah’s ear. “There’s an after-party, right? Talk to her.”
Sarah jolted back up and looked Diana in the eye. “Y-you think she’d…I mean…me?”
“I think she’d be crazy not to,” Diana smiled, laughing as Sarah gave her friend a hug.
“This is how I get rid of my bad emotions, like fear and reluctance and a desire to eat fried dough,” Sarah said.
“Okay then,” Diana said, looking back at Britney’s own seductive gait. “Britney’s on stage now.”
“I don’t care about seeing her in underwear,” Sarah said, finally releasing the hug when the applause started again. “But let’s not miss those other women.”

The night went on like that, with Sarah oozing over the three models, and then falling to pieces when Monica walked out. Falling for a pregnant woman was never something Britney had thought much about, but maybe she just wanted someone like herself.
Backstage, Michelle and Gisele had begun to complain about a weird sensation in their bellies too. Britney told them both it was a combination of eating too much and nerves from the show, but by her fourth walk, Britney could feel it too. The babies were kicking.
“I guess you want me to take a nap, huh?” Britney sighed, patting her bulge.
“What?” Monica said, changing beside Britney.
“Nothing,” Britney smiled. “You look fantastic out there. You’re a pro.”
“O-oh,” Monica smiled, dipping her head a bit. “Thanks.”
“Just one last run and we can relax,” Britney smiled. “Keep it up.”

The last walk was the hardest. Britney’s fetuses were kicking the entire walk and when it got particularly bad, Britney could hear people in the audience murmuring. Her swollen belly must have been moving and squirming visibly. Michelle, Gisele, and Nico all seemed distracted by the strange sensation in their bellies, not knowing they were all four months pregnant.
Monica ended up saving the show on the last walk of the night, giving a powerful but soothing look to the audience and giving a perfect twirl at the end of the walkway. Britney wanted to rush out and hug her. Sarah too, but obviously for different reasons.
When it was over, the six Soft Lace employees went on stage and took a bow. “None of this would have been possible without the amazing leadership of my close co-worker, Britney,” Darren boasted.
“And I wouldn’t have stayed sane if it wasn’t for my close co-worker, Darren,” Britney smiled, and the two shared a kiss on the cheek. “If you have a VIP ticket, you’re very welcome to join us at the after-party in the store’s showroom.”

Tables of hors-d’oeuvres were already prepared and the crowd’s various pregnant members began whittling them down quickly. Britney and the other models were wrapped up in robes thick enough to mostly conceal their bellies.
Darren walked over to Britney to give her another “congratulations” talk, but Sarah and Diana were already there, giving her a tremendous pregnant group hug. He and Britney made eye contact before he chuckled and went to look for his boyfriend.
“You were so good,” Sarah whined. “You were all amazing.”

“Diana!” Sarah said, biting her lip before taking a big breath. “A-actually, I was wondering if you could introduce me to one of the models. I-”
“Excuse me,” two people, a man and a woman in expensive clothes, said, approaching Britney. “I was hoping we could speak.”
“O-o-of course,” Britney stammered. This was Margaret D’Anne and Roger Corgan, two of the fashion world’s premiere investors. Britney gave the party a quick glance and motioned her hand in the direction of the closest robe. “There’s one. Go ahead and talk to them, Sarah. They’re very friendly girls.”
“Alright,” Sarah nodded, walking up to Monica as Britney looked back at the two investors.
“We just wanted to say…that was a brilliant show,” Roger said.
“It was?” Britney said, surprised by his word choice.
“Pregnant models when they’re not expected? I love experimental fashion,” Margaret beamed. “That’s why we were wondering if you’d want part in a show we’re sponsoring.”
“O-one of your shows?” Britney choked.

“Of course!” Britney laughed, hysterical.

Sarah walked up to Monica and tapped her on the shoulder. “H-hi,” Sarah said.
Monica’s freckled cheeks turned slightly redder when she saw Sarah. “Hi.”

Why do you ask?" Sarah asked, almost forgetting she was pregnant for a brief moment.

Monica's face lit up. "YES! I-I mean, sure..." she said. Monica placed her hands on Sarah's swollen belly, feeling it's somewhat familiar roundness. "So how far along are you?" She blushed, her freckles blending in to her reddening face. "So...wanna go get a burger or something?" Sarah asked. Monica slowly nodded her head, biting her lip.

The two went to the nearest burger joint, and they both ordered twice the amount of what they usually ordered. They chowed down on their burgers, chatting each other up as they did so. Kidding, but I really should start going there. Work this belly off." Monica smiled.

"So do you have a husband?" Monica asked. "Nope." Sarah replied. "Oh. Boyfriend?" Monica asked again. "Nada. I'm actually gay." Sarah said. "Well, if you don't mind me asking, how'd you get pregnant?" she questioned. "It...it's complicated. Do you have a boyfriend?" Sarah asked. "Nuh-uh." Monica replied, biting her lip.

The two finished their meal, and Sarah drove Monica back to her apartment. "Do you want me to walk you to the door?" Sarah asked. "Uh...I mean, is it too much of a bother for you?" Monica responded. "No, not at all! I might have this big belly, but I'm still in pretty good shape!" Sarah laughed. She waddled after her new crush, and the two stopped at the door. Mama's got game!" she said, returning back to her apartment. She opened the door, and saw Britney casually walking around in the nude. "Britney, I know we're friends, but what the hell?" Sarah asked. "Sorry! These babies have been kicking nonstop, I've been trying everything to get them to stop. Look!" she said, waddling towards Sarah.

Why don't you're babies kick so much?" Britney asked. "I don't know. Different babies. Different bellies." Sarah responded.

Sarah's head hit the pillow, and she felt a sense of calmness she hadn't felt in a while. "Good night, babies. At least tomorrow I'll actually find out how many of you I'm having," Sarah said, remembering that she had her ultrasound tomorrow. She closed her eyes and drifted off to sleep, rubbing her belly with love.

Britney clasped her hands together in glee as Margaret and Roger walked away. A fashion show for two of the biggest names in designer lingerie! This was a career-maker. Of course, there was the little detail of it being for "pregnant" lingerie, but this wasn't bothering Britney too much.

"Fine, stay if you want," Britney huffed. "But just don't talk to me."

"What, you want to torment Sarah some more? You know how much of a wreck she was after you tossed her like a piece of trash? You're a monster, Kate, and a sociopath," Britney hissed. "I may be pregnant, but if I see you bother her, I'll break your nose."

"Easy, easy," Kate chuckled. "I didn't even know Sarah's here. I wanted to see one of your models, Monica."

"Monica?"

"We used to date," Kate said, not backing away from Britney despite her threat. "She gave me these tickets a while back. Know where she is?"

Britney thought about how miserable Monica had been acting and remembered Darren mentioning something about a bad breakup. "You bitch..."

"Hello again," Diana said, putting a hand on Britney's shoulder, looking Kate right in the eye.

"Hello to you too," Kate said, her smile growing. "Looks like two congratulations are in order."

"Looks that way," Diana said, patting her belly.

"Never thought you were both the 'family' types. All you need is to get Sarah knocked up and you can open a nursery." Diana and Britney both bit their lips and Kate's grinning jaw dropped. "Wait, don't tell me...she really-"

"Oh, Thomas, there you are," Diana said, grabbing Thomas' arm as he passed by and pulling him in close. Diana planted a kiss on his lips and turned to Britney. "Sarah left with one of the other models, so did you want to go?"

"Might as well," Britney said. "The party here's gotten pretty dead."

"I agree," Diana smiled, kissing Thomas again while keeping her eyes on Kate, who chewed her lip while keeping a sinister smile.

"It was nice catching up," Kate said. "Now that I'm back in town, I'll probably see you all again sometime."

Diana and Britney both walked to the buffet table, with Diana dragging Thomas along by the arm. His face was bright red and his knees were a little weak. "Thomas, you okay?"

"Um...I'm...uh," Thomas managed to get out.

Diana was the one blushing now. "Kate's always had a crush on me, so I wanted to make her stew a little."

"O-oh, right," Thomas nodded. "Of course." Thomas had never met Kate or knew anything about her relationship to Diana, Britney, or Sarah, but his brain was reeling so much from being kissed by Diana that it was just throwing out the simplest words it could come up with.

"I can't believe her," Britney growled, gripping the table cloth of the buffet. Diana put her hand over hers.

"Hey, at least Sarah's moving on," Diana smiled gently. "That model of yours, Monica...Sarah really took a liking to her."

"Monica?" Britney said, a tiny smile growing. "What were the chances...both of the nicest girls you could meet, both dumped by Kate, now dating."

"Dating's a bit of a jump," Diana laughed, rubbing her belly as it jiggled. "Don't...ask her about it until she's ready."

"Right, right," Britney nodded. "Geez, a date the same day you find out you're pregnant. I couldn't imagine going on a date in my condition."

"You look great, Britney," Diana said, putting a hand on her friend's shoulder. "Even now, if you wanted to go out, you'd have guys flocking. Isn't she good-looking, Thomas?"

"You're so beautiful," Thomas slurred, looking at Diana.

"See?" Diana said, smiling. "Now, are we hanging out some more?"

"I should probably go home," Britney said, stretching out. "I'm so goddamn tired and these kids weigh a ton."

"I know what you mean," Diana sighed, resting a hand on her belly. She'd tell Britney the big "octuplet" news tomorrow.

Sarah paused and looked down at her belly. "I'm ready to take this whole pregnancy thing on head-first. I want to find out if they're healthy, if I'm having boys or girls or one of each or...or however many are in here."

Monica rested one hand on her belly as she looked herself over the mirror. When she woke up this morning, she was just bizarrely bloated and gave herself a quick, sad look. Now, thanks to Britney's text, Monica knew the truth: she was pregnant. That made her look at her body in a whole new light.

"Mom always warned me I'd end up pregnant and single if I wasn't careful," Monica sighed, stroking her bare belly. Her light t-shirt was rolled up, letting her look at her swollen middle. Monica's looks only started to come in halfway through high school, but by then, she already knew it wasn't the football captains and track stars who asked her out that she was interested in. It was the head cheerleader. It was the quiet girl in the library. It was her English teacher.

Not that Monica ever approached any of them. In her small, rural town, it was hard enough for her being the only biracial student in her grade. If she also came out as a lesbian, she feared she'd never make it out of there. So she nodded silently when her mother told her to steer away from guys who would leave her with a baby on the way like Monica's father did. But all the while, Monica made sure to study and pour herself into track and field to qualify for a scholarship to an out-of-state school in the city. Then she stayed there.

While in college, Monica found her passion for modeling, but even with her fabulous face and beautiful body, she wasn't making it much further than a few odd local ads here and there. Until she met a young, attractive ad executive named Kate who offered her work in a long ad campaign. Kate became the first person Monica truly fell in love with, the first person she slept with, and the first mentor she had.

Kate molded and directed Monica perfectly, showing her how to dress around town to get the right kind of buzz and attention, how to look in photoshoots to make others remember her, and she even landed Monica her first job on a catwalk. Everything seemed to be going right in Monica's life.

It all ended abruptly with Kate dumped Monica, telling the young model that she just wanted to have some fun and get an exclusive model for her campaigns. Unlike with Sarah, Kate never talked to Monica about the possibility of a family, which stung Monica even deeper in the days after the break-up. Monica knew it meant Kate never saw her as anything but a silly little girl to have fun with and nothing else.

On top of that, now Monica had a baby on the way. Maybe more, given her size. She stroked her mocha belly a few times, her fingertips sensing fluttering movement that seemed to be coming from multiple sources. Not that she could really tell: the bodies were too small and it wasn't like Monica had ever been pregnant before. Monica also didn't know how far along she was supposed to be. It had only been five days, and unless she was growing a few thousand embryos in her womb, what was going on inside her was more than just a five-day pregnancy. She was months and months along.

Still, even after discovering that she was inexplicably pregnant, the happiness building up in Monica's chest wasn't going away. Her night with Sarah was one of her best nights in a long, long time. Not only because of her night modeling lingerie in her biggest job yet. Sarah was a light in Monica's life, even if they only spent a few hours together. Monica brought her fingers to her lips, reminiscing on the brief contact they made with Sarah's cheek.

"Two pregnant lesbians dating," Monica sighed. "It's like a science fiction story." Her cheeks burned as she looked at her phone. Britney told her to talk to Sarah again. Monica had very little experience being in a relationship or trying to be in a relationship, but she had a feeling "hey, by the way, I'm pregnant" wasn't a great icebreaker.

Still, Monica wanted to talk to Sarah again. So, so much. But as she reached for her phone, it started ringing. Monica picked it up and cleared her throat.

"Hello?"

"Monica! Hi," Gisele said on the other end, her voice trembling. "S-so did you get Britney's message?"

"Yeah," Monica sighed, turning back to face herself in the mirror, stroking her belly slowly. "You?"

"I can't believe this," Gisele whined. "This is so crazy."

"Yeah, it's something else," Monica said, pressing her fingers against her bulge. She never imagined a pregnant belly would be so tight. Her English teacher was pregnant in high school but she wasn't adventurous enough to invite the class to feel.

"And right after my big break!" Gisele grunted. "Everyone saw me and I had it made! I'm so much hotter than most of the models out there."

"Mmhmm," Monica said, turning to see both sides of her belly. No stretch marks, at least.

"Banks, Klum, Upton, Kerr, Campbell, all of them! I'm so much hotter!" Gisele yelled again. "And now...I'm a blimp and these brats and going to stretch me out even more when they slide out."

Monica stopped to wince at the imagery. "Don't be so hard on yourself, Gisele. When I saw you yesterday at the show, you still looked great...belly and all."

"Thanks, Monica. You're too sweet to be a model," Gisele said. "Anyway, I called because I think we should get together and talk this over."

"I think that's a good idea," Monica said, slowly rolling down her shirt, only to see it stop halfway down her bulge. "Where should the five of us go?"

"There's the café on Aldon Street but," Gisele's voice trailed off. "It's only going to be us four. We don't trust Britney."

"Britney?" Monica said, sitting down on her bed, the weight of her belly taking its toll. "What do you mean?"

"Haven't you heard what people are saying?" Gisele whispered. "The energy drink, Xpect. It's what made us pregnant. People all over the city are getting pregnant like us from this stuff. I even heard some men are getting pregnant. And you know who gave us these drinks, don't you?"

Monica gulped. "B-but that doesn't make sense. Britney drank them too. She must have not have known."

"Maybe she wanted to get pregnant too. Maybe she has some kind of sick power fetish with pregnant women working under her. I don't know, but I don't like it and neither do Nico and Michelle," Gisele scowled. "But we'll talk about that at the café. Meet us there in half an hour, okay?"

"O-okay," Monica nodded as Gisele hung up. Britney couldn't have intentionally made them pregnant...could she? Would she? Monica stood back up slowly, balancing herself with both hands on the small of her back. If Britney wasn't welcome at the meeting, she definitely couldn't invite Sarah. They'd think she was spying for her friend and roommate.

But Monica couldn't help at least reaching out to Sarah again. Looking at the number Britney gave her, Monica sent a text to Sarah. <hi, it's Monica. Sarah gave me your number. Last night was fun>

But Sarah didn't respond, since she was still at the doctor's office, getting her first ultrasound and examination. Monica stared at her phone, waiting for a response before sighing and stuffing it back in her pants.

"Guess I'm alone and pregnant after all."

"She's hot, like the rest of them," Chad said, before gesturing a curve in front of his stomach. "But she's also knocked up. Nothing new, obviously, but it would be nice if some sexy women would show up without a baby on the way."

Geoff gulped. He wasn't exactly on board with Chad's sentiments. He was all too happy with the influx of pregnant customers the café had seen lately, even if some of them were crabby and had a short temper with him. The baby boom wasn't only with the customers: one of the waitresses looked like she swallowed a basketball and Chad's stomach was getting a little wide.

But if the new woman was anything like the other customers he had at Table 13, this shift wouldn't be as tiring as it looked.

He hurried outside, straightening out his shirt and trying to look as composed and cool as possible. "May I get you something to drink, miss?"

"Just tea, please," Monica said in a quiet voice, smiling back at Geoff before turning back to her fellow pregnant models. "So...how is everyone?"

"A little better now," Nico said, looking at Monica. "I thought my belly was too big, but now that I'm seeing you...well, I feel differently." Monica blushed and looked down. Michelle swatted Nico's arm with her menu.

"Nico! Jesus," Michelle said. "Be a little compassionate. We're all in the same, weird boat. Besides, you're so tall and gangly, your belly looks smaller than all of ours."

"That's enough," Gisele grumbled as Geoff came back with Monica's tea. "We aren't ready to order yet." Then she bit her lip and sighed. "Who am I kidding? I'll take the bleu cheese burger, medium well, with a side of potato soup."

"Gisele?" Michelle whispered. "Isn't that a little...heavy?"

"I'm eating for two...or three...or more, I don't know," Gisele said. "All I know is I'm hungry and I want it."

"I-I'll get the same," Monica said, her blush growing. After staring at their friends in disbelief and wiping the drool from the corners of their lips, Nico and Michelle put in similarly big orders and turned their attention back to the issue at hand.

"So we really think Britney did this on purpose?" Nico said. "I wouldn't put it past her, given how much she pushed us before the last lingerie exhibition. But I just can't think of why she'd want to do it."

"I might have an answer to that," Gisele said. "I've got lots of contacts in the industry and it sounds like Margaret D’Anne and Roger Corgan are looking for some models for a pregnancy lingerie show."

"Pregnancy lingerie?" Michelle said. As Geoff walked by the table, he couldn't help but overhear. The blood rushed to his head so quickly he had to dart back inside before he collapsed.

Gisele nodded. "And they're paying a crazy big amount. I guess pregnant models are rare and ones who want to walk around in skimpy underwear are even rarer. I think Britney wanted that money and found a way to get some additional models to work on the contract."

"Does that mean...if there really is a pregnant lingerie show and we do it, we'll get even more money?" Monica asked quietly.

"Sure, but that'll go to supporting a lot of unexpected babies," Gisele scoffed, patting her belly before looking down at it. "Then again...now that they're on the way, I guess I will need the money."

"You're keeping yours?" Nico asked.

Gisele sighed and nodded. "I come from a big family, so I might as well get this out of the way now."

"I-I'm keeping mine too," Monica said, hand rested against her belly. "Although...no, it's nothing."

"What?" Michelle said.

"I...thought I'd have someone to raise the babies with, but that might not be the case now," Monica said.

"Your ex, Kate?" Nico said, reaching out to Monica's hand.

"No, there's...someone else," Monica said. "I met her after the show last night."

"Monica!" Gisele said with a surprised smile. "It's been less than a day and you're already calling it quits?"

"She...she didn't respond to my text," Monica mumbled, looking down. The three women started laughing, reaching over to hold Monica's hands.

"Oh sweetie," Michelle said, wiping a tear from her eye. "You haven't had much experience with dating, have you?"

"Not really," Monica said. "Kate was my one and only."

"Then we've got something to take our minds off of this," Nico said, patting her belly. "Tell us everything you can about her."

"Why?" Monica said, looking between the three models anxiously.

"It's not obvious? We're playing Cupid," Gisele smiled, leaning in, her swelling breasts brushing the table as she put her cheeks in her hands. "Now c'mon. Details!"

"Well, her name's Sarah," Monica began, her toes curling as she thought about her last "date." "And...she's pregnant."

----

"Aren't you-" Sarah said before Dr. Pascat shushed her.

"Just lie still, please," Dr. Pascat smiled. She knew what Sarah was trying to say: she was the woman from the Xpect commercial. And Sarah would have been right. "Your babies look very healthy. Five months along."

"Five months?" Britney said, looking at her own gelled-up belly. "It's only been a few days!"

"It seems to go so fast, doesn't it?" Dr. Pascat smiled, patting her own pregnant middle. "Now for you." She started running the ultrasound wand over Britney's belly and smiled sweetly. "Healthy too. That's been the good part of all the women who have come in with new pregnant bellies: everyone's healthy. It's a miracle, don't you think?"

Sarah started to open her mouth, but Dr. Pascat was already by her side. "But you-"

"Looks like I spoke too soon," Dr. Pascat said, shaking her head. Quickly, she slipped some pills into a plastic cup of water and fed it to Sarah.

"F-from the commersh...you knewbou' exxx," Sarah slurred, her eyelids getting heavy as her head fell back down against the examination table.

"The fetal metabolism was a bit off," Dr. Pascat said. "But that medication will make sure her babies are perfect when they're born. She'll be groggy for a few hours, unfortunately.

"Better you help now, I guess," Britney gulped. "So when should we come back for a check-up?"

"In a few days," Dr. Pascat said, writing them both notes. "But between you and me: everything looks good." She winked and put her hand on Britney's belly. "Being pregnant is a joy. Treasure it."

Britney quietly nodded as Dr. Pascat walked back outside, calling Kate again. "You again," Kate smiled. "I'm just about to leave to shoot the next rounds of commercials."

"Good, good," Dr. Pascat said. "I also left a sample of a new product in your mail. Why don't you give it a try?"

"Sure, why not?" Kate chuckled, finding a can in her mail. As she hung up, she looked over the can. "Xtreme Xpect."

"Who was that?" Robin said, rubbing her eyes as she walked into the living room, naked except for her underwear.

"Just a client," Kate said, opening the can and taking a whiff. She scrunched up her nose as the smell, much worse than Xpect's. "Hey Robin...try this and tell me how it tastes."

Life and times change so they say.

Hillary Perkins and Theresa were living proof of that, as they sat on the couch (as much as they could with their bellies in the way) holding each other, watching TV in a state of pure content. They were going to be married, and hopefully soon, lest the two of them waddle down the isle.

Both of them 54 years old, lesbians, pregnant and getting married, starting a life together while new life mysteriously grew within them.

You know, a tale as old as time… yadda yadda yadda.

They had so much to discuss, baby names, moving in together, when they should get married, who should come… All the major questions you want to ask after getting engaged to another pregnant woman you've gone on one date with.

Meanwhile, across town, in the fanciest of fancy dining halls, The Hamilton's sat down together to enjoy dinner together as a growing family in what would go down in History as the definite definition of "The Dinner from Hell".

What was supposed to be a nice night out to celebrate Mrs. Hamilton's "Big News", became one of the most blogged about events in histories, with Laci being nearly naked, Maci pigging out, Mrs. Hamilton hiding her face in shame, and Mr. Hamilton coming face to face with his pregnancy.

On a scale of 1-10 in terms of epic dinner disasters this was a solid 100/10.
