"Cheers!" Trisha Hamilton smiled as she lifted her glass of water. Laci and Maci reluctantly did the same, joined by David Hamilton. "David, are you sure you don't want any wine?"

"No," her husband said, clearing his throat. "I-If my lovely wife can't drink, neither will I."

Trisha gave her husband a touched sigh and put one hand over his. "You don't need to do that, honey. Besides, you never gave up alcohol when I was pregnant with these two."

"I wouldn't be surprised if you didn't give it up either," Maci said callously, looking at her twin sister. "The way one of us turned out."

"I was just thinking the same thing," Laci grinned evilly, glaring at her twin. Of course, to anyone who didn't know the Hamiltons, they would never have guessed these two girls were identical twins. Laci's hair was dyed completely black, the same color of her lips, fingernails, in stark contrast to the heavy pale makeup she had all over her body.

By contrast, Maci's hair was platinum blond and curly, her whole body was covered in a strong tan, and today she had alternating blue and pink paint on her nails. Growing up with an actively occult sister, Maci was a bit superstitious and thought settling on one color would affect the sex of the twins currently developing in her womb.

Make-up choices weren't the only way Laci and Maci looked different tonight. Maci had on a thick sweater with a light eggshell blouse, all in an attempt to make sure her pregnant belly was totally unnoticeable. At five months pregnant, Maci's stomach was no longer something a casual passerby wouldn't notice.

Laci had the opposite concern. The gothic mommy-to-be had on a leather tube top that was fastening in the front with string. Laci made sure this string was plenty loose so the maximum amount of cleavage was visible. The only other clothing she had on besides her shoes was a black lace skirt that barely concealed all of her increasingly plump rear. At one of the fanciest restaurants in the city, Laci was far from the dress code, but between the waiters who were enthralled by her near-nude beauty and the waiters who were terrified of this modern witch, no one said anything.

"Girls," David said in a low tone, flashing his daughters a frustrated look. He was touchier now than he'd been before, for two reasons he didn't dare tell his family about. For one, the neighbor he'd slept with was now pregnant and seemed sure it was his. And two, he was 99.999% sure he was pregnant, just like his wife and children. How? He wasn't sure. A curse from Laci wasn't off the table, in his mind. But he'd heard some rumors of other men in town discovering that they were pregnant but never confirmed these cases for himself.

For now, he'd convinced his wife that his growing belly was "sympathy weight" and a result of stress from trying to get the family a new house. He sighed and drank his water again, wishing he could still drink without concern.

"Hello, my name is Megan," their waiter said, smiling as she walked up to the family. Megan felt a little better about serving a table with so many pregnant customers, since she was also five months pregnant and a former member of Sarah's FemmeFit class, moving to Nina's class when she discovered her pregnancy. Megan also worked at the small bar and grill near Sarah and Britney and was trying to pick up more shifts at her other restaurants now that she knew just how many babies she had on the way.

"Hi Megan," Trisha smiled. "Glad to see a fellow mother-to-be." Trisha also noticed that Megan's belly was bigger than any of theirs but decided not to mention that. "This is a celebratory dinner for us, so we're going to order a lot, I expect."

"Great, what's the celebration?" Megan asked.

"I just got a new job," Trisha said, her smile growing and growing. "Lab technicial at Trionic Chemicals. I've been wanting to get back to work now that these two are getting ready to leave the nest and," she laughed and patted her belly, "let's just say the extra money is coming at the right time."

"Congratulations!" Megan smiled. David nodded and gave a small, fake smile, his mind stuck on Tami Smith and whether she would tell Trisha about their relationship. Anyway she chose to take her secret, he knew she'd want him to pay to support her children. And after he just sank his money into the new house for the family.

The family all ordered, with David getting an odd look from his wife when he ordered far more than usual. His weight gain was pointed out by Trisha the night before and he said he would make changes to start losing some of his belly. Laci ordered a large vegetarian dish, informing her family that she was trying out a new diet she found on a wicca website that would make her a more likely conduit for the world of spirits.

But Maci got the biggest look of surprise when she ordered three full entrees and when she handed the menu back to Megan, her cheeks were bright red. "W-what?"

"That's a lot to eat, sweetie," Trisha said, one eyebrow raised while she smiled at her daughter. "Even if you're pr-"

"Don't say it!" Maci yelped, biting her lip and she shifted in her seat. "At least not out loud. I know I'm..." she looked around before leaning back in to the table. "pregnant. And pregnant women eat a lot."

"I know you've got cravings, honey, but you don't give in to them all the time," Trisha said.

"I'm not giving into all of my cravings," Maci said. "I'm trying to watch my figure."

"What, you have a boyfriend now?" Laci snickered, one hand constantly rubbing the pregnant belly she loved so much. "Or maybe a girlfriend. We're identical twins, after all. It makes sense we'd have the same tastes."

"No," Maci said angrily, flashing her twin a scolding look. "I may have an opportunity to be a...pregnant model."

David picked the wrong time to start drinking his water and everyone in the restaurant looked over as he coughed and sputtered while Laci laughed out loud. "You can't be serious."

Maci's blush spread to her entire face now. "At the fashion show I went to, there were pregnant models and I asked around after and there's going to be an entire pregnant lingerie show in a few days. They said I could audition to be in it and didn't care if I was an amateur."

"Lingerie?" David yelled in surprise, wiping his face clean.

"Now, now," Trisha said, reaching over to her husband again. "Maci's not a little girl anymore and...it's good to see you being more comfortable with your pregnancy."

"Maybe I should have Robin do a photoshoot of you," Laci cackled quietly to her sister.

When their food arrived, talk about Maci's modeling decision fell to the wayside as all four Hamiltons ate with incredible vigor, Maci most of all. But amidst it all, Trisha kept pausing and looking at her family members' eating habits.

"Something wrong, dear?" David asked, his mouth full of steak. "Upset stomach?"

"No, I just noticed that our diets are a little out of whack lately," Trisha said. "And our stomachs are getting much faster than a pregnant woman's really should. Especially you, Dave."

"S-so, do you want us to start going on family jogs?" David said, not liking his wife to draw attention to his five month belly. "Join MegaGym?"

"Something like that," Trisha beamed. "I signed us all up for MegaGym's athletics competition."

The entire restaurant looked over again as David, Laci, and Maci dropped their utensils onto their plates. "Mom, you cannot be serious," Maci said.

"Yeah, exercise? Sweating and running in a giant lit building surrounded by other bubbly fitness freaks?" Laci said. "It sounds awful. Besides, I'm pregnant. I don't think I'll be much of a competitor."

"Oh, it's not about winning," Trisha said, shaking her head at her goth daughter. "It's for fun! And for health! Besides, I was told that there were already lots of pregnant women entered. And David, it would be a good way to start trying to lose weight."

David was turning as pale as Laci as his wife told him about the competition but Maci and Laci were already debating it among themselves.

"Eat any more and you won't even be able to waddle, let alone run," Laci chuckled.

"Hey, at least I did cheerleading in high school. I didn't sit under the bleachers and read weird poems," Maci said. "You'll collapse if you compete."

"I'll have my girlfriend in the audience cheering me on," Laci replied, leaning in to Maci. "Who will you have?"

"Shut up, Laci," Maci snarled, standing up and facing her sister.

"Do you even have friends who'd come see you?" Laci said, standing up as well, her red contacts flashing as she stared into Maci's eyes. "Or did they all leave you when they heard you were knocked up?"

With a cry of anger, Maci thrust her belly into Laci's, knocking the half-naked pregnant girl into the closest table, spilling food everywhere.

"Finally, a little passion from you!" Laci laughed, getting up and thrusting her own belly into Maci's knocking her into another table. When Maci stood up, her shirt was rolled up, showing off just how big her belly was. "Ah, there's your bump you want to hide so badly."

With another yell, the two pregnant twin sisters continued wrestling and knocking over more and more tables and plates. Megan hurried out of the kitchen, looking at them in disbelief. "What is going on?"

"I think we'll be taking the check now," David said, raising one hand as Trisha just watched her daughters in silent horror, hoping the twins in her belly got along better.

"On leave?" Diana said, putting her hands on her wide hips. "Already?"

"Now, Dr. Larsen, it's not like that," her superior at Trionic Chemicals, Richard Sandival, said as he rested his hands on his desk. "You'll still be coming in and working every day, just not in your usual position. Think of it as...a light maternity leave."

"And why do I need 'light maternity leave?'" Diana asked, taking another step forward and making her octuplet belly bump into Richard's desk.

"That's one reason," Richard said, grabbing his knick-knacks as Diana's bump jostled the table. "You work in a laboratory filled with very fragile equipment and our clients give us limited samples to work with. If you broke them, we would face a substantial loss."

Diana adjusted her glasses and fumed. "It's more than a little insulting that you think pregnant women can't control their round stomachs and will just knock things over."

"Dr. Larsen, look at how large you've become in just the last few days," Richard said, lowering his voice and leaning in. "I'm not going to pry into the medical condition that explains why your pregnancy is so...prone to growth spurts, but you clearly cannot adapt to your sizes from day-to-day and I have to think of the company." Richard ran his hands through his thinning hair as he felt Diana staring daggers at him. "And that's another reason. Your pregnancy is so atypical, it can't be a bad idea to give you less strenuous work in an environment with less chance for injury."

Diana crossed her arms against her breasts, the tiny application of pressure sending a surge of soreness and reminding Diana that she needed to go shopping for maternity bras soon. "And what will you have me be doing? Am I going to be a receptionist?"

"No, don't be silly," Richard said. "We don't want to squander your fantastic mind. We could always use another bright woman...I mean another bright scientist to look through journal papers and check proposals."

The most boring job in the whole company, Diana sighed to herself. "Fine. I assume I'll have an assistant working with me?"

"Yes, someone of your position should still have an assistant," Richard nodded. "We've just hired a new lab technician and she'll be starting off with you."

"A new lab technician? I don't get to keep Thomas?" Diana said, her voice getting louder with her shock.

Richard cleared his throat and put his hands on his desk. "No...Thomas will be taking over your in-lab projects." At this, Diana stormed out of the office, her hips clumsily swaying back and forth with her belly's weight. "Dr. Larsen! Dr. Larsen!"

As Diana waddled as quickly as possible down the hall and back to her lab to get her things, she went past Thomas, whose face lit up when he saw his co-worker. "H-hey, how did it go?" Diana kept walking and his smile faded as he hurried to keep up with her. "Diana?"

"Congratulations," she spat, throwing her things into her bag. "You've project lead now. You've probably wanted that for a while, huh?"

"I don't understand," Thomas said as Diana left, heading out the door. "Diana?" Thomas kept calling but eventually just sighed and went into Richard's office by himself.

Diana felt her lips tremble as she got out her phone and called Britney. The two were at their apartment, sitting on the couch, marveling at their bellies as they rubbed them.

"Sextuplets," Sarah murmured, moving her hands in pace with the tiny movements she felt. "I can't believe this is real life."

"I know," Britney sighed, slouching to allow her belly to jut up above her, both hands slowly moving around the entire slope of her occupied womb. "Being pregnant was one thing but this...this is heavy." A kick to her bladder made Britney wince and shift in her seat. "Literally."

As her phone began to buzz, Britney groaned and tried to reach from her current position, not wanting to move too much with her huge belly. Finally she made it and answered the call. "Hello?"

"Britney," Diana said, tears starting to flow as soon as she heard her friend's voice. "Is Sarah with you?"

"Y-yeah, she's right next to me," Britney said, looking over at Sarah, who shot back a confused look. "Is...everything okay?"

Diana shook her head, even if her friend couldn't see. "I need to come see you all. Now."

------

Just as Diana calculated, there are few bad moods that could not be aided by the embrace of Sarah Richardson. The sporty mom-to-be held Diana tightly, their bellies pressed tightly together as she swung her arms back and forth. "Diana, you are the smartest, coolest, most confident, beautiful woman I know," Sarah cried out.

"Thanks," Diana sniffled, holding Sarah back. "But really, you didn't need to say it 50 times."

"But it's true!" Sarah said. "You're the smartest, coolest-"

"Uh, Sarah," Britney said, tapping her roommate on the shoulder. "Maybe...Diana would like to just sit and talk with us now."

"Yes, let's do that," Diana said, adjusting herself so Sarah could still cuddle her without suffocating Diana. "But thank you. I don't know why I got so upset. Must be preggo-hormones, huh?"

"C'mon, don't talk like that," Sarah pouted. "You've worked so hard on your career and to get pushed out for having a few babies on the way is nonsense. Even if it's only temporary."

"Speaking of which," Britney said, smiling as she let out a long sigh. "Sarah and I had our ultrasounds today."

"Yeah?" Diana said with a smile, patting her two friends' bellies. "What's the prognosis?"

"We're definitely pregnant," Britney said, placing her hands on the top and bottom of her massive pregnant middle. "And they all look healthy."

"'They?' So it's multiples?" Diana said. She still hadn't told her friends just how pregnant she was, so it sounded like the three were about to surprise one another.

"Sextuplets," Sarah said, giggling. "Can you believe it? We're each going to have six babies. That's insane, right?"

"A little," Diana laughed back, patting Sarah's belly. "Although it would be even crazier if you were carrying eight."

"Yeah, I guess we dodged a bullet," Britney laughed before stopping and turning to Diana. "Wait, what do you mean...Diana...are you..."

Sarah jumped to conclusions first, sitting straight up, her eyes bugged out. "Diana, oh my god! Are you serious?!"

"Yep," Diana said, moving her hands back to her own belly. "Octuplets, four months along. In no time, I'll eclipse both of you."

Sarah dove back into her vicegrip hug with Diana, making the blond scientist cough a bit. "This is so amazing! I...I...I don't know what to say!"

"Easy, easy," Diana smiled, patting Sarah on the back. "Seriously, easy. We've got precious cargo in here." Sarah finally weakened her hug and Diana turned to Britney, her face pleading for help.

"I know what'll make Sarah get a little less bold," Britney smiled. "Tell us about your new friend you met last night."

Like a turtle retreating into its shell, Sarah slunk back to her spot on the couch and curled up, hands against her huge belly. "W-what do you mean?"

Diana was grinning too. "I noticed her too. She looked cute."

"Stop!" Sarah said, her face turning red.

"C'mon, what happened between you two?" Diana said, putting one hand on Sarah's knee.

"We just talked and ate. No big deal," Sarah whispered.

"Wow, you really like her," Britney laughed. "Any pictures? She's a model after all."

"I'l see for myself," Diana said, reaching for Sarah's phone and snatching it away in time. When she woke it up, Diana's eyes lit up. "Oh my god, you've got a text from her."

"What?" Sarah said, stealing her phone back from Diana. Her face looked like she'd just come back from two back-to-back marathons. "Britney, did you give her my number?"

"I may have~" Britney grinned.

"You're the worst," Sarah whined, heaving herself up and doing a running-waddle into her bedroom to call Monica in private.

"I think we did some good work today," Diana smiled at Britney.

"I'm a pregnant cupid," Britney sighed, her smile shrinking a bit. A pregnant cupid who can't get a date herself.

Kate walked into the studio, chest puffed out in pride as she wore a big grin on her face. "Ah, doctor! It's nice to finally meet in person."

"I agree," Dr. Pascat, the same doctor who gave Sarah her ultrasound, said, shaking Kate's hand firmly. Kate was tall but the brown haired doctor still stood a few inches taller.

"Ah, 'doctor' sounds so cold," Kate smiled as she moved closer to Dr. Pascat's face. "Have a more friendly name I could call you?"

"Jeannie," Dr. Pascat said, a smile moving across her lips as she looked back at Kate.

"Jeannie. Cute name," Kate said as she started to walk around the studio. "The rest of our talent for the new shoot should be here soon. But I had a few questions first."

"Go ahead," Jeannie smiled, using her same graceful, slow tone. "But you understand there are some things I can't talk about. Xpect has a great deal of trade secrets surrounding it."

"I imagine so. You're a brand new product," Kate nodded, hands held behind her back. "My first question is why you're using such a gradual advertising process? You want us to slip these commercials out on the internet subtly."

"We like to generate a lot of talk," Jeannie said, standing still but following Kate with her eyes. "And frankly, Xpect isn't for everyone. We'd rather people find out about us than the other way around."

"I'm sure," Kate said. "And you went with my company because..."

Jeannie chuckled. "Because you do such good work, of course."

Kate smiled and moved back toward the doctor. "Jeannie, you flatter me. Now something else I wanted to know...have you ever actually tried Xpect yourself?"

Jeannie paused and locked eyes with Kate. "What do you mean?"

"You see, you gave me a can of one of your new beverages," Kate said, taking out the empty can of Xtreme Xpect. "And a close friend of mine tried it." Kate turned around to face the doorway. "Robin babe, would you come in please?"

In waddled Robin, her pregnant belly sticking out far past her breasts, which had also grown considerably since the previous day. With her limited "punk" wardrobe of tank tops and vests, Robin's belly was completely exposed. It was larger than Sarah, Britney, and Diana's bellies combined, but was still totally smooth and glistening, with her popped-out navel long ago pierced drawing even more attention to her already considerable size. Despite usually looking tough, Robin's eyes were hung low and she was trying to appear less conspicuous, which in her present condition was very difficult.

Jeannie smiled and turned to Kate. "Looks like our latest drink was even more 'Xtreme' than we thought. Do you know how pregnant she is?"

"You're the doctor here," Kate chuckled. "You tell us."

"We'll do an ultrasound after the shoot, on the house," Jeannie said, leaning in to Kate. "But it seems like you've picked up on what makes Xpect such an exciting new company."

"And I'm willing to keep it our little secret," Kate smiled. "I don't even want to know how your drinks can make people pregnant. I just want to keep getting those big checks for these ads. Besides, I know a few friends who've been 'blessed' thanks to Xpect."

"More and more every day," Jeannie smiled back. "We're a growing business."

Kate laughed under her breath as Robin waddled up to them. "You don't really want me in the ad like this, do you Kate?"

"Sure I do. You look great," Kate said, patting Robin's belly and kissing her on the cheek. "Besides, you'll get paid handsomely."

"I guess so," Robin sighed, looking down at her belly.

"Excuse me?" Sabrina said from the entrance, slowly waddling in. "Kate, there you are. Is this everyone?"

"The whole team's here for the day," Kate grinned as she walked over and hugged Sabrina, feeling her belly press against her. It had definitely gotten bigger since Kate last saw her, but now she had a better idea of why. "I like to keep a sparse set."

"I see," Sabrina said, clearing her throat. "I should let you know...I'm not sure if I'm the best person for this campaign right now."

"Why? What's wrong?" Kate said in a very convincing sad voice.

"I just found out that I'm...pregnant," Sabrina said, her head dropping as she looked at her belly. "Although, look at me. It's obvious now, isn't it?"

"Oh, you're pregnant?" Kate said, turning to Jeannie and smiling. "I wouldn't have guessed. You look so good still."

"You mean it?" Sabrina said, lifting her head as Kate turned back to her.

He almost looked like he was taking stylized maternity photos with the way he was positioning the shots and the way he was standing, His belly was massive and a dark line was starting to form down the center. It was impossibly round, almost watermelon shaped and was covered in stretch marks. Laci though he almost looked like a pregnant gorilla.

Pregnant. That word echoed in her mind. It brought her back to what she was doing. By the outside table was her father travel mug with the words "World's OKest Dad" written on it (A gag gift from Laci and Maci on his birthday one year). Next to it was a opened empty beverage package called "From to Maternity Milkshake: An Instant Powered Drink for Pregnant Women! Prompts healthy weight gain, baby growth, and more! Just add water."

Was her father drinking this? She unscrewed the top and got a whiff of some kind of strawberry scented watery beverage in the cup. Twice a day was written on a note next to the beverage in her father's handwriting. Suddenly, Laci got a wonderful, awful, terrible idea. She knew a perfect way to show how full of shit her sister really was. Making sure her father couldn't see her, she poured half of the can of Xpect into the cup and stirred it around. I can't believe I'm going to have to drink this shit..." He said looking down at his life filled orb. "I can't believe a lot of thing lately. How the hell did this happen to me?" He said, rubbing his belly. "God this shit's going to make me nauseous." He said, finishing the drink.

Back in her room, she pondered the half-full can on Xpect. "No, I need to show you just how wrong you are. It's not like shit even works. What's it going to do? Make me more pregnant?" Laci chuckled to herself, downing the other half of the Xpect.

"Okay ladies, let's lift those hips!" Sarah said in her booming instructor voice, further intensified by her headset microphone. That order proved a lot easier for her to pull off than much of her class. Sarah and her side of the gym were all squatting, their pregnant bellies forcing their legs even farther apart depending on how many they were carrying (almost everyone seemed to be six months along so they were equal in that respect). Standing back up straight took some time and Sarah was even giving herself a workout, which didn't usually come from her classes. But her many years as a fitness freak meant she had the core and lower body to lift her packed womb and bubble butt. Her class would take a little more time.

Peggy, an aging woman who started FemmeFit to take back control of her life without expecting to become expecting, whimpered loudly. "Sarah, it's so...it's so heavy."

"C'mon Peg, it's just like lifting weights," Sarah huffed in her same energetic tone. But she could see Peggy's complaint. The woman had a small frame before and her pregnancy was making a lot of changes in her. Not only did she had the obvious prominent belly but her breasts and butt had exploded with hormones, even more rapidly than was the case with Sarah and her voluptuous friends. Sarah could see the similar toll on the other women and once they were all up right, Sarah took a break. "Everyone, give yourself a round of applause. You're doing great."

As they clapped and felt their spirits lifted a bit, Sarah looked over at the other half of the class. It was made up of more "traditionally pregnant" women that Nina had led before Xpect came into everyone's lives. Nina was not giving them as rugged a workout as Sarah but that was partially because she could barely move. Somehow, she was going through a very different set of transformations than Sarah and everyone else she knew who drank Xpect. With each passing day, Nina seemed to grow a new, full-term baby in her belly and she now looked like her body was constantly wrestling to decide whether she would topple over first or explode.

But Nina was still committed to putting on a class and it was a marvel to behold. The colossal, olive-toned mound of a belly wiggled and shook and moved back and forth, glistening with sweat under MegaGym's bright fluorescents. Every quick move started a few flurry of kicks and stretches from the fetuses inside her and Sarah could see the globe of a belly change shape, much to Nina's chagrin, but she kept going. Sarah sighed and smiled, glad to have a partner here like Nina.

"Uh, Sarah?" Megan, a young expectant wife in the class, said, wiping her face dry. "Should we keep-"

"Yes, let's keep moving," Sarah said, switching over to a new song and starting to hop back and forth. "Let's do some side shuffles, ten at a time. And one!"

----

After the class ended, Sarah was cleaning herself up, not used to generating that much sweat during a workout. But she could feel the beginnings of a promising burn in her quads and glutes. Maybe pregnancy could be marketed as a new exercise fad...Sarah started to weigh the pros and cons but her mind drifted off when she saw a commercial for allergy medicine on a faraway TV and giggled at the cartoon bee selling it.

"Thanks for the help," Nina said, waddling over and sitting next to Sarah with a grunt, her hands immediately going to her quivering belly for a much-needed rub.

"Of course! It was fun and besides, you would have stolen away my students otherwise," Sarah said with a laugh, elbowing Nina playfully.

"Right. Everyone's got a baby on the way now. I started before it was cool," Nina chuckled, wincing as she leaned back. "Oof, a cramp and a kick at the same time. Bad timing."

Sarah's big smile started to shrink down as she saw the frustration in Nina's face. "How is everything...going with you?"

"It's just a rollercoaster, I dunno," Nina sighed, sticking with her leaned back position which pushed her belly farther out. "I've gotten used to a new boy or girl popping up every day and I can only wait on the doctors to learn something new. And my husband and I are both happy to have more kids; we just thought there would be some space in between them."

"I'm glad you're both taking it well," Sarah gulped, not sure whether to tell Nina it was her Xpect that caused all this.

"Yeah, paying for college is going to be a hill to climb but we'll figure something out," Nina said, leaning over to Sarah to whisper. "And between you and me...the sex has been incredible."

Sarah blushed, immediately picturing Nina naked with a bulldozer of a belly in the throngs of passion. "R-really?"

Nina nodded. "The hormones, the kinkiness, and the big moment is so much stronger. Have you had a chance to..."

Sarah giggled, patting her lower stomach. "I have."

"Good for you," Nina smiled. "You're a great gal and it's a bad sign when someone like you is single." She put both hands onto the back of the bench and tried to push herself off, gritting her teeth and grunting until she stopped. "Guess I'm going to sit here for a little while."

"Well...have a good day!" Sarah said, rolling herself forward and waddling back up to the office to try and get something to eat and drink. On the way through the usual exercise space, she spotted Sabrina bouncing her enormous butt on an exercise ball while holding two weights. "Hi Sabrina!"

"Oh...Sarah," Sabrina said, putting her equipment down and gliding over as best she could with a belly full of amniotic fluid. "Good to see you again. Things went well with your class?"

"Yep, they moved me to a pregnancy class," Sarah said, patting her belly. "Turns out it's a good fit."

"A-ah," Sabrina said, her face twitching a bit at the mention of pregnancy. "And would there be...any openings in your class?"

"Well sure!" Sarah said with a big grin until she saw Sabrina's eyes start to well up. "Um, is there something-"

"Sarah, it's ahw-ful!" Sabrina wailed, falling into Sarah's arms. "I'm expecting! I'm with child! How did this happen?"

"Hey, it's okay," Sarah said, shushing Sabrina and rubbing her back as their bellies pressed together. "It's not the end of the world."

"It's the end of my career! Actresses turn lousy after they become mothers," Sabrina sobbed. "All the best actresses: no babies!"

"I don't...know if that's true," Sarah said, her knowledge of which actresses had kids and which ones didn't very limited. "And you'll do fine. It'll add character to your performance."

Sabrina pulled back and sniffled. "Character?"

"Sure, build on what you're going through. A woman with a promising future who mysteriously became pregnant. Use that in your performances," Sarah said.

"I see...that's true," Sabrina said, nodding until she snapped her eyes back to Sarah. "Wait, how did you know it was mysterious?" Sarah froze and gulped. "Everyone in our apartment seems to have a 'mysterious' pregnancy, even that horrible lesbian goth girl." Sabrina stepped forward, pushing Sarah back with her belly. "Sarah, is there something you know you aren't telling us?"

"Uh...sorry, need to go pick up some...electrolytes," Sarah said, pacing away from Sabrina and jogging away. "We'll talk later! Good luck with your...exercise!"

As Sarah hurried away, she got a text from Monica <can you take me to my ultrasound appt?>

"Yes, thank God," Sarah said to herself as she replied to Monica. As Sarah made her way to the office to grab her keys and bag, a belly pushed out of a doorway to stop her. And connected to it was one of the few things about the gym that didn't make Sarah just explode into a ray of sunshine. "Excuse me, Rebecca."

"Oh, am I in your way?" Rebecca said with mock apology, waddling forward and rubbing her bare belly. "Sorry, I'm just so proud of the babies my boyfriend and I made together." Rebecca had grown quite a bit in the last few days, just like everyone else, but compared to Sarah she was still slim and trim. "Our two beautiful twins are coming right along."

"I'm happy for you," Sarah said, fishing for her keys in her bag. She didn't want to tell Rebecca about her own relationship – she'd drop that bombshell later.

"Yes, and I can still move so well even with the children on the way," Rebecca said, kicking one leg all the way up to 180 degrees. "I might even start teaching classes for pregnant women."

"I think those are set," Sarah said with a smile.

"Yes but I heard a lot of complaints that you went a bit hard on the women today. Maybe I'll look into that and see if someone else can't do it better," Rebecca smiled back. "Someone with a little more dexterity."

"Please, go talk to all the women in my class," Sarah said, taking her keys and waddling out. "And while you're at it, maybe they can give you some parenting advice. Your children deserve a good role model, after all." Sarah left as Rebecca bit her lip, fuming silently in the office.

Sarah had to lay down a few towels in the seat of her car to avoid getting sweat over everything. With her large pregnant belly, she was uncomfortable enough driving as it was. Getting everything wet and sticky would only make that worse. As Sarah struggled with her seatbelt, she felt a strong kick jerk her forward. She stopped and gasped, touching the top of her stomach. There had been a few shifts and ripples from inside her but this was a full-blown kick. Sarah rubbed slowly, trying to pick up on more of the movement. Then, on the opposite pole of her globular stomach, another hard push made Sarah yelp.

"Wow," Sarah mused, reaching between her thighs to cup the underside of her belly where another of her sextuplets was getting restless. "You're all kinda strong. Must run in the family." She figured they had to be strong to stretch out her belly. It felt so firm and rigid. And those kicks really stretched out her skin and pinched. "Just try not to kick too much while I'm driving. I'd hate to have to explain this to a traffic cop."

Over at Soft Lace, Monica sat on the side as she watched Maci nervously paced back and forth near the runway. With a small sigh, the freckled model heaved herself up, waited a few seconds to regain balance, and then waddled over to the much smaller woman. "Hi," Monica said with a smile, stroking her still-uncovered brown belly. "Don't be worried."

"Yeah, right," Maci scoffed, not even looking at Monica.

"You did a good job on the catwalk," Monica smiled. "But I think after a little bit, your nerves got to you. I used to be the same way...well, I still am but I have a few techniques to not be so nervous."

"Believe me, this isn't what I'm nervous about," Maci said, glancing at Monica. She just found out she, her sister, her mother, and ridiculously her father were all pregnant thanks to an energy drink of all things. And Laci, the one who believes in demons and black magic (or as Laci insisted on calling it, black magicks), though Maci was being crazy. "I'm just going through a hard time."

Monica tightened her smile a bit, weirdly seeing some of herself in Maci, though she never had that natural preppy charisma Maci exuded. "Still, there are ways to get it all out of your head on the walkway. Look." Monica walked Maci onto the runway and pointed forward. "You know how the light would be shining right there?"

"Yeah," Maci said, crossing her arms.

"Just focus on the space right above the light. Barely above it, even. And then, in your head, count."

"Count to what?" Maci asked.

"Count until you finish. But only count prime numbers," Monica chuckled. "It helps keep your mind clear and then you let your body do the rest."

"Lately my body has a mind of its own," Maci said, looking down at her belly. With twins, she looked just about fully due for a single pregnancy but Monica looks comparatively ready to burst, her belly button closer to Maci than to her own actual stomach.

"I know what you mean," Monica said with another laugh. "But you'll do great. We didn't think we could do the first lingerie run with our tummies but it went okay."

Maci looked down, a scowl developing, before looking back at Monica. "How can you work for her after what she did to us?"

"What? Who?"

"Britney. She gave us Xpect. She wanted us to be pregnant," Maci grumbled before she felt her pocket vibrate. It was her mother. "Hang on, I...I gotta take this."

As Maci waddled away, Monica felt something hard press against her lower back and two sweaty arms wrap around her, just below her breasts. "Guess who?"

"The belly gives it away," Monica smiled, turning in Sarah's arms to meet her girlfriend and give her a quick peck on the lips. "Let me get dressed quick, okay?"

"Mmm, okay," Sarah said in a mock-sad voice, looking over the half-naked model. As Sarah chuckled, Nico and Michelle flanked her on both sides.

"You two really are going out, huh?" Michelle said, her voice low and joyless.

"Yep! It's a happy accident," Sarah giggled, brushing some of her bright hair behind her ears like a nervous girl with a schoolyard crush.

"And you like the belly?" Nico asked, glancing over at Michelle as they exchanged a silent acknowledgement.

"You know...I do," Sarah said, really blushing now as she bit her bottom lip. "It looks sorta sexy, right? I mean, that's why this whole pregnant lingerie show is happening anyway."

"That's exactly why," Michelle said, tightening her fist. "Well, you two have fun."

"Thanks!" Sarah said, turning and giving the two models a big hug. "And any friends of Britney are friends of mine!" When Monica came back out with a jacket and pants on, Sarah hurried after her, the two holding onto one another as they left the store.

Gisele walked up behind Nico and Michelle, both still staring in Sarah's direction. "So?"

"They were both in on it. Sarah and Britney," Nico said. "Sarah got Xpect because she has a pregnancy fetish and Britney thought she could spin it into the lingerie show for money."

"I knew her roommate had to be in on it. No one is that air-headed," Gisele said. "Anything else?"

"She hugged us," Michelle said with a shrug. "I dunno, seemed suspicious."

"Maybe," Gisele nodded. "Maybe."

Back out in the parking lot, Sarah squeezed into the car as she felt another kick jerk her forward. "Hey, careful! You might make me honk the horn!"

"They're kicking?" Monica asked, leaning near Sarah. "Can I feel?"

Sarah looked back at her and smiled, rolling up her sweatsuit to reveal yards of soft, smooth belly. "Any time you want." Monica placed her hand on Sarah's belly and gently traced, opening up her palm to feel kicks, punches, and stretches. "How about you? Any big movements?"

"Sometimes. It started today," Monica smiled, looking down as she got bashful again. "W-we'd better go. I'd hate to miss my appointment."

---

"Tanner?" the nurse Jackie called out. Monica sighed and tried to get out of her chair, her belly nearly too wide for her to get out. Sarah took her arm and helped her stand, smiling at Monica as she helped her friend to the examination room. "Oh, you again," Jackie said when she saw Sarah. "Here for an appointment too?"

"No, I think I'm set," Sarah said, patting her belly.

"You'd be surprised. Lots of people are coming back when they saw themselves get bigger," Jackie shrugged. "Something's going around we're not quite sure about."

"I'd rather just focus on my friend for now," Sarah said, reaching around Monica's hip to touch her belly. Monica smiled and leaned against Sarah, their scalps rubbing a bit.

"Fine by me. It's been even more of a zoo here," Jackie said, guiding them into a room and helping Monica up onto the examination chair. "My, you're one of the bigger ones too."

"Birds of a feather flock together," said a lilting voice. They all turned to see Dr. Pascat gracefully stroll into the room. Monica seemed a little mesmerized by the doctor but Sarah flinched, still confused by her similarity to the woman the Xpect commercial. "Jackie, I can take this one. They need another nurse in a room down the hall. A gentleman is...not taking the discovery of twins inside him well."

"Sure thing," Jackie sighed, heading out the door. "I swear, there's only two kinds of guys who seem to be turning up pregnant: the ones who act like it's the end of the world and the ones who secretly always wanted it."

"Now then, let's look and see what you've got going on here," Dr. Pascat smiled, gelling up Monica's bare belly. "And please don't mind me saying you have incredible pregnant skin, dear."

"T-thank you," Monica blushed, reaching over to take Sarah's hand and squeeze it. Dr. Pascat placed the wand onto Monica's belly and pressed it in ever so firmly, making Monica gasp and tense up. Sarah placed her other hand on top of Monica's and brushed her with loving care, sending the hairs on the back of Monica's neck on edge.

"My, what perfectly healthy fetuses," Dr. Pascat cooed, looking into Monica's hazel eyes with her own piercing blue ones. "All six of them."

"S-six babies," Monica said, almost wheezing with shock. She and Sarah, pregnant with six kids.

"And everything looks just wonderful," the doctor said, taking a few more notes before handing Monica something to clean off her belly. "I hope you two weren't...worried about being pregnant unexpectedly."

Sarah and Monica looked at each other. "We had our concerns," Sarah smiled, placing one hand on Monica's shoulder. "But the important thing is we're having healthy babies, I guess."

"Wonderful," Dr. Pascat smiled. "Now then, if you could both get dressed and sit in our waiting space, I can give you a full report."

"Waiting room again?" Monica said.

The doctor laughed with a chime-like sound. "Oh no, it's a separate waiting room. Down the hall on your right," she said, her smile growing slightly. Sarah helped Monica back up and followed the doctor's instructions. But once they turned into the waiting area, both stopped dead in place.

"What a coincidence," Kate said, cackling as she looked at both of them. And next to Kate sat a heavily pregnant and tattooed Robin. "Why don't we all sit down and catch up. It's been too long."

Maci struggled with her new maternal weight as she waddled away from the stage to take the phone call. She always been curvy and round in the best places, with breasts bigger than the palm of her hand and a respectably plump rear. Now, her breasts were about as big as her belly was a few days ago and her ass could act as a quick table if someone needed a free hand around her. Both put a strain on her, from the soreness in her back and shoulders from her chest to the slow speed of her wide thighs as they wrestled with the weight of her butt.

And of course, there was her belly. Being roughly six months pregnant with twins was its own obstacle too.

"Hello?" Maci said, dropping her voice so the other models didn't hear her conversation. "Mom?"

"Hi Maci," her mom, Trisha, replied with a sigh. "Why are you so quiet?"

Maci paced and squirmed in place, feeling her cheeks burn. She really wanted Gisele, Nico, and Michelle to respect her and she worried how they'd react if they caught her taking time out of practice to talk to her mommy. Those three had a mean streak that was unrivaled even back in her high school. Not middle school, though. Middle school girls were true killers.

"Whatever," Maci mumbled. "What did you want?"

Trisha sighed again, patting her belly on the other end of the call. At 47, she had hoped she was past hearing her daughters talk back to her and they'd be going on with their own lives soon. Now, with the family's pregnancies, she not only worried Laci and Maci would stay at home longer and not emotionally mature at a regular pace thanks to the stress of early parenthood but Trisha would end up with two more foul-mouthed children to take care of. At least by the time she hit her 60s, she hoped she'd finally be past her baby-making days.

"I wanted to let you know we're having a nice dinner tonight with the neighbors," Trisha said. "Tami and Andrew Smith. You know them."

"Yeah, I know them but we barely ever talk," Maci said, rolling her eyes a bit. As newlyweds, they were annoying enough. Andrew seemed as stiff as a board and Tami always had a snarky side Maci didn't like. "Why now?"

"With so many changes going on, it would be good to start connecting with the people around us," Trisha said, palm stretching out to touch more of her firm belly.

"Yeah but we're moving into our house soon, right? They won't be our neighbors for much longer," Maci said. Both Hamiltons bit their lip, deciding how much to say. Maci knew her father, the one getting them into the new house, had a...surprise on the way and would likely be distracted. And Trisha had deep suspicions that her husband and Andrew were having an affair and wasn't sure about the future of the family.

"Still, it's good to talk with them," Trisha said, forcing a smile even though Maci couldn't see her. "H-hey, have you noticed anything strange with your father?"

Maci froze, wondering if her mom picked up on the weird male pregnancy. "Uh...like what?"

"Just anything. Maybe he leaves the house at odd times," Trisha said.

"No but...maybe we should talk more in person," Maci said. She tried to tell Laci about Xpect and their pregnancies over the phone and that didn't go too well. Face-to-face was the only option if she was going to be taken seriously.

"Alright, I-*gasp*" Trisha said, jumping up in her seat a bit. "Oh Maci, I just felt a kick!"

"Big deal, you've been pregnant before, right?" Maci said.

Trisha groaned. "Maci, being pregnant at the same time as you and your sister has been a very...difficult experience sometimes and I am trying to find a positive, getting us to connect over this but if you are going to be...well, like you always are, then that's all. See you at dinner." Trisha slammed her phone down and pinched the bridge of her nose before turning her attention back to her belly and tracing the kicks. As she rubbed, Thomas walked into the lab, blushing when he saw Trisha roll up her shirt to touch her bare belly.

"D-didn't mean to disturb you," Thomas said.

"No, I'm sorry," Trisha sighed, putting her outfit and lab coat back on to turn to him. "What can I do for you?"

"You wanted the inventory from the lab before the break-in so you could continue your studies," Thomas said, handing her a folder. "Not much went missing, I have to say."

"That's lucky. I hate to think of someone desperate for painkillers or other drugs broke in to steal but at least no one got hurt," Trisha said, flipping through the files. "Why does a sports drink keep coming up? Is it appropriate for an employee to complain about their lunch being stolen?"

"Ah, no, that was part of an experiment. Actually, the woman who last held your position studied it," Thomas said, blushing a little more at the thought of Diana catching him in the conversation. She was already livid about being pushed out of her lab job but if she knew he was helping someone else with her research? He might find out just how heavy that belly of hers really is. "It was called Xtreme or something like that."

"Xpect," Trisha said, reading it off the page slowly. "Say...that researcher wouldn't still be here, would she?"

Thomas' heart was like a hummingbird's. "Uh...yeah, she's still here at Trionic. You want to meet?" Trisha nodded and smiled. "Okay...sure. I think you'll hit it off, actually." He took one last look at Trisha's belly. "You both have a lot in common."

Back at Soft Lace, Maci was waddling back to the rest of her partners, all glaring at Britney as she was demonstrating a catwalk posture. "I know I'm a little bigger but it's the same basic principle," Britney said with a chuckle, jutting her stomach out as she popped her hip. "See, it not only makes your butt more prominent but it makes your belly bigger too."

"Why would we want this," Gisele said, prodding her large brown stomach, "to be even bigger?"

Britney looked between the models, a little stunned. "Well, it is a maternity lingerie show. Everyone knows the bellies are going to be there so why not show them off?"

The triumvirate of models looked at one another, silently conversing before Maci decided to speak up. "Um, Britney?"

"Yes, Maci?" Britney said, smiling a little at the young woman's participation.

"Did you know Xpect would make us pregnant?"

And Britney's smile left as quickly as it appeared. She looked like she'd just watched someone smash her car right in front of her. Before she answered, Britney looked at Gisele, Nico, and Michelle, all three pregnant beauties now looking very intently at Britney. She stepped forward and dropped her voice. "You all know?"

"Oh yeah," Michelle said, not looking pleased at all.

Britney ran one hand through her blond locks and groaned. "No, I did not know. You think I'd have taken it if I did? I don't know the first thing about raising a baby, let alone six."

Six? Maci thought, her big blue eyes popping a bit. Shit, that explains her size I guess.

"We've thought about that," Nico purred, slowly stroking her belly.

Britney looked even more surprised. "Wait, you think I actually wanted everyone to get pregnant? Before a big fashion show?"

"It's worked out pretty well so far," Gisele mused, turning around and looking at the set design being put together for the maternity lingerie show.

"And you all believe this?" Britney repeated, glaring at her models. The main three all looked pleased with unveiling the truth but Maci was looking down at her swollen stomach. "Okay...let's call it a day. Come back tomorrow with some fresh heads." She grabbed her clothes and stormed to the back while the models cackled.

"Now what?" Michelle said. They sighed and stared at their bellies, feeling the kicks stretch out their tight wombs.

"Yeah, that's the tricky part," Gisele admitted. "I don't know if there's any legal action we can take but for now, let's just plan."

"Are we still doing the fashion show?" Nico said.

The three of them thought about it. "I'm not passing up a committed pay day but after that, I'm cutting it with Soft Lace," Gisele said. "Plus I've got my acting career to think about."

Meanwhile, Maci was heading to the dressing room already, trembling a bit as she thought about the hurt look in Britney's eyes. As she started to gather her clothes, she looked at herself in the mirror and turned sideways, tracing one hand slowly down her pregnant silhouette, pushing it around her breasts to accentuate them.

"I don't look so bad like this," Maci murmured, turning the other way. "I could get what Laci sees in it."

David groaned as he got off the elevator, one hand pressed firmly into the small of his back, the other cradling the vast expanse of his pregnant belly.

As he waddled his way to his desk, he felt the stares of a hundred eyes looking at him and heard the hushed tones of a dozen whispers.
He felt angry, embarrassed, scared, nervous and most importantly.. bigger. He felt like he could feel himself getting bigger by the second, like he was getting even MORE pregnant.

Pregnant he thought that word in his head. How the hell did this happen to David Hamilton? At 50, he was on the fast track for the Senior Management of Sales & Advertising, and was going to shake up the office and the industry with some lofty new ideas and goals. It was what he was made for, well that, and the occasional indulgence in the vast world of women.

He was a ladies man, the cock of the walk, and he knew it. His charming personality, silver tongue and decent looks made him a real lady killer. Yes, he loved Trish, but he was never one to really settle down, and a waitress here, a secretary there didn't hurt.

So perhaps when he collapsed himself into his chair, with the vast expanse of his pregnancy spilling into his lap, he though about Karma.
Karma can turn right around and bite you they say, and Karma looked like it took a dinosaur sized bite out of David. The chickens of womanizing and shady deals have came home to roost inside the great furnace that was David Hamilton's pregnancy.

Whining from a sharp kick to his bladder, David ran a hand over the spot where the activity of the unborn was clearly visible under the skin-tight white dress shirt that barely covered his belly. He grabbed a box of office paper and put his feet up, trying to rest his swollen ankles. He allowed himself to close his eye for a moment, all while he swore he felt himself getting larger by the minute.

"Knock, Knock!" came an older female voice into his office. David snapped to attention, and tried to cover his obvious pregnancy. "Oh, Karley, good morning." David said, making himself look real busy with fake work. "What can I do for you?" His eyes not looking up for the day-old notes on his desk. "We need to talk" Karley said, hiding herself in the door frame of his office. "About what?" David asked, about to dread the answer.

"This!" Karley said, waddling herself in, pregnant belly leading the way first. At 50, Karley was one of the senior executives at the company, a no nonsense business woman who would only look down on the people below her to see what she stepped on climbing the ladder to success. Thrice married and divorced five times (no one ever asked how you can be divorced without being married), Karley was as cold as she was successful, and she was very very successful.

She wore a black and white stripped dress that looked like it cost double of what David earned in a good year, with a diamond brooch necklace and a diamond hair pin that ran through her greying strawberry blonde hair. A combination of years of expensive breast enhancement surgery and her surprise pregnancy kept her "Assests" as she called them in near peak perfect condition. She looked like a gracefully aging supermodel, which was to her design as men, thinking only with the head that was not attached to their shoulders, would underestimate her in the business world. Her mind was the gun and her body the ammunition and she was a skilled marksman at using both.

But now, as she stood in David's office, pushing her pregnant belly out for David to drink in, time seemed to stand still for both of them. Karley was a business woman that had no time for things such as children, but now she looked ready to pop, and while she wasn't happy with her current situation, she was going to try her best.

"And what is that?" David asked pointing at the huge pregnant belly attached to Karley. "That.. would be the.. results of our.. merger.. so to speak" She said, rubbing her pregnant belly. "You mean?" David asked, dumbfounded. "They are yours David" She said cold and sternly. "They?" David gulped, already knowing the answer to his next question "You mean, as in plural?"

"Twins David" Karley responded. It runs in the genes was the only thing that David could think of at the current moment. "Boys. Carl and Jacob" Karley said, rubbing a sore spot in her back. "You.. already named them?" David asked. "Of course, you typically name children you plan to raise" Karley asked
David felt like screaming, everywhere he went pregnancy seemed to follow him. Was he cursed? He certainly felt cursed.

"Look David, I didn't come in here to ask for you to leave your wife, or for money. I make three times more than you do. Our children will want for nothing. I just wanted to let you know that I fully expect you to be in your sons lives when I deem in necessary. You shall see them when I think it's appropriate, and will have no other outside communication. I've done everything else on my own my whole life, and I don't need you or anyone else telling me how to raise these children. I may not like children or ever had any desire to have any, but I feel a certain general curiosity as to the prospect of being a mother. How hard can children be I ask myself? Do I not negotiate multi-million dollar deals before breakfast?" Karley said, putting all her cards on the table.

"Then, why are you here? Why tell me all this if you don't want me to be apart of this?" David asked.
"Three things" Karley asked holding up three fingers "One, I want you to know that your children with me existed. I don't want them to not know their own father. Two, I plan on telling your wife, as soon as possible. I've seen you walk about the office, charming your way into the pants of any young woman who will listen. Such indiscretions will not fly with me. I understand that we got into this mess together, and perhaps that energy drink / tonic cocktail I had last week clouded my judgement and landed me in bed with you, but I will not be the "other" woman.

Oh god no, she's going to tell Trisha David thought to himself. "What was three?" David asked, his mouth operating faster than his brain. "Mr. Hicks wanted to see you" Karley said, cradling her belly with both hands. Mr. Hicks? The Head of the Company? To see him? Why?

"Why does Mr. Hicks want to see me?" David asked. "I don't know. Nobody has seen him since the mixer last week. Just shut himself in his office. He's the first one in and the last one out. Just told me to come find you after he saw you on the office security cameras this morning" Karley removed her hands from her belly, and looked out to the zone of cubicles and desks on the main floor. "I'll be bye tonight to tell your wife about these two" Karley said patting her belly.
"I look forward to it" David said sarcastically. "Oh, and congratulations" Karley said, in a surprisingly pleasant tone. "I'm sorry?"

"You look great. I've heard rumors about some men around town, didn't think it would happen here. If there's anything you need, just let me know, pregnant woman to pregnant.. person" Karley said, nodding towards David's belly before leaving back out to her own office.

Just perfect David though to himself, he hands absentmindedly resting on his belly. He rested for a few moments, before heaving himself out of his chair and waddling to Mr. Hicks office. Along his slow methodical journey he felt everyone staring at him again. News travels fast in a office, and news like this would certainly be hard to miss. He got mostly confused stares, but some of the stares looked disgusted, like he was some kind of freak. Yet, he caught the smile of another young woman in the office, who let out a small "aww" as David waddled by, almost infatuated by the pregnant man of the office.

He stopped in front of Mr. Hicks' door, and knocked. "Whose is it?" The gruff voice behind the door said. "It's uh me sir. David Hamilton. You asked to see me?" David said timidly. David heard the stories, and the only time you meet Alexander Hicks face-to-face in his office was when your ass got fired. Nobody saw the boss like this and lived with their job intact.

"Come in, close the door quickly" Mr HIcks said, and David did what he was told. He saw Mr. Hicks with his back turned to the door, staring out the windows, hands behind his back. HIs office was elegant yet simple, like something you would see out of a Hollywood movie about the "big shot" executive. Awards, globes, degrees, art, plants, were tastefully splotched around the office. This office looked like more than million bucks, preciously 25.25 million a year with bonus options per quarterly period.

"What is this about sir?" David said, sitting in a chair, desperately trying to cover his pregnance. He didn't want the boss to see him like this, after all that's what this had to be about right? "Family. I've never been much of a family man Hamilton. Been too busy building a multimillion dollar empire. Or sure there were wives, and mistresses, and the wives that were a decade younger than my current mistress, but never a family you know?" David was confused. "I look at the future, and wonder, what am I going with this company? What legacy am I leaving?"

"Sir?" David asked. "You're a family man Hamilton, in more ways than one, I see" referring to David's "passengers". "I'm coming over to your place tonight for dinner Hamilton. I want to met your family. See what makes you tick" Hicks said. "Sir tonight? Uh wah?" David was confused. "I see you as a man of the future, someone who could help me leave something behind for my children"

David was getting that raise! This was fantastic, new job, more money.. Wait.. Children? "Sir, you don't have any children.."
Mr Hicks finally turned around to reveal his massive pregnant belly, straining to burst out of his expensive suit. "Three boys, they tell me. Now let's talk about dinner tonight. I think we have things in common."

"Why don't we all sit down and catch up? It's been too long," Kate chuckled as she eyed Sarah and Monica. Monica's dark, freckled face was starting to turn pale while Sarah's peach-toned skin was turning bright red. She saw that Kate was back in town through social media and Britney and Diana mentioned she was prowling around the lingerie show but she had yet to actually see in Kate again in person. It had been years since Kate absolutely dashed Sarah's heart to pieces and now, at the OB/GYN office while she was getting an ultrasound, she saw Kate sitting next to a heavily pregnant woman of her own.

Sarah's jaw was hurting with how tightly she was clenching her jaw but as she opened it to speak, another little voice spoke up. "Kate?" Sarah turned to see her model girlfriend's eyes get wide as the name escaped her lips.

"It's me," Kate laughed again. "Come on, take a load off. You both must get exhausted carrying all that around." She turned to Robin and placed one hand on her exposed, tattooed belly and gave it a hard jiggle. "I know you do." Robin grunted and nodded, quickly putting both hands on the sides of her wide stomach to stroke it and settle the movement inside. Compared to Sarah and Monica, Robin was a few inches smaller in diameter but looked just as uncomfortable, if not more.

"How many are you two carrying?" Robin asked gruffly as they both reluctantly sat down as far from Kate as they could.

"Six," Sarah said, turning to lock eyes with Kate. That only lasted a few seconds as the gleeful glimmer in Kate's violet eyes made Sarah have to look away.

"Guess I feel lucky," Robin said, lifting her hips to resettle her belly, holding onto it like a loose parcel as its weight rolled around her swollen body. "Only four but they said they look like they're due any day now."

"Six little Sarahs and six little Monicas," Kate cooed, pressing her hands together. "What an interesting world the children of the future are going to grow up in."

"How do you know her name?" Sarah and Monica asked in unison, looking at each other confused.

Now Kate was truly laughing out loud, rubbing her palms. "You two didn't know? I mean, I almost didn't believe the two of you found each other but I thought Britney or Diana might have clued you in." She slinked over, bending down to give them both a look at the cleavage they used to fondle in bed. "We used to date. Both of you."

Sarah was practically boiling with emotion now. Anger, sadness, regret, lust, and another dose of anger for good measure. But she couldn't get all the thoughts out of her head, not used to feeling so much negativity. Instead, she felt her cheeks burn as tears welled up in the corner of her eyes.

"Sarah, smells like you still work out way too much. That just makes your hair dry out and shrinks your breasts, you know," Kate said, turning to Monica and grinning. "But how are the two of you together? How does it work with all that baby fat? Monica, I know you were very inexperienced when we went out but even you must find it strange." Kate reached out and rubbed the back of her finger by Monica's navel. "If only those bullies from back home could see you now, huh?"

"Don't touch her," Sarah said, a few words finally breaking through her mental barricade. Her belly pushed Kate back a few steps and she was unconsciously flexing her arms and shoulders, showing just how burly she could be when she wanted. "If you treated her like you treated me, so help me you...I don't want to use the b-word but...you..."

"Easy, easy," Kate said, holding up her arms as Robin came to her aid, staring down Sarah. While Robin didn't have Sarah's overall athleticism, she was tall and buff enough to square off. "We're all just moms-to-be here, come to take care of our little bundles of joy. No reason to get physical."

"M-mom-to-be?" Monica said, beginning to tremble. "Y-you're actually going to raise c-children?"

Robin gulped and turned to Kate, their eyes silently communicating a very personal subject. "We're having a conversation," Kate replied with an untroubled smile, contrasted with Robin's lifting eyebrows.

"Monica?" Dr. Pascat's soft voice said. The four women stepped away as the doctor strode in and handed Monica a clipboard. "Everything checks out fine. You can take that form to fill out pre-natal prescriptions." She looked between their faces, from Robin's worry to Sarah's fury to Monica's shock to Kate's pleased smile. "Is everything alright?"

"Just fine, Jeannie," Kate said, putting one arm around Robin's hips. "Just catching up with old friends."

"Wonderful. Then I'll leave you both to it," the doctor nodded, flashing Kate a serpent-like smile and glance before leaving for the rest of the office. When Monica got her form, she and Sarah left the room as quickly as possible.

"Bye now," Kate called out. "And good luck at the fashion show! I'll be there!" She belted out another laugh as they left the room and turned to Robin, holding onto the pregnant punk tightly.

"Did you mean it? That you wanted to be a mother?" Robin asked. "I'm not the domestic type but...four babies...I could use some help-"

"Shh, shh, that's so unsexy," Kate said, giving Robin a peck on the lips to shut her up. "Diapers and preschool and storks, ugh. I'd rather talk about this ad campaign. Do you have the videos ready and edited?"

"Yeah but you haven't actually..." Robin's voice trailed off as Kate rubbed her breasts against her own. "A-actually paid me yet."

Kate stepped away and scoffed. "I thought we were friends. You can wait on a little bit of money." She reached one hand under Robin's belly and gave it a teasing stroke with one finger. "I let you sleep at my loft, don't I? Rent-free?"

"M-most nights," Robin choked, always amazed by Kate's ability to find that one perfect spot on a woman's body.

"Then don't be so ungrateful," Kate said, pulling her hand away and sitting back down.

Near the exit to the clinic, Sarah and Monica were walking fast. Well, as fast as they could. "I just cannot believe her," Sarah said, her whole body shaking. "It's not enough for her to...to hurt me. She has to be cruel on top of it."

"Britney says the rest of the day is called off so you can just take me home," Monica mumbled as she put her phone away barely looking up.

"The worst person I have ever met. Hands down. The absolute worst," Sarah spat. "And she seems to bounce back pretty fast with that...inked up bruiser with a belly."

"I think she moved on to me," Monica squeaked, stopping Sarah in place. "She mentioned a...sporty ex-girlfriend she mocked a lot. And then she dumped me about a month ago."

Sarah sighed and took Monica's hands. "I'm sorry, I should have asked you how you were doing. It's just...both of us dating Kate. What are the chances?"

Monica shrugged, still looking down. "She was my...my first. I felt so lucky, you know? She was so pretty."

"She's pretty, I'll give her that," Sarah huffed. "With that olive skin."

"And her raven hair," Monica said. "And her soft lips."

"Right and her bulging breasts and her...curvy waist," Sarah said, feeling her mouth get a little dry.

"Yeah, her belly button had that perfect thin, deep shape," Monica said, starting to blush as she turned to Sarah. "A-and that way she would make you whisper her name before...before..." The two women clashed together, arms and mouths intertwined as they piled into a bathroom and locked the door behind them, panting and whining as they went at one another with newfound energy.

---

Back at MegaGym, Emily stood on a scale near the locker room, sighing and playing with her brown curly hair. "Maybe it's all of this. Once I get a haircut, I have to weigh less," Emily told herself as her other hand stroked her belly. But she didn't know who she was fooling. She was, somehow, six months pregnant despite only showing a few days ago and there were a lot of future gymnasts on the way.

"Problem?" Lori asked as she struggled past her boss, a towel wrapped around her large chest. Because of her short height, Lori looked like one of the biggest of the main MegaGym staff despite carrying even fewer than Sarah. Her long brown hair shimmered thanks to a new flood of hormones and her tan skin was like a statue glowing in the sun.

"I don't know, it's the usual fears that come with being a fitness freak," Emily sighed as she stepped off the scale. "I just didn't expect to gain this much weight."

"I hear ya," Lori shrugged. "At least it doesn't make swimming that much harder."

"That's one upside," Emily nodded. "But I need to put in a good showing at the fitness competition. This is our chance to stay in business and if the boss does a shitty job, how will that reflect on all of us?"

"Sounds like you need to take Sarah and Nina's class," Lori said. "They are kicking womens' big, plump asses down there."

"Maybe," Emily sighed. "And the other problem is..."

"What?" Lori asked as Emily's voice trailed off.

"I'm so damn horny," Emily whispered. "I don't know if it's the hormones or what but it's like I'm a high schooler again and I'm not catching any guys with all this extra weight." She prodded the top of her stomach with her thumb, fearing looking at the scale again.

"Listen, if that's what you're looking for," Lori whispered back, leaning in. "There's rumors of a...place in town where people who don't mind a little bump in the road get together. What do you say?"

Emily sighed, always trying to stay professional but...

"Fuck it. Tell me when and where."

With a sigh, Sabrina waddled into the shower at MegaGym, muscles sore from mixing a thorough workout with pregnancy. She was never particularly interested in physical fitness, relying on good genes to stay trim and curvy, so today's exercises took a lot out of her. Sabrina clutched a towel to her body, astounded at how many women were walking around naked in the open locker room. And with swollen, pregnant stomachs no less. Of course, many of them could be mistaken for potbellies. Women with Sabrina's size were more uncommon, which sent a distinct shiver of worry down her spine.

She stepped into a curtained stall and hissed as the cold water hit her body. Sabrina bit her lip and waited for it to heat up as she glanced at the other curtains. The silhouettes of big-bellied women were obvious and she blushed, placing one hand against her own big midsection. Earlier in the day, Sabrina started to feel movement inside her, counting three distinct forms.

"Triplets," Sabrina murmured to herself.

"What was that?" the woman in the stall next to her said.

"O-oh, nothing," Sabrina replied. "Just...I'm carrying triplets."

"That's nice to hear," the other woman said, poking her head through the curtain to reveal Peggy's face. "I'm pregnant with twins. You look like you're carrying it well."

"You think?" Sabrina blushed, coyly hiding her breasts as she turned her belly toward Peggy. "It came as a bit of a surprise."

"Mine too. My ex-husband had to mess up my life one more time, it seems," Peggy sighed, her belly pushing through the curtain into a tight, round bulge. "I was going to tell him but it seems his current girlfriend is expecting as well and...I can't throw a wrench into her life just to satisfy myself. I can take care of these babies on my own."

"That's a good way to see it, I suppose," Sabrina said.

"And besides, she's quite a bit younger. She'll need all the help she can get," Peggy chuckled. "I'm sorry, I just wanted someone to chat with."

"No, please, by all means," Sabrina smiled, giving a light stage bow. "I am always happy to play audience."

Peggy narrowed her eyes, her smile getting a little nervous. "Alright then." She went back into her own shower and Sabrina leaned back, letting the water wash over her as she thought it could be a lot worse.

Once finished washing up, Sabrina slowly changed and headed out to the gym, failing to find Sarah for a ride back home. Sabrina searched and came across Nina. At least Nina was always easy to find. "Have you seen Sarah?"

"Sarah?" Nina panted, stroking her massive belly and wincing with each kick and cramp. "I think she took her break. By my count, she won't be back for a little while."

"Too bad," Sabrina sighed, looking back at Nina's moon of a stomach, the impressions of feet and fists obvious. "A lot of commotion in there."

"They're active, just like their momma," Nina said with a pained smile, giving her belly a light pat, which only elicited more tantrums. "But any day now they should be here. Hopefully they're a little calmer outside of the womb."

Sabrina smiled, placing her hand against her own belly and patting it in rhythm with Nina's. "I'm sure they will be in good hands." Sabrina turned and headed for the nearest bus stop, standing next to many other expectant men and women. Once on board, it was bedlum with all seats taken up by pregnant people and other big-bellied passengers having to stand. Sabrina was one of those, pushing past bulging riders as her bright red hair tossed around rubbing against others. When she finally came to a stop, she saw a familiar face sitting in front of her.

"You're...Sabrina, right?" Gisele said, both hands resting on her belly. "From the improv class?"

"My word, yes," Sabrina said, turning the theatrical voice up to 11 in front of a fellow classmate. "And you're Gisele, if I recall."

"The one and only," she grinned. "I got to leave my work early today so I thought I'd stop by the gym, give someone I know a...a piece of my mind."

"Ah, it's always good to exercise," Sabrina said as Gisele began to stand and waddle to MegaGym, one hand reaching underneath her belly for support. "You were fortunate to find a seat."

"It wasn't hard. I'm a model. People will do anything for me," she said, winking to a pregnant young man standing near the back. "It makes acting much easier."

"Oh yes, beauty and acting go hand in hand," Sabrina nodded.

"And I have to make sure and exercise so it doesn't go away with...age," Gisele smiled, giving Sabrina a once-over before waddling off the bus. Sabrina's heart sank and she felt her cheeks burning brighter than her hair.

"Hold the door!" Lori said from outside, hurrying inside and pushing through the crowd with her belly. Once Gisele left, it was a mad scramble for the last seat. "Oh hey, Sabrina!"

"Lori! A day full of friendly faces," Sabrina said. "You work at the MegaGym, do you not?"

"Yep," Lori said, visibly a little irritated with Sabrina's dramatic persona. "Hey, sorry about us kinda fighting in improv class a few days ago."

"No, no, we were filled with the passion of the artform," Sabrina said. "And I have been thinking more about our dual show together."

"Sure, you'd still want to do that?" Lori said.

"Yes and I have been getting inspiration from the muses themselves," Sabrina said. "What if we included a third character? While you and I play mother and daughter, I am also divorced and my ex-husband has a young, pregnant girlfriend."

"Very dramatic," Lori grinned. "You really have a knack for this, Sabrina."

The redhead smiled and blushed, putting one hand on Lori's shoulder. "With kind words such as those, how could I ever stay cross with you?"

---

Back at the gym, Sarah and Monica waddled in from the parking lot, Monica's eyes wide with hesitation. "I don't really workout," Monica said quietly. "I mean, I jog sometimes but-"

"All the more reason to go," Sarah said, puffing her belly out in pride. "We can make a day of it. Now do you want to start with some cardio or would you like to get to work on those little arms of yours?"

"Hey, Sarah Richardson!" Gisele shouted across the gym. Sarah turned to see the dazzling Latina model waddle over, their bellies pressing together. "Finally. I have a lot I want to say to you."

Monica knew Gisele blamed Britney for Xpect and her pregnancy but thought she might have connected the dots and shifted blame to Sarah as well. "Hey, Gisele, how about we go talk in private-"

"No, I want to say it now," Gisele smirked, rolling up her shirt to touch her naked brown belly to Sarah's big pink stomach. "You did this to me."

"I-It was an honest mistake," Sarah squeaked, her head still a bit jumbled from her run-in with Kate. "I didn't know that-"

"That Xpect would make me pregnant?" Gisele shouted so several other gym-goers could hear and turn their head. "That's quite the coincidence because everything seems to have worked out for you and your roommate since we got knocked up."

"Gisele, don't yell," Monica said, grabbing Gisele's arm and trying to pull her away from her girlfriend.

"And I just want to say one thing," Gisele said, her smile growing as she let the silence hang. Then, in an instant, Gisele leapt up to hug Sarah and give her a big kiss on the lips. "Thank you!"

Sarah was mute with shock, her eyes wide as she glanced at Monica then back at Gisele.

"I've wanted to be a mom since I was a little girl but everyone always told me it would be impossible in the modeling world so I always held off! But thanks to you, I pushed right through and now everything is turning out even better than I could have dreamed!" Gisele squealed, stroking her naked belly in big, fast circles. "Thank you! Thank you!"

"You're...welcome?" Sarah said. "I mean, it was an accident but-"

"I have to put on a tough face in front of the other girls, you know?" Gisele said, wiping a few joyful tears out of her face. "But I just had to say thank you directly. You don't know what you've done!" She cackled with delight and looked around. "And you know what? I think I might actually sign up here. Be around other, lovely moms-to-be."

"And dads," a passing Jim grumbled.

As Gisele hurried off into the gym, Monica walked up beside Sarah and put one arm around her girlfriend's shoulders. "Do you think anyone heard her?" Monica said, glancing around at people whispering.

"Not sure," Sarah replied with a gulp. "But let's focus on the important thing."

"What's that?" Monica asked as they turned to face one another.

"You're still getting a workout and you can't get out of that," Sarah smiled, kissing Monica on the nose and dragging her toward the weight room. Meanwhile, rumors were already spreading throughout MegaGym about Xpect and Sarah's role in it. Some were appreciative, some were angry, some were confused, some were in denial. But the thing about rumors is they build and they fester, ready to spread across a city.

And as Sarah and Monica worked out for the rest of the afternoon, the rumors spread far and wide, permeating the city with a rich layer of chaos. The stronger that chaos got, the more people could swear they heard a dark laughter coming from the new cans of Xpect Xtreme that were being unloaded.
