1111112122111221121122222211121212121211.content:
12/20 notes

Trisha Hamilton took a deep breath and shook out her limbs. "Easy, easy, you're at work," Trisha repeated to herself. She couldn't let the mounting concerns she had about her husband's infidelity and their upcoming dinner tonight with the Smiths next door, on top of her own anxieties with being a mother again while raising two pregnant teenagers, get in the way of her brand new job. And she was meeting with another employee at the lab and gossip around Trionic Chemicals was this woman could be a little...testy.

Trisha pushed through the doorway into the records room, her belly not yet big enough to open the door without her arms, and waddled toward the sound of typing fingers. "Hello, my name is Trisha Hamilton. Are you Diana..."

Diana pushed her glasses back up as she turned in her stool, away from the computer. Her belly was like a second desk between the two of them, growing so massive lately that it barely fit between the walls and the tables. Trisha thought she had gotten big when she was pregnant with Laci and Maci but this woman was on a whole different level.

"Yes?" Diana said, wincing as she stood up and moved toward Trisha, her belly so big she could have stuffed the pregnant mother in there with room to spare. "I'm Diana Larsen. Can I help you?"

"Actually, I think I'm here to help you," Trisha said, blinking quickly. "Sorry, just a little surprised. I didn't expect you to be so..." Trisha could not have been more obvious with her gawking at Diana's belly so she snapped her head up. "Young."

"Oh...thank you," Diana said, breaking a smile and adjusting her glasses. "Yeah, when people hear I'm the chemical engineer here, it surprises them until they hear me start talking."

"Didn't meant to imply anything or...distrust you," Trisha said with a sigh. "Sorry, pregnancy brain."

Diana furrowed her brow and leaned forward, trying to see Trisha's belly past her own. Sure enough, there was a bulge there but it was hard for Diana to spot in her current state. "I know what you mean. So, you're new here?"

"Yes, I have a Master's in bio-chemistry but I've been a stay at home mom for a while," Trisha said, placing one hand back on her round stomach. "I had planned to come back this week but hadn't planned on these two showing up."

"I know what you mean by that too," Diana sighed. "So you're going to help me go through these journal articles and sort it all out?"

"That's what I'm here for!" Trisha grinned, trying to put on a strong face. "Though I'm surprised a chemical engineer is doing this sort of work."

"It's a long story," Diana grumbled. "In fact, how about I give you a little private tour?"

"Tour? I don't know...it's a little late in the day," Trisha said as Diana started to push her with her humungous stomach.

"Hey, I need to get out of the office and get into some excitement just like anyone else," Diana chuckled. "Maybe having you around can give me an excuse." Once down the hall, Diana's eyes started to light up, remembering the good ol' days of hurrying around with samples, looking through microscopes, and learning new things every day. But as Diana turned the corner for the main floor, Thomas was there, arms crossed, looking annoyed. "Tom?"

Thomas turned around, looking a lot happier when he saw her and nearly leapt into a hug but stopped himself when he saw Trisha next to her. "*ahem* Ah, Dr. Larsen, I see you didn't get the memo about the change of plans either."

"What change? Why are you talking like that?" Diana said.

Thomas cleared his throat again and tried to talk casually. "A-Apparently some big chemical company came in and bought a big swath of our storage tanks. All the analysis on it is being done by them and even the floor is off-limits."

"Off limits? We're the engineers and researchers. How could we be prevented from even going in?" Diana said.

Thomas shrugged. "Guess Trionic is getting a lot of money."

"I swear, every day with this place it's something new," Diana groaned, turning slowly to Trisha. "I guess the tour stops here."

"It's fine, I should be getting home anyway," Trisha said, checking her watch. "You can help me learn about working here tomorrow."

"Thanks Trisha," Diana grinned. "And if I need some parenting advice, I hope I can count on you."

"I don't know if I'm the best person for advice. You haven't met my daughters," Trisha sighed, patting her stomach. "But I'd be happy to chat. Have a good night."

"You too," Diana waved, turning to Thomas. "So, got any plans tonight?"

"I thought I might...see what you were thinking," Thomas said, reaching one hand over to trace his finger down the long curve of Diana's belly. "What do you feel up to?"

"Everything," Diana purred, pushing Thomas up against the wall with her maternal swell. "I'm angry again and I need some way to let it out." Thomas gulped. "Hey, don't be too scared. You liked it last night."

"Last night you weren't as...big," Thomas whispered.

Diana chuckled and reached one hand out to his cheek. "You know, my friend is a fitness instructor. Maybe she could toughen you up so I don't break you."

----

The mood was never great at the Hamilton house. Maci and Laci would always fight, David would either be trying to impress them with his gleaned knowledge of "youth-speak" or getting annoyed himself, and Trisha would be silently mediating things behind the scenes. But tonight, it was especially bad. David was pacing around, nerves on edge over how tonight's dinner would go with two women he'd impregnated joining his wife and children, plus his boss. And Tami's husband too, he guessed, but David wasn't all that worried about him.

Meanwhile, Trisha was quietly making dinner with help from Laci, her constant studying of rituals actually making her a pretty good cook, harboring her own fears about her husband's infidelity. She knew he had a habit of flirting but Trisha stayed with him, thinking deep down he was a good man who was taking care of them. The new house was part of that promise. But if he was actually having an affair, while she and her daughters were pregnant...Trisha would leave him. She'd made up her mind.

Maci was pacing around so much you'd think she was trying to stave off contractions. But she was wrestling with the knowledge that drinking Xpect, a stupid little energy drink, was responsible for the two fetuses rapidly growing inside her virgin womb. Same for her twin sister, same for her mother, same for her father, same for probably half of the pregnant people she'd seen around town in the past week. How was she going to bring it up? Laci already laughed her off but what did she owe them?

As for Laci, she was a little less concerned. Sure, she was still heartbroken over Robin cheating on her with some other bitch, although if Laci actually knew Kate she might switch from worshiping the devil and worship the PR exec's evil instead. But what was bothering Laci lately was the funny feeling in her belly. Not her pregnancy – she was well accustomed to that now – but something...else. Different than nausea, a kind of bubbling. Little did Laci realize her father was feeling it too.

"How's everything coming in here?" David asked, poking his head in the kitchen.

"Fine," Trisha and Laci replied in unison.

"You're not...mad I ended up inviting two of my bosses here last minute, are you?" David said.

"No, I was going to make big portions anyway," Trisha said. "With cravings, you never know how much you'll need."

Elizabeth nodded. "I've been throwing up ever since I drank it. Well, I suppose it's slowed down now, but I still feel lousy. Still, I'm managing."

Elizabeth had four children, two sets of twins. Her oldest two, Monica and Christine, were 20 and were tall, gorgeous girls with long flowing hair who spent half the day playing video games and watching movies and the other half jogging and socializing.

Her other pair, Roy and Veronica, were fraternal 18-year-old twins. Roy was planning to go to college in business and was obsessed with weird foods and drinks, sometimes out of a belief that they'd have some big health boost, and other times out of pure curiosity. Veronica, on the other hand, was a complete music nerd who was content to just eat junk and did so with great gusto. Elizabeth reached her hand over. "It's okay, if you want to talk about something else, it's fine."

Claire sighed again. "What is this power you have over me...maybe I've been feeling...old."

"Okay, see? Now that's something we can talk about," Elizabeth smiled. "We're the same age. Do you think of me as old?"

"No," Claire said quietly. "But you're...look at you. You go out and do exciting things and for heaven's sake Elizabeth: you still look like you're in your 20s."

Elizabeth chuckled and tucked a lock of hair behind her ear. "Even so, I still feel old sometimes Claire. And one day, we're not just going to think we're getting older. We really are going to be old." She took Claire's hand in hers. "And that's okay."

"I know, I just...it's hard."

"I know it's hard," Elizabeth said. "But you're old because you've lived a long life. Is there anything about your life you're not happy about?"

Claire shook her head. "No, you're right. I've got three amazing children. Well...maybe I'd wish for a husband who was around more." Claire blushed and turned to Elizabeth quickly. "Sorry, I didn't-"

"It's okay," Elizabeth said with a small smile. While Elizabeth was pregnant with Roy and Veronica, her husband Charles Dawson divorced her and ran off with his secretary. Elizabeth made enough from her own job, plus the payments Charles made, to support raising four kids, but she hadn't remarried since. "But, I hope I've made my point. We've had great lives and they're hardly over now. We can both still do all kinds of things. Besides, you wouldn't really want to relive your youth again, would you? Especially the three pregnancies."

"No, I'm glad those are behind me," Claire chuckled. "Well that's not quite true. I miss being pregnant, but I wouldn't want to be pregnant again. Especially at this age."

Claire shuddered with a smile. "Pregnant with triplets. I can't even imagine it." The two shared a laugh and Claire sighed with a smile. "Well, thank you, Elizabeth. You always make me feel better."

The clock struck midnight and both groaned softly, feeling their stomachs. "I feel better too," Elizabeth grinned. "You know...I don't feel nauseous anymore."

"Me either," Claire said, feeling her belly cautiously. "Well, I'd better try and get some sleep. We'll talk more tomorrow?"

You would have expected all eyes to be on the eight people coming to a buffet at four in the morning, two of which were massively pregnant, with one wearing a bathrobe and letting her bare belly hang out. But surprisingly, people paid little attention to Claire and Elizabeth's families. Even more surprising, the place was packed. Men and women with bellies of varying, but large, sizes walked back and forth between their tables and the food, some talking quietly with one another.

"We never thought we could have a family. It's like a miracle."

"I don't know what I'm going to do. We just got engaged and we haven't had sex yet. How do I tell him I'm four months pregnant with quadruplets?"

"One of us was going to go to a sperm bank at some point. Now we're both pregnant and we should embrace it."

"The same thing must be happening all over town," Monica said quietly, one hand rubbing her belly. While they may not have been getting attention for their pregnancies, quite a few people were checking out the attractive company that walked in. Not only had their bellies grown overnight, but their chests were now pushing E cups, or more in the case of Claire and Elizabeth.

They all piled up their plates with noodles, sweet and sour chicken and pork, big scoops of cooked vegetables, Sichuan beef, dumplings, and bowls of rice and squeezed together at the few available tables. Brad found himself face to face with Elizabeth, half of her belly visible under the table. He'd always thought Elizabeth was an attractive older woman but until he saw her pregnant belly, he didn't think much else about her.

"Did I spill something on my shirt?" Elizabeth asked Brad, who didn't realized he'd been staring directly at her for so long.

"N-no, sorry. I just drifted off," he said, blushing brightly.

The families packed away plates and plates of food, any drowsiness they felt after waking up at four in the morning absorbed by their monstrous hunger. Claire and Elizabeth alone finished off eight big plates, one for each baby they were pregnant with. Claire looked at her phone, a text back from Bella telling her she was fine and understood that they were all at the hospital. "Wow, we've been eating here for nearly two hours," Claire said quietly.

"Then the hospital's probably open for walk-ins," Elizabeth smiled, looking over at Claire. Like her neighbor, her dream last night involved the two in bed together, massively pregnant, until Brad Sr. walked in. "But if we're all ready, let's go!" Elizabeth stood up, the meal widening her belly and making her shirt, already too small for her pregnant frame, roll up, revealing her smooth, brown belly to Brad, who stiffened up even more.

"L-let's go!" Brad said, hurrying toward the car as Claire gave the buffet manager her credit card, making a conscious decision not to look at the receipt. She couldn't imagine how much she spent at this place.

The line at the hospital was thankfully much smaller than it was at the Chinese buffet. "E-excuse me, we need to see an OB/GYN," Claire said, looking back at the group with her. "All of us."

The receptionist looked a bit confused but typed a few strokes on his computer. "Alright, Dr. Stevens can see you now. I don't know if you want to go in one at a time or..."

"We'll all go in together," Elizabeth said, smiling at her children. "If this is what we think it is...we should all be there to support one another."

Dr. Stevens was an attractive young man, brushing his shining golden hair as his office filled up. "My, the receptionist said this was going to be an unusual appointment, but this is...quite the turn-out. So, who first? I have two examining tables."

"Mom, you go first," Brittany said, smiling sweetly at her own pregnant mother. On top of being pregnant herself, Brittany was looking forward to seeing Claire's pregnancy develop right before her eyes. She couldn't remember Claire when she was pregnant with Bella very well.

Claire smiled. "I think...Brad should go first," she said, turning to her son. "And Roy. Elizabeth and I know we're pregnant, but I'm most worried about you two."

Roy shrugged and got on the examining table, assuming he wasn't pregnant at all. Brad was more nervous, especially because when leaning back, his erection was more visible. "Alright, if you say so," Dr. Stevens said, running his wand over Brad and Roy's bare stomachs. "...huh."

"What is it?" Veronica said, leaning to see the ultrasound screen.

"Well it looks like you are both pregnant with twins," Dr. Stevens said. "I've heard about some other doctors in the city seeing pregnant men, but I thought it was just a joke."

"Guess you're right, bro. You weren't getting fat," Veronica chuckled.

"Let's see if you're still laughing when you get an ultrasound and we see how knocked up you are!" Roy said, the shock of learning that he was pregnant making his voice angry.

Veronica got on the examining table after him, Brittany taking Brad's place. Dr. Stevens examined them as well, turning the screens to everyone else.

"Mrs. Dawson, your daughter is also pregnant with twins. But Mrs. Perkins, you're going to be a grandma to triplets." Veronica and Brittany's faces were both masks of astonishment, but underneath hers, Brittany was ecstatic.

Next was Monica and Christine. When they rolled up their shirts, it was clear that they were bigger than any of the other kids. Dr. Stevens had a small grin go across his face as he examined them, his hand brushing against their growing breasts. They passed it off as accidents but looked at each other with surprise. "And you're both carrying quadruplets," Dr. Stevens said. "Although when there's that many, it's also possible that some more could be hiding."

Claire and Elizabeth gulped. If they were even bigger than Christine and Monica...how many could they be carrying? Slowly, they heaved themselves onto the seats, Dr. Stevens' smile getting even bigger, his breast-groping less subtle. But, as he examined them, his lusty smile faded into a perplexed look at the screen.

"I'm having trouble getting an exact number," he said. "There's...a lot here. You're all around four months pregnant, but for you to be this pregnant and not know it until now...I don't understand."

Elizabeth bit her lip and looked at Claire, wanting to reach over and hold her hand. Claire kept looking at Dr. Stevens. "Doctor, you can tell how many there are?"

After a few moments, he sighed. "I think I've got it now. Somehow, you are both...pregnant with eight babies. You're octo-moms."

1321211122111212221112.content:
The car ride back home was quiet. Brittany held her hand over her belly, one of the only women in the car glad to be pregnant, although the additional news that she was going to have triplets was intimidating to say the least. Veronica and her older sisters Monica and Christine were mute, none of them wanting to feel their growing stomachs. Monica and Christine were the closest to "showing," both of them pregnant with quadruplets. By far the most terrified passengers in the van were Roy and Brad, who discovered that they were pregnant men. The fact that most of the car's passengers hadn't had sex in the past four months was the furthest things from their minds.

And despite the talk Claire and Elizabeth both shared about wanting to be pregnant again, neither of them were prepared for the news that they were pregnant with octuplets. As Claire drove, Elizabeth stroked her belly, her face dazed and exhausted. Eight babies. I guess I really will be as big as I was in my dream...my dream with Claire. Claire's eyes were focused on the road and she had no time to stroke her belly, but she was sharing many of Elizabeth's thoughts, including the reminiscing about how sexy their dream was.

"Oh, perfect," Roy said, looking at his phone. "Now it's time for school too."

"No way I'm going to school today," Veronica said, shaking her head quickly.

"Kids, please," Elizabeth said. "Whatever all of this is...it's more important than ever that you get your education. I'm still going to work too, after all."

"Mom, you...you can't go to work with a big belly," Christine protested. "How would you even fit into your work uniform?"

"Don't worry about your mom," Elizabeth said with a forced smile. "Now c'mon, we'll stop by our house quickly so you can get your things and then take you in. I'll write you a note so you're excused for being late."

"Same for you two," Claire said, looking at Brittany and Brad in the rear-view mirror. "You'll do fine at school today. And...I have a feeling you're not the only ones who woke up with a 'surprise' today."

Brittany and Brad nodded as Claire pulled in front of their houses. Elizabeth took a deep breath as she heaved herself out of the car, hand on top of her belly, as she waddled into the house. "Alright, have a good day at school," she said as Roy and Veronica angrily passed her. "You'll both be fine. We'll all be fine."

"Sure, mom," they both grumbled under their breath, getting into Claire's minivan. Claire didn't bother getting out, both because she was driving the kids back anyway and because she'd gotten too big to easy maneuver herself. When the Perkins and Dawson kids, minus Christine and Monica, got into the car, Claire drove off to school.

Elizabeth struggled up the stairs, gripping the handlebar and taking deep breaths. "I don't remember this being so hard last time," she complained. "Then again, this thing grew more slowly," she said, patting her belly, "and I was around 20 years younger."

"Mom? Need help?" Monica and Christine said in unison, looking up the staircase at their swollen-bellied mother. Elizabeth's back was arched strongly, making her belly stick out even further than it already was.

"N-no, I'm fine," Elizabeth smiled, sweat beginning to bead on her forehead. "You both...take care of yourselves."

Her oldest twins shrugged and headed out the door to their own jobs, already changed into some clothing that would conceal their stomachs some more. When they left, Elizabeth let out a groan. "Only a few months left until summer. Why couldn't this have happened in the summer?"

When she was finally at the top of the stairs, Elizabeth waddled into her bedroom, stripping out of the flimsy pajamas she was using to conceal her pregnant body on the trip and looked through her closet at the selection she had available. Thankfully, Claire's fortuitous plan to wear maternity bras was still working out well as Elizabeth's swelling chest was held in place snuggly. Now she just needed something for the rest of her body. The maternity clothes she bought with Claire proved to be too small, but she'd bought a shirt that was close enough to her work uniform: a white collared shirt.

Elizabeth struggled to button up when there was a knock at the door and the sound of the door slowly opening. "Mrs. Dawson?"

Elizabeth waddled out, recognizing the voice. "Bella? Up here, dear."

Bella went up the stairs, her eyes opening wide when she saw Elizabeth, shirt open and belly on display. "Mrs...Dawson?"

"Just call me Elizabeth, sweetie," Elizabeth smiled with a blush. "And yeah...I'm surprised too."

Bella continued to stare before gulping. "Is...the same thing happening to my mom?"

Elizabeth nodded. "And to a lesser extent, your sister and my daughters." She thought it would be a good idea to leave out the "pregnant brother" details for now. "What are you still doing here, Bella?"

"I got dropped off at home but no one was here," Bella said. "Would you...be able to drive me to school?"

Elizabeth chuckled. "Here I thought you were playing hooky. Yes, I can do that, but first, mind helping me button this thing up?" Elizabeth looked down at her bare, smooth belly, pulling her shirt over her bulge with little effect.

"Sure," Bella said hesitantly, walking over to Elizabeth and starting to button the bottom of the shirt across her belly. "It's a pretty tight fit. Does it hurt?"

"No, you're fine," Elizabeth said, her smile getting softer. She was impressed with how well-behaved Claire's daughter was. "I expect this will be pretty tight."

As she worked, Bella's voice cracked some. "I've never...um...felt a pregnant woman's stomach before."

Elizabeth chuckled. "Well, what do you think? And I prefer to call it a belly."

"It's really tight," Bella said, her face getting red hot. "T-there, done."

Elizabeth turned her belly, bumping Bella away, and modeled herself in front of her mirror. Plenty of skin was showing in the space between the buttons but she didn't have much time. If she didn't show up to work soon, she'd be penalized anyway. "Good job, Bella. Now, help a pregnant lady down the stairs and we'll get you to school?"

Bella giggled and nodded, putting her arm around Elizabeth's shoulder and supporting her belly with her other hand as they made it down to Elizabeth's car. She found driving with a big belly took some getting used to, but if Claire could do it, she could do it. Every now at then at a stop, Elizaeth's belly would bump against the steering wheel painfully, but with no other complications, she got Bella to school. "Thank you, Mrs. Da...Elizabeth."

"Anytime, dear," Elizabeth grinned. "Say hi to your mom for me." With that, Elizabeth headed to her restaurant, waddling quickly inside, burning red with embarrassment when Carol saw her. The look on Carol's face was pure evil pleasure.

"Well well well," Carol said, looking Elizabeth over. "Elizabeth, care to explain?"

Elizabeth took a deep sigh. "Well, Mrs. Phillips, as you can see...I'm pregnant."

"Aren't you just," Carol cackled, slapping one hand on top of Elizabeth's belly, rubbing it slowly. "I don't know how you hid this big bulge for so long. Back with that ex-husband of yours or was this a freebie?"

"Aw, leave her alone!" Joann said, waddling up, her own belly bigger since yesterday. Quite a bit bigger. "I don't see you giving me huff for my pregnancy. And besides, you're getting a little wide too. Maybe you're pregnant too."

Carol fumed. "That's enough, Joann. And I'm only bigger because of bloating due to some horrific energy drink I tried yesterday at the mall." Carol gave Elizabeth a stink eye and went back into the kitchen.

"We'll talk later," Joann said, flashing Elizabeth a wink as she went back to take care of some customers. Elizabeth nodded and got out her notepad to start taking customer's orders. She knew telling Carol the added detail of her eight occupants would only make the day worse.

Work was exceedingly difficult with the huge belly, her shirt quickly becoming soaked with sweat from the exhausting of carrying around such a heavy load. Some customers were uncomfortable with her ill-fitting maternity clothes, others seemed very happy to have Elizabeth as their waitress. Toward the end of her shift, Elizabeth was running meals back and forth to a big party, Carol watching intently.

Elizabeth's heart was pounding from the sea of emotions and exhaustion, which set off a reaction: a kick. Which led to another kick, and another, and another. Oh no, Elizabeth thought, reaching down to her belly with one hand while the other hand held a tray of food. But it was no good. A series of strong kicks popped her shirt open, her big bare belly on display. It made Elizabeth let out a yelp and drop the tray, food getting all over the carpet.

"Elizabeth!" Carol yelled. "You're cut for the day! Go home before your water breaks or you start lactating on the food."

"Carol!" Joann yelled back as Elizabeth bit her lip, putting her notepad back and clocking out, storming out to her car, still holding her belly with one hand.

She made it to her car and, after taking a big sigh, began to sob, cradling her belly and feeling the kicking inside. "Oh, I want to be a good mother to all of you but...I'm going to need some help." Only one person came into her mind when she thought about comfort. "Claire..."

13212111221112122211122.content:
Health class started much differently than it had for the rest of the year, as the school's principal, Mrs. Decker, stood in front of the class, armed crossed, face clearly rocked with exhaustion and confusion. Mrs. Decker was about Claire and Elizabeth's age and her body looked it now too. Her crossed arms accentuated her heavy chest that was resting on top and her blouse was tight around her new curves that she hoped the class wouldn't see. "As I'm sure many of you now know," she began with a sigh, "an unsettlingly high number of students have reported discovering that they are pregnant. Many of those students' parents have complained and the school is looking into this issue. We do not believe this is some sort of 'pregnancy pact' like what happened in Texas in 2006 but in the mean time, we feel it would be best to include...sex ed into your health class."

The classroom was full of murmuring, with Roy and Veronica sinking low into their desks, faces turning red. Brittany wondered who else in her class might be pregnant and considered whether she should come forward with the news about her own triplets. Roy and Veronica were fixed on their pregnancies remaining a secret.

"I know that not all of the school is affected, although there have been some reports of some male students discovering that they are pregnant," Mrs. Decker continued. "I have also contacted other schools in the area and it seems that this is not an issue specific to our institution."

"Luckily, none of the boys on our varsity basketball team got this mystery pregnancy and half the team at North Central High had to drop out due to pregnancies, so it looks like we're going to qualify for the national tournament!" Mr. Franklin said triumphantly, getting a few hoots from the classroom.

"Jonathan, please," Mrs. Decker hissed, "I know you didn't get spared, so I don't know what you're cheering about. Behave in front of the students."

Mr. Franklin nodded as Mrs. Decker turned back to the classroom. "Now, because some students are pregnant and others are not, I want to remind everyone that this is not the time for a 'witch hunt' to find out which of your classmates is expectant. We are a united community and that is not appropriate. If anyone has any other questions, you can see me in my office, totally confidentially."

"Why don't you tell them about your three little surprises?" Mr. Franklin mumbled, getting a nasty look from Mrs. Decker in response as she headed out the door. "Alright class, you heard the principal. No talk about bones for the day. We need to talk about birth control. Kat? You gave a little talk yesterday. Why don't you come up here and talk to the class about safe sex?"

The classroom turned to Kat, who had her black and blue hair tied in a tight bun and was huddled close to her desk. "I-I don't have anything prepared, Mr. Franklin."

"Hey, neither do I, but you sounded like you must have at least some good advice. Please come up here, Kat."

She shook her head, getting an annoyed sigh from Mr. Franklin.

"Ms. DeLerro, come present to the class or get detention, your choice."

Shaking with embarrassment, Kat waddled to the front of the classroom, her swollen belly stretching her tiny beige dress to its limits. Her small frame made her belly look even bigger: almost as big as Claire and Elizabeth were this morning.

"L-look," Kat said, her face burning, "it wasn't like this yesterday. I just woke up and...and boom, belly." She looked at Mr. Franklin, who was already on his phone, then back at the class. "But you know what? This is bullshit. I know I'm not the only person here who's pregnant and just because I'm carrying sextuplets doesn't mean I should be singled out as the 'pregnant student.' But if I'm going to be...then I'll make the best of it."

Kat rolled up her shirt as the class gasped, showing off her bare belly. "It looks good, doesn't it? Nice and round, still no stretch marks. It's not really my thing, but I think I look pretty cute, huh?"

"Ms. DeLerro," Mr. Franklin said, rubbing his temples, "you aren't supposed to be encouraging students to be pregnant. You're supposed to be telling them how to prevent it."

"I didn't get this way by having unprotected sex!" Kat snapped back. "The doctor said I'm four months pregnant and I haven't had sex in over a year!"

"No surprise there," one of the students in the scoffed, getting loud laughs from the classroom. Kat's face started to turn red again. Roy blushed as well. He'd always thought that Kat was the only mature, attractive girl in the school but never worked up the courage to say anything to her. Now, he had an opening.

Just as Roy was standing up, Brittany beat him to the punch, getting up in the middle of the desks and yelling at her classmates. "What are you all laughing at her for? Most of you are probably pregnant from this...this mystery pregnancy. And she's the only one brave enough to admit it and show it off." Brittany felt her cheeks getting red, not daring to look over at Kat. "A-and you know what else? I'm also-"

The bell rang and Mr. Franklin let out a long sigh. "Thank God for these health classes being so short," he said to himself quietly. "Alright, I've got to do this whole thing over again for another batch of kids, so everyone out."

Brittany had mixed feelings about whether she should make made her admission to the class or not as everyone filed out, but as Veronica approached her, her neighbor's feelings were clear. "Don't tell anyone," she hissed. "You'll be tormented, just like Kat."

"H-hi, Kat," Roy said, gripping his sweaty palms against his backpack's straps, walking over to the heavily pregnant girl as she got her own backpack together. "You were really...um...um..."

"Can't even think of an insult on the spot?" Kat scoffed, heaving her belly up as she brought her bag up, bumping against her bag. "Try again next time, asshole."

"No, I..." Roy tried to say. "Great," he groaned, walking back with his twin sister and Brittany. "Well this day just keeps getting worse and worse."

"And it's just getting started," Veronica said, patting him on the back. "See you at the end of the day, bro. We'll do something fun after school."

And so the day went on, with all three of the high-school aged Dawson and Perkins children going on different schedules as they went through their classes. The school's history teacher, Mr. Greenly, was open about his pregnancy, thankfully just one, and said while he didn't know how it happened, his partner was happy that it looked like they wouldn't have to wait through the long waiting list for an adoption.

Ms. Tanner, the school literature professor, was sporting a wide, quadruplet bump, trying her best to hide it behind her desk, catching herself when she patted it aimlessly. Ms. Tanner had feathery brown hair and pregnancy made it shine, but anytime she had to move or had her belly impede her teaching in any way, a bright blush spread across her face. Ms. Tanner was single and did not look prepared or excited to be a mother in five months, let alone five days.

But the teacher who stood out the most was Ms. Renee Flora, advanced chemistry. She had always been on the student's top 3 for "hottest teacher" and pregnancy did not slow that down. Ms. Flora was sporting another sextuplet belly, barely contained by her button-up blouse, letting plenty of bare skin and her popped-out belly button be revealed to the whole classroom. Halfway through class, Ms. Flora smiled to the students and stroked her belly.

"I'm sorry, would anyone mind if I undid these buttons? It's a little tight down there?" The class was too stunned to respond and Brittany watched, mouth agape, as her teacher revealed her huge bare belly to the class. "Ooh, that feels nice. And it's just going to keep getting bigger, so either they need to make an octuple-XL shirt that's still cute or I'm going to be showing you all my bare belly a lot more often." The class laughed nervously as Brittany wondered what she would look like with a round belly.

Ms. Flora beamed throughout the rest of the class, looking over the students with her violet eyes from behind her thick-framed glasses, short black bangs having to be brushed out of the way every now and then. "That's all for today," she hummed as the bell got close to ringing. "Oh, and that's the last class for today. Everyone have a good time and be careful out there."

As everyone left, Ms. Flora stopped Brittany. "Ms. Flora?"

"Please, call me Renee," she giggled. "Brittany, your performance on your chemistry tests has been remarkable. You're understanding concepts very quickly."

"T-thanks," Brittany smiled, putting one lock of hair behind her ear. "You're a really good teacher."

Renee chuckled. "Thank you too. I have a little chemistry experiment I'm working on and I am in dire need of a good lab assistant. Mind staying after class to help?"

Brittany thought it over, her eyes constantly going to Renee's belly. "S-sure! Let me just tell my brother."

<go to mall w/o me> she sent to Brad.

<ok. Ill still take roy & veronica?>

<sure> Brittany sent back, turning back to Renee. "Alright, no problem! So, what are we looking at?"

Renee went into her supply closet, filled with all sorts of elements and chemicals that could be hazardous in the wrong hands, and brought out a beaker filled with black liquid. "Have you heard of an energy drink called Xpect?"

132121112211121222111222.content:
Back at the Perkins residence, Claire finally arrived home. She closed the door and walked inside. She sighed, realizing that having eight babies, especially at her age, would be an incredibly difficult task. Oh well. At least I won't be going through this alone. she thought, rubbing her belly as her babies kicked lightly.

Throwing her car keys on the table, she walked upstairs, deciding to get dressed. This was difficult to say the least. As she was in slightly worse shape than Elizabeth, she REALLY struggled to get up the stairs. In fact, halfway up, Claire had to take a seat, as her belly was too much weight. Realizing that she had to make it up somehow, she slowly scooted her slightly larger rear up, step by step, until she finally made it to the top. "This pregnancy's going to suck..." Claire huffed, using her bathrobe to wipe the sweat of her face and enlarged belly.

In her room, Claire removed her bathrobe and donned the maternity wear that she bought yesterday. She knew that she would get much, much bigger, and it would probably be a wise investment to take a trip to Baby Universe to buy some bigger clothes, as the maternity blouse that she bought was already tightly confining her spherical belly.

Remembering that she also had to go to the Book Club with Elizabeth, she figured that she'd have enough time to make a quick stop at the mall. After a prolonged expedition down the stairs, Claire headed out. Suddenly, her phone rang. "Hello?" she asked. "Hey, baby, it's me..."said the voice on the other end, sounding a bit restless. "Brad? Hey, how's your trip going?" Claire asked, wincing slightly as her belly bounced against the steering wheel as she arrived at a stop sign.

"Not...uh...good." he replied. "Really? It sounded like you were having an alright time the other day..." Claire trailed off. "Well, me and everyone else...uh...there's something wrong..."Brad Sr said, clearly worried. "Okay, well let's just say you're gonna have a big surprise when you get ho--wait, sorry Elizabeth's calling. I'll talk to you later." she said.

Claire ended the conversation with Brad, and answered Elizabeth's call. "Elizabeth?" Claire asked, as she could hear crying on the other end. "Claire...I need you to pick me up..." Elizabeth said, her weeping continuing. "Alright, where are you?" Claire asked. "The...Olive...Branch..." Elizabeth cried. Worried, Claire drove off, trying to help her friend.

A few minutes later, Claire arrived at The Olive Branch. She pulled up to Elizabeth's car, and saw that she was inside, head pressed against the steering wheel. Claire honked her horn, as Elizabeth looked over. Claire gestured for her to come. Elizabeth stopped crying, and opened the car door, revealing her bare belly, obviously not contained by her white work shirt. After a waddle, she made it into Claire's car.

"Elizabeth, what happened?" Claire asked. "These stupid babies started kicking so hard that my stupid shirt popped open, and Carol made me leave..." she said, resting her hand on her belly, the occupants shifting in response. "Well, I was just about to go to Baby Universe to get some bigger clothes, do you wanna come with?" Claire asked. "Yeah, sure! Then we can go to the Book Club after!" Elizabeth said, her spirits lightening. Elizabeth was able to button the top few buttons of her shirt again, but this meant that her entire belly would show. Still, it was better than nothing, as Claire drove to the mall.

A short drive later, the two pregnant ladies arrived at their destination. They waddled into the mall, and slowly walked past the health store. Ethan and Kenna were propped outside of the store, still selling the Xpect. Their shirts prominently displayed their bellies, which were exactly the same size as Brad Jr's and Roy's. "Ugh! I can't believe I'm pregnant, with twins for that matter!" Kenna said angrily. "At least you have an excuse for getting fat! Look at me!" Ethan declared, prodding his own swollen stomach. "Uh, Ethan? You MAY want to get that looked at..." Kenna said, stopping as Barbara, their boss, walked by, holstering a box on her large stomach, which was a bit smaller than Claire and Elizabeth's bellies.

"Oh, will you two quit whining? I'm pregnant with quintuplets and you don't see me complaining!" she said, clearly using her stomach as a shelf. The two burn-outs sighed, as they returned to trying to sell Xpect.

Waddling to Baby Universe, they were greeted by the store's owner, who was clearly pregnant. She wore a light purple maternity blouse, and she was about the same size as Claire and Elizabeth, but only because she was a bit further along than them. "Hey, again! Can I interest you two in anything?" she asked. "Actually, we were looking for some maternity clothes." Elizabeth said. "I can see that!" the owner said, staring at her bared belly. "You two look awfully far along to be needing bigger maternity clothes..." she continued.

"Well, we're having multiples." Claire said. "Oh, really? Twins? Triplets? I'm actually five months with quadruplets myself." she said, running her hands over her belly. "Heh, no. We're both having octuplets." said Elizabeth bluntly. The owner stopped rubbing her belly as her eyes widened. "Okay...well we do have some stuff in the multiples section that should work for now..." she answered slowly.

After grabbing a handful of maternity clothes, Claire and Elizabeth waddled to checkout. "Could I interest you in any cribs?" the owner asked. "No, thanks. I didn't bring my credit card, and I think we'll be buying a lot of them..." Claire responded. Making their purchases, the two pregnant mothers exited Baby Universe, and waddled down the mall. Suddenly, their bellies rumbled. "Do you wanna..." Claire began. "I...think that there'll be food at the Book Club. We should just hold off for a little while." Elizabeth said, although she was pretty hungry herself.

Not wanting to waste anymore time, the two waddled back to Claire's car, heading to the Book Club meeting.

1321211122111212221112221.content:
Claire sat the red light, one hand on her belly, the other on the steering wheel. Both of Elizabeth's hands were exploring her roundness. "I don't remember feeling this heavy when I was pregnant before," Elizabeth said. "Even when I was nine months pregnant with twins, my shirts never popped off or felt so tight."

"Maybe it's because our bellies just got so big at once," Claire said, looking over at her friend. "Normally, we...grow, slowly, over 40 weeks. But our stomachs started popping out of us over the course of a few days."

Elizabeth changed her rubbing pattern, just moving her fingertips across her curves. "If we got this big in one day, how much larger do you think we'll be tomorrow?"

Claire shuddered, her dream with Elizabeth with both carrying preposterously large bellies flashing into her mind. "I-I don't want to think about that," Claire said as the light turned. "Do you think our kids are going to get larger along with too?"

Elizabeth sighed, palms resting against both sides of her massive belly. "I hope not, for their sake. I don't know what they're going to do about their pregnancies. I don't even know, really, what I'm going to do about these eight."

"Whatever happens, you'll do a great job raising them," Claire smiled, blushing as she looked over at her friend and neighbor. Elizabeth might say how big and uncomfortable she feels, but pregnancy really agreed with her, Claire thought, biting her lip.

"C-careful," Elizabeth said. Claire realized she'd been gazing at Elizabeth too long and wasn't watching the road. She straightened out and, with Elizabeth's directions, made it to the local library. Waddling inside, the building was surprisingly busy, with men and women complaining to librarians that all of the pregnancy advice books were already checked out. Some people were looking through medical books nervously, others smiling pleasantly as they read through books on cooking and raising families.

"Back here," Elizabeth said, waddling to the conference rooms in the back of the library. As she walked, she had to stretch her back out to relieve her back of some of the pressure and weight of her belly. Doing so made her maternity dress she just bought ride up her skin some, revealing her bare, creamy brown belly. Blushing, Claire waddled quickly over and pulled it back down, her belly rubbing against Elizabeth's as she did so.

"S-sorry, I figured you didn't want-" Claire began.

"No, it was the right call," Elizabeth smiled sweetly, her eyelids narrowing. "Thank you, Claire."

Claire's blush turned even brighter, fanning her face as Elizabeth turned her back to open the doors. "Hi, everyone. I brought a friend along. I hope that's okay."

"Perfectly fine," Jennifer, the librarian leading the discussion, said. The chairs were arraigned in a circle, almost all of the other chairs filled with women: some with big bellies, some with bellies that were just starting to show, and some with no signs of pregnancy at all. Although that last group was definitely in the minority. Jennifer was a tall woman, around Claire and Elizabeth's age, with her light brown hair tied up in a messy bun, with thin glasses, a long black dress, and a beige blouse that was containing the beginnings of her belly but not doing a good job of hiding her size. "Nice to meet you..."

"Claire," Claire said, nodding politely as Elizabeth waddled to an available seat next to another familiar face.

"Glad you could make it, hon," Joann smiled. Her belly had grown dramatically since Elizabeth last saw her, looking only a few inches in circumference smaller than Elizabeth and her black top only accentuated her size, both of her belly and her breasts, which had always been on the large side. "Hi, I'm Joann. I work with Elizabeth," she said, reaching a hand out to Claire, who sat beside Elizabeth.

"Nice to meet you," Claire smiled, shaking Joann's hand, turning to the women next to her. "Hello, nice to meet you too."

"I suppose we should do introductions," Jennifer said. "I'm Jennifer, head of community outreach programs at the library."

"Tell us about your pregnancy," another woman, a middle-eastern woman with scruffy, short black hair, a green top, jeans, and a prominent belly said. "Since most of us are pregnant, we might as well include those details along with our introductions."

The women chuckled and Jennifer nodded. "Good point, Asma. In that case, I'm Jennifer, and I'm four months pregnant with twins. Next?"

Beside her was a young black woman with a tight afro with a long blue dress and a sweater over top. "I'm Rachel, a student at the state college and thankfully, I'm not pregnant," she said with a chuckle. "No offense."

Next was Joann. "Hey y'all, I'm Joann, I'm a waitress and hostess alongside this sexy mom-to-be," she said, patting Elizabeth on the shoulder. "And I'm five months pregnant with triplets."

Elizabeth smiled and went next. "I'm Elizabeth, a waitress, and I'm four months pregnant with...octuplets." The room gasped as Elizabeth hung her head, blushing as she rubbed her hugeness.

"I-I'm Claire...stay at home mom...also pregnant with eight." Claire said, blushing as well, reaching over one hand to Elizabeth's knee, patting her gently. Elizabeth sat up quickly at her pat, gulping as she looked over at her friend, wishing she'd touch her leg a little further down.

"I guess we're next," the woman next to Claire said. "I'm Tina-"

"-and I'm her wife, Joselyn," the woman next to her said with a smile, putting a hand on her belly. Tina was a tiny, pale woman, with rosy red lips and brilliant blue eyes, all wrapped up in a plain outfit of a blue-and-white striped shirt and jeans. Joselyn was a South-East Asian woman, with a big smile and a big leather jacket over her t-shirt. "And we're both four months pregnant with quadruplets."

"How is it being in a relationship when you're both pregnant?" Joann asked with a curious smile.

Joselyn giggled. "Well...the big bellies just started this morning, so we don't quite know yet," she said, turning to her wife and taking her cheek in her hands. "But we're both looking forward to finding out." Claire and Elizabeth looked away awkwardly, both blushing, wondering how they would be in bed, their octuplet bellies bumping against one another as they come together...

"I'm Taylor," the next woman said, ignoring Tina and Joselyn as they nuzzled noses. "I'm a teacher and as you can see-" she said, lifting her shirt and patting her six-pack abs, "not pregnant."

"Hey, a few days ago, I didn't think I was pregnant either," Asma smiled. "Be careful. As Tina and Joselyn show, it can happen to anybody." Rachel shuddered on the other side of the room. "I'm Asma. I'm a writer, a socialite, a comedian, an actress, all kinds of things. And hopefully these three babies won't slow that down too much," she said, patting her belly. "Only four months in."

"Great introductions," Jennifer smiled. "Hope that makes you feel more at home, Claire."

"It's nice to have other expectant women around," Claire smiled back weakly. If I wanted to be around other pregnant people, I guess I could just go home to my kids.

"And it's also nice to have us...update one another on our pregnancies. I know there have been some changes and they have come as a surprise to some of us, but having this room of support is a nice way to overcome that. And Claire, I hope you'll be a part of our support group now too."

"Thank you," Claire smiled, looking over at Elizabeth. "And thank you for taking me here."

"Of course," Elizabeth replied quietly. "You're my support group, after all." The two blushed and smiled a little as Jennifer got out the book for them to discuss.

Claire was a little out of the loop for the discussion, having not read whatever Victorian era romance they were discussing, but she watched Elizabeth intently during the session. Every time Elizabeth opened her mouth, she sounded so smart and incredible and...beautiful. Claire always knew Elizabeth was beautiful, but this felt different. It had felt different for a few days now.

Elizabeth was aware of Claire's stares, but didn't know how to interpret them. Did Claire think she was being too talky? Too pretentious? Stuck-up? Elizabeth felt her face getting red and wasn't sure if it was just exhaustion from carrying a heavy pregnancy. Why did she care so much what Claire thought about her? She knew she was a good friend but...she wanted to know if Claire thought more about her.

When an hour had passed, the room was filling with grumbling sounds. Joann rubbed her belly with a chuckle. "Sounds like my pups are getting hungry and so is their momma. Good stopping place."

"I agree," Jennifer said with a smile, scooting her chair back to get up. "Same time next week, ladies?"

"If we don't go into labor before then," Joselyn chuckled. "Hungry, babe?"

Tina nodded. "You know I'm not a big eater, but..."

Joselyn kissed her on the cheek. "You pregnant chicks are so cute. C'mon, let's eat out tonight."

Claire stroked her belly as Elizabeth bent down to get her purse, looking up at Claire's hugeness as she did so, loving the view more than she expected. "S-so...what are you going to do for food?"

"Just dinner with the kids. We haven't had a family meal in a while," Claire nodded.

Elizabeth stood up slowly, her belly brushing against Claire's. "M-maybe we can all have dinner together at your house? Both families?"

Claire blushed. "S-sure, that sounds great."

Elizabeth smiled and waddled back to the parking lot. Her shirt had risen up again but Claire didn't say anything, deciding to enjoy the view instead.

"I can't believe how hungry I feel," Claire groaned as she waddled around her kitchen, getting food out of the fridge and making a small mountain on the counter. Elizabeth chuckled and took some of Claire's pans and started the oven up.

"Then we'd better get started quickly. We can do more with the two of us," Elizabeth smiled. Their bellies forced them closer together in the already-cramped kitchen and they each secretly hoped and feared they would accidentally bump hips. The doorbell rang as they worked and Brad opened the door to let Monica and Christine inside.

"Where's Brittany?" Veronica asked, walking into the room to see her older sisters coming inside..

"She's said she'll be at school late," Brad said, blushing as he watched Monica and Christine come inside, their bellies beginning to show. "H-how are you two?"

"Fine," they said in unison. "You don't have a gaming console, do you?" Christine asked, turning around.

"No, sorry," Brad said. "I guess we never got that into video games." Like their mother, Christine and Monica were incredible attractive, distant eyes behind long lashes as their full lips were pursed just enough. Their bellies were totally covered for now, but underneath, Brad could have seen the same smooth, mocha skin their mother had. Brad had always been attracted to them, but until they started sporting pregnant bellies, he hadn't given a relationship with either of them more than a second thought.

"Speak for yourself," Bella grumbled, walking into the kitchen and sitting in one of the couches. "You're always more interested in playing sports and Brittany just into weird stuff."

"You play a lot of sports?" Monica asked, turning to Brad.

"You like video games too?" Christine asked, turning to Bella.

"Y-yeah," Brad said with a nervous smile. "I've seen you go running around the neighborhood a lot...n-not that I watch you or anything." He gulped and tried to recover. "Do you do any sports?"

"Swimming in high school, but you know, it was just to get class credit and stay in shape," Monica said, hand over her belly. "That's all out the window now, I guess."

"You still look great," Brad said. Bella turned and gave her brother a "what the hell" look as Monica chuckled. "I mean...it's clear that you take care of yourself, even if you're...we're...pregnant."

"Well...thanks," Monica smiled, trying to stifle her laugher as she turned back to Christine and Bella.

"You'd love the game mechanics," Christine was telling Bella. "And what's cool is Dark Souls has a semi-interactive story that you can explore or ignore depending on your preferences. Come over whenever and we can play."

"You sure?" Bella said. "Aren't you both kind of busy with...your babies?"

"UGH don't say babies," Veronica said on the other end of the living room, flipping through her cellphone. "Twins...and you're both having quadruplets...and Mom's having fucking octuplets!"

"Don't get upset now," Elizabeth said from the kitchen, turning slightly to look at her kids. "We're all going to be okay, right? We're tough."

"Yeah, yeah," Roy said, hands on his temples on the chair next to Veronica. "Learning I'm a pregnant man is a little more stress than I'm used to, Mom."

"You're not the only one," Brad said slowly, resisting the urge to feel his slowly going belly. Walking around the mall with Veronica and Roy ended up being a terrible idea for Brad. They fought all the time, the news about their pregnancies made them both even antsier, and the mall's maternity clothing store attracted huge crowds that made it even harder to walk around.

"It'll be nice to know my brother is going through the same thing as me," Christine smiled sarcastically, looking at Roy. He rolled his eyes, crossing his arms.

"I'm not going running with you two," Roy protested. "No matter how many times you ask. If you'd just eat the right food like I do, you wouldn't need to exercise as much."

"I don't know if bull penis counts as 'the right food,'" Veronica chuckled.

As Roy started yelling about the importance of trying diverse meals, Monica turned to Brad. "Maybe you'd like to try running with us? We're in a similar boat, right?" Monica ran her hand down her belly.

"S-sure," Brad smiled ear-to-ear. "I haven't really...gone on a run in a while, but I'm sure I'll be able to get back into it easily."

"Glad to hear it," Monica chuckled.

As the families laughed and argued, Ms. Flora's car pulled in front of the Perkins house, Ms. Flora leaning back and letting out a long sigh when she went into park, rubbing her belly. "This is you, right?"

"Mmhmm," Brittany nodded, looking between Ms. Flora and her belly. "Thank you for including me in your research...Renee."

Ms. Flora grinned. "Oh please, thank you. You're a very talented chemistry student and I made a lot of progress on my research with your help. This Xpect drink...there's something not quite right about it."

"Yeah, it was the weirdest compound I've ever seen," Brittany nodded. Ms. Flora bit her lip as she looked at the can of Xpect in her car and turned to Brittany.

"Can I give you a very un-scientific theory to see what you think?" Ms. Flora asked.

"Sure," Brittany said. "I've been afraid of being un-scientific around you."

"I think this drink might be making people pregnant. Men and women too," Ms. Flora said. "I don't really know how, but our research today makes me more suspicious." Seeing Brittany's concerned face, Ms. Flora gave a little laugh. "But let's not get too worried about that right now. I'll see you in class tomorrow, Brittany."

"See you, Renee," Brittany smiled, getting out of the car, waving as she drove off. Hope I get some extra credit out of this...not that I minded spending time with her. Walking inside her family house, she was greeted with a wall of noise and aromas.

"Dinner's ready, everyone," Claire said, smiling when Brittany walked in. "Ah, perfect timing. Staying at school wasn't too painful, I hope."

"No, it was great," Brittany smiled, strangely proud that her mother had a bigger pregnant belly than Ms. Flora. "I was doing some independent research with one of my science teachers."

"My little doctor," Claire smiled, giving Brittany a hug as she waddled to the kitchen table, much larger than usual. "Alright, I cooked based on how hungry I feel, so hopefully there's going to be enough to eat." There was barely any free space on the table with the amount of food laid out.

"I know a lot of you feel hungry, but the thing about being pregnant is...cravings and hunger aren't the same thing," Elizabeth said to the rest of the table. "Although when you carry triplets or more...it can be a little different."

"Great," Monica and Christine said in unison, putting big portions on their plates. Dinner went off as one would expect: Roy and Veronica argued over portions, Brad awkwardly chatted with Monica, Christine and Bella talked about video games, Brittany made pleasant chat with anyone who would listen, and Claire and Elizabeth talked so shyly, an outsider might think they were flirting.

As dinner wound down and there was thankfully plenty of leftovers for the next few days, the family began to split between the two houses. Brittany went to her room, rolling up her shirt and admiring her belly, as small as it was, in the mirror. Veronica and Roy hurried back home, trying to get their minds off their pregnancies. Christine took Bella over to the Dawson house to play video games. As Monica was about to join them, Brad went up to her.

"H-hey, do you want to maybe...go for a walk and keep chatting?" Brad asked.

"What do you mean?" Monica smiled, raising an eyebrow.

"Sorry, you're right, that's weird," Brad said. "I...I'll see you tomorrow."

"Oh...okay!" Monica said, following Christine out the door.

That left Claire and Elizabeth do to the dishes, groaning as they moved their bellies around. "Getting heavy?" Elizabeth asked.

"I guess they're settling in, but not where I want them too," Claire sighed. "You?"

"Like a bowling ball in here," Elizabeth chuckled. "Can't wait to see what it'll be like in the morning, the way things have been going."

Claire blushed. That's right: each night she woke up even bigger...would that happen again? When the dishes were finally done, Claire gave Elizabeth what she thought was a goodbye hug. "Alright, I'll see you tomorrow."

"Claire? Actually, I have a...request," Elizabeth said. "See, I was with my ex the last times I was pregnant and I've never been pregnant...alone."

"Yeah, same here," Claire sighed, rubbing her belly. "Are you suggesting we..."

"Share a bed," Elizabeth nodded with a nervous smile. "You know...for the night. Just to get me comfortable again."

"Y-yeah, I'd like that too," Claire smiled. Their bellies were inches away as their faces got redder and redder. "W-well...feel like going to bed now?"

Elizabeth nodded with a shy smile. They brushed their teeth washed up and after hesitating, stripped down to their maternity underwear as they got into bed, face-to-face, bellies touching. "G-goodnight, Elizabeth."

"Goodnight, Claire," Elizabeth smiled, closing her eyes as she slowly put her hand over Claire's.

132121112211121222111222111.content:
As Claire slept, she dreamed she was sitting in a pool. No, she wasn't sitting. She was resting against the edge, letting her body float as best it could with her enormous belly as she pushed and panted. Claire was totally naked, her belly unbelievably large and tight as she pushed, the sounds of encouragement slowly growing around her until they were so loud, she didn't know how she missed them in the first place. Brad and Brittany were on one side of her, coaching their mother.

"C'mon Mom, you're almost there," Brad said.

"Baby #1 is close to crowning," Brittany smiled. "Only seven more to go."

On Claire's other side, all of Elizabeth's children were giving her the same encouragement. Christine and Monica were massaging Claire's shoulders and Roy and Veronica held her hands.

"Squeeze, Mom. Get it all out," Veronica said.

"Mom?" Claire said in a daze, her body exhausted. "I'm not your mom."

"We're both their moms now," Elizabeth said, swimming toward Claire, her belly just as big. Elizabeth traced a wet hand over Claire's massive, smooth middle. "I'm here for you, Claire. Push before I go into labor too. I feel it coming on soon."

Claire nodded and grit her teeth, getting ready for one big push when another voice came from somewhere in the void of her dreamspace. "Claire? Claire?"

Brad Sr. rushed in, looking Claire in the eye. "B-Brad? Why are you here?" Claire mumbled.

"Claire? How could you do this to me? What about our children?"

"What do you mean?" Claire said, patting her enormous belly. "Our children are right here."

"What about these children?" Brad Sr. said, revealing his own belly to Claire.

Claire jolted awake, a cold sweat all over her body as she panted quickly. Her dreams were getting stranger and stranger, but Claire knew she couldn't just ignore them anymore. A few days ago, she dreamed that she and Elizabeth would be hugely pregnant and now, well...Claire put her hands on her own belly, nearly twice as large as it had been yesterday when she looked about eight months pregnant.

"Uh, Claire?" Elizabeth's voice said. Claire was still a bit foggy from sleep and the bedroom was dark.

"Yes, Elizabeth?" Claire said sweetly, imagining the caring Elizabeth from her dream.

"You're...pushing me off the bed." Claire blinked her eyes a few time to see that Elizabeth was on the edge of the bed, Claire's belly pushing her away. Elizabeth had grown, just as Claire had, to enormous proportions and the bed that once held Claire and her husband with room to spare was too small for the two pregnant friends.

"Sorry, sorry!" Claire said, shifting awkwardly to get her belly away from Elizabeth's and to reach out to pull her friend back onto the bed. "I guess our hypotheses that we'd get better ended up being..."

"Exactly right," Elizabeth sighed with a smile, heaving her swollen body up to sit up in bed next to Claire. "I've never been pregnant with octuplets before, but I feel like this is not how it's supposed to go."

"I agree," Claire sighed, rubbing her belly alongside Elizabeth's, looking between the two of theirs. She still couldn't help feeling that Elizabeth looked much better pregnant than she did. She was taller, smoother, tighter; all-around sexier. Elizabeth, on the other hand, looked over Claire's pregnant body, finding her friend as caring and beautiful as she was in Elizabeth's recent pregnant dreams. Elizabeth had been alone for a long time and having someone like Claire with her during this trying time was...nice.

"Having someone in bed with me, even if it was just a friend, was..." Elizabeth began, turning to face Claire.

"Y-yeah," Claire said, blushing as she got closer to Elizabeth as well. "It was...special."

As their faces got closer and their minds went blank, the bedroom door opened with a slam. "Mom! It...it got bigger again!" Brittany said, belly jutting out of her pajamas. "O-oh, sorry...I didn't know Elizabeth was-"

"It's fine," Claire smiled, moving slowly to get off of the bed. "You're not the only one who got bigger."

Brittany looked over Claire and Elizabeth with shocked looks. It was surprising enough that the two women woke up sporting massive pregnant bellies yesterday, but now they each looked like they were carrying a beach ball in their wombs. "Mom...what is going on?" Brittany said, giving Claire a frightened hug."

"I don't know, sweetie, but we'll be okay," Claire said, petting Brittany's hair.

"What's all the-" Brad Jr. said, rubbing his eyes and walking into the bedroom, where he was greeted by the half-naked, enormously pregnant body of Elizabeth Dawson.

Elizabeth smiled and gave Brad a little wave. "It happened again, it seems."

Brad's eyes moved from Elizabeth's belly to her heaving chest to her face right back to her belly a few dozen times before he responded. "Y-yeah, I guess so." He gulped. "How many more times do you think it'll happen?"

"Don't know," Claire sighed, releasing her hug with her daughter to stroke her belly. "Maybe it'll continue until we're 'full term,' maybe we'll just keep getting more and more pregnant forever. I don't think this there's any precedence for this sort of thing."

"Well one thing's for sure," Elizabeth chuckled, hands on her belly. "We're definitely pregnant." She reached over to Claire and took her hand, pressing it against the side of her belly. "Do you feel it?"

Claire gasped, face turning red. "Kicking. Lots and lots of kicking and moving."

"Eight little Dawsons," Elizabeth said, shaking her head and laughing quietly. "It's really happening."

Brad felt his head about to explode. Both of them. He rushed back to his room and closed the door, taking in deep breaths. His fetish for pregnant women was starting to be a blessing and a curse. His mind was racing, his heart was pounding, and all he wanted to do was run back out and wrap his arms around Elizabeth. But if she's bigger...so are Monica and Christine! Brad thought, which only moved his mind from Elizabeth to some other women. And at that moment, Brad grabbed his box of tissues and headed for the bathroom.


The kitchen was unusually peppy, given the current events, as Claire, her kids, and Elizabeth ate breakfast.

"Please, you didn't have to make me breakfast," Elizabeth said.

"You're a friend and a guest in the house. Besides, you need something to eat before you go to work," Claire said. Elizabeth could still fit into her work pants, but she had to make the decision to open up the bottom half of her shirt to let her belly out. Carol and the customers were just going to have to deal with it.

"I can drive you to your restaurant," Brad said, Bella between him and Elizabeth.

"Thank you, dear," Elizabeth smiled sweetly, which only made Brad's heart beat faster.

"Shouldn't you all be going to the doctor again?" Bella said. "This can't be normal."

"Well, it isn't," Claire nodded. "But something like this...I don't know if the doctor can help. We'll wait and see."

"This is crazy," Bella repeated to herself, again and again.

"So are we...due soon?" Brittany asked, one hand on her belly as she ate her toast and eggs. She now looked full-term with one baby. "I feel so big and tight. Any more and I feel like I'll burst."

"Believe me, that's how I felt with all three of you when I was only seven months pregnant," Claire laughed, shaking her head. "And according to the doctor, you're carrying triplets, so I think you still have a ways to go. Besides," Claire said, taking a step back and looking down at her own bare belly, apron clumsily resting on top, "clearly, it's possible to get bigger."

1321211122111212221112221112.content:
Since Brad was busy taking Elizabeth to work, Roy, Veronica and Brittany headed to school together. They headed to health class, where Principal Decker was waiting. The three pregnant teens took a seat.

Roy looked over at Kat, and though it was clear that she was much larger, it was evident that she had given up trying to look presentable. She wore sweatpants and a t-shirt that was much to small for her gargantuan belly. In addition, her hair was a mess. Kat was face-first in food, obviously making the most of the snack machine.

"Alright, class. I know that I'm not a teacher, but since Mr. Franklin here knows next to nothing about pregnancy, I have decided to teach the class for the time being." Principal Decker said, hand wrapping the underside of her belly that was protruding from her blouse.

Mr. Franklin stood at the back of the room and scoffed, his arms crossed over his belly, which was just beginning to show. "On a side note, Mr. Franklin is just having one baby, lucky for him, but I am having triplets. I know that there are some students that are expecting more, so I will not force you all to reveal the number of babies you are having." she smiled reassuringly. She then turned on the projector.

Throughout the class, a documentary on pregnancy played. While most of the class watched with dull interest, Brittany was extremely interested. Her eyes were glued to the bellies displayed on screen. Towards the end of the video, she felt a light fluttering coming from her belly. She gasped, and her hand immediately shot to her rounding midsection. She felt around for more movement, but it had passed. Suddenly, the bell rang, and the the class heaved themselves from their chairs.

Well, all but Kat. She tried and tried, but it had appeared that her belly had gotten stuck. Roy noticed this, and approached her. "Do you need help?" he asked as politely as he could, but he had to admit that it was pretty comical. "I...yeah. Please." Kat replied. Roy grabbed her arm, and pulled her up, surprised at how much she weighed. After a strong tug, he was able to get her free. "Whew, thank you..."she trailed, forgetting his name. "Roy..."he finished. "Roy. Right, thanks. I guess you're my knight in shining armor. So that makes me you're disgustingly pregnant damsel in distress." she smirked, giving her belly a light slap for emphasis.

"Well, it could be worse. My mom is having octuplets." he noted. "Oh, wow. That's...wow..." Kat said. "Hey, I know I just met you and all but...do you wanna...get dinner tonight?" she asked. Roy gasped. He was shocked that she was relatively interested in him. "Yeah, sure..." he replied. "And I know that I'll probably rack up the dinner bill because I'm eating for seven and all, but I can pay for it." she said. "No. No, no, no. I'll pay for it for sure." Roy answered. "You'd really do that?" she asked, wincing slightly as she felt a particularly strong kick. "Anything for my damsel in distress." he joked.

"Great. It'll be nice to talk to someone who isn't pregnant." she smiled as she waddled out of the classroom. Roy frowned, finding it odd that she didn't realize that he was pregnant as well. It was true that he was much smaller than Kat, but he had a decent sized belly. He left the classroom, happy that he was getting somewhere with Kat.

All of the classes were much more different now, as they all became pregnancy related. In history class, Mr. Greenly discussed the history of abnormal pregnancies, from immaculate conceptions to supposed alien abductions. Throughout the class, Mr. Greenly rubbed his small bump, as it was clear that he was happy with his pregnancy.

Ms. Tanner was a different story. The class was ordered to read "What to Expect When You're Expecting", which angered her, as she thought it was a waste of time. As she passed the books out, her large quadruplet filled belly bumped into desks, knocking over classroom items. Frustrated, she took a seat. Since she was still unaccustomed to her belly, it was propped awkwardly on top of her desk. She groaned, and rolled her chair backwards, as her belly plopped on her lap heavily.

Since advanced chemistry was completely unrelated to pregnancy, Ms. Flora was able to continue with her lesson plan. She wore a blouse, only buttoned over her breasts, leaving her sextuplet belly exposed, popped-out navel and all. Ms. Flora was busy discussing ionic and covalent bonds, when her stomach released a massive growl. "Ooh! Short little biology lesson," she said as she waddled to her desk,"the more pregnant you are, the more hungry you get." she said. Ms. Flora grabbed some food and began to eat, taking the rest of the class to eat. As the bell rang, Brittany approached Ms. Flora, who was finishing her meal.

"Hello, Brittany. I've done some more research on the Xpect..."she trailed. "And?" Brittany asked, placing a hand on her own large belly. "Somehow, someway, it's made everyone who drinks it pregnant." she answered. "Just like you thought..."Brittany noted. "Exactly! I'll need to do a little more research on it do determine HOW it works, however." she replied.

Brittany stared at Ms. Flora's large belly, as she watched the visible kicks and punches roll across the surface of her skin. A particularly strong kick forced her to let out a grunt. "Ugh! These babies are gonna be soccer players!" she giggled. "Wanna feel?" she asked. "Sure..." Brittany replied, not wanting to sound too excited. Brittany thought it was incredible, feeling every kick. "Have you felt any movement yet?" Ms. Flora asked. "No, not yet. Soon I hope." she said, rubbing her belly. "Alright, I think I should get back to my research. I'll call you if there's anything significant in my findings." Ms. Flora said. "Alright. See you...Renee." she replied.

With that, Brittany waddled ever so slightly out of the school, catching up with Roy and Veronica.

141.content:
Russia...

Becky Banks, 30, was due to start filming later this week on an artistic film. It was a sophisticated movie about integrity, and managing one's life in the face of economic turmoil and war. She was going to be playing one of the principle roles, a pregnant woman in charge of a vast enterprise on the brink of collapse. Her conflict with an aspiring entrepreneur and businessman was crucial to the movie, and she was eager to play the part.

What she was doing now was nothing like that. Her agent had booked a commercial in the same area, in the same week as shoots for the movie began. It wasn't a company that Becky knew. It was called Yaral Industries, and they weren't making a great impression. Few of the people on location seemed to know how to speak her language. The few that did were giving her directions for the commercial, but they knew nothing about directing.

Becky was standing in front of a giant green screen, with nothing but a tall stand beside her. She preferred actual sets, but she was patient. On the stand was a can of the energy drink, Xpect, that was being sold. She knew nothing about the product, who it was marketed to, or what it really tasted like. She didn't think that it was for her, in any case. She tried to hold back her comments to the director.

The paycheck was inordinate; that was the only reason that Becky was willing to take such an easy job. She preferred artistic and effortful productions.

"Now, Mrs. Banks, we are going to do the taste shots. After that, we'll be done."

Becky was ready. On cue, she gave her line, "Xpect, fills you with life," in Russian, and drank from the lukewarm can beside her. She immediately convulsed. The taste was horrendous, but she swallowed what she could. "What the hell is this stuff?" she cried.

"Cut. Mrs. Banks, let's keep going until we get the shot," said the director.

She grumbled. Maybe this isn't worth it, she thought. Nonetheless, she kept going. When one can was done, they brought out another. Then another. As the director said, they went through as many cans as they needed to get the best reaction shot. Becky, for her part, put on a masterful performance.

"I'm never doing a job for this company again," she texted to her agent. The day had finished, and Becky Banks finally returned to her hotel. When she got home, she vomited in the bathroom.

"I have never tasted anything so foul," she growled. "The things I have to do." She decided that she would need to reevaluate her relationship with her agent. Finally calming down, she looked around the hotel for her husband, who was still out. He loved to sight see, but she hated when he went without him. Not that she had the same appreciation for architecture; she just didn't like her husband to be away for too long. The perils of the industry, and whatnot.

Her husband's name was Arthur, and he was a great actor in spite of himself. Arthur didn't like the entertainment industry, but he had a natural talent. She didn't know exactly what kept him working as an actor if he didn't like it, but any time she asked he was quick to brush it off. Something just compelled him, she decided. He was that kind of person.

Disgusted with herself, and eager to take a break the next day, Becky put on some music and went to bed. The beginning shoots for the movie were a few days away.
