143.content:
Monica Raymond traversed the bustling city street, making her way to EnerG Tower. She was EnerG's CEO, and took great pride in the company, which specialized in energy drinks. She entered the building and greeted the receptionist. "Good morning, Kathy!" she beamed. "Good morning, Mrs. Raymond." the receptionist replied.

Monica got in the elevator and went to the top floor, where her office and her employees worked. Once she reached the top floor, she was greeted by her assistant, Todd. "Good morning, Mrs. Raymond. I hope you slept well." he said, hurrying behind her. "Indeed I did." she replied. "By the way, congrats on the anniversary tonight! What's it been, like ten years?" he asked.

"Ten best years of my life." Monica responded, brushing her auburn hair back. "So do you and Andy have any special plans for tonight?" Todd asked. "Well, we're going out to dinner, to the restaurant that he took me on our first date, and then I'm sure that will lead to a little somethin' somethin'..." she said, winking to Todd.

Todd frowned at this remark. "Right. I guess one of the upsides to being infertile is that you don't have to hire a babysitter, right?" he joked. "I guess so. You know, I always wanted to be a mother, but I gotta admit it's fun not being on the pill and being able to only be responsible for yourself. And I don't even know if I'd want to get pregnant now. I mean, getting big and fat? Stretchmarks? Yuck, am I right?" she said.

"Yep. I mean, it's not like I'd ever get pregnant. Cause, ya know, I'm a guy." Todd said. "Wait, aren't you gay?" she asked. "Yeah, but I can't get pregnant just because I'm gay. You do know that, right?" he asked. "What? Yeah, uh, of course. Duh. What do I look like, a friggin' idiot or something?" she asked, sitting down at her desk. Guess I can't believe everything I see on Facebook these days. she thought.

"Of course not, Monica. So just to let you know, you have a meeting in half an hour." Todd said. "Great! Thanks for letting me know." Monica said, as a female coworker walked in. "Hello, Mrs. Raymond. I was working on two new flavors for EnerG and I was going to decide on one. Which one do you think we should go through with? Fruit punch or chocolate?" she asked.

Monica looked her over. The employee's name was Jodie, and she just became a full-time employee after being a temp. She had just graduated college a few years ago, and was known as the office ditz, often dumbfounding the rest of the office with her thoughts. "Oh, fruit punch, definitely. What was the other flavor? Chocolate? That sounds disgusting! Nobody would drink that!" Monica said. "Sorry! I just had chocolate milk and it tasted good." she noted.

With that, Monica walked to the conference room, and was greeted by a handful of the more valuable employees. This included Charles, a balding middle-aged man, Tiffany, a woman in her early 60s, Danny, a man Monica's age, and Penny, Danny's wife. After conversing with one another for a few minutes, they began their conference all with EnerG's stockholders, which was done over the phone.

"So, Mrs. Raymond, we're sorry to say this, but the numbers have been steadily decreasing over the past few months." said one stockholder. "Well, we're in a bit of a rut, I'll admit, but we're confident that we can and will bounce back." Monica said reassuringly. "Mrs. Raymond, empty promises mean little to us at this point. If we don't see positive changes, and fast, we'll force you out of the company." said the stockholder.

Monica gulped. "Well, do you have any suggestions on how we can improve?" she asked. "Most of the energy drink market is riddled with the same old flavors. It would be beneficial to add new, exciting flavors to the market, like chocolate, for instance." the stockholder said. Damn it, Jodie was right. she thought.

"Alright, well thanks for letting us know how you feel." said Monica. "No problem. We'll talk in a couple of days, and hopefully by then you've turned things around." said the stockholder. The meeting concluded, and they left the conference room, to see a brunette woman she had never seen before, standing next to a couple dozen cans of an energy drink she had never seen before.

"What's the meaning of this?" Monica asked. "Hi! I'm here to promote the newest product from Yaral Industries called Xpect! And we want you all to try it!" the representative said. "Yaral Industries? Where the hell are you from?" she asked. "Right now, Yaral Industries is located right across the street." she said.

The employees looked out the window, and sure enough there was a tower with Yaral Industries' name on it. "Funny. This is the first time I've seen that building." Monica noted. "Well, we're here to stay! After years doing business in exotic locations such as Canada, we've decided to expand to the wonderful land of America, starting right here in New York City!" she beamed.

"Alrighty then. Thanks for the introduction. So why are you here again?" Monica asked. "We realize that you are now our rivals, but we wanted to show respect by giving you Xpect for free! Try some!" she said, handing it out to everyone in the office.

They all took a sip. Shortly after, they all either bolted to the bathroom or to a trashcan, violently vomiting. When they returned, they found that the representative was gone. "Ugh, they probably made us sick on purpose. Some respect they're showing there..." Monica said, wiping her mouth.

"Well, at least EnerG tastes better than Xpect..." Todd said. "That's right. Small victories, everyone. Small victories." Monica replied.

Monica paced around the boardroom, her belly bumping against the back of one of the chairs surrounding the boardroom table. "Sorry!" Danny said, scooting his chair further into the table as much as he could with his own pregnant girth in the way.

"It's fine," Monica said in a distracted voice, eyes focused on the charts projected on the end of the boardroom. Stock was plummeting quickly and Yaral Industries were on the cusp of a sudden, aggressive takeover.

"You should be more careful," Penny said quietly, looking at Monica's enormous pregnant belly with concern. "At this rate, a bump like that could send you into labor."

"That's how you can go into labor early?" Jodie said, pushing away from the table and waddling over to Monica, hands on her own huge belly, nearly as big as Monica's. Jodie was wearing clothes from before she got pregnant and let her bare belly press and bump against Monica's. "It feels like I've been pregnant for-evah! I can't wait to meet my babies the sooner the better."

"Jodie," Todd said, eyeing the young employee from across the room. Jodie blushed slightly and waddled back to her seat, heaving and struggling to sit back down. These chairs and this table was clearly not designed for a pregnant woman, let alone an entire board of pregnant employees. "Monica, you need to stop pacing. You're stressing yourself out."

"There's reason to stress," Monica said, rubbing her belly rhythmically as she felt her numerous unborn children kicking inside her.

"You know what Andy would say," Todd said, giving his boss a caring look. "He'd say worrying so much isn't good for-"

"I know!" Monica barked, groaning as one of her babies gave her a sharp kick in the bladder, causing her to double over. Then, a light noise came from the computer projecting in the board room. "Oh no," Monica gasped.

"It's...it's happened," Charles said, looking at the screen. "Yaral Industries now officially owns EnerG."

"That's now why I said 'Oh no,'" Monica said. "My water just broke."

"It worked!" Jodie said excitedly, hopping out of her seat before bending over and groaning too. "Ooh...this doesn't feel as fun as I expected."

"Did someone say Xpect?" a silky voice said. The brunette who first came to the office to tell everyone about Xpect walked into the boardroom, a smile on her face that was almost as wide as her midsection. She, like everyone else in the room (and many other people in the city) was immensely pregnant, and like Jodie, didn't hide it.

"Y-you," Monica growled, clutching her own belly.

"Don't worry, everything is going to be alright," the brunette smiled, taking Monica by the hand and walking her out of the boardroom. "You can trust us. And now that we're working together, don't forget the Xpect slogan everyone: Xpect fills you with life."

Monica bolted awake in bed, her mind a fuzzy blur of what she just experienced in her dream. Like with any dream, the images themselves faded away quickly, but she was left with one clear impression: she had been pregnant.

Pregnancy dreams weren't uncommon for Monica. When she first learned that a developmental disorder in her ovaries would prevent her from ever being pregnant, Monica had lots of vivid dreams about being pregnant and having children she would never be able to carry or birth. They were unsettling enough, but Monica adjusted to the idea of never being pregnant with ease, but dreams about pregnancy remained. She'd never asked other women if they had similar dreams about pregnancy, so Monica didn't know if she was abnormal in that regard.

Still, that dream felt particularly...odd. It felt real and she distinctly remembered several of her coworkers being involved. Every now and then they would pop up (including the occasional confusing dream involving her and Todd), but never that many at once. And one other thing stuck with her.

"Xpect fills you with life," Monica murmured to herself.

"Wha?" Andy said, stirring on his side of the bed, rolling over to face his wife. "Did you say something?"

"Nothing, just a reaction to a weird dream," Monica smiled, patting her husband on the head. He smiled back, happy with his angle, looking up at his naked wife. Well, mostly naked. The bedsheet was still resting under her breasts. "Good sleep?"

"You really knocked the energy out of me last night," Andy smiled. "Too bad we had to stop a little early."

"Sorry about that," Monica said, covering her mouth. "And thanks for...changing the sheets after I threw up. It wasn't because of you, I swear."

"No?" Andy laughed again, bending over to kiss Monica against the hip. "Maybe I was just too much for you and you got motion sickness."

"Aw, honey," Monica sighed, patting Andy on the head. "You're good, but not that good."

Andy laughed and reached across Monica's torso. "I won't bug you anymore. You're already armed with a throw pillow and I don't want to get hit in the head."

Monica continued to grin. "Throw pillow?"

"Yeah, this pillow you're holding onto," Andy said, pulling back the sheets on Monica's side of the bed. To both of their surprises, what Andy saw bulging under the sheet was not a pillow, but Monica's stomach.

"Oh...oh my god," Monica said, placing her hand on her potbelly, stroking it gently. "I'm...fat."

"N...o, you're not fat," Andy said. "Look at you. Your sides, your thighs, everything-" He paused. "Everything else about you looks the same."

"What was that pause?" Monica said, narrowing her eyes.

"Well, to be honest, your chest and...butt look a little bigger, but in a good way," Andy said.

"Mmhmm," Monica nodded. "I wish I had that throw pillow now." Monica tossed her legs over the side of the bed and walked to the bathroom, giving Andy a chance to see definitively that, yes, her ass was bigger.

Monica took in the feel of the warm shower and let out a light coo. Her chest did feel more sensitive, but bigger? He was just trying to be nice. Or he was being a weirdo without trying. Monica was more focused on the fact that, overnight, her nausea seemed to go away and that was enough of a positive to disregard her sudden belly. Placing her hand against it, Monica noticed that it didn't feel like fat. It was tight and firm as it filled her palm. Maybe bloating? Whatever the case, Monica knew she'd been neglecting her exercise for a long time and this was the wakeup call she needed.

Walking around her apartment with her towel half-wrapped around her, Monica called Jodie, who was almost always available by cellphone. "Jodie, I have a PR campaign I want to try out: to promote our line of sports drinks, EnerG should hold a fitness day or maybe even some kind of fun run. What do you think?"

"I think that's a good idea, Mrs. Raymond, but I won't be coming into work today," Jodie said on the other end, her usual bubbliness all gone.

"Oh, are you still feeling that stomach bug?" Monica asked.

"No, I feel fine, but..." Jodie trailed off for a while before finishing her sentence. "I'm fat."

"What?"

"I'm having a fat day. I can't come in," Jodie said, completely serious.

"Jodie, listen to me: you are a gorgeous girl. Any man would give his left eye to see you naked with the right. If you gained a few pounds, you're still going to look amazing," Monica sighed, smiling a little at her young employee's naiveté. "Also, I'm your boss and a 'fat day' sounds absolutely stupid. You're coming in."

"Okay," Jodie sighed. "Just...don't make me come from behind my desk too much. I don't want people to see me."

"Goodbye, Jodie," Monica said, hanging up and rolling her eyes. Andy walked behind his wife and wrapped his arms around her, hands resting against her belly.

"Trouble at work?" Andy said.

"No, just...Jodie being Jodie," Monica said. "I need to get dressed and you need to take a shower. You reek."

"I kissed you on the lips after you threw up last night and you tell me I reek," Andy said, shaking his head. "I see I'm the one doing all the heavy lifting in this relationship."

"When you bring in the CEO-sized paycheck, then you can say that," Monica smiled, leaning back to kiss her husband.

"Yeah, yeah," Andy chuckled, giving Monica one last naked squeeze before letting her go. "Imagine if we had kids. We couldn't have these little arguments in the open anymore."

"Yeah," Monica said with a half-hearted laugh, her mind going back to her dream. "That's another positive of not having kids."

Monica stuffed another couple dumplings in her mouth, chewing and gulping them down quickly as she reached for her soup bowl. "Careful," Danny said, swallowing a big bite of beef and rice. "This counts as a business lunch and our accountant might raise a few eyebrows if we submit a lunch with this many entrees."

"It's a Chinese restaurant," Monica replied, rolling her eyes with a mouthful of chicken. "They're supposed to have lots of plates and dishes. It's cultural."

"But we usually share the plates with the whole family," said Jacqueline "Jackie" Ming, the restaurant's manager and a close friend of Monica's. She was half-Chinese and half-Malaysian, with soft black hair tied into a ponytail, bright, laughing eyes, and thin, cute red tan lips. "How's it going, Monica?"

"Business is good," Monica shrugged, letting out a little laugh. "And we always thank you for carrying our drinks on the menu. I know it wasn't popular with your parents."

Jackie chuckled back. "I told them, if we can manage to serve Coke alongside traditional teas, we can live selling EnerG drinks too." She let out a little "oof" and put her hands on her own round, pregnant belly. "Speaking of energy..."

Monica's smile softened as she turned her eyes to her friend's belly. Jackie was eight months pregnant with twins and Monica was, of course, happy for her. Some days, seeing other pregnant women made her a little jealous and sad; other days, she saw a woman with a belly and thought "thank God that'll never be me." But after her dream, Monica felt a twinge seeing Jackie rub her belly — a curiosity about what it would be like to be pregnant; expecting and waiting for your child to come into the world.

"It looks like you're all enjoying your food," Jackie beamed, looking over the table, hand resting on top of her belly. "That's always good to see, but I've never seen a group your size finish off so many plates."

"We got a little queazy yesterday, so I guess our bodies are bouncing back," Penny said, slurping up a big clump of noodles held clumsily in her chopsticks.

"Well it's always good to see you all," Jackie said, looking at each person's face. "Although...where's Jodie?"

"Jodie...couldn't make it," Monica sighed, wiping some sauce off of her lips. "I think I'll just take one more plate of chicken in that vinegar and pepper sauce. Anyone else want some more to eat?"

Monica's inner circle shook its collective head. "You're the one with the major cravings," Todd said, chuckling. "Not to conjure up any images for you, Jackie."

Jackie smiled and leaned in to the table. "Since being pregnant, I've had all these cravings for Italian food," she whispered. "Don't tell my parents, though." As she stepped away, hands rubbed both sides of her belly, she turned back to Monica one last time. "Monica, could you come meet me in the back for a second?"

"Sure. It'll take my mind off of the wait for more food," Monica chuckled, putting down her own glass of lemon-lime EnerG to join Jackie in her office. "What's up?"

"I've heard from the other restaurants in the area that they're starting up contracts with an energy drink company," Jackie said, her normally cheery face getting more solemn. "The drink's called Xpect."

"I don't believe this," Monica scoffed, shaking her head. "They've been out there for...for a day and they're already kicking us out of restaurants."

"They haven't made up their mind yet and I'm pushing for EnerG," Jackie said. "I just want to keep you up to date on what's happening."

"Well...thanks, Jackie," Monica sighed. "You really are a good friend." Jackie hugged Monica, her big belly pressing against Monica. "And the baby shower's tomorrow?"

"You got it," Jackie smiled. "See you then."

"Yeah, see you," Monica said, walking back to her table.

Suddenly, a brown-haired woman walked in, rolling in a cart of Xpect. "Hello. I'm a representative from Yaral Industries, and we just relocated right down the street!" she beamed. "And...what is this?" Andrew asked, gesturing to the drinks. "This is Xpect, our newest energy drink. We'd like you two to try it! Everyone else in this office and in the surrounding offices have already done so!" she said, handing a can to Andrew.

The woman was wearing a skintight dress, and Andrew couldn't help but notice that her stomach slightly protruded from her torso. Occasionally, she'd stop to rub it. Honestly, it seemed a little smaller than Monica's stomach had been this morning. "Are you going to try some, Andrew?" his father asked, making him snap out of it.

1441.content:
Chelsea Matthews was exhausted. It was an early Tuesday morning and she hadn't gotten an ounce of sleep. Why? Because she had a very important cheer competition, and she had to nail every single move. She was a perfectionist that way. Chelsea was almost midway through her senior year of high school, and she was absolutely nailing it. At 18 years young, she is the captain of the cheer leading squad, an honor roll student, girlfriend to the quarterback of the football team, and is close to getting accepted into her dream college, Sunnydale University.

But that was besides the point. Chelsea's energy was almost empty, and she needed a boost fast. Walking into Jackson High, she brushed her long brown hair back, when she saw a familiar face. Michelle Stewart was Chelsea's best friend for as long as they could remember. They both had brown hair and blue eyes, and had bonded even more with their years of cheering together. And they were born on the same day.

"Chelsea, there you are! I've been looking all over for you! Oh, you look terrible--no offense." said Michelle said. "None taken. I stayed up all night trying to remember all of the moves for the competition today. I feel dead." Chelsea huffed. "Well I have something that might help with that. Let's go to the locker room." Michelle said.

Once in the locker room, Michelle opened her locker and pulled out a pack of energy drinks. The cans were half pink and half blue, and had the word "Xpect" on the front. "Xpect? what the hell is this, Michelle?" asked Chelsea. "You know how my dad works for the FDA, right? Well sometimes he gets products that don't pass inspection that he has to dispose of. He had a whole crate of them today, so I figured he wouldn't notice if a pack or two was missing." Michelle said.

"Fills you with life? Product of Yaral Industries? Are you sure this is safe?" Chelsea asked. "Please, it's an energy drink. All of them are super unhealthy." Michelle stated. "Fair enough. Shall we do this together?" Chelsea asked. Suddenly, they were interrupted, and they quickly put the two drinks into hiding.

"What are you two girls doing?" asked a strict voice. The voice belonged to Ms. Brown, a 50 something English teacher that seemed to be out to get Chelsea since she had started taking her class this year. She had never been married, and absolutely hated kids. Why she became a teacher was beyond Chelsea. "Ms. Brown, good morning. We were just getting ready for the cheer competition today. What are you doing in the locker room?" asked Chelsea.

"Hall duty, Ms. Matthews. The bigger question, I think, is what is that?" she asked, pointing to pack of Xpect. "Oh, that? Just some energy drinks..." Michelle trailed. "Energy drinks are banned from school premises, as stated in section 5 line 12. I'll be confiscating this and turning it over to Principal Howard at tonight's faculty meeting." said Ms. Brown. She picked up the drinks and walked away, giving the two girls a scowl.

Once the coast was clear, a smile grew on Michelle's face. "Good thing I brought a spare pack!" she said, pulling another case out of her locker. "All this trouble just for an energy drink, huh?" Chelsea laughed. Michelle took two cans out of the pack and opened them, handing one to Chelsea. "Bottoms up!" Michelle said, as the two took a great swig of the Xpect.

They let is settle for a minute, and then offered their opinions. "It's really sweet--" "--but really, really bitter." Chelsea finished. Suddenly, the two began to feel incredibly nauseous. They darted into separate stalls and began to vomit profusely.

While Chelsea and Michelle were emptying their stomachs in the bathroom, the rest of the cheerleaders arrived in the locker room. That included Mary, a stereotypical blonde, Zoe, a dark-skinned beauty who everyone believed would be a supermodel, Abigail, another blonde who happened to be incredibly religious, and Becky, a brown-haired, brown-eyed girl who was considered to be Chelsea's enemy.

Previously, Becky had dated Zack, the school's quarterback. They went through a rough breakup, and Zack quickly got together with Chelsea, while Becky couldn't find another boyfriend. To say that she was jealous of Chelsea was an understatement. But Zack and Chelsea were perfectly happy together. They got along great, and the two were nominated for Homecoming King and Queen, which was coming up on Friday. Becky was also nominated for Queen.

"Where are Chelsea and Michelle?" asked Zoe, looking around. "Knowing those two? Probably late." Becky scoffed. Mary looked in Michelle's open locker, and saw the Xpect. "Hey, what's this?" she asked. "Looks like some kind of energy drink. Wanna try it?" Abigail asked. The three thought it'd be a good idea. "What about you, Becky?" Zoe asked. "No thanks. Just give it to Julie, I guess." she said. Julie was their coach. She was a short, strict woman, but she really cared about the girls. Or their chance at winning the cheer competition, to be more accurate.

The girls ran into the restroom to vomit as Julie walked in, just as Michelle and Chelsea returned from their stalls. "Morning, girls. Ready for today?" she asked. "As ready as I'll ever be." Chelsea said, flashing Julie a smile. Although it wasn't really obvious, Chelsea was Julie's favorite of the group. "Where's everyone else?" Julie asked. "They all ran to the bathroom after trying this energy drink we found in Michelle's locker. Speaking of which, wanna try it?" Becky said.

"Wait, what were you all doing in my locker?" Michelle asked. "Looking for you two. We were worried sick." Becky said, as some heaving could be heard from the bathroom. "Some of us literally sick." she added. Julie snatched the can from Becky and took a sip. "That is...not good..." she mumbled, scurrying to the restroom.

"So, Chelsea, ready for the competition?" Becky asked. "Well, I stayed up all night preparing for it, so I hope so." she responded. "Good. You better not ruin this for us." she said. The ladies returned from their stalls and got their things, heading out to the bus. It was a bit of a drive, which was why they were leaving before school even started. As they walked outside, Chelsea saw Zack.

"Hey, babe. Leaving?" he asked, pulling her in for a kiss. In the background Becky watched, scowling. "Yep. Gonna be gone the whole day..." Chelsea said. "Right. Want me to stop by later tonight?" Zack asked. "I don't know. I'll probably be tired and I have to catch up on the work I'll miss today. But maybe." she said, giving him a kiss goodbye.

Chelsea got in the bus and took a seat next to Michelle, the nausea still present as they headed off.

The cheerleaders were in the locker room of the gym where the competition was held, putting their uniforms on. They still felt quite nauseous, but they cared so much about it that they had to perform. Julie approached them, preparing to give them a pep talk. "Alright girls, I know that we're all feeling under the weather, but if you all stick to the choreography we can win this. Ready?" she asked. The girls nodded in agreement and headed out.

Chelsea got in her place, and watched the lights dim low and the music start to play. She glanced over at Julie, who was standing near a trashcan, in case she got sick. Chelsea took a deep breath, and the cheerleaders began their routine. It went well to begin, as they all were able to hit their moves in perfect time. For their big finale, they had to form a pyramid, with Becky on top and Chelsea, Michelle, and Zoe on the bottom.

They held their position for a moment, until Chelsea began to feel very sick. She put her hand over her mouth and ran out of the pyramid, causing it to collapse. The girls weren't hurt, luckily, but Chelsea hurled into the trashcan where Julie was standing, causing the crowd to gasp. "Damn it, Chelsea. Are you alright?" Julie asked, rubbing Chelsea's back.

Suddenly, a voice rang over the intercom. "Due to that unfortunate event, Jackson High has been disqualified." it said. The girls sighed in disappointment. "Great job, Chelsea. Just great. You ruined it all for us." Becky sneered. "Oh, back off, Becky. I was feeling pretty sick too. If it wasn't her it would've probably been me." said Michelle, supporting her friend.

"It doesn't matter. It happened to Chelsea, so she gets the blame." Becky responded. "Becky, you need to calm down. You weren't on top form, either, and you weren't even sick. So I don't know what your excuse is. Anyways, let's go back to Jackson High. We're going to stop at Subway, so get your money ready." Julie said, as she headed towards the school bus.

The ride home was mostly silent. "Alright, girls. We'll be at Subway in five minutes." Julie said. They saw a McDonalds in the distance, and their bellies collectively groaned. "Maybe we could stop at McDonalds instead?" Mary asked. "Good idea." Julie said, as they pulled into its parking lot.

All of the girls got burgers and fries, except Becky. They grabbed a table and began to chow down. "You might wanna watch what you eat, Chelsea, or you might not be able to fit into that Homecoming dress." she said, giving Chelsea a sinister grin. "Well, at least I'm actually going to Homecoming with someone, unlike you." Chelsea fired back, causing the cheerleaders to erupt in a chorus of"OOOHH". Becky sat in silence, scowling.

They finished their meals, and shortly arrived back at school. "You all know the deal. Practice tomorrow and Thursday, football game on Friday. Hopefully we'll all feel better by tomorrow." Julie said, and the girls left.

Chelsea walked in her house, and saw her father sitting on the couch. Her mother had died years earlier, and her dad had been scraping by ever since. "How'd it go?" he asked. "Not good. I got sick, and we got disqualified." Chelsea said. "Oh, I'm sorry about that, baby. Just get some rest and we'll talk more tomorrow." he said.

"Ok. Good night, Dad." she said, heading upstairs to her room. "Good night, sweetie." he responded.

Chelsea tried to sleep, but she just couldn't. Something felt "off", and she couldn't quite place what it was. She walked over to her bookshelf and pulled out an old photo album. She started at the back, and eventually stumbled upon pictures of her with her mother. She put a hand on one of the photos, as tear ran down her cheek.

Suddenly, the sound of something hitting her window interrupted Chelsea's moment of peace. She walked over and saw what the cause of the noise was. Zack was standing outside, with a rock in his hand. "Zack, what are you doing?" she asked. "Trying to get your attention. I want to see you." he said.

"You couldn't have just sent me a text?" she wondered. "Oh, yeah. I guess so. But this is more chivalrous, isn't it?" Zack asked. "Last time I checked, chivalry doesn't mean breaking your girlfriend's window with a rock. But at least you had good intentions." Chelsea noted.

Zack sneaked into the house and entered Chelsea's room. "Whatcha up to?" he asked, taking a seat next to her on her bed. "Just looking at some old photos." she said. There were pictures of Chelsea when she was a baby, with her mother holding her. There were even multiple pictures of her when she was pregnant with Chelsea. "You were a pretty cute baby." Zack stated. "Yeah, I was. Wasn't I?" she laughed.

"You and I would make some pretty kick ass babies." Zack said. "Yeah...maybe." Chelsea responded. "Do you wanna...get some practice in?" he asked. "What, have sex? I don't know...do you have protection?" she asked. "Of course." he replied, as Chelsea removed her clothing.

Ms. Brown slammed the case of Xpect in the middle of the table. "Recognize this?"

The room was quiet. "N-no?" said Mrs. Beverly, head of student affairs at the high school. She was in her early 30s and was a kind-hearted, if not occasionally naive, woman with bushy red hair. Mrs. Beverly had several children of her own and was never shy with her pregnant belly, but swore that she was done having babies.

"I'll help you out: This is the big new energy drink with high school kids now. Xpect, it's called," Ms. Brown said, taking out a can and showing it to the room. Ms. Brown convened a meeting of the school's four faculty grade leaders. She was in charge of the school's seniors. "I've already heard of at least four other schools in the city where students have been seen with these drinks. Their recycling bins are full to the brim with the cans."

"At least they're recycling," chuckled Ms. Lee, one of the school's biology teachers and the grade leader for the sophomore class. Ms. Lee was a short, multiracial woman in her mid 30s with short black hair and a constant sarcastic smile. She was much firmer than Mrs. Beverly, but combined with her relaxed attitude, more students respected her and considered her "cool" than almost any other teacher.

"Is this really such a concern?" asked Ms. Goode, math teacher in charge of the juniors. She was leaned back in her seat, trying to hide her cellphone usage, completely bored with the meeting. Ms. Goode was the epitome of everything sexual teacher fantasies are made of: a mid 20s bombshell with long, curly blond hair, big red lips, E-cups always squeezed into a blouse that's too small, and a black shirt paired with enticing leggings. There were even rumors that she'd slept with several different teachers there, but no one could ever confirm this.

She was leaning on the table, one fist against her cheek, staring at Ms. Brown in utter confusion. It didn't help that she also had a big, firm rear, smooth brown skin, silky hair, and breasts that rivaled Ms. Goode's.

Then they've got a foot in the door for alcohol dependence. And from there, it's not hard to see them get into hard drugs. This school is not going to produce degenerates."

"So...Xpect is a gateway drug?" Ms. Lee said, raising an eyebrow.

"You laugh, but just watch," Ms. Brown hissed. "These kids start getting used to being hooked on things now, and a very slippery slope appears before their feet. It'll be bad decision after bad decision. I wouldn't be surprised if the girls end up pregnant before leaving college."

"Let's not be so old," Ms. Goode laughed. "Just because this isn't a 'classic' taste, doesn't mean-" She cut herself off as she suddenly dashed toward the nearest garbage can, loudly retching into the bin. The other women took suit.

"Oof," Mrs. Beverly panted, resting one hand on her stomach. "That's it for this meeting, I think. Everyone get home safely."

"Congratulations on your scholarship, Ms. Matthews," the superintendent smiled, shaking Chelsea's hand and turning to catch the flash of cameras. "You've been able to do remarkably well for someone in your...situation."

"Thank you, thank you," Chelsea nodded with a frazzled look. She was on stage in her high school, graduation cap on her head, with the rest of her class lined up behind her. "I've tried to work hard to earn it."

"I can see," the superintendent chuckled, resulting in laughs from the crowd. Chelsea blushed and looked down. There were two babies nursing at her chest and she was holding them both closely. Luckily, she had a place for them to rest to take off some of the weight: on top of her massive pregnant belly, sticking out bare from under a torn graduation gown. "Of course, you're not the only one."

Michelle waddled on stage next, similarly pregnant and breastfeeding. She reached one struggling hand out to take her certificate. "Thank you. I really need this."

"We all do," Abigail groaned, hands under her swollen belly, looking at Zoe sadly and touching her friend's belly out of sympathy.

"I hope you have time to give a speech while you're here," the superintendent said to Chelsea. "Everyone here is excited to hear you speak. You may not be Homecoming Queen, but there's a big spotlight here."

Chelsea sighed and nodded, waddling to a podium and leaning into the microphone. Before she got a word out, a tiny moan escaped Chelsea's lips. "I-I can't give a speech," she whimpered.

"Why not?" Michelle asked, looking at her best friend. "C'mon, you earned it!"

"I can't give a speech because...oof...my water just broke!"

Chelsea jolted up in bed, her entire body doused in sweat. She felt her heart racing and she put her hand on her chest, trying to settle her pulse and take deep breaths. Sure, Chelsea had nightmares like anyone else, but never one that felt so real. It was like an out-of-body experience, but she could still remember looking down and seeing a colossal belly hanging off of her with squirming and kicking inside.

"Just a dream, Chelsea," she told herself. "You're not pregnant." As she gave her heart a gentle pat, Chelsea noticed something felt a little strange. Looking down and giving her breast a soft squeeze, the reason seemed obvious: her breasts were larger. Significantly.

As a cheerleader, it had always benefited Chelsea to have a small chest. Lighter, thinner, easier to move around. Now, Chelsea's bra was digging into her heaving bosom. Chelsea moved her fingers around the sides of her breasts, making sure it was real.

"Jesus," she sighed. "I might need...D cups at this point. I guess I hit a puberty growth spurt at the end. Or maybe end-of-year stress is just making me fat." Chelsea stood up and walked to her bathroom, turning and admiring herself in the mirror. "I guess I picked the right place to get fatter in, at least."

After showering and feeling her new body for the first time, Chelsea dressed in a thick sweater and tried to hide her cleavage with her arms as best she could. The last thing she wanted was questions from her father. She crept to the kitchen table and sat down as her father walked around the room, fixing his own breakfast.

"Sleep well?" he said. Chelsea just nodded, pouring herself a bowl of cereal wordlessly. "I heard a big yelp from your bedroom around 7. Bad dream?"

"Just a weird dream," Chelsea smiled, putting her spoon back in her mouth. She looked back at her bowl, puzzled to see it empty. Even more strange was the astounded look her dad was giving her. "What are you looking at? What happened to my cereal?"

"You ate it," he said in a monotone. "You shoveled it in like crazy. Are you okay?"

"Yeah, fine," Chelsea said, scrunching her nose up. "I still feel really hungry though. Do we have any fruit?"

Her dad pointed to the fridge and Chelsea went to town, eating two apples, some lunch meat, four pieces of toast, and gulped down a hefty swig of orange juice. She reached for the coffee pot on the table, but her father pulled it away.

"I think you've got enough energy for now," he said with a nervous laugh.

"You're right, I've got to go soon anyway," Chelsea said, planting a kiss on her dad's cheek and running out the door. Around the curb, out of the visual path of the window, was Zack's car. Chelsea tossed her backpack and gym back into the back seat and hopped in the passenger side, giving Zack a quick kiss.

"You look good today," he smiled. Chelsea rolled her eyes but Zack kept going. "No, really, you've got...like a glow in your skin. Are you using some new body wash?"

"Just drive, Don Juan," Chelsea said. She decided to withhold the news about her new chest and see how many more compliments she could get. Chelsea had a sense when Zack saw her significant cleavage, and learned she was currently going braless, he would center all his attention there.

The day was relatively uneventful. Chelsea was glad her nausea was gone, but she still felt a gnawing hunger all day, which made it hard to sit through classes. She didn't seem to be the only one distracted. Chelsea spotted at least two instances of boys walking into one another while gawking at Ms. Goode. To be fair, her top did seem much tighter than usual and as proud Chelsea was of her new breasts, it was clear Ms. Goode had her beat.

Chelsea stopped by the school's office to buy Homecoming tickets and was greeted by Mrs. Beverly's smiling face. "Oh...Mrs. Beverly...does the student treasurer usually sell these things?"

"Oh, he said he had to take care of his aunt," Mrs. Beverly sighed, her smile never leaving her face. "Here you go."

"Thanks," Chelsea said with a small smile. She knew for a fact Sean, the student body treasurer, was smoking next to the library. Poor naive Mrs. Beverly. Everyone seemed to take advantage of her. "How are you doing today?"

"Fine, I suppose," Mrs. Beverly beamed. "I've been having a weird craving for pickles, though."

"Yeah?" Chelsea said, looking over the list of Homecoming Queen candidates on the ticket, not listening to the head of student affairs.

"Yes, it's a bit odd. I've had pickle cravings before, of course, but...i-it can't be the same thing," Mrs. Beverly nodded quickly, her smile quivering a bit. "Well, have a nice day."

Chelsea's hand rubbed her expanded stomach before realizing someone might see her. Putting such thoughts out of her head, she made her way to her first class; AP Biology. Hunching over, she barely found her seat before Michelle was whispering frantically in her ear.

"Oh my God, Chelsea, I can't believe this my parents are going to kill me how could this happen I-"

"Michelle!" Chelsea whispered as loud as she dared.

"...What?" Michelle stared back with a blank look.

"Oh my god. Look, we aren't pregnant" Her hand rubbed her sizable bump again, "but even if we are you can't freak out like this. We'll handle it together."

"Oh, right." Michelle looked off again, "Although, you would look pretty hot preggo. You've already got the boobs." She grinned, eyeing her chest, "Hey, are they even bigger? No fair!"

"No! Maybe. Shut up!" Chelsea had noticed that her clothes were even tighter around her chest this morning but put it out of her mind. On further inspection, her stomach was noticeably bigger than Michelle's too.

"Sorry I'm late I had a little errand I...Peter put that phone away!" Chelsea put her freak out on hold as she turned to face Ms. Lee.

"I'd rather you not spread rumors about me, though I doubt many of you would dare anyway. But I'm sure you delinquents have noticed a few...changes that I didn't myself, but here's the explanation: I'm pregnant." Chelsea felt her stomach sink. Ms. Lee's bump was smaller than hers as well.

"Who's the lucky guy?" A voice from the back of the room called out.

"That's none of your business Peter. But, my...partner has been very supportive. We only found out yesterday and I couldn't be happier. Now that's enough distractions. Open your textbooks to page 576. Now, pregnancy is separated into three trimesters of more or less equal length..." She turned and began writing on the white board. Chelsea couldn't help but notice that her backside seemed more ample than usual as well. She could only hope that she wasn't getting any bigger down there as well. What made her more nervous was the timing of Ms. Lee's announcement. Wasn't it yesterday that all the cheerleader's boobs got bigger overnight? Pondering for a moment she gasped.

"Mrs. Lopez..." Chelsea said aloud. She had felt her changes first-hand!

"Mmm, she's soooo hot. Even though Ms. Goode's got bigger cans, I still think she's hotter." Chelsea turned to find Michelle staring off into space, a dull blush coating her cheeks.

"Would you stop? I think whatever happened to us happened to the teachers too! We need to ask the squad at practice."

"I wonder if they're bigger too?" Michelle trailed off, eyes glazing over.

"What is wrong with you? Stop lezzing out all over my desk!"

"Sorry! I don't know what's wrong with me. But the last day or so I could really use some release. Don't suppose you could loan me Zach for an hour or so?"

"No I can't loan you Zach for an hour." She huffed, rolling her eyes.

"Guess you'll have to do then." Chelsea stifled a scream as her boobs were grabbed.

"A-hem." The two girls turned to find Ms. Lee's eyes burning holes in them.

"Anything you girls want to share or do in front of the class?"

"N-no ma'am!"

"Good, then no more interruptions. As I was saying, a common misconception is that gestation is nine months. False, it's actually closer to ten."

"Uh, Ms. Lee? Why are we learning about pregnancy in AP Bio? And shouldn't we be studying for our exam?"

"In the hall Peter. You know which corner."

"Aw man..." Chelsea stared as the boy trudged out of the room. At least now she had a plan. After school she would talk to the rest of the girls and then...She would get to that part later.

Susan Brown prowled through the hallways of Jackson High, looking for any wrongdoing students. Luckily for her, it wasn't long until she saw a student wearing a hat all the way towards the end of the hallway. She ran as fast as she could, which was a bit more difficult today for some reason, and chased him down.

"Hey, you there! Stop right now!" she huffed as she finally stopped him. "Uh...are you alright?" the student asked, concerned that she was wheezing so much.

"Don't try to distract me! You are violating a serious rule by wearing a hat in a school building! You could be hiding a bomb under there!" she exclaimed.

"Look, Ms. Brown, I'm not hiding a bomb in my hat!" he said, a little surprised. "Well, that's just what a terrorist would say, isn't it? Give me that hat, and lose that disrespect while you're at it!" she said, taking his hat. "Alright, fine!" he said, obviously annoyed. He began to walk away.

"Maybe you should lose some weight while you're at it..." he murmured, though it was just loud enough for Ms. Brown to hear. "Excuse me? Detention!" she shouted, walking away.

Ms. Brown looked down at her midsection and noticed that she did have a slight potbelly. "Maybe I do need to lose some weight. It'd help if I want to keep cracking down on students. I'll just have to watch what I eat." she said to herself, walking past Mrs. Beverly's office.

"So, Megan, did you find out yet?" asked Ms. Lee, taking a seat in Mrs. Beverly's office. "Yes. I'm...pregnant." Mrs. Beverly confirmed, while chowing down on a pickle-and-mustard sandwich. "But you've already had kids before, is it really such a big deal?" she asked.

"Jim and I had already decided that we were done having babies. And besides...I'm not so sure that this pregnancy is...normal..." Mrs. Beverly replied.

"Normal? What do you mean?" Ms. Lee inquired. "Well, I guess it'd be best if I showed you." she said. Mrs. Beverly stood up and revealed her stomach, roughly four or five months pregnant in size. Her button-down shirt was struggling to contain her swollen middle. "Megan...oh my. Can...can I feel it?" Ms. Lee asked.

"Go ahead, Leslie." Mrs. Beverly said, unbuttoning her shirt. Despite multiple pregnancies, her belly was still stretch mark free, and it was perfectly round. Ms. Lee examined her belly, feeling its tightness.

"Wow, you really are pregnant, huh?" she asked. "I must be." Mrs. Beverly replied bluntly. "How far along do you think you are?" Ms. Lee asked. "I can't be very far along. I wasn't even showing yesterday!" she exclaimed, struggling to button her shirt back up.

Ms. Lee leaned back in her chair, her eyes glued on her colleague's visible bump. She subconsciously put a hand over her own barely showing bump. "So do you think you're ready for another baby?" she asked.

"Pregnant with one baby? Sure. I've gone through it a bunch of times. But for some reason...I think I may be having more than one. But multiples don't run in our family, so I...don't know. I am going to the doctor's tomorrow after school, so I might find out then." Mrs. Beverly concluded.

"Have you told Jim yet?" Ms. Lee asked. "No. I'm not sure when I'll tell him. Maybe tomorrow when I find out, but at the rate I'm growing, I'm not sure if I'll be able to hide it from him that long." she said, putting a hand on her rounded belly. "How is Bianca doing, by the way?" Mrs. Beverly asked.

"She's good. We're good." Ms. Lee lied. Bianca, Leslie's longtime partner, was an OB/GYN. The two were beginning to have disagreements over one major thing: a baby. Bianca desperately wanted one, but since she was infertile, she couldn't become inseminated. Only Ms. Lee could, but she refused whenever it was brought up. She mainly attributed it to not being ready to be a parent, but she always hid the real reason.

She was deadly afraid of getting pregnant. Even though her good friend Mrs. Beverly had gone through numerous pregnancies, she was always terrified of giving birth. Not to mention the morning sickness and getting fat. Needless to say, Bianca was getting frustrated with Leslie.

"Well, that's good. I'm glad you two are happy. Now, I'd like to finish my second breakfast in peace. I'll talk to you later." Mrs. Beverly said, munching on the disgusting meal. Ms. Lee walked out, and thought about her own recent symptoms.

Ms. Lee put her hand on her small, tight bulge that was located in her midsection. Could I be pregnant? No, that's impossible. she thought, shaking off that notion as the morning bell rang.

Chelsea grunted as she tried to squeeze into her desk. Unfortunately, this classroom only had those awful old seats where the tiny wooden desk was attached to the chair. This made it hard to get comfortable, especially for students with growing pregnant bellies like Chelsea. But for Chelsea, trying to fit in was embarrassing because she thought her stomach was the result of bloating or, worst of all, fat. Still, in the back of her head, there was the fear of a baby.

Zach and I haven't been having sex that much, Chelsea thought as she finally slid into her seat. If he got me pregnant, I wouldn't be showing already...would I?

Chelsea wasn't the only one groaning as she tried to sit in her desk. Zoe was the other student from the cheer squad in Chelsea's first period class and she shot her captain a warm smile. "Guess we had a little too much to eat after practice last night."

"Maybe," Chelsea blushed, smiling back at the squad's top beauty. "Julie will just have to push us extra hard today."

"Oh good," Zoe said, rolling her eyes. If Zoe had Chelsea's aptitude for athletics, she would likely be captain instead because of her striking good looks but she disliked exhorting herself more than anyone on the team. The only person who pushed herself less than Zoe in practice was Becky, who was blessed with natural cheerleading talent.

"Quiet down, everyone," Ms. Goode sighed as she strutted into the room. Every time she entered a classroom, everyone stopped talking. It looked like a modeling shoot, with her long blond hair fluttering behind her, her huge breasts out in front, her long legs walking gracefully, and her face in a sexily uninterested glare.

But today, there was something else about Ms. Goode that drew everyone's attention. She always wore incredibly tight clothing so the sizable bulge in her midsection was all too obvious. It was just about as big as Chelsea's, as far as she could tell.

One student raised her hand slowly, too curious about her teacher for her own good. "Um, Ms. Goode...are you-"

"Am I what?" Ms. Goode said in a loud, low voice, shooting her blue eyes at the poor girl. In a flash, the calm blue sky of her eyes was now an icy glare. The girl only gurgled, unable to respond as she froze in terror. "No questions about teachers personal lives," Ms. Goode sighed, turning to the board. "We've got a test in a few days, so if you're all ready to pay attention, I'll begin."

Ms. Goode's inappropriate conduct was well-known by the school's faculty and administration, but she stayed at Chelsea's high school, teaching and even getting the position of junior class leader. The reason was simple: she was a mathematics genius. At only 26, Ms. Goode had a PhD from MIT and her area of expertise was calculus, which she was teaching Chelsea at this moment.

30 minutes went by and Ms. Goode finally looked over her class, seeing their eyes glazed over. Half of the students were gawking at Ms. Goode, ogling either her breasts which had grown again since yesterday or her adorable "annoyed face." The other half were staring at the series of formulas, proofs, and other calculus demonstrations she'd written all over the board. "I can see this is over your heads," she sighed, rubbing the bridge of her nose. "I'm having an off-day, so why don't you all pair up and go over the study guide."

Chelsea slowly moved to where Zoe was sitting, groaning as she tried to move from desk to desk with the cramped space. She also caught a few students looking at her pot belly and comparing her to Ms. Goode's stomach. Zoe saw her irritation and smiled, leaning in so they could whisper. "Looks like Ms. Goode pigged out yesterday too."

"I don't know if this is really fat, though," Chelsea said, putting one hand against her stomach. "It's not soft. It's pretty firm, but it's still round. I think it could be gas or our digestion is acting up."

"We did have that nausea," Zoe nodded. "But I don't feel like advertising that fact. I'll lose my reputation if I tell people, 'Hey, I'm not fat. I'm just backed up.'"

Chelsea chuckled and looked over the worksheet, scratching the side of her head. "We may need Michelle's help with this stuff. She understands things like this."

"I'm sure I can get some boys to give us a hand," Zoe winked. Part of Zoe's laziness came from her confidence that her looks could get just about any guy in the school to help her out for no charge. In fact, despite all the practical flirting Chelsea saw Zoe do, she never saw her go out on a date. "Say, have you been having...weird dreams?"

Chelsea gulped. "What do you mean?"

"I was wondering if it was a symptom of whatever's happening with us," Zoe said. "I can barely ever remember my dreams but the ones for the past two days..." Zoe shuddered, crossing her arms. "They were creepy."

"I think the same thing's been happening with me," Chelsea nodded. "You mean dreams with...pregnancy?"

"Hey!" Ms. Goode said, standing behind the two cheerleaders, her hands on her shapely hips. "Just because you're both on the cheer squad doesn't mean you work any less in my class. And don't spread rumors about people."

As she walked away, Chelsea raised an eyebrow. Rumors? Why is Ms. Goode so touchy about pregnancy?

With that, the bell rang and Zoe and Chelsea slowly tried to squeeze back out of their desks as the rest of the class left. While they were trying to leave, Ms. Goode crossed her arms at her desk. "Ladies, let's hurry up."

"Right, right," Zoe nodded, flashing a sarcastic smile as she finally got out, pulling Chelsea with her. "I have a feeling Ms. Goode had a bad relationship with her cheerleaders in high school."

"Don't know why," Chelsea shrugged. "By the look of her, she'd have fit right in."

After closing the classroom door, Ms. Goode huffed and pressed her hands against her round belly. "Pregnancy," she scoffed. "I can't believe students are telling one another I'm pregnant..." But she couldn't completely shake the idea. After all...those dreams last night felt very real.

Chelsea was on her way to her Spanish class, but she got called in to Mrs. Beverly's office. Not wasting any time, she hurried to see what she wanted. Chelsea walked into the office and saw Mrs. Beverly sitting at her desk. "You wanted to see me, Mrs. Beverly?" Chelsea asked.

Mrs. Beverly stood up, revealing her belly, which was a bit bigger than Chelsea's. "Oh, yes! Homecoming Weekend can go by very fast, so I printed out a schedule for this weekend's activities!" she said, handing the piece of paper to Chelsea. "Cool, thanks! I'll take a look at this later." Chelsea said.

She was about to say goodbye and leave, but was interrupted by a large rumbling from Mrs. Beverly's stomach. Her face turned as red as her hair, and she placed a cautious hand on her rounded belly.

"Are you hungry, Mrs. Beverly?" Chelsea giggled. "Y-yes. Tell me...do you know if the cafeteria is open yet?" she asked, beginning to rub her stomach. "No, lunch starts after this period. So another hour or so." Chelsea said. "Oh...oh boy..." Mrs. Beverly said, her belly continuing to rumble.

"I'll see you later, Mrs. Beverly." Chelsea said, finally leaving her office. Hearing the warning bell, she ran to Mrs. Lopez's class, both for the fear of being late and being caught by Ms. Brown.

Chelsea made it just before the late bell rang, and bolted to her seat, right next to Michelle. She looked at her friend, and noticed that she was wearing a large coat.

"What the heck are you wearing?" Chelsea asked. "I've gotta wear SOMETHING to hide this belly! I don't want people to think I'm a tramp or something!" Michelle exclaimed.

"Well, seeing as it's not the 1940s, no one's going to call you a tramp. People use "slut" nowadays. Besides, nobody is going to care, my belly is just as big as yours." Chelsea said, easing Michelle's mind.

Mrs. Lopez sat at her desk, looking at her cell phone. "Lo siento, los estudiantes. Estoy esperando una llamada de teléfono." she said. As this was an advanced Spanish class, they were able to comprehend the gist of her sentence. Surely enough, her phone rang, and she hastily picked it up.

"Hola? Sí, soy Verónica López. Llamé antes porque creo que podría ser ... embarazada. Los síntomas? Náuseas, el crecimiento del pecho, los antojos extraños. Y ... mi estómago es ... más grande. Mañana a las seis horas? Eso debería ser bueno. Gracias. Adiós." she said, ending her call.

"Did anyone understand any of that?" she asked the students. They all shook their heads. "Good. Now, today we are going to go over some verb conjugations..." Mrs. Lopez said, walking to her whiteboard. This let the students get a glimpse of her stomach, which was pretty identical to Ms. Goode's belly in terms of size.

"Do you have any idea what she said?" Michelle whispered. "Only a few words, but I think she was calling her doctor." Chelsea said. "I wonder what about, she kinda looks pregnant." Michelle noted. "Maybe that's what she's calling about." Chelsea concluded.

"Now, the verb that we will conjugate today is "comer". Anyone know what that means?" she asked. Chelsea raised her hand, and Mrs. Lopez called on her. "To eat?" she asked.

"Yes! Muy bueno! Now, would you like to do the full conjugation?" she asked. "Sure. Yo como, tu comes, usted come, nosotros comemos, vosotros comeis, and ustedes comen." Chelsea said. "Yes! Tu es muy inteligente!" Mrs. Lopez chirped.

They continued to conjugate verbs, but all throughout the rest of class her stomach rumbled loudly. She needed to eat, and fast. The talk of eating must have gotten to her. Luckily, the bell rang, and Chelsea darted to the cafeteria, not even talking to Michelle.

Chelsea was used to having all eyes on her. She was a gorgeous girl with everything in the right place and even the most cynical, anti-cheerleader student in the school couldn't help but get an eyeful of Chelsea when she walked by. But today, Chelsea was getting the stares of the student body for just how high her food tray was stacked.

"You're starved too?" Mary said as Chelsea sat down with her fellow cheerleaders. And like Chelsea, their trays were all as full as they could be. "We must have been working extra hard in practice, right?"

Abigail shook her head as she sat next to Mary. Compared to the rest of the cheer squad table, her tray was practically spick and span. "You still shouldn't pig out so much. It'll only slow us down when we practice today. And besides, Mother always told me girls who act good look good. Eating all this food is going to make us look like slobs."

"Are you worried about how our tummies have gotten bigger too?" Mary giggled, leaning back to show the potbelly she'd developed. Abigail's face turned red at the proposition and put one hand over her growing stomach. "I'm sure it's just gas from when we kept puking."

"Mary!" Abigail whined, looking around before leaning in to her friend. "Y-you can't talk like that out loud. We're cheerleaders. We have to be classy."

"I wouldn't go that far," Chelsea laughed as she stuck her spoon into the mountain of food in front of her. "But she has a point, Mary. We're trying to eat. Don't talk about barfing, please."

"Sorry," Mary laughed as her eyes followed Zack as he sat next to his girlfriend.

"Hey," Zack said, kissing Chelsea before smacking his lips and lolling his tongue around. "Hmm, weird choice in foods today."

"I saw all this vinegar and garlic juice on the condiment island," Chelsea said, quieting down with embarrassment. "I-I thought I'd give them a try."

"I hope it tastes better than it smells," Zack said. "Anyway, I wanted to see if there was anything on Mrs. Beverly's schedule that some of the guys from the team could help with. You know, building stages, that sort of thing."

"Aww," Chelsea smiled. "You want to help?" Zack just smiled and nodded. "But we usually have the theater department do that kind of thing."

Zack let out a loud laugh and put one hand on Chelsea's shoulder. "C'mon, who would you rather want giving you a hand? Those nerds or your boyfriend and his big, strong arms?"

Ms. Brown put her hand on one of Zack's big, strong arms and gently but firmly lifted it off Chelsea's shoulder. She put one hand on her hips and smirked at Zack. "You caught me in a good mood when you broke school rules on public displays of affection when you kissed Ms. Matthews."

"G-good," Zack smiled, trying to use his charm on the school's bulldog. Her eyes glimmered and his smile began to fade as he realized what a bad decision that was.

"But my good moods pass very quickly, Mr. Meyers. Unlike other teachers in this school, I am not opposed to giving a student athlete detention. From now on, keep your hands and...the rest of your body to yourself," Ms. Brown said. "And ladies, this quantity of food is hardly-"

A loud rumble from Ms. Brown's own growing pregnant stomach cut her off. The cheerleaders, noticing Ms. Brown's belly, stared up at her.

"Carry on," Ms. Brown said in a low voice as she hurried over to the line at the cafeteria. "Excuse me," she growled at the line of students in front of her.

"Ms. Brown?" Michelle said, newly entering the cafeteria. "Why don't you use the Administrator Express Line?"

"There's no such thing, Ms. Stewart," Ms. Brown said, rolling her eyes. "Don't make me reprimand you for teasing a faculty member."

"Well Mrs. Beverly used the line when she cut ahead," Michelle said, pointing over to Mrs. Beverly. She was eating at a furious pace, stacking up two lunch trays as high as Chelsea had.

"Shh, shh," she moaned quietly as her stomach continued to rumble. "I know you're not big enough to hear me or kick around yet, but I need you to be a little more secretive."

"Megan?" Ms. Goode said with a smile as she walked by. "Don't talk to your food too much. Susan might even give you a citation."

"R-right, sorry," Mrs. Beverly blushed, trying to slow down her meal. But before she turned back to her tray, she saw that Ms. Goode's usual tight sweater was even tighter today. Plus, the usual light lunch of phallic-shaped foods she preferred was a smorgasbord. And of course, there was Ms. Goode's growing belly. "Are you...feeling alright, Ginger?"

Ms. Goode's usual sexy veneer faltered a bit at the question. "I'm always alright, Megan." She marched over to a distant table and sat down, chowing down viciously.

"Hola," Mrs. Lopez sighed as she sat next to Mrs. Beverly, her portion also surprisingly large. "How are you today?"

"Oh, hanging in there," Mrs. Beverly said with a small laugh. "One of those days, I suppose."

Mrs. Lopez nodded before dropping her voice to a whisper. "Can I ask you some personal questions?" Mrs. Beverly nodded and leaned in close. "Was it...hard to keep teaching when you had your first baby?"

Mrs. Beverly laughed quietly and sighed. "My husband wouldn't let me work when we had our first child. He's...traditional and he had me stay home and take care of the baby, and when I got pregnant again...well, let's just say that I couldn't work again for a while."

"But if your husband were more...flexible?" Mrs. Lopez asked.

"Maybe, and if I hadn't kept getting pregnant," Mrs. Beverly laughed, placing one hand on her belly. "Veronica are you...trying to have a baby?"

Mrs. Lopez cleared her throat before whispering extra quietly. "Are you?"

Mrs. Beverly turned pale. "W-why would you ask that?"

"You mentioned being pregnant and put one hand on your stomach. Besides, you're...looking a little big," Mrs. Lopez said.

"Don't...tell anyone," Mrs. Beverly replied in a similar whisper. "Only you and Dana Lee know."

"Then can you keep a secret too?" Mrs. Lopez said. "I think I might also...have a baby on the way."

Mrs. Beverly's jaw dropped as she smiled. "Veronica, that's terrific!"

"Thank you, I'm a little excited too," Mrs. Lopez said, standing up to walk around to the other side of the table as she carried her tray. "But until I know for sure, I don't want anyone to-"

Before she finished her sentence, Mrs. Lopez slipped on some mashed potatoes that spilled off of her own tray and spun around, her food falling to the ground. As she stumbled, her shirt — already extremely tight — snapped up, showing her entire round belly and her bra on top. On the ground, she let out a sigh and rubbed her stomach quickly. "I'm just glad I didn't fall and hurt the baby," she said, looking back at Mrs. Beverly. When she saw her co-worker's shocked expression, she turned back and saw the entire cafeteria staring at her rubbing her bare, pregnant belly.

"I think the secret's out," Mrs. Beverly said quietly.

After that nightmare of a day, Mrs. Lopez was relieved to finally be done with it. She hurried to her car, in order to avoid conversation, and made her way to the doctor's office.

First, she had to call her husband, Roger. After a few rings, he picked up. "Hello?" he asked. "Hey, baby. It's Veronica." she said. "Hey, how was your day?" Roger asked. "It was...eventful. Listen, I'm going to be a little late getting home, I have to grade some papers." she lied.

"Oh, that's okay. I have a...meeting so I'll probably be a little late getting home as well. I'll talk to you later, okay?" he said. "Yeah. Talk to you later." she said, noticing that she had arrived at her destination. "Alright, time for the moment of truth." she said, slowly rubbing her swollen stomach.

After a few minutes, a nurse called Mrs. Lopez's name, and took her to an examination room. "Could you step up on the scale for a moment?" the nurse asked. Mrs. Lopez obliged, and watched in shock as the nurse continued to slide the weight to the right.

"Alright, you're now at 175 pounds. It looks like you've gained about...twenty five pounds since the last visit." the nurse stated.

"When was my last visit again?" Mrs. Lopez asked, still surprised at her weight's sudden skyrocket. "Two months ago. Anyways, Dr. Hernandez will be with you shortly." she said, exiting the room.

Shortly after, Dr. Horatio Hernandez burst into the room. He was a confident, handsome man in his late 40s, but looked younger. "Doctor Horatio Hernandez, HH Phd, at your service." he beamed.

"Hello, Dr. Hernandez. Nice to see you again." Mrs. Lopez said. "You too, Veronica. But if you want some advice, you might want to lay off the chimichangas." he chuckled, giving her round belly a pat.

"Doctor, I don't think this is weight gain. I think I might be...expecting." she said. "Oh, well let's give you an ultrasound to see if you're right." he said, walking out of the room.

He returned with an ultrasound machine, and Mrs. Lopez lifted up her shirt, allowing him to squirt the cold gel on her swollen bump. "Frio! Frio! Frio!" she exclaimed, noting just how frigid the gel was. "I probably should have given you a warning." he said, maneuvering the want across her round belly.

"Okay, so it looks like you're about three months pregnant. Weird, we didn't pick that up at your last appointment..." he trailed. "Three months? You mean I'm going to have a baby in six months?" she asked.

"Well, it's not just one baby, you're going to have...seven." Dr. Hernandez stated. Mrs. Lopez's eyes widened in shock. "Dios mio..." she said.

Mrs. Lopez returned home and noticed that Roger wasn't there. She walked inside, one hand on her belly, the other burying her face. "Pregnant. With septuplets..." she said, still in disbelief.

Veronica needed someone to talk to. Someone she was close with. Someone who had gone through a pregnancy before. She needed Lorenza.

Her younger sister arrived at her house, letting herself in. Veronica was in the kitchen washing dishes from an earlier meal, her back turned from Lorenza.

"You wanted to talk, Veronica?" she asked. "Yes, I have to tell you something. Lorenza...I'm pregnant." she said, turning around to reveal her swollen stomach to her sister.

"So you were right! Oh, I'm so happy, you're going to get so big and wobbly!" she laughed, rubbing her sister's pregnant belly. "But you weren't even showing yesterday." Lorenza noted.

"Well, I guess I'm growing a bit faster because I'm having septuplets..." Mrs. Lopez said. Lorenza's eyes widened. "Seven? Wow, you're going to get huge! You're going to be like Octomom, just like, one less. So how far along are you?" she asked.

"The doctor said about three months." Veronica said. "Alright. I'm not exactly sure, but I think we might be going through a pregnancy together!" Lorenza said, rolling up her shirt to reveal her own slight bump. The two screamed with glee and pulled in for a hug.

Across town, Roger was in the car with Ms. Goode outside of her apartment. "Listen, Ginger, you're really, really great in the sack, but I'm just not comfortable with THAT in the way." he said, pointing to her swollen stomach.

"Excuse me? You won't fuck me just because I've put on a little weight? You misogynistic asshole!" she said, getting out of the car. "Wait, baby, baby, I didn't mean it! Forget I even said it!" he exclaimed, realizing that he made a huge mistake.

"No, that's not going to work this time! Don't call me! Oh, and congrats to you and your wife about the baby, by the way!" she yelled, entering her apartment.

Roger paused. "WAIT, WHAT?!?"

Ms. Brown sighed and tapped her foot. She checked the time on her cellphone. Grant had another five minutes before she got fed up with waiting and left. Normally, a stuck-up woman like Ms. Brown would wear a watch, but she made sure to always have the most up-to-date smart phone of multiple brands on her person. If she wanted to be an effective policing force in the high school, she needed in do more than just follow students around. She had to get in their heads, understand what sick things made them tick, figure out what, with the use of these infernal devices, they were capable of.

A shadow came closer to the streetlight Ms. Brown was standing under. Not sure who it was, Ms. Brown lowered her hips, letting out a little groan as her belly added new weight to the lower half of her body. Tightening a fist, Ms. Brown pulled her elbow back as a man in a large trenchcoat slowly walked backwards to Ms. Brown, looking around shiftily. As they got up, Mary could see the impression of little kicks against the otherwise smooth skin of Ginger's belly. "Wow, so you really are pregnant," she murmured to herself.

"Go!" Ginger barked as the classroom erupted with laughter.

Megan shrugged. "It's not like Jim ever said I looked good when I was pregnant...or showed me he found me attractive."

"Well that's his loss," Veronica sighed. "You're radiant."

Megan smiled again and looked down at her belly. "No offense, Veronica, but if you're carrying septuplets, then I'm a little scared for my own ultrasound. Who knows how many they'll find in me? It's hard enough when I thought I was expecting one more baby. If it's twins, I'll be totally worn out. If it's triplets, I'll have a heart attack."

"And if it's more?" Veronica said, raising an eyebrow. There was a knock at the office door.

"Don't even joke," Megan said, groaning as she heaved herself from her seat and waddled to the door. Opening it was a struggle, with her and Veronica's bellies in the way in the cramped office. "Abigail? Mary?"

"We were sent by Ms. Goode," Abigail mumbled, her head hung in shame.

"Mary, I know your grades aren't...the best," Megan sighed, the hand on her belly staying put. "But to go this far..." She turned to Abigail. "And Abigail, you're such a close friend of Mary's. You should have told her about the consequences."

"W-what do you mean 'close friend?'" Abigail stammered, her face turning red. "Because we're not 'that' close, if that's what you mean."

Megan paused. "I...I don't think I follow."

"Don't make me say it!" Abigail whined, holding her hands close to her belly. After gingerly feeling its tight roundness, she threw her hands away again and crossed her arms.

"Anyway," Megan sighed, turning to Mary instead. "In a situation like this, we obviously have to make a note in your transcripts. And we'll have to contact your parents."

"Mrs. Beverly, please!" Abigail whined again. "I...I swear to God, we were not cheating. Please, I don't want my arguing with Mary to hurt her grades or her chances at getting into a college." Mary turned to her friend and gulped. She'd never "swore to God" before. She was far too religious for that.

Megan knew that too and let out a slow sigh. "Let me check with Ms. Goode and see your quizzes. I think that's only fair. Excuse me." Megan heaved herself around her desk, her belly bumping into both Mary and Abigail. "Sorry, sorry."

There was a pause in the room. "I guess Ms. Goode isn't the only pregnant teacher here," Mary said with a little laugh.

"I don't know what a pregnant belly feels like but...that felt like the real deal," Abigail said, rubbing her cheek, a little red from where Megan's womb smacked her.

"I think I do," Mary said, putting a hand on her own round stomach. "Hers was bigger but...they feel about the same."

"Mary, please," Abigail said loudly, cutting her off. "I...I can't be pregnant. I know it looks like it and that's what all the signs point to, but if my parents found out I was pregnant...they'd throw me out. They'd cut me out of the family. I'd be all alone."

"No you wouldn't," Mary said quietly, reaching one hand over to Abigail. "You'd have me." Abigail flinched when Mary touched her, but relaxed and gripped Mary's hand.

"This...this is wrong," Abigail said, her face feeling like a balloon on the verge of bursting. "To be...homosexual."

"Does it feel wrong?" Mary said, her eyes welling up with tears. "I mean, you do like me don't you?"

"I do," Abigail said, now sobbing as well. "But I'm not supposed to! And I'm not supposed to be pregnant!"

"It's okay, Abigail," Mary said, moving to her friend and holding her tightly. "As long as I know you like me too, that's all I need." Then Abigail did something Mary wasn't expecting: she kissed her fellow cheerleader. The two pressed their lips together, sharing their first truly intimate moment. As they heard footsteps, Mary lurched back into her own seat and tried to rub her cheeks dry as Megan waddled in.

"Why would you be crying?" Abigail said through her tears.

"Oh, I'm always so gushy," Megan sobbed. "And hormones too, I suppose."

Abigail and Mary stopped crying almost instantly. "Hormones?"

Megan stopped and looked at both of them. "Just between us, okay?" She sighed. "Yes, I'm pregnant. I know it's the rumor, after all."

"Our lips are sealed," both girls said in unison, standing up and secretly holding hands behind their backs. "Can we go?"

"Yes, yes, go ahead," Megan said, unaware that Mary was notoriously bad at keeping secrets.

Who is the first person Mary tells?

Plus, bellies like this don't exactly show up overnight. Or over a few nights.

"Except..." Ginger sighed, bringing her fingers to her pillowy lips in contemplation. On second thought, she'd recently had her prescription changed and was on a different, cheaper brand of the pill. And if it was defective, that would make the most likely candidate for her baby — or babies — Roger, Veronica's husband.

Ginger began to cackle as the realization dawned on her, driving along with the stream of cars in front of her. She'd sent him the picture of her belly as a way to rattle his cage, but he could really be the one who got her pregnant. If she's pregnant, that is.
