Chelsea and the rest of the cheerleaders just mumbled quietly in reply. They weren't as big as their coach, but each girl struggled to fit into her uniform thanks to her large pregnant stomachs. Mary and Abigail had both already resigned to the fact that they must be pregnant, despite their abstinence, and were currently shooting each other friendly looks, stroking one another's bellies gently. After tonight's game, they were looking forward to spending some time together and discovering just how much they cared for one another.

Chelsea was still trying to deny the obvious reality jutting out from her middle, but she and Michelle were fairly convinced they must be pregnant. All that was left was to bite the bullet and go to the doctor's office for a test and ultrasound to confirm it all. At least for Chelsea, she thought this was in the realm of possibility. She and Zack had unprotected sex every now and then and birth control pills don't always work. But Michelle had yet to get her first kiss, yet the movement inside her beach ball-like belly was impossible to ignore. The only cheerleader still firmly in denial about her coming maternity was Zoe, but she was hard to read. The gorgeous senior was one of the school's great mysteries.

"I'm ready," Becky said with a smile, looking at Chelsea directly before turning back to Julie. "I'm not the one who put on a ton of weight...or got sloppy with my pill schedule." Chelsea's cheeks burned as Becky ran her hand down her flat stomach. "Come one team, let's run out there and do a few cartwheels while we're at it. Everyone up to it?"

No one dared snap back at her. They were all too aware that there was no way they could run out in their condition. "I have to rule against that," Julie finally said, breaking the silence. "We have the championships in a few days and we wouldn't want to do anything risky and get an injury."

"Running out is risky?" Becky said, putting her hands on her hips. "And it's the last home game of the season. We're seriously not going to do an even semi-flashy entrance to catch everyone's attention?"

"I think anyway we go out with get attention," Michelle whispered to Chelsea, which made the team captain giggle.

"A brisk jog out, how about that?" Julie said. "It's not as though you girls sprint at every game. Now come on, hands in the middle."

They ended up getting their bellies together in the circle as the pep band began to play. All six girls ran out, with Becky far ahead thanks to her lack of a belly. Becky waved the most gleefully, laughing to herself as she heard the rest of the audience gawk at the rest of the cheerleaders. Their uniforms weren't letting their bellies come out uncovered yet, but they were a few stitches away by the look of them.

Chelsea and the rest tried to stay composed as they got to their spot and waved back to the crowd, smiling the biggest fake smile they could muster. Only Abigail was having a hard time keeping the facade up.

Behind them, the football team ran out and Zack turned to wave to his girlfriend. Chelsea waved back and Zack took off his helmet to get a better look, clearly confused by her size. They hadn't seen a lot of one another in a while and in her cheerleading uniform, it was much harder to hide her pregnant gut under a coat or puffy shirt. As Zack slowly moved away, Chelsea's smile vanished and her arms fell down.

"Don't worry about all of them," Julie said, walking past the girls. "Take a seat and get ready to do the Spring Classic at the next time out."

The game went on without too much of a hitch. The Jackson High defense was keeping the game competitive but Zack was clearly distracted and wasn't making too many strong passes. Michelle was using a pair of binoculars to inspect the other side's crowd and cheerleaders, nudging Chelsea after a while. "Who are we playing?"

"Bermont High," Chelsea said. "Why?"

Michelle handed Chelsea the binoculars and she gasped. Several of the other team's cheerleaders were pregnant as well. So were lots of women and, by the look of it, men in the opposing audience. "Weird, right?"

"R-right," Chelsea said, trembling a little. Just what was going on in this city? She was cut off as the clock went all the way down and halftime came.

"Everyone up," Julie said, clapping her hands. The girls hurried as quickly as they could, trying to do the best poses they could while wobbling around, their bellies weighing them down. The crowd just kept laughing and laughing and Chelsea felt her cheeks burn.

"Let's do the standing pyramid," Chelsea said. "We can do it, come on. We've got to win them back."

Everyone else, save for Becky, was clearly nervous about it, but they trusted Chelsea's enthusiasm. Mary, Abigail, and Michelle stood on the bottom and Zoe and Chelsea did their best to climb onto their shoulders, grunting and shaking the whole time. "Stand still," Becky laughed as she did a running jump to get on top, waving gleefully at the crowd. As people began to clap, the pregnant girls were all losing balance quickly. "Don't drop me, preggos!"

"I'm not pregnant!" Michelle yelled, and with that, the whole pyramid began to fall apart. Each girl quickly jumped ship and tried to do tumbles and flips to save face. When they had all taken a happy sigh and were glad it was over, they heard the laughter only growing. Looking down, each pregnant cheerleader now had their bellies totally exposed.

"Abigail!" a loud voice roared from the stands. Abigail looked up and saw her extremely religious parents staring at her. Abigail's father was fuming and her mother was shaking her head in despair.

Tears filled her eyes and Abigail ran back to the locker room as quickly as her pregnant body could take her. "Wait! Abigail!" Mary said, stopped from following her by Julie.

"Give her a little space for now," Julie said, whispering in her ear. "I know how you feel about each other but...trust me. Wait until after the game."

Things didn't get much better from there out. After halftime, Jackson High's performance plummeted and they ended up losing by two touchdowns. The cheerleaders didn't try anything else daring, except for Becky, and went back to the locker room dejected. "That was awful," Chelsea grumbled.

"You just got distracted. There's a lot of...illness going around," Julie said. "With some more focus, championships can be ours. I know it can, if we perform the way we did a few days ago. Now go get changed and head home." Julie paused and took a deep breath. "But before we go, I should let you all know something."

"What's that?" Zoe asked, her lips spreading into a smile.

"I'm going to keep being your coach, so don't worry, but I recently confirmed that I...am...pregnant," Julie said, unzipping the rest of her jacket and placing her hands on her belly. The other cheerleaders pretended to be surprised and "aww"ed, clapping a bit. "Thank you. It's been a bit of a whirlwind but I've always wanted a little boy or girl of my own...though one at a time."

"I'm sure you'll be a great mom," Chelsea smiled, unsure about whether she can say the same about herself.

"Hermana, you know you can't keep anything from me," Lorenza said. "What is it?"

"Things between Roger and I...feel funny. I can't point to anything specific but we've felt distant," Veronica sighed, running her palm up and down her belly as she stared at it, feeling the tiniest flutters inside her massive fleshy mound.

"You think because of the pregnancy?" Lorenza asked, pursing her large, dark lips.

"Maybe but I only told him about the baby...I mean, the babies today before we left," Veronica said.

Lorenza chuckled. "Querido I think he could tell you were expecting before today."

"It was long, long before I even suspected I could be pregnant," Veronica said, her voice beginning to tremble. "I just wish I knew."

"You think he might be..." Lorenza looked around and leaned in to Veronica to whisper. "An affair?"

"Lorenza!" Veronica gasped, her face turning red. "H-how could you say that?"

"Look, maybe it's just the office I work in. Everyone's sleeping with everyone. Well, except me. I have my standards," Lorenza huffed. "But I can always get a sense about these things."

"You're crazy," Veronica grumbled.

"Maybe," Lorenza sighed. "I hope so. And besides, look at you." Veronica's blush grew as she looked down at her belly. "I mean...look at you before you started swelling up. How could anyone have an affair behind your back? You're as hot as they come."

"You're only saying that because we look so much alike," Veronica said with a little smile.

"That's how I know it's true," Lorenza said, puffing out her chest. "No man's ever slept around on me. I can't think of anyone who would make Roger be unfaithful to you."

Veronica gulped as one woman appeared in her head: Ginger Goode. Veronica tried not to be vain but she knew how she looked and the only woman in the area she thought could compete with her in physical beauty, besides Lorenza, was Ginger. But would Roger really be so ballsy as to sleep with one of her coworkers?

She has been looking rounder around the waist Veronica thought as her sister tapped her on the shoulder.

"Come on, let's get out mind of things and go shopping," Lorenza smiled warmly. "I feel like getting something that might actually cover my belly up."

"Right, right," Veronica nodded, trying to get her mind off of what she assumed was a crazy theory. The two women waddled into the mall's enormous maternity clothing store, only to see the shocked eyes of the clerk.

"O-oh God, there's more of them," the young man said. "W-welcome ladies."

"Thank you," Lorenza smiled with a giggle. "Got anything that might fit us?"

"Honestly?" the young man said in a hushed tone. "I don't think so. But don't tell my manager. She's almost as big as you two and thinks these things look good on her."

"You don't think we'll look good?" Lorenza purred, leaning in to the front desk, letting her cleavage do the talking for her. Lorenza was far more willing than her sister to use her looks to get a deal.

The young man gulped and looked like he'd break his neck trying not to look down there. "O-our larger outfits are in the back if you want to try."

"Thank you," Veronica said, grabbing her sister by the collar and pulling her back. "That was a little shameful, sis."

"It wasn't working anyway," Lorenza sighed. "It's harder to flirt when you're pregnant. But he's right: these all look too tiny for women like us."

At that moment, the door to the changing room swung open with a slam and the half-naked body of Megan Beverly waddled out, her creamy belly on full display. "They don't fit! None of them fit!"

"Megan?" Veronica asked. When she met her co-worker's gaze, Megan's eyes immediately began to water and her lip trembled.

"Mrs. Lopez," Megan sobbed, leaping into Veronica's arms. "It's awful. I thought I could handle being pregnant one more time but...but not this pregnant!"

"Shh, shh, take it easy," Veronica said, leading her into the changing room and shooing her sister away. "Tell me what's wrong."

"Everything," Megan sniffled. "I look like a blimp, my husband will barely look at me, I'm exhausted all the time, nothing fits me, no one respects me at school now that I look like a beach ball."

"I respect you," Veronica said quietly.

"No offense, Veronica, but not many people respect you either," Megan said, looking up at the school's Spanish teacher. "Except for me and maybe Ms. Lee."

"That's nice of you to say," Veronica smiled. "I...may be having some issues with my husband too."

"Does he tell you your pregnant body is ugly? And fat? And that's it's gross to be with a pregnant woman?" Megan said, starting to cry again.

"Hey, you look lovely pregnant, Megan. Muy bello."

"You think?" Megan said in a small voice, her gaze moving closer to Veronica's. And in an instant, their lips met and hung there before tightening, feeling each other's softness.

Veronica broke the kiss first, waddling clumsily out of the changing room. "I-I'm sorry, I can't do that."

"Veronica, I'm so-"

"No, it's..." Veronica took a deep breath. "It's fine." With that, she moved out of the store as quickly as she could, with Lorenza huffing and puffing to keep up.

"We're leaving?"

"Yep, bad inventory," Veronica said, her face burning as she touched one hand to her lips.

Bianca stood in her bedroom, wearing a blue turtleneck and pants, which were admittedly pretty tight. However, her main focus was on her belly, which made her look pretty bloated. Bianca rubbed it, noticing just how firm it was. "Please don't be what I think this is..."she trailed.

She was running late for an appointment that was made on short notice by an acquaintance of hers for a teenager. Between examining the Xpect and worrying about the fact that she might be pregnant, Bianca's mind was boggled.

Bianca bustled into the kitchen, where she saw Leslie, only donning a bra and panties, devouring a large amount of food. "Ah, there you are! How's the mother of my children doing?" Bianca said, approaching Leslie to rub her belly and give her a kiss. Leslie's stomach had grown over the night, making her look nearly due with a single baby.

"Starving." she bluntly replied, barely taking time to breathe. "That's good! You are eating for six after all." Bianca noted. "I guess so. How far along did you say I was yesterday? Seventeen weeks?" she asked, stopping her binge to feel her babies kicking. "Around there, yeah. Why do you ask?" Bianca asked, quickly devouring some yogurt that she found in the fridge.

"It's just...it feels like I'm further along than that." Leslie said. "Huh. Well, I'm running late. We'll talk about it later, alright?" Bianca said, leaving the house.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Bianca arrived at the office twenty minutes later, and was approached by Jane, one of the many nurses who worked there. "Good morning, Bianca. It's actually two girls you're seeing, Chelsea Matthews and Michelle Stewart. I already took their weights, and they both seemed really upset about it." Jane said, following Bianca down the hallway.

"About their weight or their pregnancy?" Bianca asked, looking at their charts. "Both. Look, I know you're busy right now, but can we talk after this appointment? It's...important." Jane asked, running her hands through her auburn hair. Bianca agreed to do so, and entered the examination room.

Inside, Chelsea and Michelle were sitting on cold angular chairs, their burgeoning bellies showing due to their ill-fitting clothes. "Sorry I'm late, girls. So you both think you're pregnant?" Bianca asked, her eyes glued to the charts. "Seriously? Have you seen our stomachs?" Michelle asked. "Yeah, sorry. Just a bit preoccupied. So how long have you thought you've been pregnant?" she asked.

"This is...what, the fifth day?" Chelsea asked Michelle, who nodded in confirmation. "Five days and you're this big already? Actually, that reminds me of my girlfriend..." Bianca noted. "Wait, is your girlfriend Ms. Lee?" Michelle asked. "Yes! You know her?" Bianca asked, retrieving two ultrasound machines from the closet.

"Yeah, she's our biology teacher. Congrats on the pregnancy, by the way! You excited to be a mom?" Michelle asked, rolling up the part of her shirt that was covering her pregnant belly as Bianca turned the machines on. "What? Uh--I'm not pregnant! Oh, you were talking about Leslie, weren't you? Yes, I'm very excited." Bianca said.

"You've been quiet. Are you alright?" Bianca asked Chelsea. "Just nervous, that's all." Chelsea said, not sure if the butterflies in her stomach were from the nerves or the pregnancy. "Chelsea, I've met hundreds of women who've felt the same way you have, and end up loving being pregnant. You'll be fine." Bianca smiled.

She maneuvered the ultrasound wands around both of their bellies. "Well, you're both about 22 weeks pregnant." Bianca stated. "So...is it just one each?" Chelsea asked. "I'm still counting." Bianca said, trying to come to a conclusion. "Looks like six fetuses." Bianca said.

"Wait, triplets?!?" Michelle asked. "No, six each! You're both having sextuplets." Bianca concluded. "Six...Oh, god...what am I gonna tell Zack? Or my dad?" Chelsea asked.

"I'm sure they'll understand. Multiples are tough for any woman, but you and the babies are both in good enough shape to not worry about anything. Just relax." Bianca said, giving the two pregnant teens pamphlets. She bid Chelsea and Michelle farewell, and exited the room.

Jane was waiting outside, looking visibly nervous. "You wanted to talk to me, Jane?" Bianca asked. "I...I was wondering if you could give me an ultrasound?" Jane asked. "Sure. But only if you give me one, too." Bianca said.

Inside the cold examination room, Jane revealed her swollen belly to Bianca, which was previously hidden by her scrubs. Bianca conducted the ultrasound, and she herself was shocked at the results. "Jane...you're three months pregnant with octuplets!" Bianca exclaimed.

Bianca expected Jane to be in disbelief, but she was proven wrong when a smile slowly creeped across her face. "I...I can't believe it! My husband and I have been trying to have a baby for years, but the fertility experts said it wasn't possible!" Jane exclaimed, tears of joy streaming down her face.

"Congratulations, Jane. I guess we should find out how many buns are in my oven, huh?" Bianca asked, trading places with Jane. She rolled her shirt up, exposing her slightly protruding middle. "Well, you're about two months pregnant with quints. That's the same number of babies that Leslie's having, right? What are the odds of that?" Jane asked.

"After the past few days I've had, anything's possible." Bianca said, rubbing her belly.

"I can't believe we were right," Chelsea said, looking out across the football field while one hand traced her belly.

"Hey, we both denied it. And why wouldn't we?" Michelle said, rolling up her shirt with one hand while the other gripped a fast food burger. "It makes no sense that we'd get this pregnant this quickly. It doesn't even make sense that I'd get pregnant!"

"True," Chelsea nodded, eating a few fries while she looked down at her swollen middle. She, unlike Michelle, had been sexually active and she wondered whether the babies — the actual number she was carrying was still too much for her to wrap her head around — were Zack's or if they'd ended up in her womb some other way.

After their ultrasound, the two friends needed a quiet place to sit and take in what they'd learned about themselves. And after detour to satisfy their cravings, they went back to their high school and sat out on the bleachers. Football practice was already over and they had the whole place to themselves.

"Are you going to tell your dad and Zack?" Michelle asked, turning to Chelsea.

"I think my dad may already know. Or at least be suspicious," Chelsea sighed. "He saw the...the belly and it's not hard to figure out what's making it so big and round."

"So you think Zack already knows too?"

"No, he hasn't gotten a good look at it," Chelsea said, rubbing up and down her sides, feeling little vibrations of movement inside her. "Besides, he's...not really that smart so I don't know if he'd get the right idea at first."

Michelle gave a little laugh. "Anyone who dated Becky can't be that smart." She saw Chelsea's face start to grow more forlorn and scooted over. "H-hey, I didn't mean that to sound so mean, sorry."

"No, it's just...would he even stay with me when he finds out I'm pregnant?" Chelsea said, gripping the sides of her massive ball of tight flesh. "Or will he just go back to Becky?"

"C'mon, don't be like that," Michelle said, wrapping one arm around Chelsea's shoulders. "You two have been together for a long time and you go so well together. And if he would seriously leave you when you're pregnant with his kids, then...then good riddance! He was no good to begin with!"

"Thanks," Chelsea said in a tiny voice, trying to hold back tears.

"Besides, you still look totally hot," Michelle grinned. "I wish my pregnancy agreed with me as much as yours."

"Michelle, stop. You look great," Chelsea smiled, looking back at her friend. "Trust me. Any guy'd be lucky to have you."

Michelle rolled her eyes. "They'd have be be someone with a pregnancy fetish, if that kind of thing even exists."

"Oh, I'm sure," Chelsea snickered. "The Internet's full of people who are in to all kinds of stuff. You're probably someone's Marilyn Monroe."

"And with my luck, they don't go to our school," Michelle sighed, finishing off her burger and groaning. "Ugh, maybe we need some new clothes, Chelsea. I'm on the verge of needing to unzip these pants if we eat anymore. By tomorrow, I probably won't even fit in my own bed."

"Not to mention our prom dresses," Chelsea sighed. "We may have to get some new ones. I know we'd planned on renting those two but...there must be some others. We can't be the first pregnant girls to go to their high school prom."

Michelle chuckled and nodded. "Let's go there then. I want to look good for tonight if I'm going to be the Prom Queen's right-hand woman."

----

The two friends arrived at the mall's dress rental store, their faces bright red as they waddled up to the counter. "Hello," the young man there said with a smile. "How can I help you two?"

"We placed an order for prom dresses for tonight," Chelsea said.

"Right, tonight's the big night," the young man chuckled. "I go to Sunnydale too."

"You do?" Michelle said.

"Yeah, you're both on the cheerleading team. Chelsea and...Zoe, right?"

"I'm Michelle," Michelle said with a little smile, elbowing Chelsea. "Guess you're the famous one."

"I don't recognize you," Chelsea said.

"Yeah, not surprising," he laughed. "I kinda keep to myself. I'm Jonathan."

"Nice to meet you," Michelle grinned, the two of them meeting eyes.

"Anyway," Chelsea said, stepping between the two, "Jonathan, can you...keep a secret?"

"Sure," he shrugged. "I've talked to you two more than anyone else at school all year so I don't have many people to blab to."

"Michelle and I are," Chelsea cleared her throat. "p-pregnant."

Jonathan peered over the counter and his face turned red. "O-oh...yeah..."

"So the dresses we'd planned to rent probably won't be all that comfortable on us now," Chelsea said. "Do you have anything that'd...fit?"

"Yes, you're in luck," Jonathan said, hurrying from behind his counter to a back rack. "The Southdale High prom was a week ago and they also had quite a few p-pregnant students too and my manager ordered a bunch of maternity dresses." He took one long dark red dress off. "How does this look?"

"Not bad," Chelsea nodded, taking it from Jonathan. "I'll go try this on."

"Got another one like that?" Michelle asked with a little smile.

"Actually...I think this would look better on you," Jonathan said, handing Michelle a backless black dress with some reflective material around the shoulders and waist.

"Oh?" Michelle said, looking it over. "Well you're the expert here, I guess. At the homecoming tonight I'll have to see what you think of everyone else's outfits."

"I'm not going," Jonathan said with a nervous laugh. "I don't have anyone to go with."

"Hey, I don't have anyone either but I'm still going," Michelle smiled. "It's fun."

"Maybe...if you don't have someone...we could go together?" Jonathan said, his blush growing.

Michelle's cheeks got a little hot in return. "You'd want to be seen with me?"

"I should ask you the same thing about me," Jonathan smiled. "B-besides, with that dress on, you'd be the best looking girl at the dance. Don't tell your friend I said that."

"Michelle!" Chelsea called from the changing room. "Tell me how this looks, would ya?"

"H-here," Michelle said, shakily throwing her phone to Jonathan. "Put your number in, okay?"

"Okay," Jonathan nodded as Michelle waddled away. He looked around the store and sighed. "I guess I'll need to look up a tux rental store now."

Susan Brown ended her call with Grant Buckman and continued to stare at her figure in the mirror. For a 55 year old, she was in pretty good shape, as she did exercise every day before school began. But that was before she had become mysteriously pregnant.

Her breasts and butt had gotten larger, that was true, but her belly made her look seven months pregnant. And she was certain that she was pregnant. If the multiple positive pregnancy tests weren't a good enough indication, the kicks that she had been feeling this morning were all she needed.

In her grey spandex exercise outfit, her stomach looked more like a small moon than anything else. She was able to do a few basic exercises earlier, but didn't want to do anything too strenuous in an effort to not get her or whatever was quickly growing in her womb hurt. As far as Susan could tell, the easier workout did no harm.

Following her little meltdown yesterday afternoon, Susan went home and called her doctor to schedule an appointment. She was very vague about the reason for the appointment, and told the receptionist that she was having stomach problems, which was a bit of an understatement. Susan knew that if she told her doctor that she was pregnant, he'd never believe her.

Susan removed her spandex outfit and went to her closet. To her bemusement, nothing she owned fit. "Damn this all! I'm going to have to get some bigger clothes after the appointment!" she exclaimed, huffing as she felt kicking.

She decided to just wear a bra, which could barely contain her blossoming breasts, and a pair of underwear. Susan grabbed the largest coat she owned, which surprisingly hid her belly well. She headed out, nervous about the appointment.

Arriving to the doctor's office right on time, she checked in with the receptionist, her hands stuffed into her coat to hide her belly even more. "Alright, just take a seat and a nurse should be with you in a moment. Are those stomach problems persisting?" she asked.

"That's putting it lightly..." Susan muttered, taking a seat. A few minutes later, her name was called by a nurse, who had a burgeoning middle of her own. Susan followed her into a nearby examination room.

"Alright, Susan. Before Dr. Ponder can see you I need to take your weight. That coat looks like it'll add some weight to it, so would you mind removing it for me?" she asked.

"Uh...I'd rather not. Personal reasons." Susan replied, giving a nervous laugh. The nurse looked at her skeptically. "Alright, then. I won't pry any further. Step on the scale, please." the nurse said.

Susan obliged, and waited for the nurse to come to a conclusion. "That's...interesting. You've gained thirty pounds since your visit two months ago." the nurse noted. "R-really?" Susan asked. She knew that she had gained SOME weight with the pregnancy, but not that much. "Yeah. Must be all muscle, huh? The doctor will be with you shortly." the nurse said, leaving the room.

Following a brief wait, Dr. Ponder entered the room. She was a grey-haired woman in her early 60s, whom Susan considered to be an acquaintance. Not a friend, though. Susan was too busy for that.

"Alright, Susan. So you say you've been having stomach problems?" the doctor asked. "In a way, yes. But there was another reason why I scheduled the appointment. I'm pregnant." Susan said, fearing the response.

"Funny, Susan. Really, what's going on?" Dr. Ponder asked. "No, I am being serious. I am pregnant." she repeated. "I'm sorry, but that's not possible for a woman for your age. Especially since you've been through menopause. And, if you don't mind me asking, when was the last time you had sex?" she asked.

"Never. I'm a virgin. But I swear I am! Look!" Susan said, removing her coat to reveal her round belly to the doctor. "Oh...what the hell..." the doctor said. "So do you believe me now?" Susan asked.

"Lie back for one moment." the doctor said, as Susan did so. Dr. Ponder began to feel Susan's belly, noticing how firm it was. This continued for a while, until kicking emitted from her pregnant belly, making the doctor gasp in shock. "Excuse me for one moment." Dr. Ponder said, obviously shaken up at the whole predicament.

She returned a few moments later with an ultrasound machine. "I have no idea how this happened, but we're going to see what's really going on." Dr. Ponder said, starting the process. She maneuvered the wand around Susan's taut belly for a minute or two.

"Oh my god..." Dr. Ponder trailed, her jaw dropped. "What? Is the baby alright?" Susan asked. "Susan, it isn't just one baby. You're having triplets!" the doctor stated.

"Triplets? Three?!?" Susan asked. She knew that she was pregnant, as it was impossible to ignore, but three babies at her age was going to be hard to handle. "It looks like it. All boys. I'd say you're roughly five months along." she said.

The doctor handed her a few pamphlets to Susan, and sent her on her way. Susan drove home in stunned silence. When she got home, she pulled out some ice cream from the fridge and began to eat, hating that she was giving into her craving. She ate most of the carton, and was interrupted when she heard the front door open.

"Susan?" a voice called out, who she recognized as Grant's. "In the kitchen." she said, continuing to eat. "Sorry for coming by uninvited, but I wanted to talk more about...Susan?" Grant said, surprised at her lack of clothing.

"Talk about Xpect? Sure, why not?" Susan said, turning around to reveal her pregnancy to Grant, who gasped in shock. "Uhh...belly..." was all Grant could say.

"Great observation skills, Grant! If you couldn't tell, I'm pregnant. And guess what? I'm having triplets! And I'm 55! Isn't that great?" Susan shouted.

"Did...I pick a bad time to stop by?" Grant asked. "That would be a wise deduction. Leave. Now." Susan said, ushering Grant out of the house.

Susan was left alone in her house, barely clothed, and to top it all off was five months pregnant with triplets. To put it bluntly, she needed somebody so she wouldn't feel so alone. Waddling over to her couch, she picked up her phone and dialed Grant's number, hoping that he would come back.

"You sure you're going to be okay?" Michelle asked as she looked out the car window at Chelsea. Her friend nodded silently while she clutched her big pregnant belly and Michelle smiled back. "I'm sure he'll understand. You've got a cool dad."

"Yeah," Chelsea said in a quiet voice, not fully convinced by Michelle's characterization. "I guess I'll see you at the dance."

"Yep and hopefully I'll have someone with me too," Michelle grinned. Chelsea smiled back, glad Michelle managed to find someone recently. She waved as her friend drove away and took in a big breath and walked back into the house. Chelsea's father was still sitting in the living room and he had a frustrated look on his face when he saw his pregnant daughter waddle back inside.

"Hi dad," Chelsea said weakly, one hand against her round stomach. With her top, about half of her belly was still visible.

"Chelsea, I need to talk with you," he said sternly.

Chelsea nodded and waddled into the room to see him, choosing to stand instead of sit down, since she knew once she got down it was hard to get up. "I wanted to talk with you too, dad. As you can probably see...I'm-"

"Chelsea, tell me it's not true," he said, cutting her off. "Tell me it's some sort of prank or some weight gain or the school is having you wear a fake belly as part of health class."

"I wish it wasn't real," Chelsea said, rolling up her shirt to reveal her entire bare, smooth belly. "But it is. Dad, I'm pregnant."

Her father buried his face in his hands, letting out a long sigh. "How did you keep it hidden from me for so long? I've seen you before and you didn't look like...like this."

"I don't know," Chelsea said, her lips starting to wobble as she got worked up. "It just appeared over the last few days."

"Chelsea, don't lie to me," her father grumbled.

"I'm not! I'm as confused by this as you are," Chelsea said, now holding both hands against her belly as she felt movement inside her. "Great, now they're starting to kick."

"They?" Her father said, clearing his throat. He knew his daughter looked a little too big, but still, he wasn't expecting twins. "How many are you carrying?"

"Michelle and I got our ultrasounds today," Chelsea said, biting her lip to keep it from shaking. "We're having sextuplets."

"Michelle too?" her father said. "Wait...sextuplets?" If he'd been standing up, he'd have fallen into his seat by now.

"Like I said dad, I don't understand a lot of this," Chelsea said.

"Do you use protection when you have sex?" her father asked.

Chelsea froze and hesitated before responding. "N-not always."

"Chelsea, I told you to be careful. I wish you were still my little girl but I know you're becoming a woman so I want you to have a healthy emotional life but you have to be responsible."

"But Michelle is pregnant and she's still a virgin!" Chelsea yelled. "And Mary and Abigail too! And a lot of teachers at school are pregnant! Something weird is going on!"

"I don't want to hear any excuses for right now!" her father barked back. "I said you have to be responsible. Have you thought about how you'd raise the babies?"

Chelsea sighed. "No."

"Does the father even know?"

"No."

Her father groaned and gripped his temples. "If your mother was here-"

Now Chelsea began to sob and ran to the stairs. "Don't bring mom into this!"

Chelsea slammed the door to her room and cried and cried, her hands clutching her pregnant belly. Quickly, she stripped out of her regular clothes and stood in front of the mirror, gazing at her belly. In just a few days, she'd been transformed into a new, maternal woman with a swollen middle that seemed impossibly big. And she had the sense that it would only get bigger as the days went on. And at the end, Chelsea would be a mother. It was all so strange and, in a way, too much to handle.

She unwrapped her prom dress and slipped it on. Like Jonathan had told her at the rental store, it looked beautiful on her but Chelsea also noticed one thing: it didn't full fit her. A sliver of Chelsea's pregnant belly still stuck out. Chelsea began to cry again as she clutched her hands to her eyes.

"Why did I have to get pregnant? Why did all this chaos have to come into my life?" Chelsea cursed.

"Chelsea?" her father said at the door, knocking lightly. Chelsea turned around and waited. "Are you there?"

"I'm here," Chelsea scoffed back. "What do you want?"

"I just want to talk," he said. "Please, sweetie."

Chelsea stood and thought about it for a moment before waddling over and opening the door. "What?"

Chelsea's angry face went away when she saw that her father had also been crying. "Chelsea, when I brought up mom, I didn't mean to shame you. I just meant she'd know just what to do say. Much better than I could."

Chelsea wiped her eyes. "C'mon dad, I understand how you must feel. No one wants their teenage daughter to end up pregnant."

"But she'd still help you out to be a mother. And in a way, she'd actually be proud of you," he smiled. "Here, I want you to have this."

Chelsea gasped when her father handed her a framed picture of Chelsea's mother when she was pregnant.

"I wanted to give this to you as a graduation present but I thought, considering what's happening-"

Chelsea hugged her father tightly, tears streaming down her face. "Thank you, dad. Really."

"You're welcome, Chelsea," he said, hugging her back, feeling his grandchildren kick against him. "And if you say a lot of other kids are mysteriously pregnant, I think I'll have a talk with the school."

"Okay dad," Chelsea said, rolling her eyes with a smile. "You do what you can."

"And you look very nice in your dress," her father smiled. Chelsea giggled and closed the door before turning to the mirror and running her hands down her sides. Even with the little bit of belly showing, Chelsea had to agree. She looked good.

Abigail and Mary sat on a bench in the park, secluded from anyone else, as their hands nervously clutched their pregnant middles. "What do you think?" Abigail finally said after a while.

"I think I find it hard to believe that there's that many babies inside my belly," Mary said as she looked down at her belly. "Then again, I always found it hard to believe one baby could fit inside a pregnant woman anyway."

"Not about that!" Abigail snapped. "I mean, yes, about that, but it's much more. What are we going to do with these babies when they're born? How are we going to take care of them?"

"And what will happen to the two of us?" Mary said quietly.

"What do you mean?" Abigail said, starting to blush.

"You know," Mary said, reaching one hand over to rest over Abigail's. "What will happen to us?" Abigail moved her hand away from Mary's and looked away. "Oh…I thought we were-"

"I know, I know," Abigail sighed. "But it's still hard for me. All my life I thought and believed this kind of relationship was wrong but now…" She looked down at her belly. "Maybe all these babies is God's way of punishing me."

"So now babies are punishments? That's a new one," Mary giggled but she saw that Abigail was only looking more distressed. "Look, Abigail, I like you a lot and I know you feel the same way. We'll find some way to stay together."

"Even raising these babies?" Abigail said, turning back to Mary.

"I'm sure our parents would help us. My mom raised me and my siblings so how much harder can 10 or more babies be?" Mary said. Abigail was about to correct her new lover but just rolled her eyes instead, choosing to avoid the hassle of explaining things to Mary.

It was 9:00 on a Sunday night when Lindsay Walker sat down to grade her 4th graders' papers from the weekend. Actually grading the papers didn't take too long, but she liked to make comments or suggestions on them, often encouraging, and that ate the bulk of her grading time. Her husband Carl was still in Europe. He was the top salesman for his firm, and any major potential client, local, national, or international, he was often the first one to be sent over. They did miss each other, but Carl always loved traveling and Lindsay could immerse herself in her work with her students, and both found their careers rewarding.

It had been a short weekend and Lindsay was not exactly looking forward to the upcoming week. There would be a parent-teacher meeting on Wednesday, but her school was not a large one, and the parents mostly good-natured folks, that that would actual be a relaxing way to spend the Wednesday afternoon. It meant that she had to finish her grading tonight or risk lazily doing it tomorrow before school. Lindsay was so focused on this that she didn't hear the door open downstairs, her husband dropping his bags by the door and then walking upstairs slowly and quietly, perhaps thinking she might be asleep or dozing off.

Lindsay was 36, the same age as her husband minus a few months, and had been teaching middle school since she had graduated college at 22. She was a smart, patient, and confident teacher, traits that made her match for her sometimes rambunctious students. She was also stunningly beautiful, having long, wavy red hair, smooth pale skin, and a slim, toned figure that had hardly changed since high school. Her husband, himself moderately attractive if starting to show he was nearing middle age, never got tired of seeing her after a long trip.

He found her falling asleep over the papers.

"You're not one of those teachers that assigns homework over the weekend, are you?" he said, leaning against the doorway crossing his arms and holding a bag.

"Wha?" Lindsay blinked and yawned, then stood smiling broadly when she saw him. "You weren't supposed to be coming back until tomorrow."

"We closed the deal early, and they've got another big contract in Buffalo they wanted me to come home to HQ so I can head out there next week. Also, hi!" they embraced, ending with a tired but thankful kiss.

"Well, I'm glad you made it back," Lindsay said, sitting back down again, yawning louder this time. "I was just grading papers. The big PTA meeting is on Wednesday so I won't have time then."

"Oh yeah, those," Carl said, taking off his blazer and tossing it messily onto the closet floor, "I don't believe you, by the way. I don't think any parent that actual goes to a PTA meeting is there for anything other than having some kind of soccer mom power trip."

Lindsay smirked. "They're not like that there. Mostly, at least." She yawned, stretching her whole body. Carl looked her over, admiringly. If he hadn't just gotten off of a fourteen hour flight he could have gone some good married sex right about then. Maybe tomorrow, he thought with a self-approving nod.

"What are you looking at?" Lindsay asked, curious.

"Hey, I got you some things."

"Yay!"

"First, this is some kind of antique ring I found in a store that the CEO over there kept talking about. The owner assures me it's not cursed, but he kept winking at me as he said it so I'm not sure I believe him."

"It's lovely," Lindsay said, taking it in her hand. She tried it on to see if it fit, flashed it at her husband, and then put it safely away in her jewelry box to wear on some other occasion perhaps.

"And this, uh, well, this I just picked up over there. It's not for sale here yet. It's supposed to be an energy drink that's not horribly unhealthy for you."

He handed Lindsay a tall can. It was mostly plain, except for the words XPect printed in stylized font on it. Lindsay had a weakness for coffee with a lot of sugar, soda, and energy drinks. She avoided them for health reasons, but every one in a while if she just had to be up late or couldn't get started in the morning, she'd give in. A healthy energy drink, while a somewhat weird gift to most wives, was actual somewhat thoughtful in this case.

"Aw, thank you," she said, taking it and popping the top. "I still have a good two hours to go here, I'll need it."

"Two hours?" Carl said with a mock sneer, "Yeah, good luck with that." He turned to go to bed. Lindsay grabbed his hand playfully and stood up to kiss him good night.

"I know, you just had a long flight."

"Sure did. I'm hitting the sack," Carl said, walking out of the room. "Feel free to wake me when you come in, though."

"Ha ha," Lindsay turned and went back to her papers. She sniffed the drink. It was lightly carbonated, but didn't have any real discernible soda. She took a sip.

"Mm," she said after a tiny sip. There was a hint of bitterness to it. She continued writing on the papers and then took a larger gulp. This time the bitterness was almost overpowering. She swallowed, but gagged, coughing a little. Giving it just one more chance, she drank a few more sips slowly, probably finishing half the can.

She regretted it immediately. Her face contorted as an inadvisable combination of sourness and bitterness filled her mouth. She set the can aside shaking her head. It might be healthy, but nobody was going to drink this disgusting thing. It didn't taste good to begin with, and tasted even worse when combined with its own awful aftertaste. Lindsey turned back to her papers, her hand rubbing her flat stomach as it gurgled a little.

Guuuuurgle-glump!

It felt like it was trying to turn over, leap upward, and jump out of her all at once. With another sickening groan welling up inside her, it was the leaping upward part that now concerned her. Lindsay sprang to her feet, still crouching forward, and hobbled to the office bathroom. She fell to her knees and vomited into the toilet without hesitation.

She remained with her face over it for a few moments, occasionally another surge of bubbling nausea welled up inside her, and she found herself again throwing up. She wrapped her arms tightly around her stomach. It was still squirming inside her, but the sick feeling was going away. After a half hour of vomiting, dry heaving, and finally just waiting, Lindsay stood up, drank some water, and went back to her desk.

Breathing heavily, her stomach finally returned to normal, mostly. Of course it wasn't going to feel perfect after that, but it didn't feel quite right. She massaged her tummy, which was still groaning and hiccuping a little.

"I am not pregnant," Lindsay hissed as they left the building, wanting to say something nasty about the doctor but not willing to give it more effort than unintelligible mutterings.

"I know, I know, you know ho these doctors are, they think everyone's pregnant."

Lindsay rubbed her stomach in frustration, feeling much more angry and, to her own surprise, on the verge of tears. She was never this emotional, certainly about some perceived slight. It must be because she was still getting used to the idea that she had gained weight, she reasoned, calming herself down. The realization was so sudden that of course she'd feel off kilter, especially how all around awful she had been feeling the last few days. Ever since she had that XPect . . .

"I'm just not used to to . . . to this," Lindsay said, sniffling a little as she placed her hands on her swollen middle. She was embarrassed both for how she felt now and for nearly lashing out at Amy's doctor. "I'm sorry, Amy. I've been so off lately. I was sick after that drink the other night and ever since then, with work and how much I've been eating . . ."

Amy patted Lindsay on the back. "It's okay, I know it's rough. Want to go back to my place?"
14423111121222121.title: Day three goes on

choices: Lindsay is able to sleep for most of the night
Lindsay can't get comfortable enough to sleep
144231111212221211.content:
"I...I don't think so, Amy. Sorry, but I'm just not feeling well. I'll see you tomorrow." Lindsay said. Amy nodded. "Okay. Hope you feel better." Amy said, going in for a hug.

Lindsay hesitated, then begrudgingly hugged her friend. Their stomachs collided, preventing them from fully embracing. Amy looked down at Lindsay's belly, and nearly gasped as she saw how big it had gotten since yesterday. She frowned, but decided that it was best to not bring it up due to Lindsay's current mood.

The two bid farewell, and went their separate ways. Lindsay returned home, anxious to see how Carl would react to her growth. She pulled into the driveway and headed inside slowly, partly out of choice, and partly because of how weighed down she felt. No matter, she entered the house and was greeted by Carl, who was sitting on the couch.

"Hey babe." he said, his eyes not straying from the TV. "Hey. Gonna get changed real quick." Lindsay said, quickly going up the stairs. She shimmied out of her skirt and walked up to the mirror so it would be easier for her to see the buttons on her blouse. What she saw shocked her. Her blouse, fairly loose at the beginning of the day, was now tight, straining the buttons.

Lindsay unbuttoned the blouse as fast as she could, fearing that if she grew any more the buttons would burst. She looked at her bare belly in the mirror, turning to see how much it had grown. Not only had it continued to push out, but Lindsay could swear that it was beginning to become rounder. If she didn't know any better, she'd say she looked like Amy did when she was nearly six months pregnant. Lindsay shuddered at that thought, desperately trying to find something that would cover up her stomach.

She put on a pair of sweatpants, which hugged the curves of her rear a bit more than she would have liked, and put on one of Carl's t-shirts. Normally it would be incredibly loose on her, but now it was pushed out by her round stomach. Shaking her head, Lindsay returned to the living room to properly greet Carl.

"How was your day?" he asked as she sat down on the couch next to him, crossing her arms over her belly. "Not great. Still feeling kinda weird. But it's the same old same old. Oh, I did go with Amy to her ultrasound appointment today." Lindsay said.

"Really? How was that?" he asked, raising an eyebrow. "It was...interesting, I guess. You won't believe how big she's gotten, though. God, it's like she's smuggling a beach ball in her womb." she scoffed.

"Well, damn. I hope you aren't saying those kinds of things to her face. So...you've kinda been doing a bunch of pregnancy related stuff with Amy lately, haven't you? What's up with that?" Carl asked.

"I don't know. I guess she needs some help with things since she's sort of getting close to her due date now." Lindsay said. "I guess so. Anyway, I was going to make dinner soon. I was planning on making pasta..." Carl said, trailing off to give Lindsay input.

"Ooh, I was kind of wanting steak..." Lindsay said. "Steak? I thought you didn't like steak. When we went to that steakhouse for our first date you got a burger." Carl pointed out.

"Yeah, I know. I...guess I'm craving it." she said, giving him a weak smile. "Fine. I'll be right back." he said, pulling out his phone to call the aforementioned steakhouse as he left the house.

Lindsay was left alone with a growling and growing stomach, a deadly combination. Trying to fend off her hunger, she went and got her laptop, looking up her curious symptoms. Normally, she would rest the laptop in her lap, but now she had to rest it on her legs as her belly impeded her lap. As she surfed the web, she subconsciously rubbed the bottom of her belly.

She typed in her symptoms: growing stomach and breasts, constant hunger, nausea, and hit enter. There was one solution to her search: pregnancy. "It's not possible..." she said. She removed some of the symptoms, and just left in "growing stomach" and "constant hunger". There were a few more results, including weight gain, a tapeworm, or a hysterical pregnancy. "Maybe..." Lindsay trailed.

Deciding that a web source couldn't diagnose her problems, she closed her laptop and turned the TV on. She was distracted for a while, but as her stomach rumbled more loudly and frequently, she couldn't ignore it anymore. Lindsay walked to the kitchen, looking for anything to quench her appetite. By now, it was nearly 8:30, and she couldn't wait any longer.

She grabbed a bag of potato chips and began to eat them. However, this wasn't quite what she was looking for. Lindsay returned to the cabinet and pulled out some nutella, which she began to dip the chips in. In no time, she went through half the bag. She was interrupted by Carl returning. "Sorry about the wait! The place was packed. Oh, and I saw the principal there! She said hell-"

He entered the kitchen and stopped when saw his wife. "Couldn't wait, huh?" he laughed. "Sorry...I got hungry." Lindsay said. "It's fine! As long as you eat your meal..."

This wouldn't be a problem. Lindsay ate her steak in record time, and continued her conquest on her baked potato. Carl just stared in awe. Lindsay noticed after she finished her meal. "So...babe." she said. "Yeah?" he asked. "Do you...think I could have the rest of your steak?" she asked.

Carl looked down at this plate, and he had only eaten half of the steak. "Sure. I still have the baked potato to eat. He passed it over to his wife, and she began to chow down. Lindsay finished the rest of the steak before Carl was done. She stifled a burp, and looked down at her stomach. Lindsay could have sworn that it grew again, which greatly upset her.

"I-I need to go to the restroom." she said, hurrying to the bathroom upstairs. She locked the door behind her and pulled up her shirt, getting a good luck at her growing belly. Indeed, it had grown again, and she looked well over six months pregnant. At this sight, she began to cry.

Carl heard her, and approached the bathroom door, trying to open the door before realizing that it was locked. He knocked on the door. "Linds..." he said.
"What?" Lindsay asked. "Let me in. I want to talk to you." he said. He heard a few sniffles before the door unlocked.

Inside, he saw his wife, or to be more precise, her belly. "So...what's wrong?" he asked. "What's wrong? Do you see me? Do you see THIS?" she asked, pointing to her bared belly.

"Honey, you've just put on some weight. That's all. I mean, you're close to 40. You couldn't have stayed young and slim forever. Neither of us could." Carl said, putting his hand on her shoulder.

Lindsay shook her head. "So I'm fat? Thanks, you ass! And I would think that a fat stomach would be flabby and soft. Not...like this." she said. "I'm sorry. I just...think that's what's happen-" "Feel it." Lindsay said.

"What?" Carl asked. "Feel my stomach." she repeated. "I...okay." he said. He put his hand on Lindsay's belly, noticing how hard it was. "So what? You had like two steaks, a baked potato, and half a bag of chips. You're just bloated. What, do you think you're pregnant or something? We tried for years. We know it can't happen." Carl said.

"No, I know. It's just...I guess I am putting on weight." Lindsay sighed. "Hey, how about we start working out together? We can start tonight!" Carl offered. "Not tonight. I'm really tired." she said. "Tomorrow?" Carl asked. "Well, I have the parent-teacher conferences. Maybe if I'm still up for it after we can do it." Lindsay said.

"Great. That belly will go away in no time!" he said, patting Lindsay's stomach. She couldn't help but smile. "Good night." she said, playfully smacking him with one hand and pulling her shirt down with the other. "Night. I have to take a business call, so I'll get to bed when I'm done." Carl said. Lindsay nodded and headed to bedroom.

Lindsay slipped under the covers and tried to sleep, but she was surprisingly hot. She tore off the covers, which made her a little more comfortable. Lindsay shifted to her side, as the weight of her belly was beginning to get uncomfortable. Finally in a position to sleep, she shut her eyes, but opened her eyes when she began to feel an odd sensation in her stomach, a gassy, almost wiggling feeling. "I guess that's what happens when I eat so much this late." she muttered.

Lindsay rubbed her round belly, hoping that this would quell the feeling. It did, but without thought she still rubbed her stomach as she drifted to sleep.
144231111212221211.title: No, Lindsay has to get home

choices: Lindsay sticks it out and goes to the parent-teacher conference that night
Lindsay gives up and goes home, bloated and defeated
1442311112122212111.content:
Surprisingly, Lindsay fell asleep easily once she was able to turn to her side and let her stuffed belly rest, but it was a fitful sleep. She dreamed of being compelled to eat nonstop, of busting buttons and tearing clothes, of her slim coworkers snickering about her weight behind her back. When the alarm finally woke her, Lindsay awoke in no better mood. Slowly, with more effort than she was used to, she rose from her bed and wandered to the bathroom.

My new morning ritual, she thought as she turned to the mirror with her hands cradling her belly. It hard grown since last night, no doubt about it. She still felt full from her meal, which explained why it still felt full and tight, and not flabby as she knew it normally must be now. Her breasts might be larger, they certainly felt heavier, almost full as her stomach. With a grimace she realized that her belly now outgrew her breasts by a good margin.

She wanted to be comfortable, so despite believing that it would be another blow to her self esteem she decided on jeans for the day. Happily, they fit, but buttoning them was uncomfortable. Her belly sat heavily upon the button, even if she was pleased that she could still fit her good jeans over her hips and ass. She struggled with her bra, then threw on a stylish, clingy shirt. It was outfit she always liked. She thought she looked particularly sexy in it. Not today, though. The front was stretched to its limit, barely covering her belly, and the seams at the side felt like they could bust open at any moment. For her own security she threw a cardigan on over it, but knew she would be unable to button it.

She was walking slower now, she knew, but today she thought her belly was actually pulling her forward. Her back ached, and a few times she caught herself rubbing her curved back as she walked like she really was pregnant. She pushed the thought out of her mind, but didn't even bother trying to stop her hands from rubbing her back, or even her taut, round stomach. She felt an occasional bubble of gas inside her, but no burps came to relieve her.

Lindsay arrived in the teachers' lounge before anyone that morning. That worked out, as she was able to grab more snacks than she thought she'd be able to eat before anybody saw her. When Amy came waddling in, she was already seated and surrounded by wrappers.

"You look awful," Amy said sympathetically, putting a hand on her arm as she sat across from her.

"I know. I'm a whale. I feel like I can barely walk," Lindsay spoke calmly, if sadly, and Amy could tell she was somewhat resigned if only temporarily. "Carl and I are going to start working out."

"That's good . . . " Amy peered around the table with narrowed eyes, which widened as she saw Lindsay's belly packed into her too tight shirt. "Oh my god, Lindsay."

Lindsay glared at her, "Don't even say it. I know what I look like, okay?"

Other teachers had started to arrive by now. They were quieter than usual, some seemed to be in a particularly sour mood. Maria sidled up to Lindsay and Amy. Lindsay thought she looked just as tired and stressed as her. But there was something else. The curvy but slim older woman had, like Lindsay, put on some weight. Lindsay might otherwise not have noticed, even if it was pretty obvious. She felt some sadistic pleasure in knowing she wasn't the only one whose youthful metabolism was failing her, even if Principal Donner had a good twenty years on her. Her slacks and buttoned dress shirt were stretched tautly across her round stomach, which she kept rubbing as if afraid it would get bigger if she didn't.

"Lindsay. Amy," she said, "Have you give any thought to the-"

"Yeah, we know, the spelling bee," Gary, sitting a table behind them, suddenly snapped, "We know all about the spelling bee, we're not going to just conjure better spelling students out of thin air if you keep nagging us about it."

Maria, looking eager to have some to lash out at, turned to Gary and spoke in her most authoritative voice, "This is important for the image and welfare of the school, Gary. I thought you'd be a little more concerned given how your students' test scores have been lately."

Gary rolled his eyes and stood up to continue the argument, "Don't start telling me about test scores . . ."

"Let's get out of here," Amy said. Lindsay wolfed down her last candy bar and followed Amy. As she did so, she got a clear view of Amy's colossal ass and hips, and noticed the swaying movement they made as she walked. She inwardly moaned. Amy was waddling, and Lindsay could recognize that own unfamiliar sway of her hips as the start of the same walk.

They left the teachers lounge listening to other teachers get into the argument, both for and against the principal. As they did so, Lindsay nearly ran into Pamela.

"Welcome back," Lindsay said in an offhand manner, "Feeling better?"

"Not really," Pamela said quietly. The slight young woman was hunched over, her arms folded across her, Lindsay noticed, swollen chest. The baggy sweater she wore couldn't hide that her stomach was pooching out some, too. Lindsay almost said something, almost even made a mental connection, but Pamela kept walking, her eyes on the ground.

"Huh," Lindsay said.

"Pamela's put on some weight, it looks like," Amy said, then turned to Lindsay with a start, changing the subject, "So see you at lunch?"

"Yeah, sure," Lindsay said. The two parted ways to class.

As before, class was more frustrating than the day before. Tests were being given today, which meant Lindsay had to walk up and down the aisles as her students worked, to help and to prevent cheating. They were generally good kids, but it still happened. Walking down the aisles proved embarrassingly difficult for Lindsay. Throughout her whole teaching career she had taken for granted that her slim figure made the task easy. Now, there were complications. The first time she turned at the front of the class to walk down the next aisle of desks her belly grazed the desk, knocking a young boy's book off. She blushed, smiled, apologized, and the kids laughed, but Lindsay became even more self conscious than she already was. Not only was her belly bumping into desks and students, but her her gate had changed enough that walking without banging her hips into the desks was impossible. They weren't much wider than usual, but she was swaying more with each step and didn't know her own girth.

Eventually Lindsay had to sit down. Her feet, her back, the stretched skin of her belly and breasts, were becoming agonizing. She soothingly massaged her belly, not caring if the whole class saw her. Her fingers kept catching her her belly button. Even under her shirt was visible, but not deep like she would have thought. It was starting to pop out, no doubt from her overindulgence lately.

By lunch, Lindsay had had it. She was ready to call it a day, to leave, maybe go home and sulk, or even go to a doctor like Amy kept suggesting. She didn't think she could put up with another few hours of this.
1442311112122212111.title: Teachers' lounge tempers

choices: Lindsay goes off on the annoying soccer mom
Lindsay restrains herself
14423111121222121111.content:
Lindsay suffered through the next few hours. She walked among the students less, and snapped at them when she did. She couldn't go more than a few feet without her belly bumping into something. She grew overheated quickly, eventually removing her cardigan. She regretted it, as without that buffer her belly looked even bigger. She couldn't help but constantly repeat to herself how huge she was, how fat she had been getting, so much so that it was getting awkward to even walk around. She absolutely refused to think of her belly as anything but a big ball of fat that ruined her figure. That the rest of her, other than her breasts, hadn't grown was kept safely out of mind.

At lunch, she entered the teachers' lounge to some stares from her co-workers. She blushed, staring at the floor and, consequently, her belly. She tugged at her shirt. Did it get even tighter? Or, she reconsidered the thought, had she gotten even bigger since she put it on?

Apparently so, according to Amy's look as Lindsay sat next to her after slowly lumbering over to get some food.

"Oh my god, Lindsay," Amy said, staring in shock at her stomach. "Are you bigger since this morning?"

Rather than get angry, Lindsay sunk lower in her seat as her giant belly would allow, as she began cramming food into her mouth as fast as she could.

"Lindsay, you need to see a doctor."

"She's just going to tell me to lose weight," Lindsay said, barely glancing at her friend, "And I tell myself that enough."

"Okay, okay," Amy said soothingly. She gently placed a hand on Lindsay's belly. It was hard and firm, more than her own which had her significant pregnancy weight added to its size. Lindsay shuddered and turned to her, speaking more calmly than she usually did.

"Please don't do that, it makes me feel like a giant pregnant woman."

Amy removed her hand. "You need to see a doctor."

"If working out with Carl doesn't work to shrink me down to normal I will, okay?"

"Okay . . ." Amy looked for a new topic, "Are you ready for the PTA meeting tonight?"

"Sure I'm ready," Lindsay said, getting a little worked up, "Ready for a bunch of obnoxious yuppies to come in and tell me how to do my job even though they can't raise their own kids right? I don't go into their homes and tell them how to parent, why do they think they can come here and tell me how to teach?"

Amy looked a little surprised by Lindsay's response, but not too much given her mood lately.

"Well, we do work for them, really. It's a good way to improve."

"They don't have any idea what we do here. I don't think it's right letting them come here and talk down to us like they have more experience with children than they do. We're with them all day for most days, I think we know a little better than them how to teach children."

Lindsay, who had shoveled in nearly her entire piled on tray of food, stood up, bumping her belly into the table.

"Oof," she stumbled back a little, standing straight, arching her back and rubbing it gently. The entire lounge saw just how pregnant she looked now. "Need to use the restroom."

As Lindsay left, Gary looked over to Amy.

"Hey, Amy. So Lindsay is pregnant, isn't she?"

"She hasn't mentioned anything about going on maternity leave," Maria said, her hand, as it often was now, pressed firmly into her recently swollen tummy.

"She must be due soon, like in a month or two?" Pamela added.

Amy smiled awkwardly. She felt like an idiot telling her what Lindsay told her.

"I don't know what to tell you. Lindsay says she's not pregnant."

Gary laughed. "Yeah, sure she's not."

"Is it just, you know, weight gain?" Pamela asked. Amy shrugged. Lindsay's belly and breasts were getting huge but the rest of her was perfectly trim as always. If it wasn't pregnancy, Amy couldn't tell what it could be.

Lindsay's lunch didn't satisfy her for long. Her stomach rumbled the rest of the day. By the time classes let out, and she prepared to go meet the parents of her students, she was famished. She grabbed some snacks from a vending machine and ate them on the spot, watching her bloated reflection in the glass. She didn't know whether to be frustrated or depressed at the image.

She didn't have time to chat with Amy before the conference. She slowly made her way to the gymnasium where it was being held. In the past she wasn't keen on having to straight from teaching to talking to parents, but today she was glad the PTA was holding their meeting right after classes. It would get it over with. She was especially glad it was more of an informal meet-and-greet rather than a meeting with a agenda where things would be discussed in an orderly fashion, as Maria always wanted to do. The other teachers uniformly shut that idea down whenever Maria brought it up.

A crowd was something Lindsay never thought would be any kind of problem for her to maneuver through. And, through her entire life of being a petite and thin woman, it never was. But now, every time she turned she bumped into somebody or almost did. She mentally prepared a strategy for walking across the room. When she realized that she now had to maneuver herself like an ungainly ship in a dock, she placed her hands on her belly and growled quietly. At least so far, she had managed to avoid talking to the any of the parents. She was making her way to some more vending machines to calm her roaring stomach.

"Hello, Ms. Walker!"

They were the two friendly voices of the Levins, parents of Jessica, one of Lindsay's best students. Lindsay stopped in her tracks and slowly turned, making sure not to bump her belly into the wall. The Levins' faces told her they were surprised by her new, rounder look, but they said nothing. They were all around pleasant people, as much so as their daughter.

"We just want to say how proud we are of Jessica, she is doing really well in your class," he said.

"And don't think we don't know you have a lot to do with that!" Ms. Levin said with a knowing smile and pointing a finger at Lindsay.

"Thank you," Lindsay said, eager to get to more food, "Thank you so much. She's a, ah, she's a great student. I'm glad to have her in my class."

"And we're glad you're her teacher," Mr. Levin said, looking thoughtful, "You know, she was kind of a late bloomer, didn't really get into the whole education thing under after other kids . . ."

Lindsay felt her stomach turn with hunger. She rubbed her belly, again bemoaning how tight her already overly tight shirt had gotten. She must look like a stuffed sausage in her outfit, she thought, and still her biggest concern was filling her stomach even further.

"Excuse me," Lindsay said meekly after the proud parents spoke for a minute, she turned without hesitating further and made a beeline for the vending machines in the corner of the room. Her belly nudged a few on the way, but only she minded. The other parents there just seemed to accept that Ms. Walker now needed a wider berth than she used to. As Lindsay crammed a couple of candy bars into her mouth hiding in the corner, hoping to do it quickly just to hold her over, she detected someone approaching. She was about to sit down in a chair as her feet, back, legs, really her whole body, was painfully aching after a day of standing.

"Ms. Walker, can I have a word?" the words were obnoxiously formal and condescending, and they came from a woman who was around eight months pregnant, but otherwise slim and in good shape. Lindsay glared. I'm as big as a pregnant woman now, she thought sadly. Even if she didn't already dislike Eileen Kamisky, mother of class part-time troublemaker Danny, she now felt another source of anger at the woman.

"Sure, of course," Lindsay said.

"I think Danny needs more attention. He's a smart boy, you know, who just doesn't always think before he acts. I think he would really benefit from some extra attention from you, do you think?"

"All my students are important to me, Ms. Kamisky," Lindsay said with barely disguised disdain. She found herself staring at the woman's large belly, her hands listlessly rubbing it, and Lindsay didn't even realize that her own hands were now doing the same thing.

"Oh, but Danny's a special child, don't you think? He's so creative. I don't think you're fueling his creativity enough. Can you think of more ways to fuel his creativity?" Lindsay developed an sudden dislike for the words 'fuel' and 'creativity' based solely on hearing them repeated by Ms. Kamisky. "His creativity needs to be fueled."

Of course! It was so obvious. Lindsay forced a fake smile as she realized the best form of defense against overbearing soccer moms.

"You are absolutely right, Ms. Kamisky," Lindsay said, implying she agreed all along. "I can think of some special projects for some of the more gifted students in my class which Danny would be perfect to take part in."

Ms. Kamisky beamed, feeling she had done her job and happy to be sucked up to. "That's wonderful, Ms. Walker, simply wonderful!"

Lindsay breathed a sigh of relief. It looked like Ms. Walker was leaving. Before she did, she gave a half turn back to Lindsay.

"And congratulations!" she said loudly.

"On what?" Lindsay said, confused, her hand resting on top of her tight, round belly.

"On your pregnancy of course."

Lindsay blushed, narrowed her eyes, and clenched her fists. Her first response was to start going off on this annoying woman, and her better judgment on had seconds to reel her in.
14423111121222121111.title: Lindsay still isn't pregnant

choices: Lindsay goes home and works out with Carl, or tries to
Lindsay goes home and continues to eat the night away
144231111212221211111.content:
Lindsay snapped. She stormed the few feet to Eileen Kamisky so quicky their bellies grazed each other. She was livid, her words coming out in angry spurts.

"I'm not pregnant. I can't get pregnant. But if I was pregnant at least it would give me an excuse to tell you and your lazy, entitled, idiotic soccer mom friends how to raise your own kids right since I don't think any of you know the first thing about children. But you still think you can tell me how to teach them. I have more experience with them than any of you do, and I don't need you to tell me your kid is special. Every kid is special and every parent comes here thinking theirs is better than the rest. But they're not, and neither is yours. Your son doesn't deserve more than anybody else and if you weren't such an ass you'd realize this."

Lindsay wasn't exactly yelling, but Ms. Kamisky reacted as if she were. There were more teachers nearby than parents, so the damage was at least minimized to an extent. Ms. Kamisky looked more upset than angry herself, and attempted to stammer out a response, but Lindsay cut her off.

"I don't care about any excuses, I get enough of those from those kids you never taught responsibility to!" Lindsay grabbed her stomach suddenly and gasped, taking a step back. Something lurched inside of her. She felt strong, wiggling movements inside her. It didn't feel like gas, it felt like there were things moving inside her. "Ah!" she gasped again, grabbing around her expansive stomach, confused and scared. "What was that?"

She looked around. Ms. Kamisky stared back, as confused as her. Lindsay felt a few more strong jerks inside her belly. Breathing heavily, she bolted as much as her new waddling gait would let her, not even turning back to look, just holding her belly and hustling outside. Whatever embarrassment she just brought upon herself was nothing compared to the panic she felt at the motions going through her belly.

She got outside and sat on a bench, breathing heavily. The movements had stopped while she ran, or rather walked semi-swiftly. She moved her hands across her round belly as she calmed down. Her heart was still racing when Amy approached her, moving even more slowly than her.

"Lindsay!" Amy said, and Lindsay was surprised to see her half smiling, "I heard you just told off that obnoxious Kamisky woman. What's wrong?"

Lindsay held her belly, debating whether to tell Amy what she felt.

"I did. I just went off on her. She deserved. Bunch of annoying yuppies. But . . . something stopped me . . ."

"What?"

Lindsay didn't answer. After a moment of silence. Amy stood up, belly first.

"Want to get some lunch? I think we've done enough damage for one night. There's the buffet down the street."

"That," Lindsay stood up, using the same general motion as Amy did to stand, "sounds lovely."

As two large-bellied woman walking up to a buffet nobody gave a second thought to how much food both were taking. Amy and Lindsay, however, both noticed how Lindsay was piling her plates up high. She was eating more than Amy by far, and eating it faster, barely able to respond to Amy's conversation.

After her third helping, Amy put on her concerned face again. Lindsay's hand was pressed tightly into her lower belly. Even though she knew she was always full now, and that her stomach had grown round and tight, she could feel it stretching again with the food she was eating. She felt like she had another bump along with her already giant belly simply from stuffing herself.

"Lindsay . . ." Amy started.

Lindsay put her fork down and looked across the table. "I know. I'm eating like a pig," she looked down at the empty plates, feeling her own taut belly and tugging on her shirt. It was stretched well to its limit now, both around her belly and breasts.

They had both had their fill and were heading to the parking when Lindsay stopped suddenly. Several strong lurching movements moved through her belly.

"Aah!" she yelped, causing Amy to stop in her tracks as she doubled over and moved her hands all over her belly. "Oh god, what is that?" she said with panic in her voice.

"What is it?"

"Feel, feel!" Lindsay grabbed Amy's hands and put them on her belly. She felt the movements. They did, she knew from much experience, feel like babies kicking. But it would have be a number of them, and they'd have to have grown pretty fast.

"Oh, Lindsay. You need to call a doctor."

The movements having subsided, Lindsay pushed Amy away and rushed to her car.

"You don't call your doctor because you're getting fat, Amy," Lindsay said, but her voice was shaking. "I'll see you tomorrow."

On the ride home, Lindsay felt weaker, but still disturbing, wiggling movements in her belly. With a resigned sigh, she made an appointment for tomorrow after school. As hard it was to accept that she had gotten so big so quickly, that something else-especially something obvious and specific-was wrong with her was harder to swallow.
144231111212221211111.title: Soccer mom has it coming

choices: After a quiet evening, Lindsay leaves for work in the morning bigger than ever
Lindsay's appetite grows dangerous out of control, making new problems
1442311112122212111111.content:
Lindsay arrived home still frustrated but eager to fulfill her promise to herself to work out. She knew if she didn't just do it she would never get her figure back in control. With Carl to keep her motivated, she actually felt somewhat energetic even as she trudged her way through the door and nearly knocked the coat rack over by underestimating the size of her belly. Lindsay forced her unwieldy body to her feet and waddled a few steps, bumping into the sonogram and the table at once. Clearly a lot of emotions were going through her head right then, and as shocked as Carl was he was at least sensitive enough to know that Lindsay clearly had a lot more on her mind right now than he did. He could see her trying not to react with anger but also not actively trying to calm herself down.

"We tried for years and we accepted that I can't get pregnant," she said, stepping away from Carl and Dr. Monroe, who remained silent. "And now-eight? Octuplets? And I'm five months along in five days? Is this some kind of joke?"

Apparently she actually wanted an answer.

"I have no idea how this happened, Lindsay. But it's happened," Dr. Monroe said.

Lindsay rubbed her stomach as another wave of kicking went on inside her. She grunted and moaned in frustration. She moved her hands to her aching back and leaned against the wall.

"What am I going to do?" she asked. She had a very strong desire to get as far away from her own body as she could.

Carl spread his arms and walked towards her. Lindsay accepted his hug but didn't return it. She knew what he was going to say.

"We'll get through it," he said, and hearing it made her calm down a little. Her breathing was steady again, and she no longer wanted to lash out at the doctor. Carl didn't think now was the right time to bring up that they would be parents. They would both have to accept that she was, in fact, pregnant with octuplets and growing fast first.

"We're going to set up another appointment. Tomorrow. I suggest you go on bed rest," Dr. Monroe said.

"I might be a whale but I can still do my job," Lindsay said, sounding more irritated than panicked now. Dr. Monroe and Carl did not weigh on the issue right then.

They discussed the next appointment briefly. Lindsay just wanted to get out of there. Carl was running out of things to say. He hadn't worked out how he felt about this whole situation himself. They left the doctor's office, catching Kacy curiously poking at her own puffy belly as they left.

"Where to?" Carl asked once they were in the car. Both had lapsed into silence.
