Lindsay has a rough night
144231111212221211111111211.content:
"If I'm going to work through this...pregnancy, I might as well not go naked. I need some clothes that'll actually fit." Lindsay said, her hands resting on her belly.

"Honey, no offense, but with the rate you've been growing...do you think you'll be able to fit into anything going forward." Carl asked, backing out of the parking lot. "It's worth a shot, right?" Lindsay asked. "Whatever you say." Carl said.

Arriving at the shopping mall, Lindsay couldn't help but feel that people were staring at her. Then again, a woman with a belly like hers wasn't an everyday occurrence, but it still made her uncomfortable.

The walk to the maternity store was pretty difficult for Lindsay. Her feet and back ached, and to add onto that her belly was constantly rumbling. No doubt it was amplified by the nearby food court. Carl had to stop and slow down constantly as Lindsay lagged behind.

Inside the maternity story, Lindsay waddled to the nearby employee, as Carl slowly followed her. "Excuse me. Do you have any clothes for someone expecting multiples?" Lindsay asked.

The employee turned around and was taken back at Lindsay's belly. "Oh, my! Y-yes, we do. Though, I must ask. Isn't it a little late for you to be getting maternity clothes?" she asked.

"Uh...I have a few more months left. Listen, I'm sorta in pain here walking around. Do you think you could pick out some clothes for me? I was going to wait in the changing room" Lindsay said, waddling after the employee. "Oh...okay. I was a little busy. Are you sure your husband couldn't pick them out for you?" she asked.

"Have you seen how he dresses? I'd prefer someone that deals with pregnant women daily to help." Lindsay said. "Fair enough. I'll be back in a few minutes." she said, heading off as Lindsay and Carl made their way to the changing room.

The wait was fairly awkward, as the couple remained silent. "So...how are you feeling?" Carl asked. "Other than feeling like a blimp and having a soccer team inside of me? Just peachy, thanks." Lindsay said, her hands not leaving her belly.

"Is something wrong? Did I do something to you?" Carl asked. "It's just...I don't know how I'm going to do this, Carl! Eight babies...I just don't know!" she said. Carl sat down next to her. "We'll do it together. I'm here for you, Lindsay." he said.

The employee entered the changing room with a heap of clothes. "Oookay. I've got some maternity jeans for you and a few blouses and shirts. We ran out of dresses, unfortunately. We've had a bit of a boom in sales the past few days." she said.

Lindsay thanked her, and began to try on the clothes. The jeans actually fit pretty well, no doubt due to the elastic waistbands. The shirts were a little snug, but at least they fit. Lindsay and Carl purchased the clothes and made their way to the food court.

Lindsay sat down heavily at a nearby table as Carl went to get food. He returned with three treys. Two were for Lindsay, who's treys were piled with burgers, Chinese food, or pizza, while Carl's trey only had a couple of slices of pizza.

They ate in relative silence, mainly because Lindsay was too focused on eating. After nearly and hour of Carl getting more food for Lindsay, she was full. Carl helped her up, and they made their way to the car.

Arriving home, Carl carried Lindsay's bags of clothes for her. The phone began to rang. "I'll get it." Carl said, putting the bags on the couch. Lindsay waddled to the couch as well. She lifted her shirt up as her babies started to kick.

Carl picked up the phone and answered. "Hello? Hey, mom. No, sorry, we just got back from the mall. Just doing some shopping, that's all. The trip was good, yeah. Oh, really? T-tomorrow? No, it's fine, it's just...a little unexpected, that's all. Ok, then. I'll see you...tomorrow, I guess. Hope you feel better, love you." Carl hung up.

Lindsay heaved herself off of the couch and waddled towards Carl. "Who was that?" Lindsay asked. "Oh, my mom." Carl said. "Really, what did she want?" she asked.

"Uh...she and dad are going to visit for a week." Carl said, clearly nervous about what Lindsay would say. "When?" Lindsay asked. "Well...tomorrow." Carl replied sheepishly.

Lindsay exploded. "Tomorrow?! Who does she think she is coming on such short notice? And what about the house? I haven't cleaned, it's a mess!" Lindsay exclaimed.

"What about the house? What about THIS?" Carl asked gripping his wife's pregnant stomach. Lindsay looked down. "Oh, yeah. That too. Carl, you have to call her back and tell her they can't come. Tell her I have the flu or something." Lindsay said.

"Well, she's already sick. Stomach bug or something. And she already dropped off Sparky with the dog sitter. It's too late." Carl said. "Oh, damn it, Carl!" Lindsay said.

"Carl? What did I do?" he asked. "Have HER as your mom. Whatever, I'm going to bed. Good night." Lindsay said, trudging upstairs. He watched his pregnant wife climb the stairs.

"The mother of my children..." he muttered.

1442311112122212111111112112.content:
Lindsay wanted to storm up the stairs, slam the bedroom door, and throw at least one object. Normally throwing a fit like that would be very out of character for her, but she was probably more frustrated, angry, and confused than she had ever been in her life and taking out that on something inanimate would have made her feel a lot better. But she couldn't. She lumbered rather than stormed, and by the time she got upstairs she wasn't even as furious as she was at Carl. She knew he always had trouble saying no to his mother. He really didn't like her any more than Lindsay did. Other than a few almost tender moments at long intervals in their marriage, Lindsay and Carl's mother had never gotten along. She could only imagine what she'd think about her being pregnant.

But Lindsay knew that's not why she was feeling like this. She also knew she couldn't blame it entirely on the hormones, which she now knew to be coursing through her erratically, turning her usually mellow demeanor upside down at random. That was at least as unpleasant as the flurry of kicks rocking through her belly. Awkwardly, she got undressed. She wanted to shut her mind off for a while and not think about this. It was too much to take in so quickly.

Lying down, Lindsay fell into a fitful sleep. She dreamed on and off throughout the night, tossing and muttering. She dreamed she was her old slim self again, moving gracefully without any difficulty. She went to work, and realized the entire classroom was full of her kids. Before she could used to it, she felt those movements in her belly again, and found her flat stomach had been replaced by the enormous belly she had come to hate. Her dreams went in and out in this fashion all night, until her alarm went off and she felt like she didn't get any sleep at all.

Waddling, and her walk really was a pure waddle now, swaying side to side with each heavy step, towards the bathroom Lindsay was all too aware that she did feel heavier than yesterday. A look in the mirror revealed this to be so. Her belly stuck out of her thin body several feet in front of her, and were starting to dwarf her also swollen breasts. The shirt she slept in had ridden up completely. She moved her hands along the tight skin, feeling the flickering movements inside and the occasional bump rising to the surface. At least, she noticed, there were no stretch marks.

How did I miss this? she thought to herself. She felt like an idiot for not noticing the signs, however much her medical history discouraged her. With a sigh, she turned to get dressed, and found Carl already awake and getting dressed himself.

"Morning, hun," he said with a weak smile. She returned it. Lindsay started to bend down to pick the jeans from the bags of clothes Carl had brought upstairs and nearly fell over. Carl rushed over to help. Last night she would have lashed out at him, humiliated at being so big she couldn't even dress herself, but this morning she accepted his help willingly.

"Thanks," she said as Carl held her up so she could pull the jeans up. They fit fine, but she knew the elastic in the front must be stretched more. "How do they look?"

"Fantastic," Carl said, moving his eyes up and down her legs and making sure she saw him checking out her ass in an exaggerated way. She smirked at him, and then tossed on one of the oversized maternity sweaters.

"It'll be nice," she said as she pulled it over belly, "to be, you know, fully clothed today."

The two went down for breakfast, which Carl had prepared the night before in anticipation of not having enough time to make the huge meals Lindsay now required. She ate quickly, no longer bothering to feel ashamed for making a pig of herself in front of Carl. The two of them seemed to have silently agreed to not discuss this pregnancy for the moment, and that suited Lindsay just fine.

"Is a field trip really punishment?" Carl asked as he drove his wife to work.

"It's not really," Lindsay says, "I don't mind dealing with the kids in public, at least. The other teachers don't, so much. I think Marie just had to give me something that sounded like a reprimand. She was going to let me off the hook before Danny's mom called to complain."

"She's looking out for you, I guess," Carl said. Lindsay was less pleased the more she thought about it. It occurred to her that she'd have to be on her feet all day. They were already sore just from going downstairs and to the car.

Surprisingly, to herself, Lindsay actually was more self-conscious now that she was wearing proper maternity clothes. As she slowly navigated her way to the teacher's lounge, she happened to see Pamela going in before her. She didn't recognize her, at first.

She's gotten fat, Lindsay thought, That's a shame. She felt bad for the young teacher. Having changed quite a bit recently she found it easy to sympathize with the petite Pamela, recalling her she felt when she first started showing. And clearly Pamela wasn't going through the same thing as Lindsay, though. Her face looked puffy and her ass wider, in addition to the out of place potbelly she now sported. The poor girl was practically bursting out of her skirt and the tight t-shirt she wore did nothing to hide her gain. On that train of thought, Lindsay only casually noticed that Gary was looking a little chubby himself. But she merely made a mental note of that, and continued to think of Pamela. It was easier psychologically to focus on what she must be going through than her own bigger problems.

"Pam's boyfriend broke up with her last week," Lindsay turned and found Amy was sitting down. Lindsay felt a brief but very powerful desire to cry. Oh my god, I'm bigger than Amy. It passed. Her belly was bigger than her friend's, but at least she hadn't gained any of the other pregnancy weight.

"What?" Lindsay said.

"You were looking at Pamela, right? Her boyfriend broke up with her last week. She's pretty depressed about it. I guess she's, um, eating her sorrow away," Amy shrugged. "So, doctor?"

"Yeah. We went yesterday . . . you were right, I am pregnant."

Amy burst into a smile, then looked confused, then shrugged again. She didn't know how to read Lindsay's delivery of the news.

"Congratulations?"

Lindsay smiled back. "We'll . . . talk more about it later, okay?"

"How far along are you, can you tell me that?" Lindsay could sense Amy's excitement.

"Five months."

"Only five months?" Amy said. Apparently how quickly Lindsay had gotten to five months had escaped her notice, but Amy was very clearly referring to Lindsay's size. "Are you carrying more than one in there?"

"Yeah . . ."

Before Amy could respond, Principal Donner entered.

"Hello, fellow teachers," she said, loudly but unable to mask her exhaustion. "Thank you for volunteering to chaperon this field trip. You know I feel very strongly about giving out students more than just a classroom education . . ."

"Wow, think she's bigger than Pam?" Amy whispered to Lindsay. Lindsay nodded. Marie had indeed filled out, particularly in her middle. She looked horribly uncomfortable crammed in her dress clothes. The buttons on her blouse were all spread wide, some revealing the tank she wore underneath to hide the fact, and others, right above her dangerously strained pants buttons.

" . . . good luck on your trip, and I hope you learn as much from our students as they learn from us," she ended in a variation of the same thing she said at almost every remotely speech-like opportunity she could.

Lindsay, Amy, Pamela, and Gary all, less quickly than they otherwise would have, went to meet their students.

14423111121222121111111121121.content:
The four teachers put on their best faces for their students, although it was obvious that only Amy was convincingly pleasant. The students, young as they were, must have picked up on this. From the moment they got on the bus they more and more would defer to Amy rather than risk speaking one of the other snappy teachers. Even Gary, who was generally a jovial, uncle-like figure to his students, was in no mood to put up with childish antics.

Lindsay and Amy sat next to each other in very cramped conditions. Lindsay's wide belly barely fit between the seats, and once seated was pressed uncomfortably against the seat in front of her. Even Amy wasn't quite so big even if the rest of her had plumped up some. And the kicking only got worse, especially with the front of her belly pressed against the seat. By the end of the hour long ride Lindsay was holding the sides of her belly and panting softly, the discomfort turning to pain. Amy tried to cheer her up, but had to contend with the students who were now seeing her as the only safe teacher to talk to. Even the quiet Pamela was scowling at students who tried to speak with her.

"But I just fit when we came on the bus," Lindsay whispered as they exited. Amy glanced over her friend's shoulder and saw what she meant. She now had to squeeze her belly between the seats as she waddled forward. Lindsay kept her hands firmly rubbing her belly, wondering if her maternity clothes would even last the day with how quickly she was growing.

The museum should have been a peaceful trip. It wasn't. The kids were all over the place, and Amy seemed to be the only one with the energy to actually chase them to keep them in line. Lindsay tried, but within a half hour had to take her first break and sit down for twenty minutes with her shoes off. Her feet were aching and swelling so much she needed help getting them back on.

"Lindsay, I know it's rough what you're going through, and you didn't expect it, and, well, you're not as used to this as I am," Amy said, taking a breather next to her friend, "But can you help me out a little here?"

"I'm sorry," Lindsay said, not really paying attention. She wanted to close her eyes and let her body pass out. Everything ached, from her sore feet, her legs ill-equipped to deal with all this extra weight, and the skin of her belly and breasts feeling so stretched that every movement sent a stinging pain throughout them. She found herself watching Pamela across the museum now. Poor Pamela, Lindsay thought, not for the first time happy to take her mind off her own troubles and focus on her co-worker. Pamela was almost waddling, Lindsay saw. She saw her chase after two kids trying to sneak into some Egyptian exhibit. Having deterred them, she planted her hands on her back and arched her belly forward, revealing a little of its round surface from under her overly tight t-shirt. Her tiny ass, Lindsay noticed, had gotten huge. She was practically pudgy now. If the rest of her body had remained as petite as it always was, her belly would certainly make her look pregnant.

" . . . why are you staring at Pamela like that?" Amy asked, bringing Lindsay back to reality. She found she had dozed off while gently massaging her own belly.

"I feel bad for her," Lindsay said.

"Yeah, I know. Come on, let's get back to the kids."

Amy stood up with her usual difficulty while Lindsay needed a hand. They walked towards Pamela who had turned her head to gently admonish the two kids for running off while a group she had already corralled ran off while her back was turned. She turned to see them flee into some other room and moaned loudly. Lindsay thought she might cry with frustration, but then she saw the other teachers.

"We've got this," Amy said with a bright smile as she hurried towards the fleeing students. Amy actually found chasing kids around museums and theme parks fun, not annoying as the other teachers clearly did.

"How are you doing?" Lindsay asked, her voice tired and expressing the desire to not actually listen to that long an answer.

Pamela, Lindsay assumed based on her past behavior, would shrug this off and say "fine." Instead, she glowered at Lindsay with wide, almost panicked eyes. She said it quietly, looking down at her belly.

"I called Kevin yesterday," she said, who Lindsay assumed was her boyfriend, "and he said I was probably just getting fat. But I think I'm pregnant."

"Have you seen a doctor?"

"No. Have you?" Pamela suddenly asked.

"Yeah," Lindsay said, "And I am pregnant. I should have listened to Amy or I would have known sooner."

"Oh," was all Pamela said. She rubbed her stomach, her now round face looking down at it sadly. Lindsay could almost tell what she was thinking. As much as she hated thinking she was gaining weight and losing her figure due to her own laziness and diet, right up until she found she vehemently resisted the idea that she was pregnant. Lindsay imagined Pamela was going through a similar thought process, although without somebody there with her to go through it with. She patted her on the shoulder, and then walked off to look after the kids. Gary looked like he could use some relief, too. Come to think of it, he was putting on weight, too. He was a heavy guy to begin with, but not unhealthily so. Now he was definitely getting a beer belly.

"Hey Gary, need a hand?" Lindsay said.

"Sure I do!" Gary said with much relief.

It took the whole day to tire the students out. But they only regained their energy on the bus ride home. Lindsay was dozing off again when she heard Amy get a call on her cell phone. She heard Amy give a couple of short answers to questions Lindsay couldn't hear. When she hung up, she nudged Lindsay. Obviously there was news here.

"That was Marie, she wants to see all of us when we get back. She sounded worried."

144231111212221211111111211211.content:
They arrived back at the school minutes later. The kids flocked from the bus first as the teachers followed suit. Amy stood up and walked down the aisle. Lindsay stood up, and was shocked that she barely squeezed out of the seat.

"My god, I was almost stuck there. I....am I bigger?" she asked, mainly to herself. Amy turned around to see what Lindsay was talking about. "Well, your sweater's riding up." Amy replied.

Indeed, her maternity sweater was now too small, revealing the bottom sliver of her pregnant mass. She tugged on it, but it was no use. "Great. Too big for maternity clothes already." she pouted.

The four teachers made their way to Maria's office. "So what was she talking to you about?" Gary asked. "I don't know. It seemed like it was important, though." Amy said.

They arrived at the office and Pamela knocked on the door, which was usually open. "Come in." a worried voice answered. They obliged, as Maria stood behind her desk.

The buttons on her strained blouse had popped at some point during the day, exposing her shockingly protruding belly. A few stretch marks were visible, and it was perfectly round, almost like a basketball. The button on her pants was also now incredibly strained.

"Shit." Gary said. "So...how was the field trip?" Marie asked, her voice shaky. "Maria, please. What do you need?" Amy asked.

"I need to see a doctor immediately. And Pamela does too, by the looks of it. I think I'm pregnant..." Maria said. "Well, yeah. I mean you're as big as Amy. But think you are?" Gary asked.

"Because I'm 52 and haven't had sex in years for crissake! I mean, I've taken five pregnancy tests today and they've al come back positive, but...it can't be true." Maria said.

"Maria, we can go to the doctor right now. I have an appointment in an hour anyway." Lindsay said. "Okay. Amy, can we take your minivan?" Maria asked.

"Sure. We need someone to drive, though. That bus ride took a lot out of me. Gary?" Amy asked. "Eh, whatever." he replied.

The five big-bellied teachers piled into Amy's minivan. Amy sat in the passenger's seat as Lindsay, Maria, and Pamela sat in the back. Lindsay was squished between them. Her belly pressed against Maria and Pamela's rounded stomachs.

"How did that appointment go yesterday, Lindsay?" Maria asked. "Well, I'm pregnant. Very, very pregnant." she replied. "Oh. Congratulations." Maria said. She looked down and held her belly.

They arrived at Dr. Monroe's office and headed inside. Lindsay approached Kacy, who was sitting at the receptionist's desk. "Hi. If Dr. Monroe doesn't mind, we're gonna need a few extra ultrasounds done." she said.

"O-okay. I'll tell her right away. You can go ahead and head back. It's the same room as yesterday." Kacy said. She stood up and rushed to the restroom. Lindsay noticed that her belly was much bigger than it was yesterday.

Inside the examination room, Dr. Monroe was waiting for them. There were a few more chairs placed in the room. "Oh, wow. So who wants to go first?" she asked.

"I'll go!" Gary laughed. "Gary, please. I'm sure the doctor has other things to do. Let's not waste her time." Amy said. "Oh, come on. It'll take a minute." Gary said. "Fine. Just get up on the table." Dr. Monroe said, turning the machine on.

Gary got on the table with more effort than expected. He lifted up his shirt, revealing his own round belly. Dr. Monroe placed a had on his stomach and felt around it.

"Did you just have a large meal? Your stomach is...quite firm." she said. "No, I'm going to after this, though. I'm starving." he said.

The doctor probed over his stomach and looked at the monitor. "Oh my word..." she said, her mouth agape.

"What is it, doc?" he said sarcastically. "Triplets. You're five months pregnant with triplets!" she exclaimed. "There we go, doc's getting in on the jokes now!" he said.

"No, I'm afraid I'm serious." she turned the monitor towards him. Sure enough, there were three fetuses on the screen. "Wh-what the fuck? HOW?!?" he screamed.

"If I knew I would tell you. I have the feeling that you're not the only man who's pregnant in this town." she said. Gary was speechless. He got off of the table and sat down, sulking.

"Who's next?" she asked. "I guess I'll go." Pamela said quietly. Like Gary, she heaved herself on the examination table and lifted up her shirt. Dr. Monroe began the examination. "Hmm. You're five months along too. But...it's quadruplets." she said.

"Oh, no. How am I gonna take care of four babies on my own?" Pamela asked, tears streaming down her face. Nobody responded. Pamela and Maria traded their places.

"Five months. Five babies." the doctor said. Maria nodded, rubbing her belly. "Okay, Lindsay. Do you want me to check you out again?" she asked.

"I think that would be best." Lindsay said. "Alright, I'm starving. I'm gonna call a cab and get something to eat. Anyone else wanna come?" Gary asked. Four stomachs growled.

"I'll come." Pamela said. "Me too." Maria added. The three left the office in relative silence. "I'll stick around." Amy said. Lindsay was helped onto the table and the doctor began to move the probe across her belly.

"Correct me if I'm wrong, but are you...bigger since yesterday?" Dr. Monroe asked. "I think so." Lindsay said, rubbing the sides of her stomach as the babies kicked strongly, demanding food.

"I have no idea what's been going on. I've gotten more pregnant patients in the past few days than I have in the past two months. And they've all had multiples, too. Kacy's having octuplets, the poor girl. She was so tiny, I think she might burst." she said, continuing the examination.

"Well, there are still eight in there. But now you're a little over six months pregnant. I must have made a mistake yesterday. But...when did you say you started to feel strange?" the doctor asked.

"Sunday. Six days ago." Lindsay replied. "Somehow, someway...you're progressing a month of pregnancy in a day." she said. "So I'm experiencing a nine day pregnancy? How is that possible?" Lindsay asked.

"I have no idea. I'll do some research on it. That means you'll give birth on--" the doctor began. "Tuesday..." Amy finished.

"Then I want you to stop by every day. I want to keep track of this pregnancy, and with multiples...I mean they've been perfectly healthy if not a little large, but there's always a chance you give birth early. Come back tomorrow at 5, okay?" she asked. "Yeah, okay." Lindsay said as she was helped up.

Amy took Lindsay home. "Octuplets, Lindsay? There are...eight babies in there?" Amy asked as she looked over at her friend's belly. "Uh-huh." she said. "But how? Were you taking fertility drugs or something? Was Carl?" Amy asked.

"No. Trust me, we were done trying. This is impossible. I feel like I'm in a nightmare." Lindsay groaned. "Well, I'm here for you. Maybe tomorrow morning we can meet up at the cafe and talk about it." Amy offered. "Yeah, that sounds good." Lindsay replied. She thanked her for the ride as Amy dropped her off in the driveway.

Lindsay walked towards the house, her hands on her back. There was another car parked in the driveway, which only meant that Carl's parents were there. Before she reached the front door, Carl came outside.

"Hey, honey. How was the field trip?" he asked, hugging his pregnant wife. "I'm six months pregnant with octuplets and I was chasing kids around all day. Take a guess." Lindsay said.

"Right. Wait, six months?" Carl asked. "I'll tell you about it later, alright? So they're here? You told them, right?" Lindsay asked. "You see, no. I just didn't know how to break it to them. Sorry." he said.

"Well, I guess they'll find out now." Lindsay sighed as they entered the house.
144231111212221211111111211211.title: More pregnancies are revealed

The evening is awkward but uneventful and filling
1442311112122212111111112112111.content:
Lindsay steeled herself to face her in-laws. She felt ridiculous doing so and really wished Carl had told them. She, and nobody else for that matter, ever had any problem with Jonathan, but Carl's mom Cynthia had always been constantly adversarial towards her. To his credit, Carl had always stood up for her to his mom, but thought he did in a more exasperated rather than angry way. And now she would have to deal with what criticisms and insults Cynthia could come up with for this situation after what had already been a rough day. She waddled through the door deeply wishing she didn't have to waddle.

"Hi, Dad," she said, and then, as per Cynthia's request and both of their mutual dislike for each other, "Hi, Cynthia."

"Horseshoe crab!" Jonathan said excitedly, writing in his newspaper crossword before standing up to Lindsay and Carl with a big smile on his face, "Well, what's this now?"

"Mom, Dad, we have some, uh, news," Carl said, putting an arm around Lindsay. Lindsay rubbed her belly nervously. A few kicks rippled across its surface, causing her to release a small moan she couldn't suppress fast enough.

Cynthia stood up slowly looking confused. "Are you pregnant?"

"Of course she is!" Jonathan said stepping forward to hug his daughter-in-law. Lindsay reciprocated gladly, even though hugging anyone was getting more difficult every day. "Congratulations!"

"Pregnant at your age? What are you thinking?" was the first jab that Cynthia could settle on.

"Yes, I'm pregnant. And we're not that old, it's perfectly fine at our age," Lindsay said, glad to see Jonathan was on their side of the room. She felt better in this face off with Cynthia that she didn't quite so helpless.

"But, how many are you having? When are you due?" Cynthia asked. She was standing now with her hands on her hips. Like Lindsay, she was a short, slim woman. Lindsay was glad to see that at least, after all these years, his mother-in-law looked like she had finally gained some weight. She actually looked bloated.

"She's six mo-" Carl started to say before Lindsay interrupted.

"Any day now."

"Well, obviously," Cynthia said as she walked over looking Lindsay up and now, "Well," she said, clearly straining for something to add.

"I'm happy for you, too, I know how you've been trying," Jonathan said, oblivious that they had both long ago given up trying to have children. "And grandchildren! I'm as pleased as, as . . . Abe Lincoln when he wrote the Gettysburg Address," Jonathan suddenly grabbed his paper and jotted down one of those words in his crossword, then looked back up thoughtfully, "Although I suppose that was actually probably more depressing for him, thinking about it."

"Thanks, Dad," Carl said.

"I hope you're eating healthy for the baby, at least," Cynthia said, glaring at Lindsay's enormous belly, "It's not healthy to gain too much weight when you're pregnant and you look huge."

"Come on, Mom," Carl snapped, "Just be happy for us. Sure, it's unexpected, but you know what? We both wanted this." Lindsay thought that there was some sincerity to what Carl said, which was a lot different than the panic both of them had when they found out. If Lindsay was no closer to accepting this, she now got the impression Carl was actually getting there.

"Be nice to the kids, Cynthia, you always said you wanted grandchildren. So how many are in there?" Jonathan said, still beaming and, Lindsay thought very thankfully, not obtrusively grabbing her belly.

"Obviously more than one," Cynthia said, her glare softening but still not smiling. She patted Lindsay's belly. A loud groan and some turmoil erupted. Lindsay brushed and stepped back, but Cynthia patted it a few more times for good measure.

"Eight," Lindsay said simply.

"Eight!" the both repeated.

"No wonder you're so big," Cynthia said. She must be loving at least that part, Lindsay thought, flashing back to all the needless comments about how she would gain weight if she ate this and that despite never happening.

"Actually, I am exactly the right size for how many I'm carrying and haven't gained any unnecessary weight at all," Lindsay said, wishing she could mention that her mother-in-law was getting a belly herself.

"Don't just stand there, you must be exhausted," Jonathan said, ushering in his daughter-in-law into the room to sit down. Him being such a nice guy didn't completely make up for Cynthia, but it helped. "And don't try to stop us from waiting on you tonight."

Lindsay saw Carl and his dad exchanged some fatherly, sonly looks of affection while Cynthia stood off to the side sulking. Lindsay was more than happy to be off her feet. She sank into the couch while Carl and Jonathan went to the kitchen. Lindsay turned to her mother-in-law who was still looking her up and down. Lindsay's eyes settled on Cynthia's bloated middle. She must have noticed, as she awkwardly moved a hand over it and shifted her stance.

They wake up and continue to fight
14423111121222121111111121121112.content:
Lindsay's feet were so sore now that she gave up trying to look defiant in front of Cynthia and sat down. Carl was shaking hands with his dad after both had attempted an awkward hug. Lindsay would have been happy for both of them had she not felt so awful herself. Jonathan always wanted to be a grandfather, although Cynthia was irrationally opposed to the idea. Now, she was sitting next to Lindsay staring with distaste at enormous belly while she had her hands on her lap apparently trying to hide her own recent gain.

"I thought you two gave up on kids?" she said coldly.

"Sometimes these things just happen," Lindsay said, just as cooly, and felt a rush of panic at her own words. Just happen, she repeated, reminding herself how inexplicable and rapid her pregnancy was.

"Well, you must have been taking fertility pills," Cynthia said as if the idea was absurd.

"I wasn't. It just . . . happened," Lindsay rubbed her sore belly, not even bothering pulling it down over the lower part that was exposed. That soothed the inner movements somewhat.

"If you say so," Cynthia said dismissively. The blood rushed to Lindsay's face. She wanted to strike back but Carl and Jonathan were now standing in front of them.

"Let's say we let the ladies rest and we'll take care of dinner tonight," Jonathan said, still with a broad smile on his face. Lindsay sometimes couldn't believe how this man ever got with that woman.

"Oh, thank you," Lindsay said, genuinely grateful. She didn't even have to explain how much it meant to not have to be standing.

Lindsay lay her head back and closed her eyes. Cynthia made a few disapproving "mmhps!" sounds, but did not try to strike up a conversation. Dinner was served some time later, a homemade lasagna recipe that Cynthia made for Carl growing up.

"You're not going to help at all?" Cynthia said to Lindsay as the first whiffs of the finished meal wafted into the room.

Lindsay glared. Cynthia had always said Carl was a better cook and more than once suggested that Lindsay just let Carl handle dinner.

"Do I look like I can help much?" Lindsay spread her arms over her belly.

"I cooked all through when I was expecting Carl. But then I wasn't nearly as big as you," Cynthia smiled, quite insincerely, and patted Lindsay's belly. It gurgled, and some bumps moved across the surface. Lindsay winced. "No, not nearly-"

"Dinner time!" the door to the kitchen swung open. Jonathan was still as joyful as before, while Carl looked uncomfortable. He did not want to leave his wife alone with his mom. In fact, he didn't really like to spend time alone with her himself.

"Let me help you up there, Lindsay," Jonathan said as he and Carl approached Lindsay. Cynthia stood up and stopped him.

"Don't you dare, you'll throw out your back," and then added, as if to make the point more obvious, "She's too heavy for you to lift so I hope Carl can on his own." Her expression said she doubted it.

Lindsay would have given anything to have her old body back right now so she could spring up and stare her mother-in-law down. But she couldn't. Standing was getting harder every day. Now, if she rocked herself hard enough she might be able to get to her knees off the chair. Carl grabbed her hands and hoisted her upward. They both nearly fell down with Lindsay taking half a minute to steady herself. She was blushing now, avoiding Cynthia's victorious look. As much as she said obviously disapproved of them having children, she must be immensely enjoying seeing the trim Lindsay so huge and ungainly.

As Carl, ever the good host to dinner guests, passed out the plates he gave an extra helping to Lindsay. This prompted Cynthia to just flat out ask.

"How much weight have you gained?"

"Mom, give her a break, she's pregnant," Carl said.

"It's important to keep track," Cynthia said, "It's not good for the babies to gain too much. And the more you gain, the harder it is to get your figure back. I was lucky, but then I was much, much smaller-"

"I'm all belly, Cynthia," Lindsay said, pointing out how far from the table she had to sit, "My doctor says I'm healthy and she's the expert, not you."

"Don't listen to her, she's just jealous because she blew up with Carl," Jonathan said with a chuckle, "Took her a year to get back into shape."

"That's enough of that," Cynthia said, digging in. She wasn't eating as fast, or as much as Lindsay, but Lindsay couldn't help but notice her normally dainty mother-in-law was really packing it in.

That would explain the gut, Lindsay thought with some pleasure.

Lindsay was in full blown eating mode now, and she still had trouble wrapping her head around it. She was slowly accepting that she would get bigger every day. She was even starting to accept that her body would be completely out of control for the foreseeable future. But she just couldn't comprehend how she, a careful eater all her life, could stuff herself so mechanically, so fully, until every square inch of her stomach must be packed with food. It felt like her hands were taking command entirely from the hunger part of her brain and wouldn't stop until she had been efficiently stuffed. She was briefly pulled out of her eating, just when her fantastically stuffed belly somehow felt fuller, and more tight, than ever before, by her mother-in-law very uncharacteristically belching while, Lindsay saw, holding her own swollen midsection.

". . . and how are you going to care for eight kids on just a teacher's salary?" Lindsay heard Cynthia saying to Carl.

"Mom, you don't even know how much money I make, do you? Trust me, paying for the kids is the least of my worries." Cynthia had trouble remembering Carl had a very well-paying job, and often would rub Cynthia's less lucrative career in her face.

"Is she going to have time to teach with so many children?" Cynthia asked.

Swallowing first, Lindsay said, "I'm right here, Cynthia. And yes, I will."

Apparently Lindsay's tone was enough to keep Cynthia in line for the rest of the meal. That, and she seemed as eager to eat as much as possible as Lindsay was.

_______

"Well, they're in the guest room," Carl said, walking into the bedroom to find Lindsay lying on her side, her whole body tilting the bed in her direction and her belly sticking off the side of the mattress. He sat next to her and put a hand on her shoulder.

"You know," he said softly. He was going to tell Lindsay how it was starting to hit him that they would finally be parents, that after giving up so long ago they could do what they had wanted so much to do. But Lindsay wouldn't even let him start. She was fuming from Cynthia's barrage the whole night.

"Why the hell did you invite them over?" Lindsay said, turning around as much as she could. Carl almost jumped back.

"I didn't, and hey, they'll be gone and she'll come around and you should just relax," which, nobody how gently Carl said it, was not something you say to somebody who did not want to relax.

"I'm irritated, and everything hurts, and I look and feel like a disgusting blob, and you have to have your mother over who you know is only going to make everything worse," Lindsay wasn't exactly yelling, but it was clear she would be if she could work up the breath to.

"I'm sorry, okay?" Carl said, getting frustrated himself, "But they're my parents, what am I going to say to them? And they had to find out sooner or later."

"Just let me sleep and you deal with them tomorrow," Lindsay turned away.

Carl was trying to be as understanding he could. He felt that while Lindsay was getting it the worst, this was still a situation that he had to adjust to, too, and that she was picking a fight out of her own frustration. But he didn't respond. Annoyed and feeling unappreciated, Carl turned off the lights and tried to sleep.

144231111212221211111111211211122.content:
Lindsay didn't think she slept more than a few minutes at a time. Every time she thought sleep was coming one little movement in her belly would set off a flurry of kicks. They were getting worse, stronger, bordering on painful. It stretched her already overstretched skin with each movement and pressed into her cramped insides. She simultaneously felt like she would burst from the pressure and sink through the bed from the weight.

But somehow she did sleep, since she obviously woke up. She was on her side, as sleeping her back made her spine feel like it would snap in half. Her belly, enormous, round, gurgling with hunger, stuck off the bed. She sighed, looking past her painfully bloated breasts, at the enormous thing that took up most of her figure now. She tried to sit up. The key word being "try." She grunted and pulled, feeling her muscles in her sides tearing.

"Carl?" she craned her neck. Carl had woken up, probably hours ago. It was light outside. The clock on her end table read that it was almost noon. No wonder she was so hungry. Lindsay was glad it was the weekend. After the week she just had she dreaded another day of work.

"Carl!" she yelled this time. Deliberately, she heard Carl coming up the stairs. He had a tray of waffles and good pile of bacon. She could smell it all the way from her kitchen. Her belly rumbled.

Carl's expression and tone showed he was still annoyed with her, which worked out since she was still upset with him. It infuriated her that he was talking this situation up to his parents like it was some glorious miracle rather than the nightmare that it was.

"A little help here?" Lindsay said.

"Oh, yeah. Right," Carl said, his face softening. He put the food down on his end table. He rounded the bed and grabbed his wife's slender arms and pulled. She barely budged.

"Harder!" Lindsay said. The movement caused her belly to wobble dangerously. They had gotten her in a sitting position and now Carl braced himself to pull her to her feet.

"Here goes . . ." Carl pulled as hard as he could. Lindsay lifted to her feet, her belly pulled forward, feeling like it would just keep pulling until she fell on her face. She spread her legs, her hips creaking as her body settled solidly. She wrapped her arms around her sides, noticing that she couldn't even reach all the way around herself.

Carl had fallen backwards with a sharp cry. Lindsay, lost in her own thoughts and still angry, now noticed.

"You okay?" she said, taking an awkward step forward.

"Aaah, I think I threw my back out," he said, barely disguising his annoyance. He latched onto the bathroom door handle to pull himself up, wincing.

"Yeah, yeah, definitely out," he said, holding his back and walking to the bed.

Lindsay almost apologized, except that the look in Carl's glance at her showed all too well exactly what he was thinking. His eyes traveled up and down his unbelievably pregnant wife. Lindsay put her hands on her hips and glared.

"I'm sorry I'm so hard to help up," she said, then added for good measure, "Why don't you just go downstairs to to your parents and leave your fat wife alone?"

"Jesus, Lindsay, I'm in pain here," Carl said holding his back.

"You don't think this is painful?" Lindsay said, spreading her arms around her bloated torso.

Carl yelped again as he tried and failed to lie down.

"Just go, leave me alone," Lindsay said.

"Fine, fine, Jesus," Carl muttered. Lindsay couldn't wait to get to her breakfast but wanted to continue to glare at Carl as he left. Once gone, she inhaled her food in minutes, and still her stomach was begging for more.

1442311112122212111111112112111221.content:
Lindsay headed to the closet and pulled out some clothes. She grabbed a maternity blouse and some jeans. She looked in the mirror, then looked at the clothes. Her stomach as absolutely enormous now. There was no way it would fit. With a sigh, she grabbed some sweatpants and a tank top and squeezed into them.

Lindsay cautiously made her way down the stairs and waddled towards the kitchen. Inside, Jonathan and Cynthia were sitting at the kitchen table, while Carl was propped up against the refrigerator with an ice pack on his back. She noticed that Jonathan and Cynthia were still in their pajamas. Apparently it was a lazy day for everyone in the house.

Carl saw Lindsay approach. "Uh, I think I'm gonna go upstairs and lie down. Rest my back a little bit." he said, awkwardly walking past Lindsay. He grazed against her stomach as he tried to sidle past her and huffed. Lindsay glared at him as he made his way upstairs.

She turned and looked at her in-laws. Jonathan was buried in a newspaper while Cynthia was staring intently at her with a look of wonder and bemusement. "Come take a seat." she said. Lindsay obliged, and approached the table.

"Huh. This article says that there's been a spike in pregnancies with multiples in the area. Seems a little hard to believe." Jonathan said, mainly to himself. "Hard to believe? Have you seen your son's wife? No offense." Cynthia said, flashing the world's most fake smile.

"Uh huh." Lindsay slowly sat down and the chair creaked. Cynthia scoffed at her, which caused Lindsay to send her a glare. Apart from Jonathan flipping the pages of the newspaper, the room was silent until a stomach rumbled. Jonathan looked up.

"Can I get you something to eat, Lindsay?" Jonathan asked, putting his paper down. "That wasn't me." Lindsay replied. Jonathan looked at his wife. "Cynthia?" he asked in surprise.

"I had a light breakfast, okay? It's fine, I can make something myself. You don't have to wait on me hand an foot." she said. She turned and stood up. Lindsay was shocked when she saw her mother in law's stomach.

It was round and jutting out, her shirt revealing a decent amount of her belly. She appeared to be as big as Lindsay was a few days ago. Cynthia had one hand on her stomach as she perused the pantry. Lindsay looked on in astonishment.

"Um, Cynthia, are you feeling alright?" Lindsay asked, her jaw agape. "Just peachy. Why do you ask?" Cynthia replied. "Well, it's just that you've sorta gotten...you know...round around the middle?" Lindsay implied.

Cynthia frowned. "I'll have you know that I'm--" "PREGNANT!" Jonathan blurted out.

Lindsay and Cynthia looked at him. Jonathan glanced up from his paper. "Sorry, I'm just filling out a crossword puzzle here, and the answer was a type of pause. What were you two talking about?" he asked.

"Nothing. Go back to your crossword puzzle, Jonathan." Cynthia spat.

She looked back at Lindsay. "I'm just retaining some water, that's all. And I suppose that I've been eating a little more than normal, but that's to be expected when you're around someone with...such a gluttonous appetite such as yourself. So what's on schedule for today for you, Lindsay?" she asked, changing the subject.

"I'm supposed to meet one of my friends in a little bit, then I guess I have another appointment." Lindsay said. "Have you gotten anything for the babies?" Cynthia asked.

"Well, no. This whole thing kinda...sprung up on us." she said. "Well how about we go to the mall later today to get that settled? We could also come along to your appointment." Cynthia said.

"Oh, well, I guess..." Lindsay said. She heard a car honk outside. "That's my friend. I guess I should get going." Lindsay said, struggling to standing up. "Have fun." Cynthia smiled.

At the cafe, Amy and Lindsay were eating lunch. Of course, the two pregnant women were eating quite a large amount of food. "So...you've definitely grown, right?" Amy asked.

Lindsay looked down at her monstrous stomach. "Yeah. I think that the nine days theory that doctor had was correct." Lindsay said, wincing as the babies were starting to get particularly active. "How is that possible, though? I mean, that SHOULD be impossible, right?" Amy asked.

"I thought me GETTING pregnant would be impossible. I don't think anything about this can surprise me anymore." Lindsay said. "You know, Lindsay, I'm actually getting kinda worried about you." Amy said.

"What do you mean?" Lindsay inquired. "I guess I mean that you're getting really big really fast. I'm just worried that you'll explode or something." Amy said.

"I think I'll be fine. But I definitely feel more and more pressure as I get bigger. Especially when they're all kicking. Eugh, like they're doing now." she groaned.

Amy looked on with concern as Lindsay writhed in her chair. Amy approached her and began to rub her friend's massive stomach. "Does that help at all?" she asked.

"Yeah...yeah a little bit." Lindsay replied, breathing heavily. The two continued their meals.

"What's wrong, Lindsay?" Amy asked. "What do you mean?" Lindsay asked. "Something's on your mind. Something's bothering you. What is it?" Amy asked.

"Carl and I have been getting into a lot of arguments lately. I don't know. I just feel like we're drifting apart." she said. "Well, pregnancies can be stressful. For the person going through it and the father. I know that you've been struggling with it, but I can't even imagine how Carl's taking it. It happens. But in a few days you'll be welcoming a bunch of bundles of joy into the world and you'll forget all about it." Amy said.

"If you say so." Lindsay replied. "It'll be fine. If you need someone to talk to, you know that I'm always available." Amy smiled.

"Thanks, Amy. You're the best friend a woman seven months pregnant with octuplets could ask for."

Follow one of these other teachers?
14423111121222121111111121121112212.content:
Across town, Principal Maria Donner awoke as she had the last few days-larger and heavier. She was smaller than Lindsay, thank god, but her enormous belly still dominated her figure. Walking had started getting harder for her two days ago. Now standing was a chore.

As a young woman Maria had been tall and svelte, a beautiful, dark-haired woman who if not for her professional attire would have looked more like a model than a teacher. She had aged gracefully, gaining weight but mostly in her hips and breasts, and had entered her 40s as a boxum and gorgeous if serious woman. Now in her early 50s, her age was starting to show. Her breasts were less firm. Her stomach's softness was turning to paunchiness. Her face grew lines which put her clearly in the camp of older attractive woman. She felt much more at home in her body like this than the slim young woman she had been.

But then this pregnancy happened. Never mind that she was going to be a mother in a few days time. Or that this had popped up out of nowhere. The strangest thing wasn't that she felt very little panic to begin with, but now old, unfamiliar emotions started growing in her as quickly as her belly grew. More and more throughout the days she found herself rubbing her belly, staring at it, examining herself in mirrors. She stood before one now in a tank top that rode up so far her entire round orb of a belly was visible. Despite herself she actually felt sexy for the first time in years. The ungainly walk she was developing didn't strike her as awkward is it must to so many others in town. Instead, she somehow felt graceful as she pushed her giant belly forward, her wide hips following.

Maria didn't understand why she felt like this about what to most everybody else must seem like a nightmare. She only knew it was getting harder to maintain her composure around others. The need to keep her hands on her belly, to expose it for everyone to see, were growing stronger each day. Fabric chafed her sore, bloated midsection and she dreaded having to cover it with bigger and bigger clothes. Fortunately, today was Saturday, and she intended to stay indoors, wear what she wanted, and eat everything she could get her hands on to feed her always hungry stomach.

It was gradually dawning on Maria that she wasn't merely intrigued by her changing body, but by the lives growing within her. After all these years of not giving the matter much thought, Maria was going to be a mother, and the idea excited more than she could ever have thought.

-------------------------------------------

There were ups and downs at first, but within by the end of the day after finding out he was pregnant Gary had made peace with the idea. He was always someone who adjusted fast. It frankly worried his wife that he was taking this situation in stride. A pregnant man? It was impossible. And being parents at their age? Well, not impossible, but they were at the late stage where making that decision was now or never, and it looked like it was going to be now and a very soon now.

What helped Gary the most, aside from his natural disposition to taking things as they came, was realizing that not just plenty of women but plenty of men in town were going through the same thing. Even if it was clearly not normal it made him feel like less of an anomaly. He was glad it was Saturday, though. It was getting hard to wear decent clothes at work. Lindsay with her giant belly might get away with showing some midriff now but Gary imagined it wouldn't look quite so usual on him.

He looked out over his yard wearing an open rode and sweatpants, his belly sticking out well over a foot in front of him. He had to constantly hold his back when he walked. He already had a bad back, and high blood pressure, and so the doctor warned him to take it easy. She did tell him he was quite healthy, though, and the babies were too. Gary nodded to himself and allowed his hand to massage the vast expanse of his belly without shame.

He heard the back porch door next door open and walked over to the fence. Their neighbors were a young, attractive couple. He knew the wife, Melanie, was rapidly pregnant and had become a hermit lately. However, he was unaware until now that the husband, a good-looking, toned electrician named Luke, was also expecting. He almost smiled in surprise as he saw him in a shirt too small and in shorts that were pushed down far enough to be almost falling off by his belly. On Gary it looked like an out of control beer belly, but on Luke it was obvious he was very pregnant.

"Hey, neighbor!" Gary said, waving.

Luke looked over. After considering for a moment, his expression lightened and he waddled over to Gary.

"So . . . you too, huh?" Luke said.

Gary shrugged, "What can you do?"

Luke shrugged back. After some awkward small talk, the two eventually sat together and continued to discuss things that were absolutely not pregnancy related, while avoiding staring at each others impressively round stomachs.

------------------------

For Lindsay, the situation was an endless stream of frustrations. For Pamela, it was like a wonderful reawakening. Gary, he just did his best to accept it. But Pamela found nothing remotely acceptable about becoming suddenly very pregnant. Her initial reaction was much like her ex-boyfriends-they were not ready to be parents. Pamela could teach kids and care for them a little, but had no confidence in her ability to do so full time. She barely even had an interest in it. She couldn't imagine where in her apartment she would even keep a baby, let alone multiple ones. She couldn't imagine herself getting out of bed at 3:00 in the morning to feed or comfort them, and the idea would have been annoying to her had every part of this situation terrified her.

Pamela was always an assuming person who hated calling attention to herself. She was pretty and petite, and could with little effort look very beautiful, but intentionally dressed and carried herself to be as unobtrusive as possible. Now, and this made her resent the lives growing inside her so much that it only reinforced her feelings of being unqualified for motherhood, she couldn't help but be noticed. Her body had gone through what was to her a horrible transformation in the last few days. While initial her little bulge of a belly looked like it would shape into a normal pregnant shape as the others, by the end of the second day, before she even knew she was pregnant, she was filling out all over. Her thighs and hips were suddenly crammed into her work pants. Her tiny ass grew rounder and began jiggling with each step. Her barely existent breasts blew up overnight. Her cheeks ballooned out, her neck joined in, giving her a comically bloated face so that she couldn't even recognize herself. She didn't look at all pregnant, she thought. She just looked fat.

It wasn't fair. Lindsay might have the bigger belly but the rest of her remained as thin as always. Even Maria's weight was evenly distributed. But Pamela just turned round. She had taken her small body for granted and now missed it, hating every new change that happened to her. The babies kicking inside her felt more like enormous gas bubbles from her daily feasts. She was almost glad her boyfriend left before she was looked like this. She dreaded the thought of what would happen after she gave birth. She would be a desperate, incompetent mother and a fat one at that.

However, these depressing thoughts did not prevent Pamela from spending her first two hours of the Saturday stuffing her face on the couch, until even the oversized clothes she had bought could no longer fully contain her girth. Her hands rested on her stomach, sinking into the hateful flab rather than the taut dome such as Lindsay had developed. Deep inside her, movements rocked her body. She winced, moaning, but didn't know what else to do.

144231111212221211111111211211122121.content:
Carl and Jonathan did most of the talking while the four walked around the department store. Carl's earlier bad mood had lightened due mostly to Jonathan's enthusiasm. Lindsay also noticed that while his back was still hurting him, he was trying to hide it rather than play it up, which was one subtle step towards making up.

"We can probably put one of these together in an hour," Jonathan said. They were looking at cribs now. It struck Lindsay as terribly stereotypical, but she realized they would have to get some baby supplies very soon.

"Ooh," she cooed suddenly, planting her hands on her belly. They were acting up again, the bumps and movements visible through her overburdened maternity dress.

"Lindsay?" Carl said.

"Nothing, just they're kicking again."

Cynthia, who had been mostly silent the entire trip, made a sort of "hmmph" sound. She rubbed her own belly. It had visibly grown and her clothing was growing tight. She kept having to pull down her already straining blouse. Lindsay thought her son and husband must be oblivious to what was obvious.

Before Lindsay knew it a young woman in slacks and a polo shirt was speaking with Carl and Jonathan. While slim, Lindsay saw the telltale sign of recent change she had seen in so many this last week. This girl, barely 19 by the looks of it, had a rounded, puffy tummy that she was doing her best to be comfortable with. If she thinks it's bad now, wait a few days, Lindsay thought as the girl continually tried to keep her hands away from her stomach.

" . . . so how many are you going to be needing?" the young woman asked Carl, glancing at Lindsay.

"Er, eight," Carl said. Lindsay felt a strange twinge of some kind of pride at the response that she couldn't quite explain.

"Oh, wow, you'll have your hands full," the girl laughed, her hand once again going to her belly.

"How about yourself, miss?" Jonathan asked good naturedly. The girl's face fell as she spread her hands over her stomach, then crossed her arms to stop herself.

"Uh, I'm not, um . . ." seeing the awkwardness of having to tell customers she was not in fact pregnant, she quickly changed the subject, "Say, I'll bet we can get you a bulk discount!"

"Great!" Carl and Jonathan, who both had the same eye for a deal, said at once.

Once those three had walked off, Lindsay lowered herself onto a bench with a loud "oof!" She looked around. So many women in various stages of pregnancy wandered around. Even though this was a store for baby supplies, it struck her that it must be much fuller. She thought about the poor girl who must be experiencing this, too, but didn't know it. She would be in for a rude awakening come tomorrow.

"I suppose these cribs are fine," Cynthia said, rocking the one they were looking at.

Lindsay glared at her. Cynthia only ever acted cordial to lure her into another insult. Any response she had would have a come back ready.

"You need to see a doctor, Cynthia," Lindsay said bluntly.

Cynthia blushed, "I have my regular check ups. If you're insinuating that I've put on weight, I assure you that's normal for a woman my age."

Lindsay rolled her eyes, then closed them as another wave of motion hit her hard. She rubbed her massive sides and moaned while laying her head back.

"That looks very uncomfortable," Cynthia said with a slight smile.

Before Lindsay could respond Jonathan was walking back.

"So Lindsay, you think these are the ones? Good price, study build, not going to tip over."

Jonathan helped Lindsay up, which took a moment. Lindsay lumbered to the crib and bumped it with her belly. It rocked a little. Despite herself, she laughed. It was the first time she had found anything remotely amusing about her current body.

"I think they'll do fine," she said, giving her father-in-law a tired smile.

Carl returned moments later.

"They'll deliver them later today," he said, putting a hand on Lindsay's shoulder. She nudged towards him as much as she could without falling over. "So, I was talking with Dad and we're thinking the den upstairs should be moved downstairs, and we'll turn the office next to us into the baby room. It's big enough and right by our bedroom."

"If you two can fix it up I'm for it," Lindsay said, thankful that she did not have to extend any thought or effort into this part of the preparation.

"Sure we can. I built near half our house before Carl was born," Jonathan said.

"Sounds wonderful," Lindsay said, and she smiled at Carl. He smiled back. Their politeness to each other felt forced, but Lindsay was glad that neither of them were itching to fight the other now.

"Where to next, ladies?" Jonathan asked.

1442311112122212111111112112111221211.content:
"I could go for some food!" Cynthia blurted, one hand under her belly. Lindsay eyed her mother in law's burgeoning middle with concern. It was obvious that she was pregnant. Why couldn't Carl and Jonathan see it?

"I could, too, but I have my appointment to get to, remember?" Lindsay asked Carl. "Oh, yeah. Forgot about that." Carl replied.

"Fine. I guess I can wait a little longer to eat..." Cynthia said. Her grumbling stomach said otherwise, as she placed a hand on her rounding belly.

The four made their way out of the mall as Lindsay lagged behind, of course. Carl noticed this, and dropped back to walk with her. He wrapped his arm around her back, rubbing her belly.

Inside Dr. Monroe's office, Lindsay approached the front desk. "Hi, Lindsay. More ultrasounds today?" Kacy asked, staring at Cynthia.

Kacy lead them down the hallway to the examination room. "So...how far along are you?" Lindsay asked, wincing as her babies unleashed some particularly strong kicks to her bladder.

"5 months. Or days...I guess." Kacy replied. "What?" Cynthia asked. Before anyone could reply, they had arrived to their destination.

Inside the examination room, Dr. Monroe was turning on the ultrasound machine. "Hey, doctor." Lindsay said, clutching her monstrous midsection. The doctor turned around, eyes bulging as she saw how big Lindsay was.

"G-good afternoon, Lindsay." she stuttered. "These are my in-laws, Jonathan and Cynthia." Lindsay said. They greeted each other and shook hands, as Dr. Monroe's eyes diverted to Cynthia's pregnant-looking belly.

"Nice to meet you both. Are you excited to be grandparents?" the doctor asked. "Absolutely!" Jonathan beamed. "Yes." Cynthia said dryly.

Lindsay was helped onto the table, as Dr. Monroe lifted the pregnant teacher's shirt up. "The babies sure seem a lot more active today..." the doctor noted as waves of movement rippled across Lindsay's belly.

"Yeah, they're definitely getting stronger. Feels like there's a fight club in my stomach sometimes." Lindsay groaned. "Well, at least you only have a few days left." Dr. Monroe said, squirting gel onto Lindsay's belly.

The doctor began the sonogram, moving the probe across Lindsay's vast midsection. "Well, I think we were right about our nine day theory. Seems like you're on track to give birth on Tuesday." the doctor said.

"Oh, please. I just had a checkup two weeks ago. It's just some weight from over eating and water retention." Cynthia muttered, crossing her arms over her belly.

Of course that means that I won't be present for the rest of your pregnancy. Kacy will conduct your examinations from here on out." the doctor said.

"I'm sure she'll be fine. If you need anything call me or Kacy." she said. Lindsay nodded, and the four returned to their car.

Cars were no longer fit for Lindsay. Not only would she be cramped in an even bigger vehicle than they had, but driving was making the babies more active. Her stomach twisted and writhed under her hands the entire time home. She had already been growing into a bad mood again and this was making it even worse. She grunted after a particularly heavy series of kicks began, visible as rippling bumps through her tight maternity top.

"You okay?" Carl asked.

"No," Lindsay said, "It feels like-aah-it feels like they're going to kick their way out of me. I really don't know how much more I can take."

"It won't be much longer," Carl said as they pulled into the drive way. Lindsay bristled at the comment. Even another day like this, and with more growing to go, would be a nightmare. Carl reached over and rubbed her belly as he put the car in park. His hand looked miniature on her midsection. Lindsay glared and brushed him off as he started to speak.

"Don't do that," she snapped. Carl complied and went around to help her out. As usual, getting Lindsay to her feet was a complicated process.

"I could go for some variety," Jonathan said to his son, "Let's say we make both our ladies happy. Pizza and Chinese."

"That'll hit the spot," Carl said, "That okay, honey?"

Lindsay nodded, out of breath before they even reached the door. When she walked now it felt like her belly was trying to pull her down and drag her back at the same time. Her whole body felt vestigial to, her skinny legs just a means to sometimes move, and her slender arms to feed it whenever it demanded. She was going through repeated variations of these thoughts as Cynthia chimed in.

"I don't see why we need to get so much food, it's only four of us," Cynthia said, then looked knowingly at Lindsay, "Or is that twelve now?"

"It's twelve," Carl smiled, patting Lindsay belly again. It rumbled and churned. Lindsay fumed. Once inside, Jonathan went to the fridge to find local places to order some while Cynthia rushed to the bathroom. Lindsay turned on Carl and whispered.

"Stop touching my stomach. I already feel like a bloated freak so I don't need you reminding me."

"Honey-" Carl said gently, some annoyance creeping into his voice.

"This isn't fun for me," Lindsay said, controlling herself to not blow up any more. She waddled slowly away, muttering, "I just want it to be over."

Jonathan could be heard calling for pizza, then Chinese. He ordered a good variety to be on the safe side. Lindsay settled into a chair to get as comfortable as she could. It barely helped, although being off her feet were nice. She felt trapped under a colossal belly now. Looking down over herself she saw just how big her breasts were getting too. Swollen with milk, she thought. She would need more clothes tomorrow. She was going to outgrow this outfit by the end of the night.

"This is quite a meal for you, Lindsay," Cynthia said looking over the food as Jonathan and Carl set up around the coffee table in the living room for an informal meal. Lindsay glared, knowing that she would pack quite a lot of this away herself. "Does your doctor think it's normal to gain so much weight at this stage?"

"She says I'm fine," Lindsay said, "And you're one to talk."

Cynthia looked up set and touched her stomach, then smiled.

"Girls," Jonathan said, patting his daughter-in-law's shoulder as he handed her a plate packed high with Chinese food.

Cynthia was already chowing down, her stomach's rumbling could be heard across the room. Jonathan and Carl looked like they were on a diet compared to how their wives' were eating.

"When I was pregnant with Carl it took two years to lose the weight. Of course I was a lot younger," Cynthia said. Lindsay couldn't respond right away, her mouth being full. She gently pressed her stomach to settle it. Blushing as she did so, Lindsay stifled a loud belch.

"I'm sure you'll be fine, it's perfectly normal for a first time mother in her late 30s to become plump," Cynthia smiled sadistically at Lindsay, who felt more furious and trapped than she had all night. She would have given anything to be able to stand in a huff and haughtily leave the room.

"Mom, come on," Carl said.

"You wouldn't mind if your wife as a little plump, would you, Carl?" Cynthia asked.

Carl opened his mouth to say "of course not" defensively, then realized that might be the wrong thing to say.

"And you'll get used to it," Cynthia said, "being plump-"

"Stop saying that," Lindsay said. She had stopped eating now and was holding her enormous belly in both hands, rocking back and forth, trying to stand. Cynthia started to speak again when Carl stepped in.

"Mom-"

In a massive effort that nearly pulled every muscle in her legs and back, Lindsay actually stood up. She almost fell right back down, but she managed to remain standing, wobbling, with her legs spread wide and her hands protectively holding her sides. She started to storm out, aware that she must look like a pathetic, slow-moving cow rather than the beautiful, indignant woman she knew she was.

"Jesus Christ, mom," Carl said, going after Lindsay, who had made it to the foyer. Behind them, they could hear Jonathan's polite voice reprimanding Cynthia.

"Leave me alone," Lindsay said, barely holding back screaming. She didn't know if she wanted to fight or cry. "Just leave me alone, okay?" she said, sadly now. Carl put up his hands and backed off.

"Okay. I'm leaving you alone. I'll be hear when you're ready."

Lindsay barely heard him. Once Carl left, she grabbed her purse and awkwardly walked outside. It's a good thing they didn't have steps out front or she certainly would have fallen.

Lindsay felt helpless and angry. She had no idea what she was going to do. She could hardly go for a walk, she'd be winded by the end of the drive way. But what else was there? She wasn't going back in there with her mother-in-law. She couldn't believe Carl was so calm in talking back to her. If her parents acted like that to him she'd never speak to them again.

"Uh," she said, slouching forward a little. They were acting up again. She would have to find something to do some place to go.

"Hello?" Amy answered, sounding like her mouth was full of food. "Hey, it's Lindsay. Listen, do you think you could pick me up? And could I maybe stay at your place for a little bit?" Lindsay asked, her free hand rubbing her belly in an ill-fated attempt to calm her unborn children.

Lindsay grunted as a particularly hard kick was sent to her bladder. "Mmm...I'll tell you when you get here. Could you make it fast, please?" Lindsay asked.

Lindsay's feet were killing her. She plodded over to the rocking chair that was on the porch and plopped down. It creaked in protest. Lindsay's belly groaned again. Her babies were already hungry even after that feast.

The redhead pulled up her shirt, revealing her pale dome of a midsection. It glistened with sweat and bulged in multiple places as her babies continued to kick. Luckily, she had gone this far without any stretch marks, which seemed like a miracle. Lindsay thought about what her body would look like after she gave birth, and shuddered. She'd probably still look pregnant. It was hard to believe, but in a matter of days she'd be a mother. It almost seemed impossible.

A minivan pulled into the driveway minutes later, and Lindsay knew that it was Amy. She exited the vehicle and waddled over towards her friend. She was clearly surprised by Lindsay's size.

"Hey. Jeez, look at you. Any day now, huh?" she asked. "Yeah. And it can't come soon enough. A little help here?" Lindsay requested.

With some effort, Amy was able to get Lindsay off of her feet, and they made their way to Amy's minivan. She got situated and moved her seat back, but her stomach still pressed against the dashboard.

"So what's going on?" Amy asked. "Carl's parents are driving me crazy. Or at least his mother is. God, she is so insufferable. And Carl's getting on my nerves, too. He keeps rubbing my stomach when I tell him to stop. He refuses to keep Cynthia in check. I need to get away for a little while." Lindsay said.

"Well, can you really blame Carl? He's going to be a father, and he probably had given up. I mean, aren't you excited?" Amy asked. "I'm excited for this to be over. These babies are killing me, Amy. You have no idea what it's like to have eight babies inside of you, fighting for room and for food. It's a nightmare."

"Fair enough." Amy said.

They arrived at Amy's house minutes later. Inside, they were greeted by Amy's family, who were sitting at the dinner table. In the middle of the table was a huge dish of macaroni and cheese. Lindsay's stomach groaned loudly. Amy's husband, and her three children looked up at Lindsay, obviously amazed at her size.

"Kids, this is Lindsay, my friend. She's going to be staying here for a while, so please be nice. Lindsay, of course you know my husband Owen." she said, gesturing to her husband, a handsome man about the same age as Amy.

"Good to see you, Lindsay." he said, trying not to look at her belly.

"And this is Arnold, our oldest. He just turned seven." Amy said.

Arnold waved. Lindsay waved back.

"This is John. He's five."

"Hi." he said sheepishly.

"Hi, John." Lindsay replied. Her feet and back were killing her now.

"And here we have Billie. She's going to be four next month." Amy said, pointing at her daughter, who had short curly hair.

"Are you having a baby?" Billie asked bluntly.

"Oh, honey, you know you're not supposed to ask that." Amy said. "But yes, she is."

"Well, actually, I'm having eight." Lindsay replied.

Owen dropped his fork. "I-I'm sorry, did you say eight?"

"Yep. I've got octuplets in here." she said, patting her belly. It, of course, growled and shifted in response.

"Here, take a seat and help yourself. I need to start doing the dishes anyway." Owen said, leading Lindsay to his chair. She sat down and began to eat voraciously as Amy's kids looked on in wonder. She ended up licking the tray completely clean, leaving one less dish for Owen to wash.

Lindsay was pretty exhausted, so Amy led her the guest room. It had a bathroom and a king-sized bed, which was good enough for Lindsay. Amy let Lindsay be, and she got ready for bed. She removed her maternity clothes, leaving Lindsay only in her bra and underwear.

As soon as her head hit the pillow, she drifted off to sleep.

West Hadsley wasn't New York or Chicago, but the new Officer Carly Martinez wasn't going to treat it any different just because it wasn't a big city. It was at least larger than East Hadsley. She had left the academy days before very proud of herself, fit and determined, ready to begin what she knew would be a long, hard, fulfilling career as a police officer. She had done well at the academy and was pleased that she had outdone many of her male classmates. She had put up with some sexism and harassment, and expected to see even more in a smallish town like this. Carly was prepared. She almost welcomed it.

She began her day at 5:00 AM sharp as usual with her workout routine and a run down the street. She was taller than average for a woman at 5'9" and had a lean, toned figure that, along with her stern expression, could make her very intimidating. The young woman donned her uniform for her first official day on duty and couldn't help but smile to herself proudly. She was going to work her way up through the ranks to detective in no time. West Hadsley might not have a lot of crimes to prevent or solve but that wasn't going to stop Carly from putting her all into the job.

"'Morning," said an older, gruff-looking office at the front desk as Carly entered the police headquarters. His appearance did not match the friendly tone of voice.

"Oh, good morning," Carly said. She held out her hand stiffly to him over the desk, "I'm here to see Chief Milligan. Officer Martinez."

The older cop looked at her, then grinned and took her hand. "Nice to meet you. Chief's that way."

"Thanks," Carly went straight through the back. A few others glanced at her, some nodding hello with barely any more acknowledgement than that. There was a carefree, easygoing atmosphere to the place Carly found very disconcerting after months of grueling training. She noted that, predictably, every one of the twenty or so officers present were men, and that most of them were middle-aged and out of shape. They all seemed friendly enough, at least the ones who weren't buried in paperwork.

She stood stiffly at the Chief's door and was about to knock when she saw him waving her in from behind his window. He was heavyset, in his 50s, and had a giant mustache that did not hide the giant smile that erupted on his face when he looked up to see her. Before that, he looked quite serious, but as he stood up to greet Carly he seemed more like a friendly, goofy uncle than the hard nosed police chief she was expecting.

"You must be Officer Martinez," he said, shaking her hands rapidly like a salesman. "Chief Bill Milligan, pleasure's all mine."

"Thank you, sir. I'm proud to be-"

The Chief chuckled and waved his hand, motioning for Carly to take a seat. He sat down himself. "There's no need to be so formal around here." Carly bristled as she felt he was about to tell her to call him 'Bill,' but he didn't. "You're just out of the academy then? You settled in? Things going good?"

"They are, thank you, sir. I am eager to begin work."

The Chief looked amused and Carly knew it was at her demeanor. Even as a kid she had a very stern and serious attitude, a very clipped, direct way of speaking that made people uneasy. The Chief certainly wasn't uneasy. Carly had expected him to be unsure of her, willing to accept her but wanting her to prove herself. Instead, he was overly friendly, leaning back in his chair comfortably, apparently now fully aware that Carly took this very serious and that her, chief of police though he was, did not.

The Chief leaned forward, "So Officer, what are your goals here?"

"I plan on eventually becoming a detective, sir."

"We could use some, that's for sure. Not a whole lot of crime here, though. Listen Martinez," he said it firmly but couldn't help smiling as he affected the no-nonsense attitude he could tell Carly was expecting, "we're a peaceful town with peaceful people. Keeping the peace in a place like this you don't need too strong a hand. Be subtle. Enjoy your work. You'll get to where you want to go."

Carly had not expected friendly encouragement. If her welcome here had meant anything, then far from being an organization she would have to prove herself to, it looked like it would take all her effort to make anyone else take this job seriously. She expected an uphill battle against people who didn't take her seriously and was getting the exact opposite.

"Thank you, sir?"

"Now, I guess you should meet your partner. Let's see, who were you going with today?" looking at his papers, the Chief then glanced past Carly and motioned somebody else in. "Ah, here's your new partner now-"
