The drive was pretty uneventful to say the least. Maybe Monica was right. Maybe this town really was as slow as she said it was. They sat in the car, waiting for something, anything to happen. It was getting late, and the two were getting a little tired.

Carly looked at Monica's ring. "So...what's your husband do for a living?" she asked. Monica raised an eyebrow. "My what?" Monica asked.

"Your husband? I...I saw the ring you have on." Carly said. She could feel her cheeks growing red.

"I don't have a husband." Monica replied bluntly.

"Then why...oh. I get it now. Cool." Carly said, coming to realization.

"Yeah." Monica said.

Carly nodded. "So...how long have you two been together?" she asked.

"Twelve years. What, do you wanna know where we got married and where we went on our Honeymoon, too?" Monica asked, slightly annoyed.

"No, that can wait." Carly said.

There was an awkward silence. "You adopted any kids?" Carly asked. Monica turned towards her. She was angry.

"Could you maybe chill with the personal questions for a while? We're co-workers, not family members. And the answer's no, by the way. And we're not planning on raising kids, either." she said.

As Monica finished talking, a black SUV sped through the intersection on a red light. "What the hell?" Monica exclaimed, putting the car in drive. She turned the siren on and began to speed after the perpetrator.

"What's that all about?" Carly asked. "I don't know, but we're gonna find out." she answered.

They tailed the SUV in hot pursuit. they chased after for a few minutes, but finally the other vehicle pulled over. Monica parked the car.

"Alright, rook. You're up." Monica said. Carly turned to her partner. "You want me to talk to the driver?" she asked.

"Yeah. It'll be good experience for you." Monica replied. "Okay." Carly unbuckled her seatbelt and took a deep breath.

"You sure you don't want to do it?" Carly asked. "Oh, come on. I'll be right here if you need me!" Monica joked.

Carly exited the car and approached the SUV. She noticed that the windows were tinted. The driver was a woman in her 40s with glasses and frizzy hair. She had on some sort of badge on her lab coat, but Carly couldn't quite make it out.

"Ma'am, did you know that you ran that red light?" she asked. "Oh...my apologies. I'm a little preoccupied. Busy times at work. You know how it is!" the driver exclaimed.

"What line of work are you in?" Carly asked. "I'm a scientist for Yaral Industries. Ever heard of it?" the scientist asked.

"Can't say I have." Carly said. "Oh, well I'm sure you will!" she said.

"Miss, running red lights can be very dangerous. I'm afraid I'm gonna have to write you a ticket." Carly said.

The scientist's upbeat demeanor was beginning to disappear. "Really? Are you sure I can't change your mind?" the scientist asked, pulling out some cash.

"Are you trying to bribe me? I'm not going to stoop to that." the young officer stated. "Fine. Well, if this money won't change your mind, then maybe my friends will!" the scientist exclaimed.

Two hulking men exited the back of the car. They were much, much larger than Carly. One cracked his knuckles while the other cracked his neck. "Can I change your mind now, honey?" the scientist asked.

"You can't threaten me..." Carly said, her voice shaking. The two hired thugs looked at each other. One thug picked up Carly and threw her into the SUV. She collapsed to the ground. Her head hammered.

Monica exited the squad car and ran towards the commotion. She hit one of the men in the back of the head, but he barely moved a muscle. In response, he knocked her to the ground and held her down. Carly stayed on the ground in pain.

The scientist threw two cans to the hired thugs. They opened the cans. One thug forced Carly to drink one can, while the Monica was forced to down the other.

One of the hired thugs threw the can to the ground as they got back in the SUV. It sped away into the night. Monica slowly got up to check on Carly.

"You alright?" she asked. "I don't feel good..." Carly moaned. Monica helped the young officer onto her feet.

"Well, that couldn't have gone any worse." Monica stated. "Those guys could have killed us. I'd say we got off easy." Carly said. "What the hell was that drink? It tasted terrible." Monica said.

Monica approached the crumpled can on the ground and picked it up. "Xpect. Looks like some sort of energy drink." she said. "It tasted terrible." Carly said weakly.

"I won't argue with that. Come on, let's get back to the station." Monica said.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

They returned to their desks. Monica put the can of Xpect in one of her drawers. The Chief approached the two.

"How'd it go, ladies?" he asked. "Pretty good. Until we got ambushed after pulling over a car that ran a red light." Monica said. "Oh, really? Try harder next time, I guess." he said, returning to his office.

"That's it? We aren't in trouble?" Carly asked, surprised. "I told you things are pretty relaxed around here." Monica said.

Carly's stomach gurgled. A wave of nausea ran through her. "Ugh. I feel sick." Carly said, putting a hand over her mouth. "You're just nervous after your first taste of action. It happened to me too." Monica reasoned.

Moments later, Carly vomited into the trashcan under her desk. "Oh, on second thought, maybe you should head home for the night." Monica said. "Yeah, that probably wouldn't be a bad idea." Carly said.

She grabbed her things and headed out. As Carly left, Monica began to feel ill as well. She bolted to the restroom and emptied the contents of her stomach. "Must have been whatever was in that energy drink..." she muttered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Monica returned home. It was 11:30. She figured that Angie would be asleep by now, but alas her wife was waiting for her in the living room. Her shoulder length fiery red hair was always the first thing she saw when she entered the house. "Hey, babe. Good day at work?" she asked.

"Not really. Got a new partner. She's...very determined and inquisitive. I'm sick, by the way. Probably shouldn't touch me." Monica said as Angie got up to approach her.

"Good idea. You think a drink or two would help?" Angie asked.

"I'll pass on that. I should probably get some rest." Monica said. "Okay. I'll be in bed sometime soon. Night." she said. "Good night." Monica replied.

Monica retired to her bedroom and changed into her pajamas. She still felt nauseous, and felt like her stomach was doing flips. She hoped that she'd feel better in the morning.

1442322331111.content:
Having spent much of the early hours of the morning leaning over her toilet, Carly barely remembered getting to bed. She must have at some point, since she awoke hours later at the crack of noon. That she had planned on, certainly when she would be working nights, but it still felt weird after training herself to always get up early. Slowly the previous night came back to her. She moaned to herself, feeling humiliated, like a failure. Her first traffic stop should have been a footnote on her way to the top of the force. Instead it went as badly as it possibly could go. That there seemed to be no repercussions, or even follow up, from her partner or the Chief made her feel even worse. Just how lazy and incompetent were the police in this town, and if she could screw up so badly did that mean she belonged with them?

Her stomach had thankfully calmed down. The nausea was replaced by a low growl, an almost full feeling. She realized quickly how hungry she was. Carly patted her toned stomach and went to the kitchen. She stopped and blushed. Something about that seemingly normal action suddenly felt strange. She fried up some eggs, threw some toast in the microwave, then for good measure made up some bacon. It all smelled so good. She mixed her usual protein drink which, in her hungry state, even looked appetizing. By the time she was done, having finished off all of her eggs, bacon, and most of her bread, Carly was certain she had never been quite so full. She chugged her second protein drink. Something felt very off about her, perhaps it was her intense hunger when the night before she wouldn't have been able to keep anything down. Or the way her hand now listlessly ran up and down her full, but still hard and flat, stomach. She shook her head to snap out of it.

Carly's work out was a short one. She was too full to truly run her usual five miles and only made it one before turning back. Also, and this was odder, her breasts were hurting. They were feeling more restrained in her bra than usual. She spent the rest of the day, not researching this Yaral company as she planned, but on the couch eating, resting, and was quite shocked when eight rolled around. Jumping into her uniform, she noticed the buttons strained a little around her chest. She thought little of it. It was just another minor inconvenience.

Monica was walking in the door as Carly pulled up. She stopped and waited for Carly.

"Hey-" Carly started.

"Listen, we're going to look into this, but don't go telling anything more to the Chief, okay?"

"Why not?" Carly asked. It was highly unusual, but then the Chief's blase dismissal of their assault was, too.

Monica sighed and held her head as if having to explain something for the hundredth time. "Because none of these idiots here are going to take it seriously, and none of them are going to be any help. We'll find these assholes and bring them in ourselves."

Carly recalled how bored Monica looked for most of their ride yesterday, and how she looked quite the opposite. Against her better judgment, she nodded her head firmly.

"Good, glad we're on the same page," Monica glanced through the door. Carly saw Monica's hand listless to her middle, rubbing it up and down over her uniform. She turned to Carly with an angry look when she saw her staring, "What are you looking at? Let's go."

They went inside, exchanging some nods and waves with the half asleep police force.

"So have you ever heard of this Yaral Industries?" Carly asked as they went to Monica's desk. Carly had yet to be assigned a desk, and took to pulling up a chair.

"Sure have," came a smarmy voice from a few desks over. Carly looked to see two officers, both in their 30s, and both with the unmistakable looks of people who just couldn't pass up a chance to show off or show somebody up, no matter how trivial.

"What do you know about anything, Petersen?" Monica said, logging into her computer without even looking up.

The two exchanged smirks.

"Yaral brought out the old factory on the other side of town for one thing. Last year."

"That's right, and didn't that lady have something crazy to say about them last week? That's more what I was thinking, not the factory thing," said the other.

Carly and Monica exchanged glances.

"What crazy thing did she have to say?" Carly said.

Petersen and his cohort shrugged.

"Said they drugged her. She thought she was pregnant and that it was their fault. Was that the half of it, Morris?"

"That's about it. She didn't look pregnant to me. Just crazy."

"What was this?" Monica stood up.

"Six, seven days ago? Why, who cares? What do you care?"

"We're working a case," Monica said, "You know, those things involving crimes that we're paid to stop from happening?"

The two smirked at each other. After some hedging they did tell her what the potential victim had told them.

"Are we going to see her or to the factory?" Carly asked, exhilarated to be jumping into action despite the gnawing hunger quickly building in her. Monica's stomach sounded like it was feeling the same as Carly's.

"What? Let's start small, I'm thinking we question this Eva Jakowski about what she knows about Yaral," Monica said.

Carly's stomach gurgled loudly. "Wherever we go, let's go through a drive through on the way."

14423223311111.content:
In the end, they decided to check on this potential victim first. There wasn't much to read in the report since nobody took her seriously. Carly did a quick search for her online. She seemed to be just a normal young woman. Pretty, too.

"What do you want?" Monica said as they pulled through a drive through. The smell of grease wafting into their squad car was strangely enticing even for the health-conscious Carly. Her stomach, feeling a little tight from her breakfast, rumbled under her hand as she rubbed it.

"Maybe . . . maybe a few double quarter pounders. Like, two . . . three?" she found herself saying. Monica raised an eyebrow at her causing Carly to uncharacteristically blush and, again to her surprise, start rubbing her stomach softly with both hands. When Monica glanced down, she stopped, embarrassed. Monica then turned to the window and ordered a dozen burgers and some sodas.

They ate ravenously as they drove, barely speaking to each other. After the third burger Carly had to stop. She shook her head, holding her painfully full stomach. Did it actually look as full as she felt? Her uniform did feel slightly snug up front. Monica was no better, although she ate slower, methodically. Now she's looking bloated, Carly thought as she saw her partner's stomach oozing just a little over her belt and into her seatbelt. But then she had already known that Monica had a classic tall, skinny-fat figure. She must gain weight easily, Carly thought, feeling a little bad for her.

Still, she managed to scarf down another burger just as they arrived at the house. As they exited the cars, both wobbled just a little. Monica belched loudly and Carly barely was able to keep hers in. They both look at each other, slightly confused, and then rapidly tore their hands from their own full tummies.

"You find anything else about her not in the report?" Monica asked as they approached the door. Both women felt a little restriction around their waists, like their belts should go out another notch.

"Nothing-urp-god, sorry-nothing that interesting. Seems like a normal girl. Nothing about Yaral and her, either."

Monica rang the door bell. The two stood at attention in that casual cop way. Monica belched again while they waited.

"Jesus, sorry," she said, "Why the hell did I eat all that?"

Carly shook her head and shrugged, not willing to openly admit that she had stuffed herself just as disgracefully. Monica knocked on the door.

"Anybody home? This is the police," she said loudly and sternly.

They heard a voice and shuffling.

"Police?" the voice said, belong to a woman who was either tired, scared, or both.

The door opened a moment later and both officers could not suppress their surprise as Eva Jakowski appeared. Carly even gasped. This was not the slim, normal young woman who had filed the report of being drugged by scientists or businessmen last week. She was now quite pregnant, or at least looked it. Her breasts and face looked bloated and round, her hips must have widened significantly, and her belly dominated her figure like nothing Carly or Monica had ever seen. She waved as she stood, one hand holding the door frame and the other on her bare, horribly bloated belly. She was wearing a pair of sweatpants which her belly and ass almost pushed off of her, and a huge t-shirt which left most of her belly, stretch marks and nobbly naval all, very visible. Carly felt sick to her stomach and held her own slightly swollen middle in her hand. Still, she retained her professionalism.

"M'am, we'd like to ask you a few questions," Monica recovered from the sight of the cartoonishly pregnant woman faster than Carly did.

"What about? About this?" she said, her exhaustion letting some anger, or maybe just sarcasm, seep out. "When I came to the police station last week nobody cared."

Eva winced and doubled forward. A series of large, alien movements wrapped around the surface of her belly. Carly took a step back. Monica didn't reveal any surprise.

"Ms. Jakowski, we'd like to ask you what you know about Yaral Industries. May we come in?"

"Yaral?" Evan said as the movements passed, "No!"

"Wait-" Carly recognized the fear in Eva's eyes and stepped forward, but Eva was already waddling backwards into her home.

"They're watching me! They're watching everyone. You don't understand. They told me I was just testing some new drinks, and then, and then . . ." her voice shrunk to a whisper as her eyes darted around.

"Wait, drinks?" Carly said stepping closer. "What about 'drinks'?" She felt a concern rising within her.

Eva calmed a little.

"Some kind of soda. It was awful. They said they were taste testing them. I only tried it once, though. They asked me to come back the next day and report how I felt. I thought it was a little weird. I was sick all night, and the next morning, I felt," she choked up a little as her hands ran down as much of her belly as they could, "I told them I felt hungry."

Monica and Carly gave each other knowing looks.

"We'd like to come in, Ms. Jakowski," Monica said. "If they're watching you-"

"They are. They want to see that what this is is safe," she said with a bitter smile. "Please, just stay away. I told you everything I know."

"But-"

"Stay away from me," Eva said, but before she closed the door, she stopped, "There were a few others, too. We worked at the mall together and knew each other, so that's how we got roped in. But," she glanced behind them to a van down the street. "Shit," Eva said, her face falling. She closed the door as fast as her overgrown body would let her.

Monica started to knock again, but Carly stopped her.

"What do you think she meant about drinks?" Carly said. It didn't take a particularly clever detective to see some connection. "She drinks something Yaral gives her and a week late winds up a human balloon?"

"Don't dwell on it. She won't talk, she's too scared-" Monica looked to her younger partner to see that Carly's expression showed not only worry, but some fear, too. Carly held on hand on her stomach, lightly pressing it through her uniform. It definitely felt a little puffy. That would be rare enough, as Carly's perfectly fit body never got so much as bloated. But with her appetite that day, and that she was still hungry.

Despite the witness's uncooperative nature both officers knew that they gained valuable information by coming here.

"It's your call," Carly said, removing her hand from her belly and placing them on her hips, standing defiantly despite her half-formed fear of what happening to both of them. "Do we go find more victims among her co-workers or check out the factory now?"

"We don't even know where she works," Monica said.

"Not true," Carly said, "She's a sales associate at the Bately & Stein's in the mall. She works in the ladies' formal wear section."

"How'd you figure that?" Monica said, sounding impressed and realizing right away that of course Carly found that out. She had been doing just basic searches on Eva on the ride over. She nodded her head as Carly just shrugged.

"Fine then, let's go to the mall," Monica said. Both their stomachs rumbled, and they both found themselves unconsciously rubbing their full stomachs.

Without even asking Monica pulled through a Taco Hut on the way and began ordering. She glanced to Carly, like it was perfectly normal to be ordering another huge helping of fast food after eating multiple burgers earlier. "You want anything?"

"Uhg, no," Carly said, but her stomach's growl betrayed her. Why was she so hungry? The answer, of course, was right on the edge of her mind, but her thought process veered away from that direction. "How can you can eat all that junk?"

"Look who's talking, Ms. Six Pack," Monica said with a very slight smile and nodding towards the wrappers of the fatty lumps of pseudo-food which now rested packed and writing in Carly's stomach. "Hey, see if we have any word on Yaral. Our research guys have to be good for something."

Carly, glaring at both Monica and, briefly, her stuffed stomach, called headquarters and found that, strangely, nobody had ever heard of Yaral Industries. They reached the mall with no more information than before, and with Carly feeling guilty for having eaten two of Monica's tacos. At least her stomach stopped growling. But the increased heaviness, now with a healthy and uncomfortable dose of gassiness, were worse. As they strode in their authoritative police way through the Bately & Stein's to the help desk Carly felt that that they both appeared less intimidating than the otherwise would have. It frustrated her to no end how her hands kept gravitating towards her stomach, which felt very confined by her belt and slacks.

Monica, looking stern, almost bored, approached who they assumed was the manager while her shorter partner walked behind her.

"M'am, I'm Officer Harris. This is Officer Martinez. Are you the manager here?"

"Yes, I am," she said. "What can I do for you?"

"We'd like to ask you a few questions about Eva Jakowski. She works here, is that right?"

"Yeah, she did, but we haven't seen her in a week, and nobody's heard from her-"

All three, and some of the customers turned their head just in time to see a side emergency door swing open and a man flee out of it. He was dressed fashionably as all employees of the upscale department. Carly's heart raced, her instincts kicking in.

"I got him," she said, not even turning back to look at Monica not even trying to run with her. Carly took off. She was momentarily impeded by the door being locked, and lost a good thirty seconds as the manager unlocked it. No matter. She could hear the suspect reaching the bottom of the flights of stairs. Carly was in top form, she thought, every trained muscle in her toned body working together to first rush her down the stairs and then, as the bottom door opened the man continued to run, over the last railing and landing practically right behind him.

"Freeze, police!" she yelled as she slammed the door open and saw him running across the back lot. She ran, picking up speed, this guy was fast but there was no way he was as trained, or as in as good of shape, as Carly. Carly had run faster than this, and longer, during her daily workouts. This was why, the sudden, growing stitch in her side was unusual. She brushed it off, but found she couldn't pick up speed, and the suspect wasn't getting any closer. He was only fifteen feed ahead of her now, if she could only do one last sprint.

Carly's stomach heaved, she almost tripped but tried to keep running. All the food she had stuffed herself with early rushed into her memory. She gritted her teeth, pumping her arms and legs for all she was worth to get past the enormous cramp building in her middle. It felt like a lead ball had been placed there and was no exerting its gravity. Also, and this caught her by surprise, her breasts felt sore suddenly. They were moderately sized and well secured, and she hadn't had any problem during any of her exercising before, but she was struck just now at the worst moment with an almost painful discomfort. It did not, however, rival the queasiness growing inside her. She gripped her stomach and had to stop, feeling to her knees, heaving, breathing, her heart beating.

"Aaaaaanhhhhhh!" she growled in a frustrated, humiliated moan as her arms wrapped tightly around her middle. The contents of her stomach churned violently, threatening to rise up and further humiliate her. With her arms tight against her stomach she would very much feel how ridiculous full she was it. It felt like a gyrating rock.

"Freeeeeze!" she yelled getting to her feet with one arm still around her middle. This couldn't be happening. She was doing everything right, had done everything to prepare her mind and body for just such an occasion, and now her body was betraying her. "Stop, damn it!"

The man, halfway across the parking lot now, slowed, turned, and even stopped. She saw he had a name tag but could not read it.

"Freeze, god damn it, we're the police!" Carly picked up the pace to a trot again, but knew that she would need a rest before even trying to chase somebody down again. The man turned and ran, but not nearly as fast as before. Carly glared, growling to herself. Proving herself as a cop to herself seemed like it hinged on catching this random person right then.

The suspect was not racing for any vehicle, but instead the woods that surrounded this part of the mall. He might lose Carly there. Or, she thought as she fought through the pain in her sides and the heavy feeling in her middle, he would trip himself up and make an easy target. Carly grunted and pushed herself forward until, seconds later, somebody else did her job for her. A van, black and official, like a government vehicle, was racing around the edge of the parking lot alongside the woods. Carly and the suspect both saw it at the same time. He slowed down looking at it and Carly, then ran diagonally away from it. The van was too fast. It skidded to a stop, blocking Carly's view. Her sides were splitting, her stomach was heaving, the skin feeling like it was stretched across a drum, and her breasts sent a jolt of through with every movement, but Carly sprinted ahead with gritted teeth. She heard some struggling, a yell, and was mere feet from the van when she heard the door on the other side slam shut as the van took off.

"Freeze!" Carly yelled again. She hadn't even seen who was driving it, and didn't know whether or not the suspect went willing and with thanks, or was kidnapped. She screamed a nonsense cry at the van, stamping her foot. There was no license plate, either. Her heart beating faster than it had in a very long time, even during her most strenuous work outs, Carly clutched her arms around her middle and fell to her knees.

"Hey, Martinez," came the softly authoritative tone of her partner as she jogged casually up behind her. "Did he go with them or did they take him?"

"Uuuuh," Carly shook her head, which was now spinning. She was positive she would throw up now. Her stomach heaved under her arms. It felt like it was placed in a vice. "Don't know," she forced out.

Monica gave her her hand to help her up. Carly shook her head and stood up herself, hunched over still.

"Are you okay?"

"Damnit," Carly said, "I'll be fine. Too . . . much food," she said, which must be the case. Carly could kick herself. She hardly ever indulged, certainly not to the absurd degree she had been doing. She couldn't bring herself to be mad at her, but she did blame Monica's habits for it. She'll just have to be careful when she eats around her partner.

"It's fine," Monica said, a little annoyance in her voice, "I already called it in it. No license on the van, was there? Damn."

Monica looked off to where the van had fled. Their squad car was on the other side of the mall. By the time they had gotten to it the suspects would have been well away from them. She rubbed her stomach absentmindedly. Considering how full she felt it actually felt good, even soothing. Her radio squawked at her.

"We've got a black van speeding along Pine Oak, Dr. just crossing 4th, no ID on it yet."

"Roger, thanks," Monica said. "Come on, let's go talk to that manager. Don't beat yourself up. That guy was a speed demon."

"I should have caught him," Carly said as her breath returned and the pain, but not the discomfort, subsided. Without thinking she squeezed one of her breasts and gasped, hoping Monica didn't see her. It was painful, but oddly pleasurable. She wanted to get out of her bra and, and this part made her even more embarrassed for herself, unbutton her strangely snug slacks.

"Stop it," Monica said sternly, "If you keep feeling sorry for yourself over every thing that goes wrong you're not going to last long in this job, let alone make detective."

Carly nodded. It made sense. She wondered if Monica was still a uniformed officer after all these years because she wanted to be, because she wasn't good enough to move any further upward, or something had held her back.

They were able to get some useful information from the manager and other co-workers. The suspect who fled and was rescued/captured was named Derek Bryan. He was a sales associate in the men's section. He was work friends with Eva and the two often spoke and sometimes took lunch together. They didn't seem to see each other outside of work as far as the manager knew. One co-worker suggested otherwise, but then backed off. Carly and Monica both suspect that, like Eva, this girl had a lot more to tell than she let on. She was small, pretty, and quiet, barely out of high school and so a few years younger than Eva or Derek, so it would be no surprise if she really didn't know anymore.

"Give us a call if you remember anything," Monica said, handing the girl, Ashley, her number.

"We just want to help," Carly said in as comforting a voice as she could muster in her increasing discomfort. Her stomach had stopped doing flips but was now lulling heavily back and forth, and her hands were constantly moving to it against her will. She wound up gripping her belt tightly to stop them from wandering.

"Okay, I will," Ashley said. She looked like she was going to say more, but didn't.

Monica checked in with the station. After the initial update there was no news on the mystery van.

"Do all witnesses refuse to say anything remotely useful?" Carly asked when they walked back to the car.

"Sometimes. They're usually not hiding from anything as weird as this, though," Monica said, then pressed her hand to her mouth and stifled a burp. "''Scuse me. Let's get back to the station and get this paperwork done and call it a night."

Carly realized that it was, in fact, night now. She also realized she was exhausted, something which her body had politely hid from her for the last few hours. Annoying, infuriatingly, her stomach's loud growling indicated that she was also hungry again. With a grimace as she buckled her seatbelt across her full tummy and tender breasts, she turned to Monica.

"Yeah, but let's go through a drive-thru or something first."

14423223311111121.content:
Monica was able to file the paperwork for that day with effortless efficiency. Carly did not. She was frustrated with herself, vacillating between the urge to go out and keep working through the night and to hide herself away. They finished late and parted ways. Monica, who had repeated to Carly to not beat herself up over losing the suspect, patted her on the shoulder as they left.

"We made good progress today. Nothing to be ashamed of."

"Yeah," Carly said not feeling it, "See you tomorrow."

Removing her pants and bra that night were much more relieving than ever before, and Carly passed out on her bed almost instantly, her hand listlessly caressing her stuffed stomach.

Normally, Carly would rise at 6:00, take a jog around the neighborhood for a half hour, and then work out for another half hour in her own personal gym. It took up most of her apartment. Today was different. Carly slept through her alarms, and when she did finally get up at a quarter to 9:00 she did not rise with her usual vigor, but awoke slowly and with difficulty. Her first thought was that she was late. Her second was that she was hungry. She growled. Of course today would be off to a bad start.

As she slowly moved her normally limber body off the bed she felt some odd resistance, like something was keeping her down. She rubbed her eyes as she made her way to the bathroom. Petersen grumbled but only let his smile fall a little. With a huff, he motioned to Hansen and the two began walking off.

"Let me know if you need any more leads on that wild goose chase, tubbs," he said. Monica rolled her eyes. She stuffed the last bite of a doughnut into her mouth. She had eaten five just standing there. She rubbed her stomach absently.
